title: Young daughter had to stay in separate room, couldn't check in until 8pm
text:
My seventy-something mother and my fourteen-year-old daughter went to NYC for a quick trip and together we decided on this hotel because of it's convenient location. My mother requested connecting rooms. When they arrived at the hotel, my mom was told they now could not accomodate the connecting rooms request. This was incredibly disappointing and something we would have appreciated knowing in advance, as we were not at all comfortable with a fourteen-year-old girl in her own hotel room, away from her grandmother, for three nights in New York City. For me, back home, this created a great deal of unnecessary anxiety since now everyone at the front desk and within earshot of the conversation they were having with my mom knew a young teenage girl was staying in a hotel room alone.

In addition, despite the posted and promised 3pm check-in time, my mom's room was not ready until 8pm. Having woken up at 4am for her flight, this was just another crappy situation for her and my daughter at this hotel. It was otherwise fine--rooms were fine, location was fine. But for families needing two rooms, just be aware that connecting rooms are never guaranteed here apparently, that they won't tell you ahead of time that your minor child might end up in a separate room, and that you may have to wait five hours past check-in time to even get to your room. 

We'll be using other hotels in the future.

title: Holiday Vacation
text: Great customer service, we arrived during the early morning our room wasn’t ready but Skyy was able to accommodate us with priority service on the first available room so that we could rest.  Amazing location in walking distance of everything uptown and midtown.

title: Bad desk. Horrible waits for the elevators. Not renovated in 25 years.
text:
Don't stay here. I used to love this hotel but every time it's a fight at the desk. This time, I had to choose the time of arrival and chose an upgrade (paid an extra 60 bucks plus taxes and fees) and was able to choose my room. I arrived at the time I said I'd arrive, the room I had chosen wasn't available. Why? it was available on the app. The desk claimed that they are not required to give you the room you choose (then why offer the option?) and can change it at will. Corporate said there must be something wrong with the APP, but the app does the same thing about 50% of the time (I travel for work 3 weeks a month) which is why I questioned it. I chose the room on the floor I wanted because it was larger than the other upgraded rooms on the same floor. Nope. Even when you tell them when you're arriving and choose a room that's available, it's not guaranteed. Fine. Ok. Exactly zero you can do about it. 

The hotel hasn't had a renovation since opening 25 years ago. The area between the entry way tile and carpet has the carpet nails sticking through and the carpet is worn in the area from the tile to the bed. 

The terrace furniture has holes and needs to be replaced (this is the reason for the increased cost). 

But it's the elevators that are the most concerning at this hotel. There's three. Going up there's a line. Coming down is impossible. They're always full. Checking out today I waited 25 minutes on floor 2 to get on an elevator and only 4 doors opened in those 25 minutes.  I even tried going up but those were full. I finally carried my luggage down the stairs to the lobby (floor 2 is really floor three as the lobby is double height). Is there a solution? Yes. Add another elevator to the outside of the hotel. It's possible. Buildings have done it. A Kimpton hotel next to our house did it. 

I am done with this hotel ( I keep giving it second chances and always regret it).

title: Good stay in an excellent location
text: Location was excellent, 10 minutes walk from Central Park and Time Square. Lots of great eating and drinking options surrounding the hotel. Check in was smooth and room was fine. We had two double beds with view of 54th street. Room was quite small but very clean, quiet and comfy beds. We didn’t have a room safe which was unusual compared to other hotels we have stayed in. Coffee etc refilled on some days, not on others. Overall a good stay that suited the purpose of a busy sightseeing trip to NYC.

title: Mixed review
text: Hotel was in a great location. The rooms are very small (even for NYC). Our room smelled pretty strongly of mildew or mold, but beds/views were nice and quiet. Elevators were very slow at times (which was especially frustrating when the aggressive sales pitches for the Hilton timeshares would start). Staff were either very warm and kind or very cold and short.

title: Room was ok except for vape smell.  Front Desk service was painful.   Good location
text:
Checking in was painful.   My wife had prepaid but apparently the reservation hadn’t gone through.  The reception person didn’t seem to fully understand the computer reservation system.  My guess.  

Room smelled of vape.   I suspect the vaping was ongoing (not a residual from a past guest) but hvac appeared to send the smell into our room.  I applied a medical anesthetic pad to my shoulder to disguise the vape smell, which I admittedly hate more than other people do I suspect.   

Breakfast was in fancy room and service was fine.  But buffet was limited.   We had a 20 dollar daily allowance but a single not terribly tasty buffet breakfast was $32.   Mandatory 5 dollar tip included.   Net 12.   It was worth the net 12 bucks but food wise I’d have preferred an egg sandwich n coffee at a deli.   But room was nice , as mentioned.  

At checkout the 20 buck allowance wasn’t initially applied.   More of the same…

Pretty disappointing.

title: Clean, comfortable, and reasonable accommodations
text:
We've stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on W 54th Street numerous times, and this was by far our favorite stay.

The room was surprisingly quiet for facing the front AND for it being the northern end of the Times Square area (although it's closer to Columbus Circle). The Applejack Diner around the corner on Broadway and 55th has a good breakfast and a savvy staff. The Ray's Pizza on 7th between 53rd and 54th actually serves good NY pizza. A very large slice of a specialty pizza can run you $6, but it's quite filling.

Having stayed many times, we still feel that the rooms could use a couple of coat hooks by the front door. Otherwise you have to use the closet (which is too small) or put them on the back of a chair.

This hotel only has three elevators, and the wait can sometimes be longer than you're expecting to come down, or wait in a crowd in the lobby on the way up. But that's more at peak times, which are posted on the elevator bank walls.

A special shout-out to DaShanda at the front desk, who made our check-out breezy and filled with laughs.

title: Great location but needs a little TLC.
text:
There was so much that was good about this hotel.  The location is right off Broadway so it's close to the Theatres, Times Square and Central Park.  The lobby is nice and the service is friendly.  Restaurants everywhere, at all different prices (cheap to pricey).  I liked the fridge and microwave in the room, and the bed was comfortable.  Good Wifi and outlets.  I liked that I could open the window and get some fresh air. 
 
Now for the concerns.  The HVAC was very very noisy and didn't work well; I had to turn it on to get heat and then back off when it got too much -- the infrastructure seemed very old and I couldn't regulate it.  The bed linens had seen better days, with some pulled fabric and threadbare spots.  It took at least 8-10 minutes to get hot water in the shower, so I had to plan for that time.  The elevators also were very slow, and one time I waited over 5 minutes for one.  None of these concerns are deal-breakers but just show the age of the hotel and need for some TLC.  

Lastly, at the last two Hilton properties I have stayed at, there is a person in the lobby trying to aggressively sell you their "vacation properties" -- I *do not* like this; when I am staying in a hotel I want to relax and not be assaulted by a sales job.  This makes me want to choose other chains over Hilton.

title: Over from the Uk would stop there again
text: We have stopped there twice and been pleased both times, the rooms we stayed in were nice and roomy for the two of us and were clean, the bathroom was nice and well lit so could see properly to shave etc, it is also in a convenient place for times square which is roughly two minutes walk, we didn’t really use any amenities whilst in the hotel as we were either out or too tired to do anything else once we got back to our room, we didn’t use any of the tea or coffee in the room as  a bottle of water was 3 dollars which I think was a bit expensive but apart from that we were happy with the hotel.

title: Good hotel - overcharged following check out
text:
Good hotel in a great location. Rooms clean and tidy and a good size for a city. Staff friendly and welcoming and would have given a 5 star review, however, they have let themselves down following check out.
We were charged a $100 a day service charge which is refunded on check out less any amenities used (this includes tea, coffee, water) in the room. We purposely didn’t use the water as felt $3 for a small bottle was excessive. However we have now been charged for 4 bottles of water following our stay. I have challenged this with them and they are very dismissive and basically it is our word against housekeeping, so just beware of these charges…I appreciate only small but it lets them down.

title: Overcharged
text:
The hotel was good, clean and in a convenient location for walking. 

The main issue is that we were substantially overcharged and have been unable to get any resolution despite numerous attempts contacting the hotel and also through booking.com

title: Great location--just south of Central Park
text:
This is a very nice (not great) hotel that has a lot to offer; however, it has a few problems that keep it in the "average" range.  The two elevators (very small) have to be the slowest in the world.  The check in process is a little confused and slow for Honors Members.  The lobby is small and tight--filled with a lot of people that appear to be waiting for something.  The standard rooms are a little small, but they are very quiet--a real plus because we heard no street noise! The location is wonderful and well located if you are in the city to catch a cruise--as we were.  The terminal is minutes away by Lyft or Uber, but getting into them is a bit of a problem because the traffic is heavy and there is no place for the driver to park--save in the middle of the very busy street.  It is a bit of a hassle to get your bags loaded into the trunk. 
 
The location is great for just about any tastes--upscale shopping, the park, museums, art and antique shops, Radio City (a great Art Deco architectural conglomeration), St  Pat's Cathedral, restaurants, people watching, ....  As a note, the Today Show is just a few minutes' walk away--some of the people we met were planning to get there for the 8:30 AM plaza break.  The hotel has a very nice restaurant for dinner or wine/cocktails.  

For New York City, the price of the hotel stay is very reasonable.

title: Family trip to New York 🍎🗽✈️
text:
Family of five adults booked two rooms, both rooms were clean and comfortable. Serviced every two days the rooms were serviced to our needs eg clean towels, top up coffees and beds made. 
Reception staff were friendly, however on check in was requested to pay substantial holding deposit - await results of any charges.
Location of the hotel is ideal to explore New York, 10 minutes away from Times Square,great restaurants and accessible to the metro.

title: Great 5 days in NYC
text:
Location of this hotel is perfect. 5-10 minute walk to Times Square and the same to Central Park. Staff were friendly and welcoming on check in. We had a package holiday with Virgin which included the local taxes that some hotels charge but a $100 a night security deposit was taken but refunded on departure. 

Rooms were great for what we needed. Family of 2 adults and 1 teenager. Room has 2 double beds, bathroom with shower, coffee making facilities, microwave and fridge. Option for housekeeping everyday but we opted for every other day.

Didn’t not experience any issues with lifts as mentioned in other reviews. Never waited more than a couple of minutes. We were room only so can’t comment on any food side of things but there is a restaurant attached to the hotel.

All in all a great hotel, no issue, would recommend and come back.

title: Great location, room good size. Lifts slow but near Central Parlk.
text: Location great, room very comfortable and larger than other hotels I have stayed at in New York. Temperature great and I had read reviews and was aware of slow lifts. Only complaint was that the staff could have bene a little bit more helpful and friendly - which was unfortunate as all other people I can win contact with were super friendly and helpful. If you want your room set v bed each day - ask when checking in as I had two c heck on day 2 when room was going to be serviced only rot be told I should have requested daily service when I checked in - which I would have done if I had been informed.

title: Honeymoon review
text:
Came here for our honeymoon. Before arriving we had agreed to an upgraded room, the room was not particularly great, visible dust on the counters, cold air coming from the terrace, and the pillows on the bed need refreshed. The rooms need updated badly. 
The 5 night stay we had to shuffle past the cleaning trolleys as they were permanently parked outside our door.

 Thankfully we were on the second floor and could take the stairs as the lifts seemed to constantly be full. 

Breakfast was fine, a few options but did the job. 
Staff were lovely and could not fault them. 
Also we weren’t informed about the security deposit that would be taken upon check in which was another 500 dollars, thankfully we used our credit card! 
Upon returning home we noticed we had been charged for the water that we never actually drank in the room. We left it and bought our own in the 7-11 nearby. $6 dollars for water we never even drank. 

Overall the hotel is in a great location for exploring the city, the staff are nice, just other small things could be done to make the hotel a better experience 
Added a picture of the permanently parked domestic cleaners trolleys that were parked outside our hotel room.

title: SKIP DIRTY
text:
DUMP part college dorm
Really run down and dirty
Just unpleasant
Breakfast was a voucher for whatever appeared in a room of boxed stuff
Not sufficient elevator capacity, the wait always was minutes to 1/2 hour
It is smart to choose another option here.  There are more offerings in this price range that clean up offer decent breakfast and are not poorly operated

title: Great one night stay!
text:
I spent one night at the Hilton Garden Inn Central Park Sout/Midtown West and would happily stay again.

I was able to check in 2 hours earlier than the official check in time.  I got a very nice, quite spacious, king bed room.  As requested, the room was away from the elevator and, as it was on the 21st floor, was quiet.

The bed was comfy and the pillows as well.  The room was contemporary in decor as well as the bathroom (thanks for the lighted mirror for make up application!).

I had no issues with the elevator.  

Hotel is in a great location, mid way between the chaos of Times Square and the serenity of Central Park.

All the staff I dealt with were very friendly and personable.

title: Convenient location, friendly staff.
text: This is a very conveniently located hotel, within easy walking distance to Times Square, the theater district, and Central Park. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. As with most hotels in Manhattan, the rooms are relatively small, but very nice and comfortable. The one downside is that this hotel only has three elevators, one of which was not working during our stay, so we often had to wait 5-10 minutes for an elevator.  Overall, it was a nice home base for a few days, and we would stay here again, especially because the room rates were reasonable (for NYC anyway).

title: Lovely hotel, good location.. needs a room update and bigger breakfast
text:
Lovely hotel in good location, room
Is basic as expected in NY, no heated towel rail ( needed in December!) and requested daily clean which didn’t happen. We were on 31st floor so may have been a dated room. Staff are lovely, breakfast is limited and tip expected each day despite pre paid for the trip but then again its NY. We have stayed elsewhere before and maybe wouldn’t choose here again vs other hotels used but it was clean, comfortable and fine for the week we stayed. Overal the location was the best for Central Park /seven 11 round the corner and you have to try the Poke takeaway on 52nd street/8th Avenue xx

title: Buen hotel pero mal servicio.
text: Muy bien ubicado, cerca de Times Square y Broadway. El bell boy nunca volvió a ayudarnos, creo que dí mal propina. Hay 3 elevadores, uno fallaba mucho y durante los 2 últimos días sólo funcionaba uno para 34 pisos, en una ocasión tuvimos que bajar 18 pisos por las escaleras. NO había agua CALIENTE en la mañana para bañarse 🥶😡, esto me hizo escribir esta opinión, no soy de los que se quejan.

title: Good location
text:
We had 2 rooms on the 4th floor, we found the staff very helpful and facilities very clean.
The location was great also- 15 mins walk to Central Park. 10 mins walk to 5th avenue and 15 mins walk to time square. Plenty of places around to get breakfast and would definitely recommend Pick-a-Bagel. Just be prepared to pay $100 per room per night on arrival as a deposit. Put ours on a credit card and got it back straight away on departure. Getting around is also very easy from this location as a lot of the Uber drivers tend to park near the hotel so generally will be picked up in around 1-5 minutes

title: Visiting
text: This hotel was excellent  . Staff so friendly and helpful nothing was any bother to them.would like to thank the young man who gave me directions to the subway for return to jfk airport and printing out our boarding passes I forgot to get his name but a massive  thank you. also we had no issues on wating on the lifts as i check reviews before we went and a lot of people where  complaining  about this.

title: Quality hotel
text: We stayed in the hotel for a week, it is ideally placed for Time Square and Central Park. The hotel staff are lovely, very friendly and polite, the rooms are nice , could do with more storage. Always check fees and taxes before booking as NY has lots hidden costs. The hotel is excellent and I would recommend anyone to stay here, the beds are very comfortable

title: Christmas in NYC
text:
The location of the hotel was fantastic, halfway between Times Square & Central Park. The staff were extremely friendly & helpful. We arrived early & were offered a room prior to check in (for a fee). The lifts are a bit of a disaster, we were on the 4th floor & could use the stairs so it wasn’t as much of a problem for us. The one negative is that the hotel is quite shabby. It’s clean but shabby. Stains on carpets, musty smell in places, the bed linen could do with being replaced. There was a weird humming noise coming from outside of our bedroom window. We stayed here as part of a bigger trip so didn’t have much choice in the hotel. I probably wouldn’t book it again, I would recommend it as a budget hotel.  

On another note I would like to say that NYC is dirty. Trash everywhere. It’s also VERY expensive. But at no point did we ever feel unsafe. The WiFi points around the city are great. There is no more of a homeless problem than in any other big city. We were there for Christmas. It was CRAZY ! But great !

title: Great location
text: Great location, friendly staff, clean room larger than expected for NYC. Lots of negative comments about the elevators but minor inconvenience for where the hotel is located. We stayed for a week and our room was cleaned regularly. Thanks for a lovely stay and happy holidays

title: Not bad
text:
The let down of this hotel was the staff, miserable (not all but most) 
Also they request a $500 depsit on check in so make sure you have it! Wasnt made aware of this...i imagine this could be a problem for anyone who doesnt have back up cash.
The lobby... the lifts take ages and always busy!
Clean, tidy, good location.
Can be loud, we were out all day from around 7am til 11/12, woke up most nights at 1am & 4am with noise outside...music, traffic....they beep theor horn a lot in nyc, road rage is at its best!!! 
Overall  not bad for what we needed.

title: Non rifanno la camera e non hanno opzioni Gluten Free
text: Hotel in ottima posizione ma oggettivamente con molte pecche. Non rifanno la camere tutti i giorni, non cambiano gli sciugamani e la colazione è davvero molto parca e risicata (giusto eggs & bacon, patate e poco più). Inoltre non c'è alcuna possibilità di avere delle opzioni gluten free e con mia moglie celiaca è stato davvero pessimo

title: Good location but could use updating
text:
Pros - location
Cons - elevators took forever, beds were not comfortable and the blankets were so thin. Also we had a handicap accessible room (I don’t know why), but the water from the shower in the bathroom leaked to the entire bathroom floor. It was a mess after every shower. Outdated rooms too. 

It’s a place to sleep but I wouldn’t stay here again.

title: Give yourself plenty of time to wait for a lift.
text:
Very nice hotel in a great location, rooms and hotel in general were very clean, we came in December and the reception area was nicely decorated. 
Check in was quite slow but the information given about the hotel was thorough, at check in a $400 security deposit is taken for you room, this is fully refundable (I hope). 

The bed was comfy, pillows are quite poor , very thin and lumpy. 
Room walls are paper thin, we listened to every conversation our room next door had among other activities. 
If you get a room next to the loft shaft be prepared for a constant wind sound of the loft going up and down in the shaft at all times. 
Speaking of the lifts, they haven’t quite mastered how to efficiently make use of a lift, they’re far too small, seem to fly past your floor on multiple occasions and when it does get here it’s full. 
On our check out we waited 15 minutes for a lift we were able to get in. 5 separate lift calls later we finally managed to squeeze in one.

title: Great Place!   Great Food!  Great Staff!  Reasonably priced!
text: Thank you for the opportunity of writing this review, as a long time New Yorker I have stayed in many hotels in Manhattan, I stayed at the Ganzevoort in the Manhattan Suite that went from 800 to almost 2000, if you want to get ripped off, go there, if you want a very nice experience, a great restaurant on the first floor, a marvelous view, a clean, neat, tidy and a Chic room and dog friendly too, at a very reasonable price, go here!

title: Nice hotel, can i have my deposit returned please
text: The hotel was pleasant enough with helpful staff. The room was clean and it is close to many of the popular sites. Now comes the kicker, on arrival we were asked for a deposit of 500 dollars which we were not previously made aware of. I negotiated 300 dollars as all of my money was in cash at the time. I was told when we left that the money would be put straight back in my account and here i am 5 days later still waiting for the money to be returned.

title: Pior staff já visto!! Grosseria por parte de todos
text: Cobrança em duplicidade por parte do hotel e continuam insistindo que o fato de esta "pending" em um dos cartões não serei cobrada. Estou explicando todos os dias é que para o cartão a transação é como se tivesse acontecido então meu limite esta preso sendo que no outro cartão também consta na fatura!! Um absurdo! o Gerente teve a falta de respeito de me falar que estavam cobrando certo por

title: Christmas 2023
text:
Stayed 1-5 Dec 2023 in a 2 x double bed room. Staff were really attentive throughout stay. Room did have limited floor space, but it has 2 double beds, so I expected that. Was enough for what we (3 adults)needed for the time we spent in the room.
Coffee and tea were provided, and tap water is OK to drink, so no bottles are required. Microwave was a great bonus.
Bathroom was equipped with a 'propper' hair dryer. Shampoo,conditioner and shower gel were really good quality.
Location was great, approx 15-20mins from Tume Square one way and same from Central Park other direction. 
Would stay here again as location good, facilities do what they need to, staff really polite and cost affordable.

title: Small Rooms, Small/Crowded Lobby, Friendly Staff
text: Close to Subways and Lincoln Center.  Smallish, clean rooms and waits for elevators.  (Warning signs in elevator lobbies.)  No Hilton Diamond welcome or recognition.  Basically a Comfort Inn under the Hilton Name.

title: Mean Front Desk people
text:
Experience was OK. The room was bit tight space. The bad experience comes from Lobby. That is the first/and last point of contact with your guests where the front desk people can make you guests WOW or YUCK.

Every time I called, the call went to your central call center (I guess). It was very hard to reach front desk by phone. Prior to check out I tried to call front desk, to have my car in the front of the building (since I noticed earlier that the lobby was full of people checking in/ and out. But you guys don't have enough employees to help the guests. 

Anyways, I called the lobby as usual the call went to some call center than they transferred my call to the lobby, and I was not able to reach the lobby by phone. 

 When we all came down at the lobby and checked out and asked how long it'll take them to bring the car the lady said 20 minutes. I exclaimed why 20 minutes. She said, 'because it takes 20 minutes I don't want to say 10 minutes and if it takes longer you'll get mad'.

After 30 minutes later I went to the front desk again and I asked why it's taking so long, I wanted to call from my hotel room so you could have brought the car by the time we are checked out, this time the lady name 'Angelique' was so rude the tune she was using as if she was talking to her subordinate.  and she asked me If I'd like to go myself and get the car, I was so surprised by her comment and attitude. She added, 'It's not far, it's down the street.

I asked what's her name was?! She replied 'Why are you going to complain? then she pointed out to an African American lady (sorry I didn't get her name) who initially helped us check out. I went to speak to her, but she was with another guest, so I was waiting. In the meantime, after 38 minutes later the car pulled over by the front of the building, So I didn't care to speak to her and leave. I didn't want to spend any more time there.

title: Great location-avoid this hotel!!
text:
Arrived at the hotel early evening. Was greeted by a member of staff who was in training at the time. He asked for a credit card for payment of $100 dollars per night. Totalling $500 for 5 nights. Never explained what it was really for. When I asked the other receptionist she gave me an abrupt answer & said it’s a ‘security deposit’. We handed over the card & thought nothing of it. Got handed over the room cards. Got in the lift & couldn’t work out how to get to our room. No-one advised you needed to scan the room key to get to the floor! Not what we needed after 12 hours of travelling! 
When we got in the room, my partner checked his bank account & found out the credit card payment from earlier was taken out of his bank account!! We were completely shocked-we thought the payment was going to be held on the credit card-not taken out completely! It’s unheard of in the UK, & took out a massive chunk out of our spending money. When we asked again at reception-we were told it would be put back into the account when we checked out. We tried not to let it ruin our trip. 
We booked a room with two queen beds. There was three of us sharing a room with three large suitcases. The room they gave us was two double beds & you barely manoeuvre around the room. It was tiny & not what we booked!! At this point I was too tired to go back to reception & ask for a different room. 
The reason I didn’t give this hotel a one star is the location. It is a 10 min walk away from Times Square & near the subway. 
This was our first time in New York & we saved a year for this trip. I was really disappointed with this hotel; the attitude of the reception staff, the ‘security deposit’ payment & the room size was poor. There are much better hotels nearby…we won’t be staying here again.

title: Excelente custo-benefício em Nova York
text:
Para quem procura um excelente custo-benefício em Nova York, sem dúvidas eu recomendo o Hotel. O tamanho do quarto é excelente, com um banheiro bem amplo e uma excelente ducha. Algumas pessoas reclamam do elevador do hotel, eu sinceramente fiquei 7 dias no hotel e não tive problema em nenhum dos dias, sempre que chegava ou saia, o elevador chegava rapidamente.
O serviço de quarto não é diário e isso foi avisado para nós, o que não tinha problema nenhum, inclusive nós até pedimos para adiar a limpeza do nosso quarto e a equipe foi muito solicita e remarcou para o outro dia e o quarto ficou muito limpo e organizado.
Minha unica sugestão é com a questão de iluminação do quarto, poderia ter uma luz no centro do quarto, logo abaixo da cama, para deixar o quarto mais iluminado durante a noite, para pessoas que gostam de quarto mais iluminado para organizar as coisas no fim do dia, mas isso é apenas um detalhe.
Quero destacar aqui que achei incrível ter a disposição um frigobar e um microondas no quarto, eu podia comprar água, refrigerante e energéticos, deixar no frigobar e não ter nenhuma cobrança pelo uso, isso é excelente.

title: New York, New York: So good they billed me twice.
text:
I booked my room via Booking.com. The price at the time of booking was €1,361. I was billed $1,900 at checkout time even though I booked with booking.com for $1,361. I had to explain to the staff member three times before my correct bill was presented. Upon returning home I discovered my credit card was billed for both amounts. Reading other customers' reviews it seems this is a regular occurrence and not an isolated incident. Trying to contact the hotel and talk to someone in the accounts department was impossible. In the end, it was only resolved by seeking assistance from Booking.com.

When you book a Deluxe King Room with a Terrace you expect a large room. The room was small with a king-sized bed which was just possible to walk around. As for the terrace, it was an area at the back of the hotel and we were on the second floor. All the rubbish from the hotel could be seen and smelled. The corridor outside the bedroom door seems to be the store for all the housekeeping trolly. It was there for the three days of our stay. I did not dine in the hotel at any time but it was interesting to observe just how few people there were in the dining room at meal times. Do they know something? Overall an underwhelming experience.  The staff were at least cheerful and friendly! This hotel is best avoided!

title: This Premier room shown on Hilton's website having a cushioned sitting chair.  This room did not have a sitting chair.
text: I expected to get the room that was in the photo.  I asked Front Desk and they said its a premier room.  Then where would a sitting chair go...in the Hall?? Being a person of 2 hip surgeries...I need a chair to sit in. Sitting on a bed is not comfortable..as a bed is for sleeping.

title: Great stay at a hidden gem
text: This hotel is a hidden gem.  Close to everything, super convenient, very clean, and remarkably quiet for the location.  We walked less than half a mile to radio city to see the Rockettes.  Les than half a mile in the opposite direction to a theater on Broadway.  And around half a mile to Columbus Circle/central park.

title: Quiet and wonderful staff
text: Outstanding experience. We received the warmest of welcomes from Will and Luis and they were happy to accommodate our bags until we came back for check in. I’ve stayed in NYC several times, but have never had quieter rooms than our sixth floor connected. Just a lovely experience. Thank you.

title: Bom hotel. Voltaria.
text:
Hotel com excelente localização, perto do metrô, time square, restaurantes, etc.
Quarto com micro-ondas, frigobar e cafeteira. Cama e travesseiros confortáveis. 
Limpeza diária com troca de toalhas.
Banheiro com box de vidro, bom chuveiro, shampoo, condicionador, sabonete líquido para corpo e mãos e tb creme hidratante, todos de boa qualidade.
A recepção não conta com pessoas solícitas. Fomos atendidos rispidamente no check-in. 
Estávamos em 4 pessoas no quarto, 2 amigas chegaram antes e meu marido e eu chegamos 2 dias depois, a recepcionista fez pouco caso dizendo que nossa reserva não estava lá, isso pq meu marido fala inglês (então não foi problema de comunicação) e estávamos com o impresso da reserva em mãos. No final tivemos que falar com nossas amigas para "liberarem" nossa entrada.
Café da manhã não incluso mas o hotel conta com restaurante. Café da manhã 25 dólares por pessoa.
Ficaria novamente.

title: Great stay
text: Maranda and Dashona provided superb courtesy and customer service. The property was well maintained and very comfortable. Even with how busy York City is at this time of year, it was a very pleasant experience.

title: Terrible
text:
They lost my packages that costed me over 200Usd. The receptionist did not want to spend time trying to find even though Amazon proved the delivery. 
The ar conditioner was really loud, small towels, nothing really worked.

title: Hilton super especial
text: El hotel super el señor martín en front desk supero amable para mi uno de los mejores que nos atendido el servicio d los cuartos excelente el restaurante muy acogedor y el chico diminicano del bar también muy amable lo recomiendo el hotel 100 %

title: Great Hotel to see New York
text: Great Hotel for viewing New York in central position near to Central Park. Hotel has all the facilities required to see the city. Near to most of the sights or within walking distance to transport to them. Good breakfast in restaurant next door

title: Highly Recommended
text: Great location for access to all the sights. Helpful and friendly staff. Rooms are clean and spacious, noise never an issue. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return. Highly recommended.

title: A great choice for us.
text: We’ve just come back from a great trip to NYC from the UK and we’re really glad we picked this hotel. The location is great, rooms clean, comfortable beds and super helpful staff at every opportunity. They were especially helpful with organising a late checkout when I was unwell at the end of the trip so that I could rest until the last possible moment, then organising a taxi for us. The only thing stopping me giving this hotel a 5* review is the elevators as they were super busy and we almost always had to wait a long time.

title: Great stay
text:
Amazing hotel. 
Wow, I couldn’t believe the welcoming. After such an awful experience at another hotel we we’re going to stay at on 141 e 44 st we tried this one instead, my husband loved the room. The bed was very comfortable and rooms are very spacious. 

They accommodated our stay perfectly, staff are friendly and very helpful. 
Cheers! 
We shall visit again very soon

title: Excellent emplacement
text:
Super emplacement. Vraiment pratique. Métro au pied de l’hôtel. Proche de Time Square, et des magasins pour shopping. 
Chambres un peu petites a 4, et lits étroits. Mais confortables. 
Personnel toujours dispo et souriant.
Chambre faite tous les jours.
Vue sur l’Empire State Building= TOP

title: Great Stay in NYC!
text: I took my 16 year old daughter to NYC as part of her birthday gift and we really had a great time. It was my second time staying at this great hotel. Pricilla at the front desk is phenomenal. Anything I requested was definitely granted. Stayed on the 30th floor with zero issues.

title: Great location and very helpful staff!
text:
So impressed with this property. Great location - close to everything but far enough away from the Times Square craziness. SO quiet! Can’t believe how quiet our room was. Very clean. The room was spacious for NYC. Beds were so comfortable- my daughter and I slept great! Priscilla and Angelique texted me daily to see if there was anything we needed - thank you! They arranged for a car to take me to LGA at the end of our stay. 
The room had a funky smell that didn’t go away. No maid service while we were there. Other than that it was excellent and I highly recommend. Will stay again!

title: me dieron una habitación ocupada
text:
Me dieron una habitación que ya está ocupada el tipo estaba bañándose y estaba desnudó mi hija de tres añitos lo vio totalmente desnudó y cuando bajé al
Lobby llorando aterrada lo único que hicieron fue cambiarme de cuarto sin ni siquiera pedir una disculpa

title: Look for something better
text:
3 stars is generous.

The hotel itself was fine, location good and staff very friendly until the last night.  The reviews about the elevators were my biggest worry and ended up being fine. Our shower wouldn't drain and was never fixed over our 5 night stay. We only had TV and internet a handful of hours the entire stay and were told many different reasons why it didn't work. Then  told on the last night there was a cable outage? Not sure what was actually going on. The girl at the front desk got short with me and hung up. I was explaining that if this was such an issue we should have been told as we were also unable to work, due to the outage.  I would never stay here again.  The lobby is very small and there are much better choices for the price.

title: Best Experience EVER!
text:
From the moment I walked up to the hotel till the moment I left the following day - every staff encounter was extremely exceptional!! Happy staff, helpful
Staff!! I will make this location my top choice!
I highly recommend 5/5

title: Great location
text:
Hotel was perfect for our visit to NYC. The room was clean, bathroom good size, bed comfortable. Location is ideal for everything you need. I would recommend this hotel. 
Yes it’s expensive and the room is not huge, but it was perfect for what we needed, clean, quiet, and functional. The elevators are small and sometimes there was a wait but it was not an inconvenience at all.

title: Decepcionante
text: Cobraron 60 USD por recibir unos paquetes que no estuvieron 5 minutos en recepción,un abuso que demuestra la atención al usuario.Sucio,raído, baño con hongos, una sola limpieza de habitación en 5 dias, ascensores que mueven las paredes de la habitación y suenan 24 horas.

title: Williams, friendly staff,
text: This was a great place. I would not hesitate to stay here. They went above and beyond when I had an issue.  We need to stay extra night and they said we had to pack up and move to another room.  They called back in the same room.

title: Clean, comfortable rooms in convenient location
text: Clean and comfortable (if not spacious , but this is NYC) rooms, very good location for a walk to Broadway or Times Square or a run in Central Park, helpful staff - especially Priscila at the front desk who helped me book connecting rooms for a future stay with my family when I couldn’t figure out how to do it online - and a comprehensive fitness center/gym. An added bonus was that the temperature in the room was easy to control and the in-room microwave meant I could have a cup of tea in the morning without having to use the Keurig which makes tea that tastes of coffee.

title: Great location and rooms
text:
Great location, nearby everything. There are many subway stations around, which makes easier to go to any part of the city.  

Times square is just a couple of blocks from the hotel. 

The rooms are excellent with beautiful view. The staff was nice and helpful. I really recommend it for long or short stays.

title: Junior Suite is worth the extra $
text: Stayed in the king room with patio on 2nd floor. Room itself was clean and hotel location perfect.  However, we’ve stayed in the junior suite on the upper floor previously, and it has so much more space, with a sofa as well as outdoor patio. I wish we’d spent the extra money and gotten the suite, it’s definitely worth a little more. Only downside is the extremely slow elevators and slow front desk. Could use the stairwell from 2nd floor.

title: A great hotel with great staff!
text: Good location, clean, and nice hotel. The  entire staff was great, especially Pricilla at the front desk who allowed us to check in early after a very long overnight flight. The room was nice, quiet, and comfortable. Will stay there again!

title: Great Trip
text: Priscilla was a great help !  Everything was awesome and very convenient. You’re able to walk or access the nearby subway to see all the major spots.  I’d definitely recommend  staying here when you come to NYC.

title: 5 stars , should be more
text:
Just arrived back from a great 5 days in NYC , where we stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Central Park
From the moment we arrived we had a fantastic experience
The staff were excellent, especially the reception ladies  , who always made us smile on entering and leaving
The room was ideal for us, we spent most of the day out and about so to come back to a lovely room and shower was perfect
The hotel is ideally satiated if you want to explore NYC .
Close to Tines Square , The Empire State building , and all that Manhattan has to offer 
7th Avenue metro is just minutes away if you want to branch out a little further 
All in all we had an incredible time in NYC, and when return which we will then we would stay at the Hilton Garden Inn
10/10
Phil and Nicola
Rushden
UK

title: Lot of things to Like about this Garden Inn
text: Staff here is excellent . Special shout out to Angelique at front desk, Easy walk to Times Square, Central Park, Broadway, etc. Stayed here several times. Will do so again. Only issues are that the rooms are a bit small (this is NYC after all) and the elevators can be slow, but a great sleep and good shower. Treat yourself to a great steak at Empire (pricey but excellent) - tip: ask for discount coupon at check in . We stay here often when in the City

title: Very small rooms in an overpriced hotel
text: A terrible experience for the following reasons:  elevators were totally inadequate for the number of rooms; the request for towels were NEVER delivered; the request for additional hangers was never taken care of; the room is very, very small.  While the staff was friendly, it did not result in fulfilling any requests.  The best to be said about the hotel was the central location of the hotel.  Very expensive for the size of the rooms and the level of service.

title: Clean with Great Price and Location
text: Hotel is perfectly located for sightseeing - close to Broadway shows/Times Square and near many subway stops. Was clean, staff people helpful. Rooms are small but have what you need if you are out sight seeing all day. We especially liked that there was a small laundry room so we could clean a couple loads of dirty clothes. Elevators are slow and crowded but we found that the worst times are check-out and check-in. Solution is to try to plan your day without needing elevators at those times if possible. The excellent location, reasonable price and workers like Harrison make up for this inconvenience. Would definitely stay again.

title: My stay at the Hilton
text: I just want to say that Priscilla Pibernus is the best  front desk agent  you have! She made my stay extremely easy going and stress free. She was very polite and extremely professional in every aspect.  She always greeted me when entering the hotel and while leaving. You should definitely hire more people that work as hard as she does!  I will definitely stay at this Hilton hotel because of how good Priscilla took care of me! She get 100 stars from me!

title: Superb Customer Service!!
text: The hotel is in the most central location for NYC travel. My family and I came into town for some sightseeing. The girl at the front desk, Priscilla, was super helpful!!!! She helped my family and I find things to do. She was even helpful with dinner suggestions!!! Nowadays it’s so hard to find pleasant people who genuinely love what they do. This young lady went above and beyond!!!

title: Infested with rodents
text: This hotel was horrible.  The first room reeked of animal urine, and upon switching rooms we found the second did the same once the air conditioning was turned on.  My wife awoke in the night with something crawling on her, and the next day we found bite marks on her jeans, where a rodent seemed to have gnawed at the leather tag.

title: Great Stay
text: Great spacious rooms. Concierge was great at front desk. Right in the middle of everything. Walks away from time Square. Will stay again. Easy access to your room. Rooms were clean.will definitely stay again.

title: I had a wonderful stay.
text: Everyone one was so kind. Especially Priscilla. Thank you for everything. The manager on duty as well. I had the room with the terrace and I loved that room. I was able to enjoy the patio at the end of my working shift.

title: Excelente
text: Melodíe fue una excelente anfitriona. Muy responsable, comprensiva y amable. Nos ayudó con las valijas, con la habitación. Súper voluntariosa. Entendió nuestras necesidades. Gracias a ella que nos recomendó hacer cosas

title: Great location, great staff, recommend staying here if visiting Time Square, Central Park, and TV morning and late shows
text: We arrived late Sunday evening, Alex & Miranda at the front desk assisted us and helped with traffic as we had to unload quickly.  If it wasn't for their diligence we may still be waiting for parking.

title: Superior Customer Service
text: From the moment of check-in with Miguel, to check-out, I received superior customer service.  I did encounter a problem with my room early one morning, the issue was taken care of quickly, and all staff made sure I was comfortable in my new room.  I will be returning next week!

title: Outstanding
text:
Read some bad reviews on this hotel, I can only imagine that some people are very hard to believe.

From the first moment we checked in to our checking out 5 night's later, the staff couldn't be more perfect

Hotel perfect, location perfect, would definitely recommend

Thanks everyone for making us feel special

title: Muy buena ubicación
text: El hotel se encuentra en una excelente lugar para conocer Manhattan a pie o en metro. Sin embargo no tuvimos servicio de aseo a pesar se haberlo pedido a la gente correspondiente, lo que implica que hicimos nuestra cama y baño (Solo nos pasaron toallas nuevas).   en un hotel de 300-400 USD la noche luego de un largo día recorriendo Inaceptable para nosotros!!!

title: 1 week sight seeing holiday
text: Great location, great beds and great porters. Harrison was really helpful. The only annoying thing was the lifts as busy at peak times, but all in all a great hotel for a week sightseeing. I will definitely be back .Thanks for a great stay Hilton

title: Laughable for the price
text: We booked this hotel at the last minute to attend a family funeral.  I realize that some concessions must be made when you need a room quickly, so I took that into consideration. However, the idea that this hotel has the audacity to charge $600 a night for a room no better than an interstate highway hotel is laughable. The room is remarkably tiny and dated, and when we checked in, they were nice enough to "upgrade" us, so I have to wonder how small the original room was.  The staff was very nice, and check in was smooth, so I have absolutely no issue with people or service.  They were all welcoming and friendly.  I just want travelers to avoid spending what I believe is twice what the hotel is worth for the night. There is no room for people to walk next to each other, so we were constantly moving out of the way.  The only chair is the desk chair, which was  frankly in the way of the only area we could walk, and the "closet" was a narrow cabinet. I come to New York all the time and have stayed in places better and worse, and they were priced accordingly.  I don't need luxury, but I certainly don't want to pay for it if it doesn't exist.

title: Amazing hotel!
text:
Location is great, good concierge, people very friendly. Douglas it was amazing guy! Very friendly and helpful!

Lift was below expectation. Very slow and crowded.
Room are good, shower good and room clean! For sure will be my option on the next trip to NY!

title: Time to renovate and change room policy
text: Great location and super friendly staff but... elevators have problems every day and 17 floors via the stairs is no fun.  So whenever an elevator stops you take it, up or down doesn't matter.  But the horrible thing is that if you order wine it's plastic glasses no matter the wine, for safety reasons!!!!!!!!!

title: Melodie at the front desk is great
text: Melodie at the front desk was great. Greeted everyone with a smile and was very helpful in expediting check-in.  She checked to make sure a room was ready and I was able to get on with my business of the day. Thank you, Melodie!

title: Great experience
text: The staff was amazing, the room was very clean, and cozy. I enjoyed this hotel a lot.  They had a very nice lobby. Everything was clean, the bed was very comfortable, comfortable couches in the lobby.

title: zentrale Lage
text: Zentral gelegen, das Rezeptionspersonal teilweise unfreundlich. Im Zimmer hat es gestunken und war ohne Raumspray nicht auszuhalten. Die Tür war so verzogen, dass diese nur mit viel Kraft zu öffnen und zu schließen war und das sehr lautstark. Putzservice versteht kein englisch. Rezeptionschef war bemüht.

title: Excelente opción para viajeros que gustan de hacer actividades caminando, todo cerca !!
text: Solo estuvimos una noche en este complejo y el trato por parte de su recepcionista fue excelente, la habitación que nos dieron fue en un oído alto y con una vista fenomenal, estaba muy cerca de times square, la ubicación está excelente y las habitaciones están bastante cómodas, hotel totalmente recomendable como para viajeros que se la pasaran todo el día conociendo Nueva York, excelente para regresar a cargar las pilas, no visitamos el restaurante frente al lobby pero se veía muy atractivo. Por cierto el portero un señor que habla español se le vio muy atento y servicial, en todo momento nos saludó y hasta se adelantó a nuestras expectativas al momento de tomar el elevador.

title: Hôtel excellent, situé à proximité de tout Alors n’hésitez surtout pas vous le remercierez.
text:
J’ai beaucoup hésité suite au commentaire négatif, mais je peux vous dire et vous garantir que cette hôtel mérite sans pb ces étoiles, hôtel très bien situé, chambre faites tous les jours en le demandant à votre arrivée, concernant l’attente de l’arrivée de l’ascenseur ok un peu d’attente mais pas plus de 15 minutes.

Essayer effectivement de demander une chambre élevée mais franchement pas trop de bruits.

Personnellement je recommande cette hôtel et je compte revenir pour Halloween.

Merci et à bientôt

title: Good hotel for visiting new York
text:
Ottima posizione dell' hotel a metà fra Central Parc e Times Square.

Camere spaziose e pulite. 
Unica pecca il servizio di rifacimento camera: nonostante le richieste le camere non sono state rifatte , anche se il soggiorno è stato breve.

title: Poor management and rude staff
text: Dirty carpet in the room. Bathroom door won’t shut. Improperly hung. Shower door didn’t close right. Keurig coffee maker broken. Waited an hour for “engineer “. Took it to front desk myself requested working replacement to take back up. Brought me one with an okd used pod. At least it worked. Did not acknowledge my Diamond status or offer the usual “basic check in perk”. Staff rude at times or basically indifferent to requests or concerns. Diamond status with Hilton means NOTHING!.

title: Hotel de terror pesima experiencia
text:
Pésimo hotel .
El personal del hotel es grocero, déspota si no eres una persona caucásica , no te atienden , si eres latino o de color te discriminan.
El hotel está viejo , las instalaciones sucias , el elevador en malas condiciones, lento, en nuestra estancia solo funcionaba 1 ya se imaginaran el tiempo pérdido en bajar o subir .Los sillones del lobby asquerosos.
Para hacer el check out si son estrictos , pero para hacer el check in tardados y todavía te ponen caras como si tu les hicieras un favor, eran las 3:00 pm y aún no estaba no solo mi cuarto el de varios otros huéspedes y ni siquiera un disculpen o una botella de agua.
La habitación tuvo un problema y el "manager o gerente" ni siquiera dió la cara y por su puesto no nos ofrecieron en compensación cambiarnos de habitación.
Obviamente nos hicieron el cargo del depósito y no consumimos nada ni rompimos nada , pero no nos regresaron nuestro dinero y eso es robo .
Les podria contar más de nuestra estancia, pero resumo diciendoles que no se dejen llevar por el nombre , pues no vale nada .
Huyan de ese hotel .

title: Un ... 3 etoiles seulement sauf l'emplacement et ...le tarif
text:
Personne ne parle francais 
On vous prend le 1er jour une caution de 100$ par jour non annoncée au moment de la réservation.
Il a fallu courir apres un portier pour emmener les bagages à la chambre
Vous attendez très longtemps avant d'avoir un des 3 ascenseurs desservant 34 etages.
Le premier soir on nous a donné une chambre avec vue sur le mur d'en face et sans vue sur la ville, alors que nous avions payé au prix fort une vue sur la ville: il a fallu réclamer 3 fois pour obtenir une chambre enfin conforme.
Pas de gobelets pour les dents.
Pas de protege tête.
Le Seche cheveux était en panne
Pas de café pour la machine à café
Aucune chaîne gratuite de télévision européenne. L'Europe on ne connait pas.
Le premier jour la chambre n'a pas été faite: on ne vous dit pas qu'il faut demander chaque jour que le ménage soit fait. 
On vous oblige à adhérer au programme Hilton Honors pr avoir le Wifi gratuit .... à débit limité. Sinon il faut payer ce qu'on ne vous annonce pas lors de la réservation.
Cet hôtel ne mérite pas 4 étoiles sauf pour la vue sur la ville et l'emplacement mais à peine 3 étoiles. 
Pour ce tarif un hôtel 4 etoiles français vous en offre beaucoup plus ! Le terme Hilton est pour les gogos.
Alors n'hésitez pas à pousser votre gueulante dès le début, même si une employée nous a dit: "vous avez raison mais ils s'en foutent". Ca a changé quand même certaines choses. Ecrivez aussi un mail de réclamation à Hilton en cas de problème. Ca fait bouger les choses.
Quant aux relations quotidiennes on est dans un pays de rustres fiers de l'être ( exception de quelques personnes).

title: Great location!
text: Had a great stay with my family of four. Good space for New York standards. Just beware that you will have to wait quite a bit for the elevator. Stayed on 17th floor and was very quiet. Will stay again.

title: Great hotel and location.
text:
Stayed here for 10 nights, was greeted by Priscilla who swiftly checked us in and kindly upgraded our view since we were celebrating a special occasion.

Room was clean and surprisingly spacious for a New York hotel with great amenities as standard, such as a fridge and microwave. The staff/cleaners were all extremely friendly and did a great job with the room service.  

The lift can get busy at peak times but it’s a small inconvenience in the grand scheme of things.  Would happily stay here again.  10/10

title: Great location!
text: Hotel was clean and staff was friendly! Decent sized rooms for NYC and one of the more affordable hotels that offers 2 beds in a room. The washroom door slides open/shut but there is a gap when fully closed so be mindful!  Waited a bit for elevators but not a deal breaker. Overall great location and I would stay again.

title: I’ll be back-my room was great!
text: My stay was great.  The staff I interacted with was pleasant, room was clean.  Everything worked well.  Not really anything to complain about.  I slept well, the street was quiet.  Would definitely recommend & will gladly return to this location!  Loved room 804!!!

title: Bien situé et propre
text:
Très bien situé mais cher pour la prestation comme tout dans New York 
Bien insonorisé, aucune vue car situés au 4 étage , réception à l écoute. 
Attention peu d intimité car salle de bain fermant par une porte coulissante.

title: Disappointing stay
text: This hotel has a great location, but so does the Marriott next door.  Next time, I'll stay there instead.  While the front desk service was great, there were other things that were really ridiculous.  1.  The door to our bathroom didn't close without scraping the floor and making a weird sound. This should be an easy fix and seems to indicate lazy building ops/housekeeping staff.  and 2. We called for towels and kept being told "Consider it done' - but they never came.  After 4 phone calls, text messages to the front desk, and four hours later - I was instructed to walk to the other end of our hallway to get my own towels and toilet paper.  I mean - that's just stupid.  Pierre and Skye at the front desk were excellent though despite the other things.  Overall - C-

title: Bon hôtel bien placé
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, nous avions une chambre au 5eme étage donc pas de soucis avec l’ascenseur mais cela semble être un réel problème.
Chambre propre et bien équipée.
Petit déjeuner à revoir, trop chère pour si peu de choix.

title: Nice hotel, great location
text:
Nice hotel that is very handy for Broadway and Central Park- only about 10 minutes walk to each.  Also a wide range of food places nearby.  The room was a good size, good bathroom and air con.  The staff were all really helpful and friendly at all times.  
The elevators get quite busy which can be a pain but we just planned ahead and added a bit of time on when we went out.

title: Happy visitor!
text: Pierre helped expedite us get to our room when we arrived prior to scheduled check in time and was kind enough to also upgrade our room which was so appreciated. Clean, spacious rooms and wonderful location ideal for anyone wanting to see theatre, also quick walk to Central Park. We go to NYC often and plan to book here moving forward.

title: Won't be returning to this hotel
text:
Our first issue was with check in. Check in was listed as 3:00.  We arrived at approximately 3:30 and the room was not ready.  We booked a room with 2 Queen beds and they offered us a room with 2 Double beds, but since there were three adults, we really needed the Queen beds and decided to wait. They told us on 3 separate occasions that the room was clean but just needed to be inspected and it would only be  a few minutes.  We waited for nearly an hour.
The room was extremely small. The Bathroom was extremely small. The comforter was stained.

The elevators were insufficient for the number of rooms and number of floors in the hotel. During the afternoon, there are routinely 20 people waiting in the  lobby for the elevators (so not everyone gets on when it finally arrives). Also, it will only open 1 elevator at a time. So, even though there are 20 people waiting, you cannot even call another one until the first one is full and gone.

title: Pleasure
text: Pierre was simply AMAZING from the time we checked in until the time we checked out. From the moment he greeted us he was the most pleasant, welcoming person. He made our stay very much enjoyable it would be the main reason out of a 1,000 hotels in NY we would stay here again. Thank you so much Pierre for your kind hospitality. ❤️ Room 3307

title: Get the room with city view terrace!
text: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was excellent! We had a room with a king and pull out with a terrace. Awesome city view and we used it every night. The beds were comfortable and the room was spotless. The bathroom had both a tub w/shower and a separate shower which was very convenient. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Un petit déjeuner PITOYABLE !
text:
Séjourner durant 8 nuits dans une chambres familial, chambre assez serrée, les odeurs des étages dessous montent dans les salles de bains c’est à dire que des odeurs de cigarettes et autres (produits illegaux) montent et c’est horrible
Le petite déjeuner est pitoyable !!! Je répète PITOYABLE, ne prenez pas le petite déjeuner, il est étaler sur une table avec 2 bols de fruits, 1 bol de charcuterie et 1 bol d’œufs, c’était degeulasse, les jus et café sont dégoûtant !
Les ascenseurs prennent 30 min à arriver, ils sont pas assez rapides pour le nombres de personnes qui hébergent dans l’hôtel !
Outre à cela l’emplacement est bien !

title: Good location, but needs work
text: I’ve stayed in this hotel a few times since it’s near my favorite bars, but it could use some work. There are only 3 small elevators causing it to be very slow. Lobby is always full of people waiting. The hotel seems newer, but already looks run down. My room had a weird smell to it with some of the linens dingy. The carpet in my room felt wet. The ac also didn’t work great. The worst part is when I was taking a nap and someone tried to get into my room. He didn’t introduce himself as maintenance or whatever he was before trying to get in. He was wearing all black and he never said what he needed. Definitely startled me and made me feel unsafe.

title: We need our pajamas back
text: We stayed for 5 nights, on the 3rd night, the housekeeping came and cleaned our room and took my pajamas along with the sheets. We checked over and over again about what to do and they never updated us on anything. They said housekeeping never got back with them, and the pajamas were not hidden, they were just laying on the bed. We have still heard nothing and are very upset about our experience. We have still not been updated on anything and continue to ask and not get a definite answer.

title: Great location with good service and outstanding value
text: Wonderful location near Central Park and shows. Also plenty of places to eat and good access to subway stops nearby. Modern and clean rooms with housekeeping services as needed. Yes, the elevators can be slow, so you need to be mindful of that during rush times. Service was great and Angelique did an amazing job getting us a room even though we were checking in way early. Great value in Manhattan.

title: Small and unkept
text:
Rooms were smaller than small. Facilities in rooms weren't working. 
For the price of the Room for 3 days i was expecting ALOT more. 2 adults staying in a room with 2 Queen beds we could not move around each other and we did even have space to open our bags.,

title: Felt like the a five star hotel!
text: Very well managed hotel. Skyy in particular made sure that we were as comfortable as possible. She always had a smile on her face and was ready and willing to help if we needed it. The whole team working at the hotel could not have been nicer and more professional. We will be back!

title: Perfect "Home" for a NYC Visit
text: After switching from another Hilton property at the last minute, my daughter and I were exhausted when we arrived. Priscilla welcomed us immediately upon arrival, gave us water, and our keycards. She was so kind and understanding.  We ordered delicious room service (but my daughter feel asleep almost immediately!). Throughout out 4 day stay, Priscilla as well as another woman at the front desk, gave us advice and directions to make the most of our stay. This hotel quickly felt like our "home base" and provided much needed rest after running around the city all day.  On the last day, another employee, Brian, helped us with our luggage and secured a black car to take us to the airport. Our trip would not have been near as enjoyable had we chosen another hotel or location. This was perfect!

title: Dirty room and poor service
text: The first room we were in had smelly sheets and when we investigated it was pee. We reported it and the manager on duty was rude and unapologetic. When they finally sent someone to the room they sent him with fresh sheets and Lysol. Only when the attendant removed the sheets it uncovered a huge pee stain on the mattress topper that even after n fresh sheets were put on the smell came through. The ride manager eventually changed our room and still wasn’t even nice about it. No apology! The other room was ok but the sheets had stains and the bathroom had some mold in the ceiling. We will never stay here again!

title: Good place
text:
Nice location with easy access to everything in the city. It was easy to drop our luggage early while we waited for checking. 

Hotel is clean and cozy. Service was great. Pierre at the front desk was super helpful!

title: Great hotel near Central Park & Carnegie Hall
text:
Great hotel near Central Park / Carnegie

Stayed here for Memorial Day weekend for an event an Carnegie hall. It was a great hotel.

Rooms were nice, restaurant & bar on property, and the staff here were really helpful & nice

Central Park is just a couple blocks, great restaurants all around. Not a far walk from Times Square, really had every box checked.

Will definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Great service and will come back.
text:
Great service!  I had a problem at checkin and Priscilla (front desk mgr) made everything right.   She’s the best!  

The rooms are nice with comfortable beds.  Yes the elevator thing is annoying, but it’s midtown Manhattan.  Need to have some patience.  That said, might be a good idea to direct cleaning staff not to ride the elevators together with their cleaning carts?  Might free up space for customers.

title: The elevators are the deal breaker
text: The hotel location is great and well priced however quite basic in amenities but clean and tidy but the biggest issue and the deal breaker is the huge queue for the elevator I have stayed in 100’s of hotels and never waited consistently that long in the 4 days I have been here on average 10 - 20 mins with huge queues in the small lobby. The staff and their trollies to clean also need to use the same elevators so make it worse. There are so many hotels don’t waste value minutes of your vacation in a stressful queue

title: SMALL rooms, good service.
text: I’ll start with the positives. Great customer service. Employees very friendly, efficient, helpful. Great location if Midtown is what you want (I usually don’t stay in Midtown, but we were here for a wedding reception in Midtown). Negatives. SMALL rooms, I mean, really small. Really, really small. And only three elevators….you might wait a while. We were on the 32nd floor and one morning while waiting for the elevator the staircase door opened and a young guy came out sweating….he had walked up 32 floors because he didn’t want to wait for the elevator. The lobby is crowded. Yikes, when we checked out Sunday morning….holy geez!!!! LOTS of people. We had a “city view” which meant we had a view of random buildings…..

title: GO ELSEWHERE
text:
THIS HOTEL IS TO BE AVOIDED FOR VARIOUS REASONS.
THOSE WHO SPEND THERE SEVERAL NIGHTS MUST PLAN ON WASTING TIME, UP TO FIVE MINUTES WAITING FOR ELEVATORS EACH TIME THEY GO TO THEIR ROOMS OR LEAVE THEM.  THERE ARE THREE OF THOSE ELEVATORS, ONLY TWO OF THEM NORMALLY FUNCTIONING, AND DURING THE DAYTIME THEY ARE INVARIABLY OCCUPIED, NOT TO SAY CLUTTERED, BY THE PERSONNEL SERVICING THE ROOMS.  IN OTHER WORDS: GUESTS WASTE A GOOD DEAL OF TIME JUST STANDING IN THE CORRIDOR, WAITING.
SERVICING THE ROOMS:  THAT HAPPENS ONLY ON SPECIFIC REQUEST.  WITHOUT SUCH A REQUEST THE ROOMS ARE NOT TOUCHED. THIS IS NOT MENTIONED WHEN CHECKING IN.  WHEN THEY ARE IN FACT SERVICED IT IS BEING DONE IN A SLOPPY AND CARELESS MANNER – BUT EVEN WHEN A REQUEST HAS BEEN MADE, IT MAY BE FORGOTTEN.
THE HOTEL IS, OF COURSE, LOCATED IN A HIGH-RISE BUILDING WITH WINDOWS THAT CANNOT BE OPENED. GUESTS ARE THEREFORE DEPENDENT ON THE AIR-CONDITIONING WHICH, FOR SEVERAL MINUTES EVERY QUARTER OF AN HOUR OR SO AROUND THE CLOCK, MAKES AN INFERNAL NOISE, BONKING AND BLOWING 
NEEDLESS TO SAY: THE PRICES OF THE ROOMS ARE THOSE OF A LUXURY HOTEL. FOR THE SAME AMOUNT THERE ARE PLENTY OF GOOD HOTELS IN THE VICINITY.
.

title: Great service
text: Ideal for mid-town business trips.   The hotel has a great location, rooms are in decent shape, and client service is excellent.  Its in midtown so crowded sidewalks and elevator waits come with the territory.  A special thank you to Pierre and Angie at the front desk for being so accomodating during my stay.

title: Pffff lang wachten op een kamer
text:
Kamer was niet klaar bij aankomst in hotel.
Na uur nog steeds niet klaar.
Blablablabla housekeeping has busy day, blablablabla 
Heel lang moeten wachten tot we in kamer kunnen na lange en vermoeiende vliegreis.
Niet kunnen verfrissen of van kledij veranderen
Niet echt een leuke start van wat leuke reis zou moeten zijn

title: Muy bueno
text:
El hotel es tal cual la descripción, resulto excelente la ubicación y tiene muy buen servicio por parte de todos los empleados. Llegamos antes del horario de check in y nos recibieron las valijas.
Esta bien la relación precio calidad.

title: Rooms a bit small but great location.
text:
Nice hotel, friendly staff.
Rooms are quite small, we stayed in a family room. There's no plug sockets next to the beds so if you want to charge your phone of a night, you can't have it next to you whilst in bed.
Overall though, nice hotel, great location and a special shout out to both Skye and June who were lovely.

title: Great location, great experience
text:
This trip was booked through a UK travel company, Virgin Holidays who arranged flights and accommodation for our trip 9th to 19th June 2023.

We chose this hotel because I spend on average 80 nights per year in Hilton chain hotels as I travel frequently with my job, and generally have good experiences with the Hilton Brand.

So, first the positives:
Greeting and check in very good, no waiting time and we were allocated our room on 18th floor immediately.
The room was not huge, but was very clean and well appointed with a King size bed, desk, sofa, fridge, coffee machine, room-safe, iron and board along with adequate drawers and other space for storage of our luggage etc.
The bathroom was spotlessly clean, a great size and with a large walk-in shower.  
There was enough space to move about the room without feeling we were on top of each other and the City views from the picture windows were great.  The air-con unit was very effective and kept the room at ideal temperatures for us at all times.  It was occasionally quite loud but once accustomed to it, this was never intrusive and certainly didn't affect sleep or disturb us in any way.

There are 3 lifts in the hotel and signs advising guests to plan ahead at peak times (which are clearly shown) as there can be waiting times.  Throughout our 10 night stay, we never waited more than a minute or 2 and the lifts were fast moving between floors.  Having read some previous reviews we anticipated long waits but I can honestly say they caused us no issues at any time.

I used the gym almost daily and it is well equipped, spacious, temperature controlled and provided everything I needed for my workouts.  It was never busy and often I had the room to myself.
The hotel location was ideal for us, close to Central Park, 5th Ave, Times Square, and only a 20 minute walk from Pier 83, where we boarded several fabulous river cruises.   

Staff:  On the whole the hotel staff were excellent, friendly, approachable and very professional ( there were 2 exceptions to this and I'll mention them later).
There were also staff that were great ambassadors for the hotel, the Hilton Brand and for the City, and I would like to  mention to them:  Pierre - this Guy is amazing, a fountain of local knowledge (subway lines, routes to attractions, what to see in every area we planned to visit )....and all this with a nothing is too much trouble attitude and a genuinely welcoming personality. 
Alex, another exceptional member of staff, always willing to help, provide advice and tips.  He pointed us to the best place to go for New York bagels, showed genuine interest in everything we had seen and done, and when he realized that on our final day we would have to spend hours waiting around reception before our transit to JFK, he arranged a later check out time so we could enjoy our last hours in comfort.  He also introduced me to Douglas, another fabulous member of the team who made arrangements for a car to the airport,  explained the options, looked after our luggage and made this a seamless experience. 

Thanks also to the many staff who gave a cheery 'Have a great Day' on leaving, and 'Welcome back', on returning each time to the hotel.  These are little things but can really make a holiday feel special and guests feel welcome.

Okay, now the negatives, and fortunately this is a very short list:
2 of the female reception staff ( I wont name them but they will probably know who I am referring to ), were not of a standard I would expect from any hotel.  They were abrupt, impatient and anything but friendly.  I get that it can be a stressful job, but if you are not enjoying it, and don't want to be friendly and polite.... find a job more suited to your skillset.
Room service: only happened once in our 10 night stay, and although bedding was replaced, we had to contact reception to ask for towels as these were not.  Ironically, on check out day we got a knock at the door 30 minutes before leaving, from a maid asking if we would like our room to be cleaned???

So, if you've read this far, then here is our overall verdict.  This hotel is great value, very well located, (mostly) very friendly and welcoming, and I would thoroughly recommend a stay here to anyone.  We had a fabulous holiday in NYC, and this hotel and its staff played a major part in that experience.
I have given an excellent rating, as the few minor negatives were not significant enough to detract from the overall excellent time we spent here.

title: A nice shoebox with humidity and cockroache
text:
It's a shoebox with cockroaches. 

When I walked into my room the first day (of my 6 nights stay), I was in a tiny room, tiny as it could be...and it was warm. So naturally I turned the AC on, what happened? a cockroache walked down the ventilation. By this it was around 10 pm. What did I do? I called Front Desk, explained the situation and 25 mins later Housekeeping came. Did the individual came with a spray or a screwdriver to open and fumigate the vent? No...he said that he needed to call maintenance, another 20 minutes went by and maintenance came. But by then I was already too tired to function. Next day I was offered to change the room and obtain that night for free. Ok, fair enough. 

Got into my new room. Was it still tiny? Yes, but a big less tinnier that the first one.

Problem with this new room: lacks of proper ventilation and you can feel the humidity in the room, in the actual air of the room...I do believe that fungus in the ceiling is not good for your health....but I'm too tired to complain again, I don't want to spend my holidays hopping from one room to another. 

Also, everytime a door shuts (a neighbors door from another room) not only you may hear it slam, but also it vibrates in the whole room. So it's not easy to fall asleep. 

Elevators? They are just 3 or 4 for the whole Hotel. And when I mean whole Hotel is whole. Housekeeping, Concierge, Guests, Maintenance Crew, you name it. So...you may spend 10 minutes (or more) if you're lucky to get into the lift. 

Staff? Uncomfortable. Most people here speak Spanish, because I hear them they do, and I'm a native Spanish speaker. When I asked in Front Desk if they received packages (in Spanish) they suddenly only spoke English...it was a weird and uncomfortable situation.

Oh, I'm writing this at 4:30 pm in the mini hall of my floor waiting for Housekeeping to finish doing my room...

Most likely I'll never stay in this Hotel or sub-product-brand oh Hilton ever again (and I'm a Diamond Member)...

Avoid this property.

title: Hilton Fan For Life
text:
The front desk clerk who was on duty at 7:15 AM 6/21/2023 was one of the most helpful individuals with whom I have dealt at a hotel. He was courteous, knowledgeable, professional and incredibly helpful. 
I am a Hilton Fan for life!

title: HORRIBLE Hilton Garden Inn Hotel
text: NONE of the outlets were working, severe odor in the room, no hand soap in the bathroom. My husband travels all around the globe due to his high-position job, and we have NEVER had so many issues!! We had even gone down to ask for someone to come up and fix the outlet or at least give us another room that had working outlets, we were told someone would come up, but no one did, and we ended up missing our dinner reservations whish were made 1 month ago. WORST SERVICE EVER will definitely be letting others know via social media not to book here!!

title: Very Good  Budget Hotel in a Great Location
text: My wife and I have stayed at several relatively inexpensive (for New York) hotels in Manhattan. This was definitely the best. The lobby was modest and crowded at times, but our room was nice. Our room was relatively spacious, spotlessly clean, with new looking furnishing, and it was generically but nicely  decorated. The free wifi was fine (they offered faster wifi for an extra fee). The bed was comfortable and there were places for two big suitcases off the floor. The room had a Keurig coffee maker, small fridge, hair dryer, and a microwave. The new looking comfortably-sized bathroom was sparkling with a large sink counter (the shower door didn’t close all the way - Room 806) with full dispensers of bar soap, shampoo, conditioner and body wash, and plenty of towels. (They need a flow control valve on the shower head, for water conservation.) There were many drawers, shelves, a desk, and other storage spaces including a closet with an iron and board, and a safe. (The iron with holder and ironing board took up most of the hanging space of the closet - the iron needs to go somewhere else.) For New York, it was a very quiet room. I wouldn’t recommend the laundry service unless you want to pay very high prices for each item (see photo). There was no “resort fee” (the tack on scam fee added by many hotels in New York). (I noticed that there were rooms with adjacent elevators on both sides. They are probably rooms to be avoided.) We had a nice city view from our 8th floor room (see photo). If you are tired of cramped worn-looking budget hotels (where you can’t sit on the john and close the bathroom door at the same time), and you want a nice room near Central Park, in a safe neighborhood at a good price, look no further.

title: Customer service
text: Just arrived into the city and got great help at the front desk from Terrence Conseillant. He was very serviced minded and was great getting us set up with the Hilton Honors program. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Amazing Customer Service!
