text: Planned on visiting the weekend of June 8. Unfortunately, the wild fires in Canada covered New York in smoke so we had to cancel our trip. Pierre, the general manager, was so friendly and accommodating. He allowed us to cancel our reservation past the customary cancellation period. Customer Service like this shows you they truly care about putting their guests first!  We cannot wait to rebook our trip and stay at the Hilton Garden Inn, Central Park South / Midtown West!

title: Una gran experiencia
text: Desayuno, muy bien. Habitación, justa, pero bien. Hielo, un poco lejos. Ubicación:10. Lo mejor, Priscilla, de Recepción que nos ayudó en todo: 10. Gracias, una grata experiencia para mi familia y para mi

title: Great location and staff.
text: We arrived In evening and the staff was lovely as they were every day we stayed.  Rooms were clean and if you needed extra cleaning you only needed to call front desk and request it.  All the staff I dealt with were so kind and accommodating.  The only issue was the elevators are a bit slow. There is no service elevators so sometimes you share the elevator with the cleaning crews.  The restaurant next door looked lovely and served beef and other things however I can’t comment on food as I did not dine there.  I did ask for extra coffee pods and never received them but seriously that and the elevator were my only minor complaint. Sleeping at night it was very quiet and I did not hear any sirens or noise from outside.  I felt completely safe at this property. Only other downside was booking thru TripAdvisor you get no Hilton rewards points which is a bummer

title: Average hotel at best
text:
It was a great central location for our plans but too many distractions to rate this any higher than an average stay.
First — do not pay extra for a room with a “city view” as the view is of other adjacent tall buildings 
Second — 34 stories with only 3 slow elevators.  Be careful of what room they assign you as good chance you will be next to an elevator.  There is even a room on each floor that is between two elevators
Third — rooms are very small but understandable for NYC
Fourth — showers on 34th floor were luke warm at best

title: Not bad for NYC
text: This was a decent hotel for New York City. Check in was slow, but the rooms were typical New York size, so don’t expect a ton of space. The bathroom had been updated and it was nice and bright with a shower instead of a tub, which was nice. The room was well insulated and there was very little street noise or noise from other rooms. My frustration with the hotel is that I accidentally left a shirt hanging in the closet. I called as soon as I got home and realized it, but of course they said they didn’t have it. It was absolutely my fault for not seeing it in there (it was a dark shirt and the closet was dark), but I hate that it wasn’t put in a lost and found of some sort. Oh well! I also went to meet with coworkers for breakfast. I have a food allergy, so I brought my own oatmeal packet and just told them I needed hot water and a banana. They charged me the full buffet price of something crazy, $30 or $40?! For a banana. I thought that was ridiculous for a banana and hot water, especially considering the other two people at my table did pay and used the buffet. They essentially charged me for sitting in the dining room (which was really tired and dark and smelled a little like a retirement home dining hall). The location of this hotel is pretty good. My coworkers and I walked everywhere we needed to be for dinners and for work around Lincoln Center.

title: Una muy buena opcion en Tucuman
text: Excelente Hotel, moderno y comodo, quiero destacar la atencion, en especial de los chicos de la Recepcion, muy atentos, nos facilitaron la estadia evacuando todas las dudas e indicandonos donde podiamos visitar, gracias Sebas, Vivi Pame, una masa

title: Memorial Day Weekend visitor from Georgia
text: I had a wonderful experience at the Hilton Garden, Hotel and midtown Manhattan. Customer service was amazing, and the rooms were very nice and clean. They do offer alcoholic beverages, as well as breakfast, and even though it’s not complimentary, it is worth it.

title: Come stay here!!!
text: As I walked into the property, I was greeted by a staff member named Pierre.  He was very welcoming & pleasant. He made sure all my needs were met. I had a wonderful stay and I'll be sure to recommend.

title: Hilton Stay for Broadway
text: Perire was very helpful at the front desk with checking in. He offered reservations at the restaurant before our broadway show and a discount. He was very helpful and made our stay great! Our room was lovely and clean.

title: Gutes Hotel für 1 Woche New York
text: Gute Lage zwischen Times Square und Central Park. Zimmer ausreichend groß, Bad auch. Leider keine Möglichkeit, die Handtücher nach dem Duschen irgendwo aufzuhängen. Und für Jacken auch keine Haken. Im Winter dann sicher schwierig. Frühstücksangebot haben wir nicht genutzt, sondern alles beim Diner um die Ecke geholt... Für eine Woche NY aber ausreichend gutes Hotel.

title: Exceptional customer service. Ask for Priscilla at the front desk.
text: Great atmosphere. Great hotel. Customer service is top-notch. The workers are extremely helpful and kind. But you must ask for Priscilla at the Front Desk. She is an excellent worker. I had a conference to attend and had no idea where the conference was located. Priscilla wrote down the directions for me. Her directions were phenomenally helpful as I had not ever driven or was even remotely familiar with the Manhattan borough (Midtown-West-Central).

title: Terrible, constantly arising incomprehensible questions and problems with a refund.
text: Didn't like almost everything. Firstly, upon arrival, they said that our booking was canceled and that despite this they would try to provide us with rooms. In the morning, due to incorrect registration, we had problems with breakfast. After a long discussion, the issue was finally resolved. After that, I noticed that an additional $300 was withdrawn from my card. When I asked the reason at the reception, they said that everything would be returned within 10 days after сheck out. It's been more than a month and despite my requests, I have not received a refund. Moreover, they took off an additional $ 11 ((. I did not expect such a service from Hilton Hotels.

title: Mitigé
text:
Hôtel très bien placé, proche de Times Square et Central Park. Stations de métros aux alentours. 
Les chambres ont une décoration sobre mais peu moderne mais elles sont spacieuses. 
Nous étions au 3ème étage, avec une chambre donnant sur une cours ce qui limitait le bruit.
Il n’y a que 3 ascenseurs qui peuvent être très longs à arriver donc être sur des étages bas peur être souhaitable.
Personnel professionnel mais pas spécialement chaleureux. 
Rapport qualité prix reste élevé, on paye bien plus la localisation que les prestations.

title: Great location and wonderful staff!
text: The hotel has an excellent location.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  The room was comfortable, clean and quiet.  They have a restaurant on the property although we did not have an opportunity to go there.  There is a Subway across the street and Dunkin Donuts around the corner.  I would stay there again.

title: Decent, but unremarkable.
text:
The front desk staff, Pierre and Sky, are great and the 5 stars I'd award them have pulled this up from a 3 star to a 4 star review. I needed a room change and a late check-out, which was no problem for them.

The rooms are on the small side (the main photo on the website is of a suite, not a typical room). Our room had two queen beds crammed in, with very little wardrobe space, and nowhere to sit except at the desk.

Overall the hotel and room were clean and well maintained (my safe was broken, but they replaced it within 30 mins).

The bar is expensive even by NYC standards. Go to the bar and burger place across the street, if you want a drink.

The city view high floor room I was allocated on arrival was very noisy, with air-con fans from surrounding buildings, but the low floor street-side room we moved too was fine for noise.

title: Great accomodation
text: It was an excelent experience for one night it has a good location near central park and time square, and all the people very kind,  especially Pierre that help us a lot solving many things with a great actitude, and recommending good places!.

title: Good Location but consider other Hiltons instead
text:
I stay at Hiltons regularly and this was a very poor hotel and would recommend people consider other Hilton choices in the area. Why?
- Only 3 elevators with about 25 floors - a lot of delays.
- The room was so small - hard to get past the desk and chair to get into bed.
- Worst TV channel system ever (i.e. 12-4 is a channel), and no in room channel guide
- Staff was friendly
- Excellent location and there are other Hiltons nearby

title: Not going back again. Location good. Bell staff great. The rest - fahgettabouit.
text: We chose our room because we were asked to on the app. The hotel doesn't honor the app. I chose a digital key. The hotel doesn't offer a digital key until after you physically check in at the desk even though you're a diamond member with 1.3Million points and stay at Hilton hotels 3 weeks a month for work travel. Even though you have a credit card on file. This hotel has had issues with the elevators since the beginning and this trip was no different. There are not enough of them to accommodate the number of rooms and height of the hotel. They post "busy times" for the elevators and tell you to avoid them but it's literally 6 hours a day you should not use them according to their signs. We were granted another room on the 2nd floor, which we chose because you can just take the stairs. The rooms have not been upgraded since inception either. Same carpet. Same beds (now lumpy and rough). New pump soaps and lotion in the bathrooms means you can't take them home  (who would). The front desk was combative. We avoided it after the issue at check in. One redeeming quality was the bellman on the way out. Kind. Generous with his time. But not enough to return to this one. It has become as run down as the two other Hilton properties on 8th Ave. Avoid them all.

title: Really, really don't stay here
text: This would rank at the bottom of the list of hotels I've stayed at in NYC or anywhere. The lobby, elevators and hallways are dirty and dingy. The carpet in our room is just gross. The person who checked us in (who was very nice and the reason this isn't rated even lower) told us the room we chose during digital check in wouldn't be ready for awhile and he offered to change our room so we could check in right away (this was around 1pm). He said he found a room that had been cleaned and was waiting for inspection and when that was done, he would get us our keys. About 5 minutes later, we were all set. I had to laugh though because I'm not sure what they were inspecting....the dirtiest carpet?  Then check, you nailed it on the head. Beds and bathroom were decent so I'll give them a point there but the 2 biggest downsides other than the gross carpet...we can literally hear EVERYTHING in the room next door...every movement, every tinkle, every flush. I'd rather not have to listen to strangers' bathroom noises. And I don't think this room could possible get smaller. Again, I've stayed in plenty of hotels in NYC (chose this one for this stay due to proximity to an event we are here to attend) and it is just large enough for the furniture and 1 person - I'm here with my 2 teens and this room just isn't cutting it. I didn't bother requesting another room I'm sure they're all similar. If I was paying a reasonable rate, I might cut it some slack, but I'm paying $1,000 for 2 nights - I regret booking so early in advance because out of curiosity, I checked for a  reservation the night before we got here and I could have had the exact same room type for $200 less than my reservation, which was not able to be canceled or changed at that point. Oh- and the kicker, when we went out on night 1, we put the DND tag on the door (as I always do) and we came back that night and found a bag of (I hope) clean towels on the bed. We didn't request towels and the DND tag was on the door but they apparently came in and threw them on the bed. Even if we had requested them, they should have left them outside our door when they saw the DND tag. Glad we didn't have anything of value in the room. Really, really don't stay here. Hilton needs to do better and I'm questioning my Diamond loyalty at this point.

title: Besvikelse
text:
Tyvärr var standard på rum och städning dålig. Städning gjordes först efter vi sagt till. Rummet låg precis bredvid hiss som lät högt.
Utsikten, som vi betalde extra för var dålig. Priset på tok för högt med tanke på kvaliten.

title: Poor.For the price find somewhere with better service. 2 rooms connecting paid out almost $5000.00 for 4 nights.
text: lacking, only thing was good location and Sky. Alex smiled and told what you wanted to hear but no follow through. Restaurant did not have breakfast or lunch. Opened at 4:00 PM. Never come here again. Did offer to help with luggage .

title: Lovely and clean, great location.
text:
A lovely clean and safe hotel. 
Location is great, a short walk to tines Square and in the opposite direction to Central park. 
The rooms are lovely and clean, but we have a room with 2 double beds (3 people) and there wasn't much room to get around. 
However, for a clean and safe place to sleep it was just what we needed. 
The staff are lovely, gave us directions and booked us a taxi for our trip back to the airport on our departure date.

title: Minor complaints but good overall
text: Room was very nice. Soundproofing was excellent. The lobby area is very cramped. We were told to allow an hour for the valet to produce our car, which seemed excessive. It only took twenty minutes, but having to allow an hour made it difficult to plan. Also no coffee in the lobby- strange for a Hilton Garden Inn- perhaps they did not want to encourage morning lobby  traffic.

title: Wretched
text: Stayed here for a night.  Only one elevator was working so had to take the stairs or wait 30 mins.  Coffee maker in the room and in the snack room were both broken.  No other free coffee.  Double charged for parking and despite multiple calls cannot get a credit.  Rude staff.

title: Terrible servicio. Sucio.
text: El hotel está bien ubicado. Pero el servicio y la atención personal es penosa. La limpieza en general es mejorable. Además, no limpian la habitación salvo que se pida expresamente. Y aunque lo pidas tampoco lo hacen. Yo estuve tres noches. Pedí limpieza todos los días, varias veces y con queja expresa al ver que omitían la limpieza. No lo hicieron ningún día. Por otra parte, los ascensores son escasos y caóticos. En ocasiones la espera llega a 15 minutos para poder coger el ascensor. No es para volver.

title: Nice comfortable hotel in an excellent location
text:
We picked this hotel for its proximity to dining, theater, and museums, and the Hilton brand.  

First - the good.  The location was perfect, a few blocks walking to many of our destinations.  Very close to many excellent restaurants.  10 minute walk to Times Square, but away from the noise.  Taxis easy to hail from the avenues, or a quick walk to subway.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially our bell captain in arranging a car service to get us to the airport when we departed.  Both check-in and check-out were pleasant and seamless.  Our higher floor room was very clean and quiet, although cozy small.  Fine for 2 people, but would have been very crowded for a family.  Excellent hot water.  

Second - things to be aware of.  *Manhattan is expensive.*  And the hotel puts a hold on your credit card of about $100 per night, for « incidentals » plus bills all of your reserved nights when you check in.  If you don’t spend any incidentals, it gets released when you check out.  There is no service elevator, so hotel staff (housekeeping) use one of the three smaller older passenger elevators along with the guests.  This adds to the high traffic times in the mornings and late afternoons when you will wait 5 to 15 minutes for the elevator.  Lots of signage advising this, not a problem if you plan accordingly.  But the lobby is tiny, especially when waiting for the elevator.  Housekeeping is only provided after the 4th night of your stay.  (This seemed a little cheap in a $400+ per night room).  A call to housekeeping for clean towels and an additional roll of toilet paper mid-way through our 4-night stay was quickly and graciously provided.  Shampoo, soap, body lotion are provided in pump containers affixed to the walls of the shower and mirror over the sink.  There is no written paper or binder within the room advising hotel policies, room service, check out times, etc.  only a QR code for your phone.  (It took us a few days to realize this !)  

All in all - this hotel is comfortable and extremely well located, and the staff is professional and pleasant.  I’ll be back :)

title: Girls Trip
text: In February I stayed at the HGI on a girls' trip. Being from out of town, I was a little out of my element. Wasn't I lucky to be greeted by Skyy! Her energy was infectious! And her welcome was warm! She quickly checked us in and informed us of all the highlights: a little convenience store in the lobby (incredibly handy), how the key in the elevator worked, and discounts at a nearby restaurant.  Upon checkout, Skyy asked Brad to help us with our luggage and a taxi. The whole staff at HGI were helpful, fun and professional which really added an element of ease and fun to our girls' trip. Our room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is located within walking distance of Central Park, Times Sq and Broadway. I'm looking forward to my next trip and booking at HGI.

title: Muy buena opción para unos días express!
text:
La experiencia en el hotel fue muy buena.
La ubicación es especial, cerca de todas las estaciones de subte, las principales avenidas y el Central Park.
Destaco ante todo, la excelente atención tanto en recepción, como en el desayuno/comedor y la atención y limpieza de las habitaciones. Cálida, atenta, minuciosa.
La habitación espaciosa, con heladerita, microondas, caja fuerte, escritorio, ventanal, baño impecable.
El desayuno muy digno, si bien resulta un poco inadmisible que el café no sea express o de cápsula.
Muy recomendable.

title: Una experiencia buena
text:
Excelente ubicación y atención del personal (recepción y concierges) pero el cuarto solamente fue limpiado una vez y fue a solicitud de nosotros. 
Solamente había una barra de jabón en el baño y solicitamos una más y nunca fue enviada.

title: Lage top, Service und Zimmer flop
text:
Das Hotel liegt nur wenige Meter vom Broadway entfernt und sowohl Timesquare, Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center etc. können bequem zu Fuss erreicht werden. 
Das Hotel ist alt und benötigt dringend eine Renevation. Der Teppich in meinem Zimmer war abgetreten und schmudelig. Für die 34 STockwerke / über 400 Zimmer gibt es nur 3 Aufzüge, man wartet teilweise bis zu 10 Minuten bis ein Aufzug kommt. Der Eingang zu meinem Zimmer (Nr. 1205) lag zwischen den alten Aufzügen, die die ganze Nacht brummten und ein ruhiges Schlafen verunmöglichsten. 
Am Schlimmsten war aber, dass die Zimmer nicht gemacht werden. Auf meine Erkundigung hin informierte man mich, dass die Zimmer seit der Pandemie nur noch ab dem 4. Tag gemacht werden. Wenn man das Zimmer täglich gemacht haben will, muss man das melden. Es kostet zwar nicht zusätzlich, aber beim Einchecken wird man nicht darauf aufmerksam gemacht. Am Abreisetag habe ich mein Gepäck zur Aufbewahrung bis zur Abreise dem Bellboy übergeben. Als ich es wieder abholen wollte, war es vorerst unauffindbar. Erst nach ca. 15 Minuten hat er es im Keller gefunden. 
Alles in allem stimmt hier das Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis keinesfalls.

title: Great experience
text:
Such amazing service a huge shout out to Melodie she gave me 5 star service at the front desk 
I also lost my passport in the lobby and the staff found it immediately ... they are 
Centrally located 
I highly recommend this hotel 
I also included a view from my room

title: Andre is the best!!
text: Andre was amazing! I checked in late and couldn’t find my reservation and he was so so patient and kind. He was a fantastic, welcoming presence and I so appreciate how kind he was. You are lucky to have such a strong and wonderful leader on your team and representing your brand.

title: Amazing place to dine <3
text: I didnt stay there for my stay but the bar & restaurant was my fave place to stay. The energy of the staff is just amazing. I love it. Loved to stay at the bar and have my drink :) close to everything and next time definitely I will stay there and will be back

title: Great location supported by exceptional staff!
text: Exceptionally clean room supported by friendly and professional staff. Alex keeps knocking it out of the park!  Great location and close to all theater offerings. 10 min walk to beautiful Central Park.

title: Localização excelente
text: Foi ótima nossa estadia. Não solicitamos limpeza diária, mas se quiser é só solicitar no momento do checkin. Hotel perto da Times Square. Quarto silencioso. Camas e travesseiros confortáveis. Com frigobar, microondas e cafeteira.

title: Ok for Lilliputians with no allergies
text:
I have stayed at  several Hilton properties in Manhattan. This one has the smallest rooms, hallways, lobby and elevators resulting in endless waits and crowding.
The Good: The location is excellent - walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square, MOMA etc. The staff are superb - patient, friendly, efficient, and helpful - special thanks to Skyy who gave us the best check in experience ever and Luiss who made breakfast delightful with Spanish lessons. The fridge in the room - always nice to have a cold drink on hand, and the quietness. Outside noise was almost entirely blocked and inside you could only hear doors closing - no noise between rooms.
The Bad: As noted above, the smallness of common areas and the room - I realize these are infrastructure issues and beyond the control of the management but they are noteworthy. The hallway carpets did not seem to be cleaned sufficiently, quite dusty, and probably need to be replaced (also old carpeting in room). Worst for me - and anyone else with an allergy to animal dander was the allowance of pets in all areas. I would suggest the restriction of pets to a particular floor/s so that those with allergies can be assured their room will not educe an asthma attack.

title: Gute Lage, nettes Personal; Preis-Leistung mittelmäßig
text:
Das Hotel liegt sehr gut. Unweit vom Central Park lädt es zum morgendlichen Laufen ein. Auch die Metro ist nicht übermäßig weit entfernt. Das Personal ist hilfsbereit und nett.

Leider ist das Hotel sehr stark gebucht und die Aufzüge reichen nicht aus. Häufig sammeln sich Wartende vor den Aufzügen. Unser Zimmer war altmodisch eingerichtet und hellhörig. Die Sauberkeit war nicht sonderlich gut. Häufig lagen Bettlaken lose vor den den Zimmertüren auf dem Boden (wurden wohl von Zimmerservice vergessen).

title: A good chain in a good locale
text: I thought this was an excellent place to stay for the location, on site amenities, and room condition and availability. Staff was friendly and easy going. Plenty to walk to from this location; diners, steak house, Central Park, we walked to The Met from here, through CP.  Parking garages are about a block and half away, and we paid dearly for a weekend stay, but that’s just how it is. Valet drop-off is also an option or just drive right up to the front doors for luggage drop (may be a line). Overall, I would stay here again as the rooms were clean and hallways and stairwells were also clean. Elevators are fast moving too and feel safe. Lobby is up to date with an outside seating area too.

title: Don’t go
text: Worst hotel we’ve ever been to!! Don’t go!  We stayed for 2 nights with a broken toilet! Manager says he’s sorry and gives us 10,000 points back (we used 125000points). When we complained to Hilton they did nothing!

title: Great hotel
text: Brilliant location, spacious room (1 bed) coffee maker and fridge in the room make mornings easy before heading out. Amazing staff, very friendly and helpful. Would be 5* but they were a little short staffed so room not cleaned as often as requested and a few minor issues that needed fixing but amazing value and location.

title: Above and beyond customer service
text: Superb location and top notch staff. Pierre, Melody and Kaya made every effort to make our stay great. We appreciated their friendliness and commitment to high level hospitality from the moment we checked in to our departure the next day (also a shout out to Kareem for helping us as we departed!). I would definitely stay here again.

title: Falta de limpeza do quarto
text: Passei 5 dias no hotel e não houve limpeza do quarto, troca de toalhas. Com uma tarifa que não é barata, isso deveria ser o normal, mas para limpar era preciso solicitar. Solicitei 2 vezes e não fui atendida.

title: Hilton is lucky to have Pierre!
text:
We had the pleasure of working with Pierre during our stay in the city. He exceeded our expectations and made our visit a memorable vacation! He went above and beyond to make our experience pleasant. 

The hotel is very clean and the staff were all very polite. Diana also assisted our party and was efficient and quick to get us checked in. 

Not to mention the location is great and there are many food options and shopping nearby.

title: Great stay!
text: The hotel was very clean and perfect for our needs! Everyone was friendly telling us bye on the way out of the hotel! Pierre was very helping when we needed a late check out due to work and was very kind about getting that taken care of for us!

title: Great hotel but avoid taxi service
text:
Good location for Times Square, Central Park etc. Room was clean, nice view, comfortable. Staff friendly upon arrival. Safe not working but no issue. Lifts sometimes a bit of a wait but not too long, was no problem for us! Also, be aware off the deposit charge ($500 per 5 nights) so you are prepared if you needing spending money for your trip.

Potentially avoid the taxi company/service via the hotel, staff told us it would be $85 inc tolls/tips (to JFK). Which was confirmed twice prior to booking. Taxi arrived on time however charged us $105, he also avoided tolls and then that was without a tip.

I believe yellow cabs have a flat rate of around 52$ approx and then tips & tolls, or get the subway. Aware this is likely the taxi company but maybe better communication with their taxi service would be great for the customers who trust Hilton, as we did trust them.

Overall, pleasant stay.

title: Great location, great staff.
text: Clean rooms, very helpful staff, perfect location for Manhattan attractions. Better soundproof widows would be helpful, or ask the city to fix the loose manhole cover in the middle of the road. Would stay here again.

title: Helpful staff
text: Angelique and Priscilla made my trip a little better this time by taking such great care of me. Room was nice and the view was great! Convenient location. Will definitely stay again for my next business trip.

title: Stay at Hilton Garden inn
text:
I was going to leave a glowing review for the hotel however our stay has had a dampener put on it when we arrived home. 

The hotel itself is in a very good location, staff are friendly and greet you upon arrival and when leaving each time which is nice. Check in was smooth and the deposit for $700 per room was taken on our cards (total of $1400 as we had 2 rooms) which we thought was steep we've only ever paid $250 per room for 7nights at any other Manhattan hotel but we found out before we arrived so we were prepared. We had room 1704 and 1908. 

When we got into room 1704 it was clean as was 1908. The television in 1704 didn't have a signal and the safe wouldn't work so we went down to reception and someone came up and sorted the safe but said that a cable guy would need to come out to the television the next morning. So the next morning we went to reception and they said someone would come when we were out but on return this hadn't happened so we went back and they sent the guy from the night before who came up and took the TV off the wall and tightened the cables which gave us 6 obscure channels and he once again said we would need to get reception to get the cable guy to come up. We just put up with the 6 channels. The maintenance guy (didn't catch his name) was always very pleasant and as helpful as possible. 

The elevators within the hotel are a pain and there are signs about busy times but everyday the middle lift wasn't working sometimes it was a 30minute wait just to get up to the rooms. 

Upon check out we went to reception and gave in our keys and we were told no charge and our deposits were released. We asked for a receipt for each room which we were told we'd get via email which we still haven't received. Devon then came and took our cases and organised a taxi back to the airport for us which was fantastic. 

Now my big issue is that upon landing back into the UK my husband's credit card now has a charge on it and while it is only £2.69 it will incur a foreign transaction fee and the other issue is we have no idea what the charge is for as we used none of the hotel amenities that were chargeable. It also makes no sense as we were told at check out we had no outstanding bills. I have tried to contact the hotel via email but no reply. I have had a reply from the hotel on Facebook telling me to call, this would be fine if I wouldn't get charged at a higher rate for the call. This has left me disgruntled and made it so that I won't stay here again.

title: A gem of a hotel
text: This hotel is a gem, my Wife & I both agree the rooms were great the staff all of them were so nice and really made you feel special.  This made our stay in New York special.  Back to the rooms comfortable beds, bathroom with a great shower was good as well and very clean. Thank you to all at this Hotel until we return for another break

title: Great Service
text:
I travel all the time for work, hardly ever leave a review. I was blown away at how great the staff is at this location. Everyone was so nice and helpful. Especially Priscilla when I checked in.
She went above and beyond to take care of me, and it really put a smile on my face after a long day of travel.

title: If they need to adjust a bill…don’t take their word.  Adjust before you leave.
text:
Booked for 6 nights in Jan 2023.  The problems came with the bill.  Daily diamond food and beverage credits not posted.  We left a day earlier and manager in charge (well dressed African American, big smile) offered us a refund on the 6th night since we needed to leave early. Nearly 7 weeks later, still waiting on that credit plus the diamond daily credit. No one answers the accounting phone.  No one (even the GM) returns phone calls.  Diamond desk has opened a case and attempted to get action…even they can’t get anything but the emailing of the original bill. 

There are better options.  Don’t reward poor follow up and greediness, taking advantage of someone who has trusted the brand over 1500 times.

title: Clean and great location
text: We stayed in a two queen bed size room. The hotel was clean the desk, and all of the workers were extremely pleasant and helpful with any questions we had. It’s a great location, our room was quiet, we did not hear any street noise at all. My only complaint was the beds were not very comfortable, not used to what we have at home. Other than that I would recommend staying at the hotel.

title: Horrible check in
text:
A part of the cleaner who was helpful the majority of the staff were rude and unprofessional. They made you feel not welcome and uncomfortable. Our checking was done by someone called MTAMAYO. He DID NOT inform us about ANYTHING such: as breakfast time, wifi, check out, etc. He just requested me to pay another $500 on top of the $840 already paid as a deposit and seemed very bored with my questions. Imagine after 9h of flight finding someone like him. 
This travel supposed to be a birthday gift for my mum for her 60's birthday. I emailed this hotel on different occasions requesting where to buy a small gift cake for my mum (for breakfast) and they didn't even bother to answer my emails over booking.com.

Half of the receptionists should be trained again since they receive their salary thanks to tourism and obviously, they haven't got skills.
I choose the Hilton hotel since I have been to Hiltons worldwide and love the company. I have been working for Hilton myself and that's not the spirit of this company, that's the spirit of lazy people. I will never be here again.

title: Wonderful customer service
text: My partner traveled toNew York, and I wanted to make sure everything was set up for him so that he didn’t need to worry about anything except for going to his class at the valoranah. I called up the hotel and spoke to the calmest, loveliest individual Skyy. She told me she was going to look into it make sure that it is properly set up and really gave me a sense of assurance that everything was going to be above board. And boy was she on her game everything was absolutely spectacular. I could not ask for a better Guest service agent. Thank you so much exuding, true professionalism.  I can’t wait to book again. We need more fabulous individuals like skyy. Thank you.

title: COLD SHOWER
text: Cold showers. We stayed for one night, try to take a shower when we arrive in the evening, the shower was just at a little bit under warm temperature. The next morning I tried again, this time it was not even getting warm, stayed cold. I called the receptionist, and told me  will have a engineer come in...Never came. Had to shower with the cold temperature. This is not acceptable for a hotel like the Hilton...

title: High floor at your own risk
text:
Rooms are fine usual NYC but newer and well laid out. Staff helpful if overworked. I waited 22 mins for elevator (see photo) in lobby at 430pm (maid has most of the elevators in use) I waited 15 mins at 845 am. etc etc There are signs warning you that you will wait, and wait. Even if you are a lower floor you will wait to go up (Walk down )
Its a code thing that they can't have a service elevator I believe.. oh and you HAVE to ask for housekeeping if you want it in advance. As a Diamond member I did not get an upgrade..ah well. But the elevators , that was not good.

title: Pierre saved the day
text: My family and I were supposed to go on an international vacation that was delayed and eventually canceled due to an issue at JFK. Pierre helped us get rooms and make the most of our unexpected time in the city.

title: Great hotel!
text: Piere and Kareem gave us a warm welcome on arrival and made the check in process very smooth. The hotel is very nicely located in midtown Manhattan and room was nicely sized and clean! Highly recommend!

title: Very nice and great location
text:
I booked this hotel because of its proximity to Lincoln Center. But it's really a great location overall - to many midtown destinations, Central Park, Times Sq. I even walked from Penn Station. 
The room was very nice, pristine, quiet (on back side) and a very reasonable size for NYC.
So a very discovery and I'd highly recommend.

title: Shh...Great Hotel in NYC Midtown West!
text: Crossed the river from NJ to spend some time in New York.  This hotel is perfectly located to all I wanted to do while not being among the congestion of the City.  The staff was professional, friendly, and very accommodating.  Kudos to Pierre and Angie for cultivation top staff including Melodie.  Room was very clean and well stocked.  Didn't need to ask for extra towels!  The water pressure in the shower was impressive.  Highly recommend this hotel, based on how it's run and operated!

title: Awesome Stay - New York Fashion Week,Valentines Day Weekend
text: Every time I come to NYC, I stay at this property.   Its away from the NYC Hustle, but close to everything (Central Park, Several Train Lines, Roc Center, Theatre District, Hells Kitchen, Times Square).  I loved my room on the 18th Floor, overlooking the city.  Want to send a special thanks to Priscilla, Sky, Harrison, Luis and Pierre for making my stay enjoyable!!!!

title: Happy Stay.
text:
Third visit to New York, first time at this Hotel - stayed 11th to 16th February - no complaints whatsoever. 
Pleasantly surprised at how good the hotel was bearing in mind some of the reviews on this site. 
Never had an issue with the lifts - but I accept in peak season the hotel could have installed more lifts when designing the building. Never waited more than a couple of minutes going up our down. 
Hotel itself is perfectly situated for Times Square and Central Park. 
Bedrooms are more than adequate - would have preferred the walk in shower in the room or friends had but the shower in the bath worked well and the water was always hot. 
Overall we had a superb stay and would certainly use the hotel again if we return to New York. 
Didn’t eat or drink in the hotel.

title: 센트럴파크나 타임스퀘어가 가까워서 좋음.
text: 시설 자체가 좋은 편은 아니나, 뉴욕에서 가성비를 생각하면 좋은편이라 생각함. 센트럴 파크와 타임스퀘어, 각종 뮤지컬을 도보로 보러 다닐 수 있어서 좋음.

title: Perfect location
text: Thank you to Skyy and Angie for making us feel at home, keeping us going in the right direction and endless smiles. Your kindness was so appreciated. We love this hotel- it is so safe and clean. The location is perfect. Can’t wait to visit again.

title: Pierre
text: Pierre is a very kind and helpful host . He gives you a warm welcome and gives you. All the information you need 😃The location of the hotel is only 4 minutes from Times Square , 2 minutes from the metro

title: Nice experience
text:
Pierre and Kareem were great and very helpful. Friendly facility! Kareem really went the extra mile and offered good suggestions.
Also good size rooms for NYC and nice shower. The room was very clean and well kept.

title: Great all rounder
text: Was a bit dubious arriving at this hotel after reading some reviews that wasn't so great but glad myself and my partner stayed here. We was here for 5 nights in total and couldn't fault it, not one negative thing about it. Fair enough sometimes the lift was busy but no busier then if waiting for one at a shopping mall. Yes certain times with the lifts are busier but to be fair it's only housekeeping trying to get to floors to clean the rooms! The desk staff were fabulous and especially Pierre! Every single time we seen him he was always bubbly with a smile on his face. Room was as expected, clean carpets, spotless bathroom and bedding. Was on the 15th floor room 1508 and found it really quiet.  Never had a bad night's sleep in the 5 days we was there, bed was soo comfy. Room came with a coffee machine, fridge and microwave and hairdryer in the bathroom. Would definitely stay here again! Also great location. Pierre and team keep up the brilliant work👍 and hope to see you again in the future😁

title: 2 rooms; 1 with non-working hot water, another non-working heating
text: My room (1101): the hot water knob in the bathroom was not put in right, which I tried to explain: it turned only partially and its fullest position it turned the water lukewarm, not warm enough to comfortably shower, especially since outside the weather was below freezing. I went to meetings unshaven. When I called to have it fixed, I was told that I had to wait 15 minutes with the water running and see if it gets hot (it didn't.) The person downstairs  was dismissive and picked up the phone saying simply "Hello." Sounded annoyed (my perception). I tried to explain that the water in the sink was scolding hot, so it was not a hot water issue but the shower knob issue. The engineer came and reset something, saying it would help. I waited 10 minutes and it was still the same. I showered in lukewarm water but could not shave under the shower and was late. The next day I didn't even bother with them and showered in the same lukewarm water. Room 1501: the heater wasn't working in my friend's room (I booked it for her), same limited mobility room, someone came and fixed the heating but it again stopped working at 3-ish am. She said she didn't want to call and let someone into her room in the middle of the night. At checkout, I told the personnel about our experiences. They became defensive. Another female employee stepped in our conversation (unprompted and unnecessarily), but I continued talking to Angelique. I said I was a Hilton Gold member, that person said since I booked through booking.com, my gold status didn't transfer and I received no perks. I didn't want any perks, I said, just hot water and working heater. I didn't realize these perks were not for everyone. Now, the million dollar question is this, and I am asking Hilton: I was told to let the water run and wait for at least 15 minutes, and also was told this is "standard", in other words, this is their first line response to hot water issues. Do they realize how much water is being wasted if each guest follows this protocol? What kind of environmental impact does it cause and how can Hilton be comfortable with this as a corporation? I will not stay at that hotel, that goes without saying, but they really should review your NYC hotels. I understand it's a bustling city and you will never be without guests, I also realize NYC has a different culture. Still.

title: Great staff and experience!
text: We had a few hiccups on our trip here to New York, but Veronica made sure to take care of us! Staff was excellent, service as well! We will definitely be using Hilton Central Park for our next visit here!

title: Meh.  Small rooms, dodgy elevators and overprices, greasy breakfast
text:
Checked in on the Hilton app (2 rooms for 2 nights), only to be told our connecting rooms were not available when we arrived at the hotel.  After much effort, we were able to obtain 2 rooms on the same floor, but not connecting, on a much lower floor.

Our disappointment with the lower floor was soon gone when we realized that only one elevator was working (this on the very busy late December tourist season!)  Fortunately, we were able to walk the 6 floors up to our room.

The breakfast was overpriced, with chewy eggs and bacon swimming in bacon grease.  Still, they did comp one day's breakfast due to the reservation problems.

Not too much nice to say about the neighborhood, but that's on me, we wanted to be near Times Square and RCMH.

I'm pretty loyal to the Hilton brand, but I think I'd look for somewhere else next time

title: Helpful customer service with canceling reservation.
text: Pierre at the hotel was very helpful in getting us a prompt cancelation of our room when Memorial Sloan-Kettering canceled my wife's treatment in the city at the last minute. The frequent trips to the city are expensive and the hotel's reasonable response was much appreciated.

title: Great stay, staff lovely, clean rooms and good location.
text:
Pierre and his team was very helpful in guiding us with directions/trains etc. Nothing was too much trouble. The team made us feel very welcome. 

The rooms were clean, modern and we had a good view. We would definitely use this hotel again. Great location too for Times Square, central park and subways.

title: My NYC Go-To Spot
text: I LOVE this hotel - it's my go-to personal and professional hotel anytime I'm in NYC.  It's not fancy but it's modernly perfect.  The team is always warm and welcoming to me and my family.  They even gave my 1-year old daughter a NYC teddy bear she still has over a year later.  I always check to see if they are available anytime I travel.  Perfect location - close to Central Park for running/walking, easy access to a number of subway lines.  Way to go team!

title: Exceptional service by receptionist ( Name: Priscilla ) and amazing stay at Hilton Garden Inn NY Central Park !!!
text:
Exceptional service by receptionist named Priscilla . Her professionalism, competence, and knowledge was evident. She has outstanding communication and customer service. Goes the extra mile to help you if she cannot resolve an issue herself. She is a kind of person who will make sure all options are examined carefully. She will make sure you are well satisfied and happy with your stay. She made our wishes come true on New Years Weekend. She resolved our concerns, and even helped us sign up for Hilton Honors . She is a great resource and can’t state enough the value she brings for Hilton. I appreciate service by individuals like her. Thank you Hilton. 

The Hotel is excellent, clean, welcoming, and good food. 

Location was the best!! Right in the center. Everything was close enough especially time square.

If your looking to stay at Hilton Garden Inn NY Central Park , you won’t regret it. Great place! 

I highly recommended it.

title: Desk confusion about hilton honors members and  benefits.
text: This hotel was my go to hotel until they stopped caring about the guest. Apparently that level of service is back. My room came complete with a noisy hvac system that wouldn't make a peep when the engineer was in the room. But I recorded it. But that doesn't get it fixed. it only proves something happened. It's like turning in your car for a strange noise and the dealership can't replicate it. This hotel hasn't changed much except the lobby is now just one big cavernous space without warmth or furniture. The elevators still don't arrive on time which is why I asked for a second floor room. Easy to take the stairs up or down. The front desk did seem confused about my status with them and there didn't seem to be a clear explanation of that's afforded to me as a diamond member. It should age a welcome bonus of points plus breakfast or the equivalent dollar amount for two people in the room, not one. Not the case. I was given only the choice of points or a specified dollar amount for one.

title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
text: We loved the location! Close to the park. Hotel is just a few minutes to Times Square. In the middle of the Theater District. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again!!

title: Great customer service!
text: Thank you to Pierre and Skyy for your fantastic hospitality and customer service. I needed to change my stay at the last minute and you guys were extremely accommodating. Look forward to seeing you soon!

title: Buena experiencia!
text: Estuvimos a finales de diciembre y fin de año, y la verdad es que la habitación estuvo muy bien, con vistas , limpieza muy bien, tan solo comentar el tema de los ascensores, a veces se formaban colas para subir. Por cierto, dar las gracias a Priscilla de recepción que tuvo la amabilidad de llamarnos al transfer que teníamos contratado para confirmar la hora de recogida por el hotel. Gracias, buen servicio.

title: Excellent service, always friendly!
text:
Our room was fine.  We were on the 33 floor which we would easily stay on again.  Very
quiet.  The secret to the elevators is to watch the arrows carefully and you will not be lost.  Pricilla was the best, helping with directions and always a friendly smile.  She has a real flair for it!  Looking forward to our next visit.

title: Memorable & Pleasant Experience
text: Hilton is our favorite hotel to stay but One of best part of staying at this hotel is the staffs specially led by the gentleman “Mr. Pierre”. Pierre is the finest with his customer service & communication. He truly represents Hilton name brand. He is very kind, honest, responsive, & top notch with his services. He is a Jem. We wish him nothing but the best. And also a shout out to Veronica as well. She really carry’s the Hilton Brand name to the top & what a warm hearted personality is she. Love everything about this location & personnels. Thank you all for making our vacation memorable again!

title: Great theater district hotel
text: Great stay. Elevators are a hassle but they warn you about that. Try to get an upper floor as street noise is definitely a thing. We were on 19 and heard the song of the NYC people constant horns. Staff was wonderful! Only glitch were elevators and our water pipes “squealed”. It was cold so who knows. But if you ran the sink or flushed the toilet it got better

title: THE WORST!
text: I have been all over but this is the WORST hotel ever! Only three small elevators for 34 floors and, most of the time, in the midst of the Xmas season, TWO of them have been out of service! Long lines to get into an elevator! Rooms are so small two people will find it hard to get their stuff out of their suitcases! In sum, NOT EVER again!

title: Christmas in New York
text:
This hotel is situated in a really good place to get around New York. We went for Christmas and had a great time. The rooms are fairly small but adequate and no surprise in New York. Everything was clean and front desk were helpful and most were pleasant.The breakfast was good.
The only fault is the lifts which at times annoying as the wait was so long. There is no service lift which does not help the situation. We did get stuck in the lift for 25 minutes between floors which was not nice at the time. Apart from the lift situation I would stay again but ask for a lower floor.

title: Christmas Themed Trip
text: From the minute we walked in to the moment we checked out, the service was EXCELLENT! Priscilla and Deshawnda were particularly wonderful and so friendly and helpful, but every staff member we encountered was so nice. The lobby was clean and had ample and comfortable seating. We were on the 28th floor and the elevators were quick. Our room was a great size for the two of us, larger than the normal NYC hotel room. The bed was comfortable and we heard no noise from the streets. The bathroom and shower were a good size and very nicely done. Everything was very clean and comfortable. My only request would be a firmer option for pillows and an extra blanket in the closet. We requested new towels from the front desk and they were delivered within five minutes. We very much enjoyed our stay here and will definitely stay here again!

title: Christmas in New York
text: decided to visit New York at Christmas, great location of hotel, got me extra Hilton honours points. no restaurant with hotel, but there is a £££ steak restaurant next door, very nice, just off Broadway and 3 blocks south of central park, 2 blocks away from subway, which is easy to use and cheap. friendly staff.

title: Outstanding Customer Service!
text: From the front desk to housekeeping, One of my best hotel experiences in NYC. Alex was the most impressive at resolving my booking needs and his beyond good customer service. Definitely will book again for business and for a night on the town.  Aaron S.

title: Excellent customer service
text: We had to cancel our stay at the last minute due to weather, and even though we were canceling past the deadline to do so without charge, the manager Pierre kindly let us cancel with no charge.  We will definitely stay there in the future because of the wonderful customer service.

title: Change of plans!
text: We were headed to a once in a lifetime trip to Iceland when everything got cancelled on us as we sat stranded in JFK airport at 9:30pm on Sunday. We had stayed in the Hilton Garden Inn Central Park South about 7-8 years prior so my husband checked there first. We needed two rooms and they accommodated us last minute. What a relief! The rooms were just as we remembered and we felt a level of comfort and familiarity here. We began the arduous task of canceling all other things for Iceland and booking all things for NYC. The whole ordeal was stressful enough, but having a place to stay with warm and friendly staff made it so much better! I have to give a major shout out to Pierre! He was absolutely THE BEST, helping us through every twist and turn! I would 100% recommend staying here, and if you do, definitely ask for Pierre to help you!!

title: Try another Hilton
text:
Elevators are broken.
Coffee machine is broken.
Window are not sound proof.
The heater in the room sounds like a 747 departing all night long.

People waiting 45 minutes for an elevator to come down from the 30th floor.

Not good.  It's not for me. 

I'm sure you'll enjoy it.

title: Good central location
text: Decent hotel, tiny rooms- no surprise for nyc. Elevators are fast which is key for a hotel with 34 floors. Everything works in our room, water pressure is fantastic! Skip the hotel breakfast, not worth the $25 price. Was not good at all. Plenty of places to get a bagel or egg sandwich.

title: Dirty, rude, terrible
text: I was there for a weekend, the room was overpriced. The place itself is dirty, rooms are tiny, they don’t seem to have kept the place up.  Costumer service rude overall.  Elevators smell and very very slow. The worst was that my room in the second floor had the toilet clogged, and 3 hrs pass without anyone coming to help.  Eventually the morning after i had to catch the housekeeper which gave me a plunger and didn’t even bother to come help.   I stayed there before covid and was a total different experience. Sad to see this place now turn into a horrible disgusting place to stay.

title: NYC Christmas trip
text: The  front desk staff made our visit to the Hilton Garden Inn a 5! They were so friendly, remembered my name and were quick to go above and beyond to help us with any questions or issues. Dashanda even went across the street to try and get my $20 from the parking attendant who charged me extra for my oversized vehicle. The hotel is in a great location, the theater district within a 15 minute walk to Central Park, Rockefeller center, st Patrick’s cathedral, and Times Square. We also had a great city view from our room on the 25th floor! I would definitely stay at this Hilton again if visiting Manhattan

title: The most expensive room is $500, I was charged $1600.  And Hilton won't make good.
text:
I booked a room for this Hilton for December 6th to the 7th.  Thier booking portal is not clear.  Shortly after booking, I discovered I had booked a day room only for Dec. 6th.  I reworked my reservation.  I have a confirm for the 6th-7th.
I got to the hotel.   The told me I only had the day room for the 6th.  The had no other information.  I was told the room would cost $1500.  New York at Xmas time is tough to get a room.  So I booked the room and I paid over $1600 after all the fees and such were added.  For the record, if you go to the Hilton website for this hotel, there are no rooms that cost over $500 even right now...prime holiday season!1
I got home and found my confirmation Dec 6th to 7th, 2 beds,  In fact it has an offer to upgrade to queen size beds.
I have contacted both the corporate office and the hotel.  Each says I need to talk to the other.  In short, the confirmation number was worth nothing.  Hilton does not stand by their confirmation codes.  On top of that, they will charge wild rates when they don't honor the confirmation.  To say I was treated rudely and with complete indifference would be an understatement.  I have been a  long time Hilton customer, but I will never stay at a Hilton again.  The local hotel apparently did not have the updated reservation (taking them at their word.  Honestly though, they could say or do this to anyone.)  And despite having a record of the confirmation, the corporate office will not stand by their reservations.  Why would anyone ever book a Hilton room when they can pull shenanigans like this.  Why did the add $1000 to my bill when they saw I was distressed?  These are good questions.  They can do this to anyone any time and there is apparently no recourse except to complain on Yelp and This site and any other site.  I don't ever recommend booing any Hilton ever!

title: Burglars, disgusting customer service, go somewhere else.
text: Disgusting customer service, do not go to this place, they ask you for a security deposit for your stay, they charged me 300 dollars and mentioned returning it 3 to 5 days after the day of departure, my stay was from October 8 to 11, 2022, Today is December 5 and there is no refund, I contacted the customer service corporation, they requested my bank account statement where they can see the charges and I got a negative response in which they disclaimed those charges, the staff does not know anything customer service, they are disgusting, do not stay there because they will only steal your money, stop something frequent from the staff since I have seen many complaints here on TripAdvisor on the same subject.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel. Clean friendly and convenient location. Would thoroughly recommend.  Staff were welcoming and a special mention for Harrison who went the extra mile for us. Loved the bar which was a great end to a very tiring day. Would definitely return.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Being from Texas, we can have pretty high expectations when it comes to hospitality. This is why we have been so impressed with the team here, particularly Melodie, Pierre, and Skyy, and highly recommend this hotel for your next trip to New York. Thank you to everyone who has contributed to a wonderful stay, and we look forward to our next visit.

title: Great location for first time visitors to New York!
text:
The hotel was in an excellent location for our first time visit to New York! It was very close to Broadway and only a short walk from Times Square and Central Park. It had the advantage of being down a quieter street meaning there was no noise from passerby’s. There was a subway station right around the corner and lots of bars, cafes and restaurants in close proximity. 

The room was modern, clean and spacious. We’d read previous negative reviews about the speed of the elevators however it was never an issue for us - the most we had to wait was a few minutes! We could occasionally hear the elevator going up and down during the night from our hotel room but it didn’t affect us greatly. 

The staff at the hotel were friendly and very accommodating. When I mentioned it was my boyfriends birthday, we were given a complimentary gesture which was a lovely touch! 

I would highly recommend this hotel to first time visitors to the city!

title: Ho hum stay, ba humbug
text: Good location for Times Square, and parade, and Central Park. Beds and pillows are no-good. Size of room and beds very small for 3 people, can't imagine if we brought our boy. Gift shop hardly had anything most days. Elevators were always a pain. Staff was fine, didn't have to rely on them much.

title: Hellhole
text: Avoid this olace if at all possible. Two of three elevators working but very, very slowly, completely inadequate to handle the many guest room floors. At one point there was a line filling the lobby for the elevators, and we waited half an hour for our turn. Second, the bathroom sink didn’t drain AT ALL, even after we cleaned out a huge wad of disgusting slimy hair. When we complained about both these things at the front desk (after waiting in line), we got no apology, only “there’s nothing we can do about it.”

title: Hidden charges one ignorient  staff member
text: My husband and I arrived at this hotel on 14th November at 7pm new york time went to the reception to check in and immediately the receptionist says that we were to pay 100 dollars a day which menr they wanted 700 dollars for security charge we told them that we didn't have the money to pay this the manager that was on that night told us that we couldn't get in our room unless we payedthis she had me in tears stressing us out noone told us from virgin that we had to pay this what I had to do was to call my sister in Glasgow in the UK to ask her for alone of the money very upset about doing this calling my sister when she was in her bed . Also the room we were in 1207 had dirty mould marks on the ceiling I will not be coming back to the hotel don't get wrong all the other staff were very nice except one also we have not received our money back yet

title: Very rude 'manager'
text:
I've given this hotel 2 points for it's location (excellent) and it's comfortable bed.
However, as other reviews have alluded to, you are expected to provide $100 dollars extra per night of your stay as a "security deposit" because they don't actually trust their guests.  They are very quick to debit this from your card but are very reluctant to refund it making people wait up to 5 days.  They can't explain why they won't just keep a card number on file or why it takes so long to refund the money that they were so quick to take.  They also refused to, on my penultimate night of a 5 night stay, to refund the unused money from the previous 4 nights.  The person who claimed to be the manager on duty at the time (Veronica) was extremely rude and unhelpful.  She even claimed  that this happened in all hotels (as a busy international traveller, I assured her it didn't0 and said that "she knew it did because she had allegedly worked in the industry for 24 years2.  Her rude and unhelpful attitude told me she had barely been in the customer service industry for 24 minutes, let alone 24 years.  She also rudely refused to help me with a number to contact my holiday provider and just vaguely pointed me to a phone and then walked away.  The other thing is that this hotel had randomly put some Amazon handling charges onto my bill for a package that I had certainly never ordered, let alone received.  I was eventually able to get hold of my holiday provider via whatsapp who contacted the hotel on my behalf and eventually was able to get them to drop the bogus Amazon charges and reassured me about the deposit money.  They also complained about Veronica's rudeness to me and apparently they were issued with an apology although Veronica didn't have the decency to apologise to me directly.  Veronica could certainly learn some customer care skills from my holiday companyI didn't eat in the hotel (for fear of them charging goodness knows what to my account) so can't comment on that.  Other staff that I bumped into in corridors etc were polite and the one person to single out was the Porter on the morning of my departure who kindly offered to look after my luggage for me for a while as my flight was after the time for departing the room.
Whilst this hotel has a good location, there are others that, despite what Veronica claims, do trust their guests and will not take a $100 charge per night from your card.

title: Great hotel with friendly staff!
text: Had a great experience here.  We ended up coming in on Marathon weekend which we did not realize.  The desk staff and lobby was overwhelmed with people. They handled so well! Were kind and on point even though you could tell they were drowning in people.  The bell hop managed all the bags that were coming in early for storage and did great! And got them right back out when we returned to check in.  Someone was always willing to help when we had subway questions.  The rooms are of course smaller New York rooms which is to be expected, but very clean.  About time for new carpet in halls but that is about it.  Wonderful central location.  Would definitely recommend!

title: Poor Customer Service/ reception
text: When I tried to book in I was told my booking hadn’t crossed over from booking.com even though I had confirmation email from Hilton themselves 6-8 months earlier, I didn’t get the room i had booked which was a expensive room with a terrace which would be a luxury in New York as rooms are so small compared to other countries it was also breakfast included  i ended up with a room on 22nd floor with no terrace and no breakfast and room was smaller even though the receptionist was trying to convince me otherwise, i was told i was lucky they had a room for me at all. As to not ruin our trip i reluctantly just went to the room provided. We were there 5 nights and we asked for room to be serviced 2 days in a row and didn’t receive it even though had complained the first time totally incompetent on receptions part, finally room was serviced on 4th day. Reception just weren’t interested in making sure you had a good stay or not. The lifts in this hotel are horrendously slow and at peak times was a long wait. Had put in a request with booking.com for a partial refund but the hotel refuse to answer there email and when they rang they were told manager is unavailable for some time.  Have stayed in Hilton’s numerous times and my partner is a honours member, but i doubt we will use the Hilton brand again after such a terrible experience at this hotel.

title: Super customer service!
text: We stayed at this Hilton for a couples getaway. It was great, customer service was outstanding, room was spotless and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again. Priscilla and Alex at the front desk in particular were very helpful. Not the cranky NYC attitude you sometimes encounter - at all.

title: Fantastic Friendly Service
text: Everyone at Hilton Garden were extremely friendly and helpful! We will be back! We were on the 25th floor and the room was perfect for sleeping 3 of us! Valet service was simple! It was only a couple blocks from winter garden theater and right around the corner to The late show!

title: Hotel stay
text: The hotel conveniently located.  The reception is nice.  The elevators need to be repaired and they need to do a better job cleaning the hallways.  They were gross.  The room itself was clean and nice.  It was quiet for where it was.  The bar restaurant looks nice but we didn’t visit.

title: Pior que Formule 1
text: Carrinhos de limpeza ficam sempre nos corredores, 24/7, atrapalhando quem passa com malas. O banheiro não é feito para tomar banho, alaga inteiro. A equipe do lobby só faz checkin/checkout, não espere ajuda com malas ou qualquer outra coisa.

title: Unexpected $100 per room per night hold on credit card
text: This hotel is really well located and rooms are clean and comfortable. We paid in full at a non-refundable rate on booking. On check-in, we had to provide a $100 per room/night deposit (totalling $800) on our credit card which we were told was for “breakages” which would be refunded “3 to 5 days after we checked out”. This was completely unexpected and is not in the Hotel policies on the Hilton app. Is this legitimate? This really ought to be made clear to guests at the time of booking.

title: Business Trip post COVID
text: Only stayed 2 days so no room services but they had a good plan for how to get extra towels and stuff, and they told me up front. Also Priscilla kept my bag so I could attend my meeting without luggage which I appreciated.

title: Pleasant stay.
text:
I had read a few reviews before, and after, booking through my local Virgin Holidays store. I can only give my overall opinion, based on my experience.
My wife and I arrived early afternoon and were greeted with warm reception from desk staff as you would expect. Check-in was efficient and we went to our room, on the twentieth floor. Room was clean and tidy so no issues there. Shower room clean, tick. Being at the rear of the hotel there wasn't a view to speak, wasn't expecting too much in such a high-rise city, no problem. I'd agree with one previous review in that the room could do with a refresh but it was okay. No street noise, even emergency vehicles being at the rear.

One thing that has been mentioned on a number of occasions, the lifts could, at times, be in high demand. This normally occurs at morning check-in, evening check-in/out and when bulk laundry movements happen. Nothing you can do about that if you expect fresh towels and linen - the larger of three elevators is commandeered for this activity. Have a little patience.

Throughout our stay, every member of the team, if not directly engaged with a customer, would wish you well as you left and welcome you upon return. very nice.
The location - as the first days played it became apparent we were in easy reach are Central Park, subway and bus stops for up and downtown travel and so many places to eat! Times Square, Fifth Ave., and many more are just a bit further, if you can walk with some comfort for periods at a time. It just felt an ideal spot.

Just adding that as a guest of the hotel, a discount can be had at  the steak house next door. Remember to ask for the voucher from desk staff before going! Albert, the concierge, was kind enough to get one for us when he explained what should have happened. Whilst expensive, my wife commented that it was probably the best steak she'd ever had.

title: Disappointing stay
text:
The front desk lady is very kind, and you can tell she cares. I was offered early check in, and they didn’t try to charge me unlike some properties. I was happy with that. 

However, when I arrived in my room, there were a host of issues. The coffee maker water receptacle is filled with RUST that floats around when you fill it with water.
The 2 lamps by the bed don’t work, and plugs don’t work to charge your phone.
There is dirt on the wall where a previous guest made a mess, and the chair is dirty. 

I was quite annoyed that the issues weren’t fixed in the several hours I was out of my room. I called not once, not twice, but three times to solve these issues. 5 hours later, I’m back and nothing was fixed. The manager is too busy to speak to me but the maintenance guy just arrived. No other rooms to move me to apparently. The front desk lady was kind enough to offer me 5000 points. However, this hotel does need improvement. At the rates they charge, I think it’s reasonable to expect a room in good working order. It doesn’t have to be perfect, but things should at least work.

By the way, the elevators are very slow. But that is a common issue among all newer hotels which are tall buildings like this one.

title: Amazing checkin experience
text:
The hotel front desk was absolutely great, amazed about the excellent treatment I received from Pierre and Charelle.

World class employees I felt extremely valued as a costumer, the experience with an esrly checkin was amazing, welcoming

title: Wonderful Hilton Garden Inn!
text:
This is an unbelievable hotel to stay out. They accommodated us early for a check in, and Pierre and Melody were awesome to work with.
I was able to upgrade my room upon arriving and Pierre provided us with a reasonable rate. When we come back to the city again, we will definitely be staying at the Hilton Garden Inn on 54th St.

title: Excellent Location
text:
The selling point of this hotel is the location, within 10 minutes walking distance of Central Park, Times Sq, Broadway etc. it’s about 90min walk to Lower Manhattan. 
Rooms were clean, we asked for the rubbish to be collected from our room as the bin was full but the cleaner said no which was disappointing. We stayed for 4 nights and the room was not cleaned and no fresh towels were provided, this has to be requested if you want this service.
The Wi-Fi was very hit and miss and quite often unavailable, we did not have a problem with the lift and we were on the 25th floor.
Pierre and his staff on the front desk were very helpful, overall this hotel was very good, we did not try the breakfast as we preferred to go out and explore the area for food.

title: 4 stelle fake
text: Iniziamo dai lati positivi. La posizione e poi….niente, la posizione! Dopo 9 ore di volo e 1 di taxi l’accoglienza è stata pari a zero. Non c’è stata mai in questi 4 giorni empatia col personale dell’accoglienza. Forse qualche rara eccezione tra i ragazzi della colazione e quelli delle pulizie. Arrivati alle 23 stravolti e a momenti ci facevano dormire fuori a causa di un problema con la carta di credito. Risolto “alla meglio”il problema sempre zero sorrisi cosa che non è il massimo se come lavoro fai ACCOGLIENZA AI CLIENTI DI UN HOTEL HILTON 4 STELLE A NYC! La mattina dopo scopriamo che la colazione costa 25dollari. Meno male che ci siamo ricordati che ce l’avevano nel pacchetto che avevamo prenotato. Come si dice a Roma “Ma che ce stai a prova’?!”   Camera piccola, in 4 giorni neanche una volta sono passati a rifarla. Cialde del caffè contate è mai aggiunte. Quindi caffè in camera solo il primo giorno. Dovendo prendere una bustina da sciogliere in acqua calda ho cortesemente chiesto un bicchiere di vetro per riscaldare l’acqua nel microonde. Risposta:non ne abbiamo. Meno male che la mattina dopo un ragazzo della colazione è stato così gentile da procurarmelo. Insomma nel complesso se non fosse stato un 4 stelle e di quella specifica catena sarebbe potuto andare anche bene MA considerando la non gentilezza (per me biglietto da visita di un hotel) e la poca propensione a soddisfare le esigenze degli ospiti il mio giudizio è negativo. Peccato! Basterebbe una rinfrescata alla struttura (datata) e un corso accelerato di gentilezza e accoglienza per il personale e forse qualcosa si potrebbe salvare. Ovviamente città meravigliosa e posizione tattica per arrivare a piedi nel cuore pulsante di NY.

title: Awesome service
text: Melode at the front desk was super helpful along with the other front desk staff. They were professional, courteous and able to accommodate my questions with friendly and welcoming attitude. Highly recommended!

title: Disappointed
text:
The overall experience was OK, we found the hotel expensive for the services offered.
The carpet in the rooms is dingy and dirty, we should ask twice for the rooms to be cleaned and for fresh towels. 
People at the reception were keen to help but we didn't get any info regarding the breakfast (timing and vouchers).
The staff at the restaurant was not smiling, cold... And for $64 breakfast could be better than it is actually.
Internet connection can sometimes be disrupted for more than an hour and it is impossible to work there. 
A bit disappointed by the experience and by a Hilton hotel.
Finally the location is perfect, 4 blocks far from Time Square and you have 2 or 3 others restaurants in the street that were great, groceries and access to the subway very close to the hotel.

title: very nice and wonderful service
text:
wonderful and friendly service. very quick. our room 2206 right in front of the elevator was quiet and calm and the elevator was quick!!!
The room was very clean. The best thing in this hotel is ALEX at the front office. Enormesly friendly and quick and always there.Thank you Alex! We come back!

title: Caution non remboursee
text: Lorsque nous sommes arrivés l hôtel à exigé une caution. Cette caution n à toujours pas été remboursée 3 mois plus tard! Ils ont toujours une bonne excuse et nous demandent de patienter depuis 3 mois pour récupérer cette caution! Scandalleux

title: Great location!
text:
Location was suberb! Staff very friendly. Especially Pierre in front desk! Room was a bit outdated (mainly the carpet) but clean, comfortable and not as tiny as many nyc hotel rooms tend to be. Showers were obviously renovated not long ago, so those were really nice. The bed was big and comfy. Nice views from our room in 24th floor! Many have complained about elevators, but we had no problems with them during our 7 nights stay. Never waited longer than 3 minutes… 
Again: the location! Only steps away from nearest subway station, all broadway theatres as well as central park.

title: Excellent stay close to everything
text: Check in was quick and efficient although we arrived a little early. Right around the corner from Broadway and the Ed Sullivan theater and a couple of blocks from Central Park. Everything looked very clean. The carpet was stained and should be replaced (probably with a darker color).  The bed was comfortable but the bedspread cover was weird and kept coming off. Elevators arrived within a couple of minutes except when we were checking out when it took 5-10 minutes.  We ate at Black Iron Burger across the street and Ponche Taqueria a couple blocks away and both were excellent.

title: Was expecting better...
text:
I am a Hilton Reward member so I only really stay in Hilton Hotels and this one just didn't hit the mark for me.  

I use the digital check in so that process was easy and staff I did interact with were friendly and helpful.   I opted to pick my room on the app and happy I did.   Picked 4th floor so stairs could be used instead of waiting in lines for elevators.

The room itself was clean.  Pillows kind of flat.  TV bracket had a tilt to it that I wasn't able to fix so TV tilted entire time. And some of details just overlooked.  Example being:  looks like bathroom doors had been painted by a lazy painter.  Instead of taking off the doors to paint you could see were the paint stopped due to the wall getting in the way and even paint on the walls for trying to reach.  

Rooms are smaller as expected in the city but what was really challenging was the smell in the "cellar floor."  Not sure what it was but off putting enough to have my wife and I scurry back up the stairs.    

Limited options in the pantry or snack room.

Overall location was nice for what we were doing in NYC.  But next time I think I may try a different Hilton.

title: Nice hotel terrible elevator service
text: We stayed at the hotel from September 9-11. After reading the previous reviews on TripAdvisor about the hotel and seeing a trend about the slow elevator service I decideD to call the hotel prior to my arrival to inquire on all 3 elevators being in operation and to request a low floor. I was told all 3 elevators are functioning and I was placed on floor 6 room 602. Thank goodness for the 6th floor because the elevators were absolutely ridiculously slow and full by the time it came to your floor. There were more people walking up and down the stairwells carrying luggage because the elevators were that slow! One time I timed it and it took 18 minutes to get an elevator  during non rush hours! Absolutely ridiculous to wait that long! We ended up using the stairs the entire trip duration to include taking luggage. Upon checkout I complained about the elevators and was told “Sorry”! I then called the hotel the following day to make a formal complaint and I was told the hotel was sending someone to service the elevators and that i would receive 5000 Hilton honors points for my inconvenience. Well it’s been a month and I never received my points! If you decide to stay here just choose the lowest possible floor because you will undoubtedly be using the stairs.

title: Nula actitud de servicio.
text: Solo el Bell boy fue amable, todo el resto del personal parece que te hace un favor al atenderte, tampoco el hotel limpia la habitación si no lo solicitas, muy buena ubicación, cama muy cómoda, baño buen tamaño, relación calidad precio... Puedes encontrar algo mejor por 400 usd la noche.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: Room was clean and bathroom seemed newly updated, no marks on the bedding and towels. Coffee making facilities were a godsend and a mini fridge just incase we purchased our own drinks from outside the hotel. Never had any issues with the lifts and we was just across from them, we expected some noise and waiting but was pleasantly surprised.
