Front desk staff were friendly, professional and extremely helpful, nothing was to much trouble, at the end of the day all we needed was a bed and shower, we never planned to stay in the hotel that much when in New York. Wasnt sure about paying 100 dollars a day as a deposit but it wasstaright back in our account the day we chcked out. Overall a very pleasant stay

title: 2-star hotel at 4-star prices
text: This hotel offered a very poor experience to our NYC trip. We were put in this old dusty room between the lifts (even though we booked it months ago) which meant all night we kept hearing the doors and cables just clunking. The carpet in the room was so worn out and dusty (I have pictures) that it triggered my allergies and I had to get antihistamines. The mini-fridge was empty but I was still asked to give a $400 deposit (again 2 star experience at 4 star prices). The furniture was all scratched, old and some parts showed signs of damp. Overall it was just sincerely disappointing given the Hilton name - I know Garden Inn is its lower sub-brand but you’d still expect the high standards. On a positive note the location was good and the staff was nice.

title: A few years has worn this down.
text:
We are in NYC 4-6 times a year. We are pretty Hilton loyal and bounce around between parts of the city.

We stayed here three years ago and really enjoyed it. I am sorry to say the years have not been kind. 

The reception staff was scattered and bordering on unprofessional. The elevators are as bad as all the reviews mention. All guests look unhappy which is not a good sign. 

The room was not particularly clean and the bedding not up to any Hilton standard (even at this price point).

It was nice to feel we could have a choice in midtown in this price range but I would rather bump up the price per night and lock in a predictable experience. 

No acknowledgment of Hilton Honors status/waters. That's pretty basic. 

Also there is a a guy in the lobby at all times (nice guy) but he seems to be promoting something???? Not sure. No hard sell but wanted to know what you (or any guest that we overheard the many times we waited for the elevator) was doing. But then, you couldn't quite tell what the end game was. So to this Hilton property, make it clear who he is and what he represents: is he Hilton? Timeshare? Sightseeing? Tickets? Again, he was pleasant but when you watch someone approach every guest, it's weird if he doesn't say "I'm Ralph from Hilton/ticket seller/sightseeing vendor."

title: Great hotel
text: I just returned from a one night stay in this hotel. I checked in perfectly and the room was clean and a bit small, but comfortable. I requested a low floor room so there wasn’t a problem with the elevators. This is located close to the Winter Garden Theater so we walked.  The breakfast package was a must with a great buffet offered on our day of departure.

title: Excellent accommodation and location
text: Hotel was clean, staff went above and beyond to ensure we were ok throughout our stay. Staff were very friendly. Hotel was quiet, we didn’t hear any noise from other guests or outside. Great location, easily accessible to a lot of attractions either on foot or subway. Can’t recommend enough!

title: Musician
text:
The hospitality was great. I was greeted before I got to the front desk. 

Even the cleaning crew was very happy and cheerful when they greeted me.

The room that I was in was nice, clean and cozy.

I'll recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

title: Nice location close to attractions
text: Nice location with easy access and walking distance to subway, restaurants, supermarkets, Central Park, shopping stores, time square, MOMA, etc. . Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful but the facilities at hotel are quite old and the elevators are very slow. Air conditioning are making big noise.

title: Great location, staff could be more knowledgeable
text:
Hotel is only four or five blocks from times square, and close to theatre district. The street it is on is very small, so be prepared to bring your suitcases with you. Room was standard for a NY hotel, a bit on small side which is to be expected. We bumped ourselves on the bed a couple of times trying to get to the other side of the room. 

Parking was really confusing. I called ahead of time and asked about parking, and was told it was $55 for the stay (basically every time you took car out, we just parked it for the duration of the stay). Upton check in we received a paper stating it would be $70 per night for the stay. When we asked several different employees they said the garage charged (Its the city Park garage), the garage would say the hotel charged and no one knew the price or how it worked. The hilton employees seemed very bothered by this question. 

Turns out it is charged to your room ,and so far I have only been charged $70 for the stay. We were repeatedly told it would be for each 24 hours but that does not seem to be the case. 

Priscilla was amazing! She got us our room early so we could change for our show and even left us an anniversary card and treat basket.

Bottled water is 3.00 so bring your own. Overall I would stay again.

title: Very Frustrating place
text: The elevators are a huge issue, I cannot tell you how much time i spent during my 3 day stay waiting for elevators. They have signs(see image) warning you to plan your elevator trip during peaqk hours, its so insane. The was a half drunk(see image) water bottle in our room when we arrived with a label telling us its $3. The internet was down for 2 of the 3 days we were there.

title: Very nice option to stay in Manhattan.
text:
I really liked my stay at this hotel (especially after my bad disappointing experience at the Dream Hotel Midtown). The hotel’s location is great. It is very close to Central Park and also not very far away from Times Square. The area around is very convenient and very busy with shops, restaurants, cafes etc. My check-in was fast and easy. The front desk lady was super sweet with me. I was allowed to check-in around noon with no extra charges. Moreover, I got room (#704) fitting my major requests – a high floor, open space (no building right across my window) and a nice city view. My room was more than big enough, looked pretty basic but had good design and was perfectly clean. I really loved having a big window. My room had a lot of daylight, which I really loved. I also loved the little sofa lounger next to the window where it was possible to lay down and chill. The actual King Bed was super comfortable! The closet in the room was pretty big, also there were a lot of additional big cut out spaces within the furniture for stuff including a space for refrigerator, coffee machine and microwave. The bathroom in my room had fairly good spacing. I really liked the big shower stall. Unfortunately, the bathroom amenities were of an okay quality and smelled not that great. Wi-Fi was working very fast during my entire stay.
The last thing I want to mention is the rate I paid. The value per night was approximately $160 with all taxes included. And I find this deal amazing for the good hotel quality I got.
I absolutely recommend this hotel for a stay in New York City. There is nothing really fancy about it, but for a pretty low amount of money for the Midtown Manhattan area, you will surely feel comfortable staying there.

title: Great hotel for tourists
text: The hotel was perfectly located for visiting both Times Square and Central Park. Our room was clean, and the shower water pressure was amazing after a long day sightseeing. Hotel staff was responsive to any questions, and Wit was helpful as we were leaving, making sure we had everything we needed to have a safe trip home. As for the elevators, we never had an issue (though we did not leave/arrive at peak times and specifically chose a high floor to try to beat the crowds when we left the hotel). Another advantage of the high floors was almost no street noise - we slept very well!

title: Fabulous stay
text: Hotel staff were friendly and hospital, especially Priscilla and Win. Check in was efficient, room was comfortable and quiet and the hotel location was perfect for sight seeing. The elevators were a little slow but we realized that we just needed to plan for more time to get in and out. Win was phenomenal. Very attentive when we had questions. We had a fabulous stay. Will definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Great location, hotel needs to improve some stuff though
text:
They have 3 elevators, only two work, one is mostly  by housekeeping going up and down one floor which means there’s only one lift for the guests, average wait from lobby is about 15-20 minutes then 10 to get to your floor, some evening queue for the elevator goes outside the hotel past the door! 

Check in- booked king room , I think I may have been downgraded (room 1111) because when you open the door it crashes with the bathroom door plus I always cut myself going across the room because the bed was almost the same length as the room, ( nice bit bed though 😎)

Breakfast - was basic, self service and  staff nice! 

Location- great! Really close to everything 

Amenities- good, A/C in my room was unbelievably great!  Wish the tv was a smart tv (YouTube Netflix ect…) all it had was a lot of news channels, Coffee machine and pods nice touch! 

Cleanliness- housekeeping  needs to be requested 24hr in advance, when I found out I asked for some coffee pods and shampoo to the room, never showed up!

Friendliness- I had read reviews online about their customer service and was worried but check in lady was very friendly and she offered complimentary breakfast for the inconvenience, ( I had free breakfast anyway  but still nice gesture)  can be hard to contact guests services via phone but that could be during busy hour check in.  Floor staff Front of house and on floors were very friendly when met in hallway! Guests services granted a late check out extension for me

Overall- Hilton management need to plan a better elevator system, it’s something that going to effect their overall revenue in the long run, considering most reviews mention this i’d think by now they would have a plan! The Poor staff getting abuse from guests because management have failed to plan to hotels infrastructure correctly! They need all 3 elevators fully operational plus a separate back of house staff lift so housekeeping carts and staff are not mixing with guests

title: Too many hassles so don't stay there
text: Huge elevator blockages, some bad staff attitudes and accounting issues give a poor and frustrating experience. Rooms acceptable but nothing special. The hotel's location is it's only positive but there are plenty of alternatives within a few hundred yards.

title: STAY NEXT DOOR INSTEAD!
text: Run , don't walk, from this property. It is old and dated and showing wear and tear. Not kept up well at all. The A/C does not cool properly (won't go below 74) the carpets are dirty, furniture chipped, very poor check in process, elevator broken, no sanitizer in machines, no use of key for elevator resulting in very poor security, TV remote has no menu, shall I go on? Next door at the Residence Inn and Courtyard you will pay a bit more but the experience and quality is NIGHT AND DAY.

title: Does Hilton really care for guest experience and feedback? PS: Where is my money?
text:
My stay in the hotel deserves a naught. The single star in this review goes to the Pierre, the manager. However, I’m not sure whether it’s him being overworked or a lack of attention from his superiors up the management ladder, even he’s been unable to address our concerns. 

Let’s start with the good things. 

-Check-in process was smooth. BUT, our card was charged with 300 USD extra for incidentals. We were supposed to get it refunded.

-Our room was on 34th floor (3403). Tiny, but with decent view of the skyline. Very clean.

Now the nightmare:
-The reviews of this hotel warn about how busy and slow the elevators are. But our experience surpasses all of those. 
We stayed here 3 nights and got stuck in the elevator THRICE. It’s no fun getting stuck in the middle of two high floors and dreading the next malfunction. 

-ONCE the elevator had a free fall for about 3-4 floors. Enough to send my covid weakened heart into a tizzy. 

-Now the housekeeping nightmare. I understand that many hotels now follow the “on request” policy. But what does one do when repeated requests are not honoured? Despite requesting on the second and the third day for fresh towels and bathroom cleanup, nothing happened. When we raised it at the reception, the receptionist apologised as she could see a request under our room number. 

-My husband flew out of New York the day we were supposed to checkout and I decided to leave the next day. However, the stuck-in-elevator situation made me check in to the neighbouring Wyndham property. 

-During checkout, the receptionist took USD 100 off the total bill to compensate for no housekeeping. Since the card had already been charged, we should have got incidentals refund + USD 100. I’m still waiting for that money! 

-I got in touch with Pierre, the front desk manager, on phone after trying for many days. He was most kind and helpful and promised to get back to me at the earliest. I am still waiting for a response from Hilton. 

-Since I’m back to India now, it’s ridiculous to chase the management on international calls. And for my own money! I don’t understand why there’s no email address for grievance redressal. 

-If Hilton properties are so quick at charging for potential bad behaviour of the guests, shouldn’t the guests be extended the same courtesy if their experience has been…well…let’s just say, less than ideal? 

In India, my family stays at Hilton hotels quite often. Not anymore.

title: Customer Service at Its Finest
text:
My hotel stay was top notch.  Michelle,Liypaya and Pierre provided me with an excellent customer service experience.  It was NYFW and people were checked in seamlessly.  One guest was upset that she left her phone in a car and although it was busy at the front desk, the staff assisted her by listening and showing empathy.  I was pleased witnessing the level of service.  I'll be back. 

LaDonna

title: Staff is Amazing!
text:
HR deserves a round of applause, because Michelle, Laniya, Pierre, Alex, Helima, Jeremy, Deshanda, Roni and everyone employee I encounter is so nice and professional.  I stay here often and they are the reason why.  

Also the Empire Steakhouse next door is a perfect compliment to the Hotel.  They have a very well rounded menu.  Whether you are pinching pennies or want to spoil yourself, there is something for everyone.  

Location is awesome as well.  I like to run and HGI is just 5 blocks away from Central Park and Columbus circle.  
Awesome Hotel!

title: Average hotel BUT service was great!
text: Hotel is centrally located to many access points in the city, however, hallways were not air-conditioned and there were long waits for elevator. With that said, the staff was really great. A gentleman helped us unload our bags in front of the hotel and the woman at the front desk, Priscilla, was exceptional in helping us find the best available room for us.

title: Great Location & Front Desk Service
text: Let me begin with the positives. Hotel has a great location and the service provided by the front desk was great. Pierre was very helpful upon check-in and we were upgraded to an upper floor (32) room.  Noise level was awful (not the fault of the hotel), sirens and horns all night long.  The best was to describe the room is "compact". Not an inch of wasted space. At one point I cut my leg on the sharp corner of the bed frame.  Always carry bandages with me.  There was no pen or paper in the room to write down messages. Elevators were small and tend to be extra busy at certain times.  We stayed here mainly because of location.

title: Great location but customer service issues
text: The location was superb for Central Park and getting into town.  Rooms for a family of 4 were tiny and beds x2 double beds tiny and awful nights sleep. Recommend asking for Queen size or whatever is largest they have.  Aircon noisy and controls did not seem to be working properly. Fridge in room and oddly a microwave but may be handy for some.  TV but no channel list (would have helped as no channel list on the to either). A complete night with the broken lifts and often had to resort to taking the stairs.   There was this guys who seemed to be running the bag storage when leaving and trying to control what taxis people could order. Felt uncomfortable and almost trying to force more expensive taxis on guests and saying the yellow taxis will rip you off.  Know this to be inaccurate and when we had a taxi pick up outside the said bag/taxi control man was giving our taxi driver a hard time.  Did not like that or the taxi hard sell etc from the hotel. Hey charged us $10 for bag storage before leaving late p.m and tried to make us feel he was doing us a favour and could have charged more if we took taxi hey could arrange. When we collated bags one of them was crushed at the bottom of a trolley.   Really expected more from a Hilton hotel and seemed to be trading on location and clear high demand but poor customer service and value. Could not see any repairs being done during 5 days there nor were the bins emptied in my room.  Disappointed.

title: Not up to standards
text:
This property is a bad joke. 
The elevator situation is a total disaster. Three old elevators for a 30 story hotel where they packed 14 tiny rooms in each floor. And to add insult to injury, while you are waiting for the elevators in the lobby (there is always a queue) they have people trying to sell you timeshares.
Room was tiny and dusty. They also don’t provide housekeeping daily which certainly makes the cleaning situation worse.
The front desk staff was nice though. There is not much they can do when the property is ran like a tourist trap.

title: Da vedere 😂
text:
Allora piano 11 la moquette sporca
La. Camera oltre a piccola ma quella è una caratteristica  la porta del bagno a scorrimento non chiude ci passano due dita quindi quando uno è in bagno e da il meglio di sé l altro partecipa 😂😂😂
Incredibile poi scendo educatamente e mi dicono si si son tutte cosi
Allora visito la camera di mia figlia e grazie a dio un po' meglio
Son già felice 
Ho video perch ele. Foto non rendono ve le mando a richiesta favoloso

title: The Perfect Getaway
text: We recently stayed here to celebrate our 50th Anniversary. We got in early and not only did Priscilla secure a room for us, but also treated us to a lovely breakfast buffet next door. The staff signed a card for us and Priscilla made our stay even more celebratory by bringing a bottle of Prosecco to our room. It’s this kind of attention to details that made our stay even more special. Besides the great customer service, the location is perfect for walking to Broadway shows and nice dining! We will be back!

title: The elevators are a deal breaker
text: I will not stay in this hotel again.  Staff were fine. Cleanliness was good. Location is wonderful.  But the elevators may as well be non-existent.  This is a 30 floor hotel with only two elevators.  During peak check in / check out times, you wait 20-30 minutes or longer.  Several times we just walked down 8 flights of stairs rather than wait.  If you decide to book here, get the lowest floor you can, because you'll be using the stairs a lot.

title: Great location, average hotel for the price
text:
Customer service, overall could not fault them , I had came to the states for my partners 21st, pre booked 3 months in advance, which I had advised them to get some balloons ready and get a cake etc if possible, ballon’s we’re done , however no cake. They had gave us 2 free days of breakfast, which was a nice gesture to cover the expectation which was not delivered. 

The room was spacious , air con was brilliant no concerns there, worked fine ( above standard) the room for the price was a bit expensive however it is 1. New York , 2. The location was 5 mins away from Central Park. 

We had put a sign on our door stating no room service for a couple of days out of the 5 nights we were there, however when we wanted it doing , we had a knock on the door at like 7am which we were still asleep at this point and I believe personally is too early. Anyway, as we got ready for the day I had informed the receptionist around 11am stating “ we are going out now, is it okay if the cleaner does service, we will be out for the day” “ yea sure no problem “ 

12 hours later.. open the door , no room service, which was bad in my opinion as did expect them to atleast to ensure my request was a priority. As we were checking out however I did advise the receptionist of this whom in stated we can give you a free breakfast for the inconvenience, which I feel was great as they did acknowledge the issue and applied the gesture. 

Breakfast: believe it’s 18$ ( £16) , which is around standard price in Manchester UK however much wider variety and better quality. not much choice , box standard, wouldn’t pay for it as price doesn’t reflect onto the selection provided.  

There is I believe 4 lifts, however you can be waiting 10 minutes for one to arrive, as they are so slow. 

Overall: good hotel with regards to the location and big spacious room however £900 ( 1100$) for a 5 night period, in my opinion is ludicrous,  
The restaurant which is provided by the hotel, never saw anyone in it, the prices were so high and the menu looked bland. They offered 10% discount if we wanted to go however even with this it was still highly priced. Would I stay again? Yes but for a way cheaper price, good hotel but not up to scratch to be at a £900 price in my opinion. ( we have stayed in Hilton’s prior and would say this was lack’s in areas in comparison.

title: Giudizio forse troppo positivo dato il prezzo
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato pochi giorni fa in questo hotel.
Partiamo dalle cose positive:
-dispone di una palestra e di una lavanderia
-stanze nel complesso pulite e personale ai piani attenti a non disturbare 
-tv funzionante e bagno spazioso
-posizione ottima a Broadway
Note dolenti:
Appena entrato nella hall ci sono come minimo 10/15 gradi in meno rispetto a fuori, personale che non parla nemmeno una parola di italiano (prova a roma a non parlare minimo 3/4 lingue),bagno con porta praticamente aperta per la struttura della stessa che rimane aperta anche se chiusa,quindi privacy zero !
E poi fatevi il segno della croce per l'ascensore...ce ne sono tre e servono tutti i 34 piani più il piano con palestra e lavanderia.
Usato anche dei lavoratori,ci siamo ritrovati a dover aspettare anche 10 minuti e prenderlo pieno...neache fosse un bus allora di punta.
In conclusione buono ,ma ne sceglierei un altro per il nostro secondo soggiorno a new York

title: Good location but poor service
text:
Two sides to this: location was perfect and the room was comfortable. West 54th Street is ideally placed for all the typical New York highlights and the hotel is a couple of minutes from the subway. Room itself was what you need: comfy bed, working shower and plenty of space for luggage. The other reviews are right about elevators but we were on the 6th floor and used the stairs most of the time.

Staff weren't great for two reasons. First off, we reported a faulty safe on two occasions and it didn't get fixed during our stay. Who knows if it has been fixed yet? The second guy we reported it to had his phone hidden behind the computer monitor and was texting all the way through us reporting the issue. Needs to be more subtle next time or improve customer service! 

Second issue was as we left; we asked for a taxi to the airport and they offered to phone for one. Manhattan to JFK has a flat rate of $52 plus a few dollars extra for tolls. The guy quoted us $100 for one and told us, once we asked about the flat fee talked about widely online, that we'd struggle to get a better deal and that a yellow cab driver would try and scam us. Felt like that was exploiting customers and trying to push an agency they work with for a few dollars their way. Got the subway instead and won't return. 

I expect some compromise with Midtown hotels but I don't expect such basic rudeness and to have someone try to exploit like that.

title: Do not stay here
text: The only good thing about this hotel was the staff and the location  The elevators were always packed and you had to wait for multiple ones before you could finally get on.   Our room was the size of a postage stamp.  If someone sat in the chair at the counter you could not get between them and the bed.  The bathroom door stuck so to close it you had to use your strength and push it or pull it while it dragged on the floor.  The shower door did not close all the way which made for water on the floor.   And the "city view" run I paid extra for was a joke.   The window actually looked directly at the building next to it unless you got between the cabinet with the fridge in it and a tiny chair and looked way off to the left to see a few buildings.  Plus I think it is utterly ridiculous how you have to request housekeeping now.   It should be done no matter what.   That is what I pay for to stay in a hotel.   Even frickin Disney does it without asking every 2 days. The "store" if you can call it that was never stocked.   Always out of everything so my $20 credit some days was useless.  Go to the Marriott next door.  The airline people stay there.  Much nicer.  Oh, and the lady in the lobby harassing us to book another trip with Hilton in other cities for a discount and trying to get you to sign a contract and tour a property for a higher membership was offensive.

title: Servicio y limpieza pésimo
text: El hotel está bien ubicado pero eso no contrarresta el pésimo servicio, la limpieza y calidad del alojamiento. No limpian las habitaciones, los ascensores no funcionan viejos y tardas esperando 15 a 20 minutos lograr subirte a ellos y las instalaciones huelen mal

title: Awesome Service
text: I opened the door, and the great service began and continued throughout my stay. There were several helpful folks. I'd like to give a special shout-out to Priscilla. She made everything seem effortless. Watching her end her evening shift and return in the morning with the same smile was everything.

title: I've stayed at this HGI at least 20 times and the service here is always phenomenal!
text: I just checked in and Michelle was so nice, efficient, and professional as always.   Every employee I've encountered(Dashand, Priscilla, Jasmine, Veronica, Alex, Jeremy, Harrison, Halima, Laniya, Michelle, and the GM) at this Hotel are always so nice and make me feel like family.  I will continue to choose HGI Central Park South, because of this group.

title: Low floor please
text: Room was clean and staff were friendly. One of the three tiny elevators were out of service and waiting took up more time than I would have liked. Took the stairs down from the 15th floor a few times but too hot to take them up.  Great location close to Central Park and Times Square. Will definitely stay again, with a request for a low floor so I can take the stairs.

title: Nul a part l’emplacement
text:
Pas de ménage dans la chambre sauf sur demande (nouvelle politique Hilton)
Trop peu d’ascenseurs pour le nombre de chambre, vous pouvez l’attendre jusqu’à 15 mn
L’hôtel m’a envoyé 1 semaine avant la possibilité d’une option « skyline vieux » que j’ai prise… pour me retrouver sur la rue au milieu du building sans aucune vue ! Option qui m’a bien entendu était facturé !!
J’ai mis 2 étoiles uniquement pour l’emplacement

title: v poor for hilton brand
text: Do not book this hotel as the service was extremely poor. As mentioned by other posts the hotel has over 30 floors with 3 lifts. One is permanently off which i assume house keeping use as no sign put up to say out of order. That leaves 2 lifts for all guests and staff - the average wait time for our stay over 5 days was 15-20 minutes .We had to use the stairs from 18th floor to get to breakfast one day as the lift just would not come. House keeping was even worse, although we had to request this , which we did the room was not cleaned for 2 days even though we had a water leak affecting the bedding. Informed front desk to request bins and housekeeping on 4 occasions one day still it didn`t get done ! Only positive was the location but definitely ruined our experience of new york.

title: The worst I ever stay
text: The whole experience in the hotel was terrible. At first it was bearable with the smell in the room and the slowest elevator ever until the hotel bring back our car with two dents on it. We did the valet parking. I wouldn’t write this review if it’s just the Elevator ( BTW we waited for more than 20 minutes just to get to the ground floor and there were so many other customers complaining about it too) but I couldn’t do it anymore when the hotel told me that they partnered with the garage, it’s not their problem if we got our dented car? I feel so sorry for my friends and I that I booked this hotel for this trip to New York. It was so disappointing and awful. The garage I believe it was call “city parking” that they try to use the excuse of saying we got our car for too long and the paint came off by it self? HAHAHA funniest joke I ever heard in my life? Hope you guys don’t have to this awful experience when you come to New York since it’s a beautiful city. This city doesn’t deserve anything like this.

title: Insufficient elevators
text: This is a 30 story tower with three small elevators.   Waits are unacceptably long.   Only two were operative through my stay.  Otherwise, room was nice, clean, and relatively spacious for midtown Manhattan.

title: DE HILTON SOLO TIENE EL NOMBRE / PÉSIMO
text:
Lo único positivo ha sido la ubicación si deseas estar en pleno centro de NY. El resto ha sido de terror empezando por la
LIMPIEZA hemos tenido que pedir 5 veces cada día que vengan a hacer el cuarto y aun así han pasado días sin venir! El OLOR espantoso que tiene la habitación a humedad por sus alfombras lo hace insoportable, el ruido del aire acondicionado otro tema y LOS ASCENSORES, tres de los cuales sólo funcionan DOS para 33 pisos con un promedio 10/12 habitaciones por piso, una espera interminable cada vez que lo hemos querido tomar! Una vergüenza de hotel, de HILTON SOLO TIENE EL NOMBRE! No lo recomiendo en absoluto, existen muchas mejores opciones por el mismo o menor precio y mayor servicio! UNA PENA

title: I would return just to see the doorman....
text: I arrived a bit early and was checked-in and received a room (well before check-in time).  The room was spacious and I think it was an upgrade. THANK YOU.  It was hot, humid and the streets were afire, so I really appreciated the fridge and daily portion of bottle waters.  THANK YOU. There was a bit of construction noise during my stay, but it stopped after 5pm.  THANK YOU. Room was comfy, I slept well, and the view towards 7th st. was very nice (room 1231). THANK YOU.  I accidentally left behind a small bag of personal items.  It took about 20 minutes but they had retrieved it and everything was in tact.  THANK YOU.  If for nothing else, I would return to be welcomed by the doorman (who checked for key cards after hours, otherwise you couldn't enter the hotel).  Whenever I returned to the hotel, he gestured me into the lobby like I was the Queen of Zamunda and rose petals were laid before me.  For me, it's the little things.   I can't say it enough... THANK YOU :)

title: Great front desk
text: I stayed at the property the staff was amazing. I arrived early to be welcome by the two most energetic young ladies shanda and Priscilla. I was early so I left my bags. The bellman Harrison was a sweetie made me a VIP. When I arrived back Veronica checked me in with a wonderful smile made me feel like I was taking to a great friend. The con of my stay is that my ac wasn't working i called the front desk Jasmine had someone there in 5 mins. I usually don't write reviews the staff at this property was a true delight and I look forward to staying again

title: Huge noise coming from elevator #3 and no resolution from the hotel
text: Called the front desk several times, always promising they would shut down elevator #3, never happened. Solution proposed was to wait until less people used the elevator at night and try to get to sleep. They also promised to give me a new room, and it never happened. Avoid it if you like quiet rooms.

title: Clean rooms and joyful staff!
text: The location is right in the middle of everything in NYC - the bellman is the star of the show in the property. Knowing the hotel business, I understand why breakfast isnt complementary, but of course wish it was - it was amazing breakfast!

title: Priscilla is a gem
text: We received international visitors at our home in Connecticut, and decided to take them to NYC to see the big apple and other sites.  The hotel was generally clean, and it was remarkably well-organized despite the very busy lobby.  A person named Priscilla was working the front desk.  Priscilla was calm, collected, and extremely helpful and friendly when we approached the desk with questions and also to request a forgotten toothbrush.  Priscilla resolved everything in stride and never missed letting us know that the staff was always available to help in any way possible.  At breakfast, a waiter named Luiss and his coworker named ?Humberto or Eduardo? were friendly and very accommodating.  It is always the people who make the difference.

title: Hilton Garden Inn W. 54th St
text:
Pros: 1) Fantastic location in the theater district. You can walk to most theaters. One is right across the street! There are so many restaurants close by, it's hard to choose where to eat! (If you're looking for a great burger,
go across the street to Black Iron Burger, get a big, delicious, fresh, juicy burger!)  2) Our room was a little small with a king size bed, but was roomy enough to be acceptable. The bed was very comfortable, the room was very clean when we arrived. 3) We ordered transportation to the airport a day in advance through lobby staff .. it was easy and efficient, and they picked us up exactly on time the next day. Perfect,!

Cons: 1) We stayed 2 nights and service by room attendants only occurs when you request it . Cleaning or refreshing linens is not done daily. For us, that was fine; the 2 of us didn't have many needs .2) The business center, although there's a sign that says open 24/7, was nonexistent..it's currently being used as a storage room and there is no signage on that floor to indicate a different location (apparently there isn't one). When we asked front desk where we can print documents, they pointed us in the direction of a sign that had some vague instructions which made no sense to us, and we gave up. 3) The lobby is almost always very crowded with people waiting for an elevator. With only 3 smallish, old, slow elevators, the wait can be very long, especially in peak hours. And usually they were packed tightly with people, not a good thing in the days of Covid.

All of that being said, the hotel was fine for our 2 night stay. The room rates on the days we were there were much less than the Marriot next door, and with the cleanliness and comfort of the room, great location, we'd gladley overlook the cons and stay here again.. (as long as we can save a little money over a nearby hotel)

title: CEO
text:
I witnessed professional decorum that is from a by-gone era in affect. Michelle, Brian, Harrison, and Jeremy operate systematically in their own divisions of labor. What wowed me was how Michelle diffused disgruntled guests upset about limited elevators. Possessing a real golden mindset that shines brighter than the disruption unfolding is the pinnacle of pleasantly.

Before my Lyft was fully stopped, Brian and Harrison ushered me into the property and made me feel the Hilton hashmark!

Jeremy came to my terrace-that incidentally Michelle made sure I had that I paid for on Booking.com, nonetheless, Jeremy tried to get me connected to the internet as it was critical that I use wifi .... 

Even Rany the G.eneral M.anager of the property came to sit with me and didactically instructed me how to not just use the company site but how to use TRIP Advisor. With some new upgrades to this property it could outshine much more luxurious addresses with committed talent that go the extra mile for that extra smile!!!

I was in town to make a multi-million dollar pitch to the federal government to use my uvc technology to help keep government workers and the public they come in contact with more safe-which by the way is ideal for the hospitality industry!

SHOP NOW: WWW.MIDIGITEL.COM 

BURGESS "BYRD" FOSTER, FOUNDER/CEO

title: Priscilla was outstanding!
text: I needed 1 night to prepare for an interview and work on the room. Priscilla understood my urgency and got me a room in short order and even let me checkin a little early to get a head start. So appreciated!

title: How could this be a Hilton?
text:
I stay in Hiltons all the time. This one is a disappointment. Some of the problems:
 - Elevator takes forever. There's usually a line of frustrated guests standing around waiting, trying to push their way in when one finally arrives. 
 - Elevator is noisy in the room. It makes a loud scraping noise all day and all night. Like the soundtrack in a horror film.
 - Hot water in the shower takes several minutes to warm up (particularly in off hours), and slowly increases temperature so you have to keep adjusting it.
 - Little packets of shampoo that are hard to open in the shower, and not enough shampoo.
 - Filthy carpets and old worn sheets.
 - Air-conditioner in my room didn't work; it was very humid and warm when I arrived, but the thermostat was set to 63°F. I asked for another room, but they sent up an "engineer" who didn't speak English, so I couldn't explain what was wrong. He set the thermostat to 50°F and changed the filter! Haha. I'm an actual HVAC engineer, and took it apart myself and fixed it, although the thermostat never did work correctly.
 - I could make out every word of the neighbor's conversation and smell their pot smoke.
 - Restaurant service was disorganized and slow. For a $25 breakfast with automatic $5 tip, I expected a little more (but the food was good). 

Good things: 
 - Location.
 - Location.
 - Everything I didn't complain about above. Like: there were walls, a bed, pillows, etc.

title: Wonderful central location hotel with amazing staff
text:
We booked this hotel as a central to Central Park and Times Square area and it did not disappoint.  Everything is close by and accessible.

Priscilla is the best, the very best.  Great service, professional, and took very good care of us during our stay.  All the staff we’ve had the pleasure of interacting with were fantastic as well.

5/5

title: Bien situado
text: Buena situación.muy ruidoso el ascensor.hay q avisar para q hagan las habitaciones.en horas punta puedes esperar 15 mins el ascensor.siendo 3 estrellas no está mal.poca oferta en desayuno.lo mejor la ubicación

title: Great location!  Superb hotel.
text:
Great location: Walking distance to Times Square; Central Park; Rockafellar Center.
Spacious Rooms (for NYC) with great amenities in the room. Friendly check in and check out! Great amenities  on site.  Clean room-daily maid service is on request only when staying less than 5 days.  Surprisingly quiet-my room was on the 6th floor and right outside the elevators-no noise heard!!!

Travel tip-stay on a low number floor so using steps is easy when elevators are slow or filled.

title: Horrible Property
text: Horrible hotel. Rooms were dumpy, sink was clogged, air conditioner barley worked, and car got numerous scratches on it while with valet service.Elevator took forever and at one point, we waited over 22 minutes for one to arrive. Ordered towels at 11:00 AM and still had not received them by 7:00 pm.  Stay away from this hotel. Plenty of better options in immediate area so definitely do your research. Surprised at how low the quality was for a Hilton property.

title: Great location in theater district
text: Great location.  Small hotel. Our room with two queen beds was tight for two adults and one adult-sized teen. Updated, but still a little tired.  comforters could use a good clean or replacing.  Safe did not work. Generally friendly staff. maintenance responded quickly to resolve a plumbing issue. Elevators are slow at peak times so plan in advance! Location makes up for a lot.  suggest booking a premium room at this property.

title: Bien situé, bel apparence mais mal insonorisé et manque de propreté
text:
L'hôtel est bien placé, environ 10 mins de marche pour être au coeur de Times Square.

Apportez vos bouchons, car le moindre bruit dans le passage se fait entendre c'est mal insonorisé par la porte (nous étions au 22e étage). 

J'aurais pu prendre plus de photos pour ce qui était mal nettoyé, surtout le tapis de la chambre je ne pouvais me promener sans bas c'était très sale et quelques endroits (base de la douche à quelques endroits, meuble de la tv, mur, table de nuit).
La literie c'était ok par contre.

L'apparence de la chambre était toutefois très bien. 

Pour le nettoyage de la chambre (literie, serviettes...) si vous restez moins de 4 nuits, il faut le demander, c'est bien indiqué dans la salle de bain que sinon elle ne sera pas faite.

title: Sucio
text: Sucio, ruidoso, feo, las fotos son irreales, filas para usar el elevador, y tarda mucho en la espera. Nos iban a compensar con el desayuno incluido, cosa que fue mentira. No sirve el conmutador para hablar a recepción

title: The staff was amazing
text: We had a block of rooms for a family wedding last week.  The front desk staff was exceptional.  I had many occasions where I needed assistance and Priscilla could not have been more accommodating.  I would highly recommend this property.

title: Fantastic Clean Hotel With Great Service
text: We traveled to NY for a funeral and with all the airline craziness 2 of our flights have been canceled and have forced us to stay an 3 additional days in NY. Our previous hotel was sold out and we had to move to another hotel. That is how we found the Hilton Garden Inn. I have to say, Pricilla at the front desk was absolutely amazing and was able to check us in early. I know how challenging that can be when there is a full hotel the night before, so thank you Pricilla! Her can do attitude and smile made a great first impression. The synergy of the whole team at the desk was remarkable. I watched them handle a lobby full our guests checking out. All the guests remarks were positive ones. The rooms are very clean, have a microwave and mini fridge. The location is wonderful as well. Thank you Pricilla and team for coming to our rescue!

title: Internet is sporadic and works randomly.
text: Been here for a day and the staff seems overloaded and unable to help. Had internet issues which were never resolved . No complimentary water which is insane. The only good thing is that it is close to Central Parks room is also not that clean. Disappointing for a Hilton hotel.

title: Not worth it
text: Came here for a Family vacation. Filthy and not worth the price. Location is decent but much better hotels in the area. Service was very poor. Carpets were filthy and wait times for front desk and elevators were awful

title: Short but sweet...
text: Had a really nice stay at this hotel.  Location was perfect and customer service was excellent.  I even had a mistake on my bill that I thought was probably 'unfixable', but thanks to Jasmine DaShanda, everything worked out beautifully and didn't take up any extra time.  Thanks again for hard work.  Keep smiling... Aloha!!

title: Muito ruim sobretudo com bebê!!!
text: Wi-Fi não funciona. Precisa pedir limpeza do quarto (não limpam todos os dias - e não avisaram) e meu quarto ficou com mal cheiro com fraldas do bebê. Não tinha o berço solicitado no quarto. Tive que buscar o berço e montar sozinha. Roupa de cama para o berço chegou horas depois. O telefone do guest service e da recepção não funcionam. Ninguém atende. Tudo tem que ir resolver na recepção e os elevadores são congestionados. Funcionários pouco colaborativos e até grosseiros.

title: You will not regret staying here!!!
text: Our flights were cancelled so I was very worried about us getting to NY in the middle of the night with our original hotel reservation. When we arrived we had to stay in a different room for one night. On the following day, Pierre gave us the double bed we had originally reserved and gave us complimentary breakfast at the Empire Steakhouse for our stay.  Wonderful staff both at the restaurant and at the hotel. The front desk people actually stopped us the following day to ask if we had had our room changed. They really made us feel like they care. Thank you guys. You made a difference in our NY visit. We will come back!!!

title: Pierce was very helpful
text:
The manager Pierce was very helpful and accommodated us while we were in town. 

The place was nice and in a good part of town. The lobby has a cool bar right outside that makes it a fun place to hang. I will be coming back.

title: NFT NYC!
text: The manager (Pierce Perks) helped my co-worker and I put tremendously with a unique need during our stay. It was nice to see the southern hospitality which we are accustomed to in Georgia be translated to the experience of staying in a hotel in New York. Thank you Pierce—we’ll be back.

title: Review
text: Excellent stay.  Hotel staff very pleasant and helpful. Nicole provided excellent service.  Great location in midtown conveniently located to shops,, restaurants, shopping and times square.  Looking forward to next visit.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: The manager Pierre and his staff are great! The hotel has a great location and the Empire Steakhouse is also great.  My family and I are extremely happy to have stayed in this hotel this summer and we are already planning to visit again next year.

title: Worst hotel I’ve ever been to
text: The hotel staff is very unfriendly, ignores you, does not answer the phone at the reception, we asked for towels they never arrived, asked to have the garbage can removed from the room never collected it, everything you need you must go down to the reception and ask and even then 4 people will stand and talk to each other  Or play on their phone, this is the worst hotel I've ever been to in my life, it's better to sleep on the street and not go back there

title: Too expensive for what you get
text: We got a room on the thirs foor and it was very loud all the time from some generators from outside. Additional to this, we tool double bed room and it was so small that we were not able to open our suitcases anywhere. For the lift you are waitinf like crazy. The front desk is not really helpful. I asked 3 times to change the room and each time they tole me to come later or they did not have a room to change. The only thing hotel has is location. I would not recommend it.

title: Priscilla at the front desk is the best!
text: We traveled with our toddler an needed help getting to our airport after our flight got delayed! Priscilla made us feel well taken care of! She made arrangements to get my family to the airport with no problems! Thanks Priscilla!

This hotel refused to help arrange a rescheduling of dates despite written evidence of that this was in my original booking. The booking site, Booking.com failed to reach the hotel for this and the hotel refused to help.

title: WNBA game
text: Location was perfect. Hotel was clean, staff very friendly. Felt safe and secure. Room was a little small but perfect for a couple. Walking distance to Barclay's Center, several places to eat and shop. Will definitely stay here for future visits.

title: So glad we didn't take other reviews seriously!
text: this property was perfect for our recent NYC trip - front desk staff were beyond pleasant and helpful!  Pierre and Priscilla are gems.  Room was clean, quiet, and the location is perfect.  We only experienced a delay with the elevators twice in a 6 day stay.

title: Great location
text: In such a great location, we never had to catch an Uber or subway.  Close to Central Park, restaurants and theatre with Hell’s Kitchen and Times Square a stone away!   Elevators are slow but being on 2nd floor helped.  Great bar and outdoor area!   Will be my go to hotel in the City.  Staff was great too!

title: Guest Beware
text: Front desk personnel were great.  My issues were resolve in a timely fashion.  It was nightmare to get into the hotel if you have a car.  The temp parking was taken up by motorcycle and delivery trucks and there is no valet.  All self parking is down the street.  If you must park pay the parking facility directly. The hotel adds a $20 premium per day if you go through them.  You park in the same place, the hotel does not have a parking facility.  The breakfast is over priced.  They added an automatic  20% gratuity for a self serve limited buffet breakfast for 3.  Total bill came to $96 they did reduce to $45 after I pointed out my status with their frequent stay program.  As for rooms extremely extremely small.  Did I say small.  We had a double room for 2 adults and a teenager.  You could not both walk around the bed at the same time.  I stay in a lot of hotels, I have never been such a cramped hotel room.  It looked like to goal of this hotel was to get as many rooms as possible in the space provided.  Got woken up by other hotel rooms doors opening and closing in the early morning.  Not what I expect form a Hilton garden Inn.  Why is my rating so high?  The staff treated me very well, the room was clean, the location was perfect and I couldn't rate a 2.5.

title: Worst experience ever.
text:
I’ve never been in so bad hotel. I can’t believe it’s one of Hiltons hotels. 
Tiny rooms- there is 60cm-1meter around your bed and this is it. 
Hotel will not clean rooms - Hilton will clean your room every 4th (!!!) Day! So, if you have full basket of rubish or dirty towels - go and clean it by yourself in first 3 days of stay.
Reception - 1 of 10. Very baaaaad! Not giving you any kind of information - not time or place for breakfast, not important information that Hilton is not cleaning rooms anymore “because of covid” LOL. Because “of covid”?? Are you seriously?? And more : reception guy is telling “i told you we are not cleaning rooms”. No, you didn’t. All my family members are witneses of what you told. You spoke on the phone with another client about changing towels.
Dont buy breakfast at this hotel. You can go 100meters to Applejack , and take brilliant breakfast there. Both options available from 7am, and will cost you about the same.

Very loud - aircondition, elevators, neighbours, street noise - its too much. 
So, please don’t make the same mistake as I did! Don’t choose this hotel!!!

title: Great stay with great staff!
text: Chose the hotel due to availability of ADA room. Pierre at the front desk could not have been more helpful - even adding a bday surprise for my mother at check in. He continued to be helpful throughout our stay! ADA room was big enough for 3 of us to share and the shower/water pressure were better than any other NYC hotel we’ve stayed in. The attached restaurant was great for pre-theatre meal!! The elevators are slow - really only “con” to the stay! We’d definitely come back to stay again!!

title: Oh dear……..
text:
Disappointing somewhat understates my dismay at this experience.

Location is ok: reception bearable. Lifts so slow the snails crept up the walls more quickly…. and breakfast was a poor second to the average British greasy spoon!! Very poor.

The room is so small the average dead cat could not be swung without serious risk.

Rooms are cleaned on request…… this is the third Hilton on this trip……. Nashville and Indianapolis too ……… and they all only do room cleaning on request…… a cost cutting measure…… or just another opportunity to charge full rate to recover after the ravages of the pandemic and to hell with the customer experience? 

A shame but I will not be returning to this hotel; will be avoiding.

title: I won’t stay there again
text: I don’t know what happened to this hotel. It used to be good. This time the service was poor (except the manager), the rooms were loud and it was run down.  I had to change my first room because it was near the laundry shoot and the entire room would shake when laundry came down!

title: Tutto perfetto!
text: Nonostante le recensioni non fossero il massimo abbiamo deciso di affidarci alla catena Hilton devo dire che siamo rimasti estremamente soddisfatti, accoglienza ottima camera con doccia e arredamenti nuovi non rumorosa, albergo in zona centralissima e colazione ottima! Torneremo sicuramente

title: MR
text: Really enjot the stay here good location in the heart of new york. The best thing is there service are really top class  shout out to the guy Pierre who always help us with everything  👏👍🙌😀🙏👌👏👍🙌😀

title: Bravo to Pierre and front desk
text:
Fabulous location for theaters, Times Square, Central Park. Clean. BEST FRONT DESK SERVICE EVER - THANK YOU, PIERRE! He saved our trip. Handled a late night check in and reservation mixup with patience and good humor. He is a gem.
Enjoyed the bar and restaurant. Long waits for elevator only downside

title: Avoid the hotel
text: The worst Hilton that I ever stay. The rooms are size of a cheap side road motel, maintenance is bad and hallways are so narrow as you will have difficulties rolling your suitcase through them. The only positive aspect of this hotel is location. Definitely does not meet the Hilton standards.

title: La mejor experiencia. The best expirience.
text:
En el mes de mayo me hospedé en este hotel, el trato y el buen servicio fue excelente, es un sitio que recomie do 100% 
Gracias a todos los colaboradores en especial el Sr. Pierre el cual hizo de nuestra estancia la mejor experiencia.
Así mismo resalto el buen trabajo del Sr Brian.

title: Visita NY
text: La semana pasada estuve en el hotel, el servicio y la calidez de todos fue muy buena pero debo destacar especialmente a Pierre y Brian en la Recepcion. Siempre dispuestos ayudar y anticiparse a nuestras necesidades. Muchas gracias por hacer nuestra estadía muy grata.

title: Pluses and minuses
text:
The hotel has pluses and minuses.  Front desk staff were very friendly, and helpful, though by phone not always available. Twice we had to go downstairs to ask for help on something re our room, because no one answered the front desk.  Our room was clean, functional, and the bed was very comfortable.  The room was generally quiet, although the heating made a dripping sound in the middle of the night, except when we had a person next door who made a lot of noise (the walls are very thin).  The bathroom was accessible, but done in a makeshift way, e.g., water came out on floor outside shower, curtain too short, floor not correctly leveled.  Bathroom door is sliding and did not shut completely, annoyingly!  The bathroom sink has no space around it to put your travel bag.  

Our refrigerator had been turned off and we could not turn it on without help from engineering.  Likewise, our TV was not working.  We had to wait 24 hours for engineering to get us a new one.  
Finally, the lobby was surprisingly small, which we did not realize from the pictures online, and extremely crowded most of the time, so that we could not hang out there with our friends also in the hotel.  NY doesn’t seem to care about COVID anymore!  Finally, the restaurant connected to the hotel is very expensive (Empire Steakhouse), but food was good.  

The price was right for the hotel, but I think I will go elsewhere next time I’m in NY.

title: Asian in the hotel
text:
Most of the staff where not nice. Once i tried to ask about something to the officer at the front desk, he talked to me while still playing at his phone an not even looking at me.

But the guy that standing in front of the front desk was really really nice

title: Not Hilton Like
text:
This Hilton Location and the staff on this location are causing harm to the Hilton brand - I can say this for sure, have spent many nights in  multiple Hilton locations, a diamond member as a result of it ( HH 1184895868) 
-  screw up on my laundry because the front desk folks forget to put the laundry paper in the bag - for the screw up offers me two breakfast coupons; not going to make up for the time lost.
- the wi fi sign in the landing page is so spotty- never had this bad experience ever any hotel anywhere in the world 
- busy lifts even in the non peak hours; cleaning staff, working  staff use the same lifts - keep the lift doors open to chat.

title: Best service ever
text: I met pierre ! He was the best and helped me with a personal issue ! Thanks to him my trio wasn’t a disaster.  Thanks pierre you are simply the best ! I really will be thankful for you ever ! The location of the hotel it’s great and the services too ! Thanks so much for everything ! If any trouble ask for pierre at front desk.

title: Professionali e gentili
text: Ho soggiornato con un amico in questo hotel e son rimasto colpito dalla posizione tattica e dal prezzo sicuramente conveniente. Ottimo compromesso per essere vicino al centro e non spendere una follia. Consigliato vivamente. Ottimo anche il personale che si è rivelato molto gentile.

title: Malo. Decepcionante. No hacen las habitaciones .  Ascensores colapsados. Desayuno a la habitación NUNCA llegó.
text: Muy mal hotel. Lo único bueno es su ubicación. Servicio pesimo. No hay personal suficiente. Todo colapsa. Hay que esperar horas el ascensor. Servicio de desayuno Tb colapsa. Desayuno a la habitación nunca llegó. No hacen las camas..! Horror

title: Check in
text: We were greeted by Pierre who was very accommodating.  He was able to help us get into one of our rooms with early arrival and offered us a complimentary breakfast.  It was a nice check in experience as we were all very tired.

title: Very clean, modern rooms, friendly staff
text: I arrived around 1 PM but was able to get a room right away (I am a Hilton member).  Check in staff was super friendly.  When I checked out the next morning I left my bag at the hotel.  When I returned that evening around 4 I was able quickly reclaim my bag and head for the GoBus terminal

title: Frustration
text: The room was nice. And staff was friendly. It was my experience with Hilton that was a nightmare. Apparently once you check in, Cusomer Service and the app can do nothing to assist you in changing or adjusting reservations.  I was on hold for over 15 minutes twice. And then it just disconnected.  The front desk was busy and I was concerned I would miss a cancelation deadline. I am surprise that Hilton can not manage their operations. Seriously surprising.

title: Great dtaff great location
text:
They worked out the problems we had with hotels.com and the rooms are   very clean and well maintained. We have stayed there twice and will do it again    
They also  have a heated garage if its snowing
Perfect place to stay.

title: Lack of Hospitality - Hilton Diamond Member
text:
My wife visited New York with her sister.  They arrived early and was told they can not check in early.  The hotel took their bags for safekeeping and told them to come back at 3pm for checkin.  My wife and sister-in-law arrived shortly after three to be told rather bluntly by the front desk that the hotel was full and there were no rooms ready for her.  She asked to speak to the manager, since the front desk was being rude and she was told there would be a room ready at 3pm.  The lady at the front desk left to get the manager all the while mumbling about how she "hates this job".  The manager arrived, and was able to assist my wife in getting into the room she booked three months prior.

Upon reaching the room, she thought she would be able to soak in a bathtub to relax for a bit.  Nope.  No bathtub in the double queen rooms at this hotel, but that's not disclosed on the website.

As the account holder, I tried to reach the hotel to discuss my displeasure with the poor service and lack of amenities.   Each time I called the number listed on the website, it would ring give me a choice of extension, then ring the extension for 5 minutes before disconnecting.  It didn't matter which extension I chose, I got disconnected no less than 5 times.  

Then I attempted to contact Hilton customer service through the "Call Me" feature.  I waited on hold for over 30 minutes before someone answered the call.  Explained the situation, and was told they couldn't help, I would need to speak to an escalated group.  Waited on hold for another 15 minutes before that line was answered, went through the process of verifying my identity and Diamond status, explained what had happened at the hotel, and eventually was told "Sorry, but there's nothing we can do".

I'm a Hilton Diamond member, and this is how my guests were treated.  Imagine how poorly you'll be treated if you're not Diamond level.

Because of this experience, we will no longer use any Hilton property labeled "Garden Inn".  They're a joke, with a complete lack of hospitality.

title: RUIM
text: Hotel esta bem localizado, quarto muito pequeno para familia de 4 pessoas, fiquei 8 noites a limpeza e troca de toalhas foram feitos apenas em 2 vezes, vc que tem que pedir antecipado limpeza do quarto, cochao ruim faltou reposiçao de papel higienico, prudutos de higiene mais ou menos, recepçao antipatica, falta de alcool gel nos quartos, corredores  , enfim  nao recomendo pra familia

title: I Hate when hotels do this to guests...
text:
I've been a Gold/Diamond member for over 20 years, so it pains me to write negative reviews for Hilton brands.  Unfortunately, I have to;
- The location was ideal for us (room 1913 & 1914 this past weekend), with a decent view, and close enough to walk to Central Park, Times Square, and across the street from Stephen Colbert's theater
- The room was fine. Some signs of age, and small footprint, but overall acceptable.
- Lousy elevator situation. There are only three elevators in the hotel, and one was broken. Average time to get an elevator was 20 minutes, and once it took 30 minutes just to get to our room.
- The most distasteful part is that they notate the standard Hilton Garden Inn "Diamond member" benefit of $10 per person daily as an offset against charges at their restaurant. As a number of reviews illustrate, they don't seem to honor that benefit, which is just unacceptable and dishonest. I could have just called (likely argued up the management chain) and pursued the matter, but this fraudulent activity has to stop.
So if you do go to this hotel, expect long delays, OK rooms, and check your bill before leaving. To the folks at the HGE, I hope you enjoy the extra $40 on an overpriced hotel, and an even more overpriced restaurant.

title: Pierre was a life saver
text:
We couldn’t find a room in the city at 2:30am and Pierre hooked us up and really took great care of us - amazing customer service ! Late checkout and housekeeping accommodating - central location! Definitely will be back for more fun
!

title: Great hotel perfectly located with amazing front desk associates
text: This Hilton is perfectly located in west midtown NYC. I’ve stayed at this location while on business for over three months. After experiencing several other locations, I couldn’t imagine staying anywhere else. The hotels team of associates are without the best! Everyone makes every effort to ensure each guests feels at home while staying with them.

title: Cleaning every 4 days is unacceptable Don't blame COVID for bad service
text: Cleaning every 4 days is unacceptable Don't blame COVID for bad service. No complementary water available. Didn't get the $20 credit per day for food or restaurant. Overall is the worst Hilton experience I ever had.

title: Custo benefício bem ok.
text:
A localização, cama, banho,  quarto e café da manhã são ótimos!
 Entretanto as camareiras só passam nos quartos a cada cinco dias,  então vc chega da rua cansado e a cama está desarrumada e o cesto de lixo cheio. 
O hotel tb não disponibiliza taças de vidro ou acrílico  para emprestar aos hóspedes para tomar um vinho no quarto, tampouco abridor de garrafas. Tivemos que pedir para o restaurante abrir e tomar em copos descartaveis de café.

title: Great location and great employees
text: Had a great stay here . Rooms were clean , quick check in . Want to mention Alex and Jennifer at front desk who went above and beyond to make sure my stay was pleasant . Very good customer service , will definitely be returning .

title: Very poor do not stay here
text:
We had an awful experience over our Christmas break in NYC. We were not told on arrival the rooms would not be cleaned and only gleaned from towels being left outside other rooms that this was how we could get clean ones!  I would like to put to Hilton why rooms are not being cleaned when other hotels are???  When opening one of the draws in the room it fell off!  
The hotel was very dirty inside and outside of the rooms, the lobby was dirty and crowded.  Worse still in the middle of a pandemic staff were not enforcing the rule of 4 in a lift at all.  12 people were crammed into the lift we used one evening - we got out before our floor.  We had to do this 6 or 7 times during our stay.  One of the receptionist's was blowing gum whilst serving us.  None of them were wearing uniform.  Really unprofessional and lets the Hilton brand down severely.  
Breakfast, not even part of the hotel.  We booked breakfast there and I couldn't eat there as the hotel did not pass on my dietary requirements.  The breakfast we did see looked horrible, dried bacon, and unhealthy cereal. Not worth $20 which we had already paid. We had to spend another $200 on our trip to get breakfast elsewhere each day!!!
Overall, incredibly disappointing.  Won't be staying at another Hilton anywhere again!

title: Best spot reserved!
text: It's one of the most trusted, busiest and the most convenient boutique hotels in Midtown! It's casual and easy to deal with unlike the overly decorated luxurious hotels. You get the "inn" experience with the microwave, a common space laundry machine, refrigerator, shower, bed, desk and chair. Some rooms have the one person sofa or a balcony. I think it's good for business, too, despite the fact that it's gut the vibe of entertainment from Times Square neighborhood located in the south of this property. Very easy-going.

title: No corresponde mucho las fotos a la realidad
text:
Las fotos de las habitaciones parecen mucho mas modernas de lo que son en la realidad, necesita un lavado de cara.
En cuanto a la ubicacion esta muy bien situado y el restaurante un trato genial de Lina

title: Lençol sujo usado pelo último hóspede
text: O hotel fica muito bem localizado. Próximo aos principais pontos turísticos e a estação 7 ave do metro linha E. No entanto, constatei que as roupas de cama não haviam sido trocadas depois do último hóspede. Achei sugeira e muito cabelo e pelos do corpo. Fiquei enojada. O banheiro não tem desnível para o box o que causa uma molhadeira sem tamanho. Vira uma lagoa. Muito ruim.

title: Great location, awesome staff, great HGV value
text:
Excellent location close to Times Square. It was the perfect place to stay for NYE!!!

Note: We got a great deal via a Hilton Grand Vacations promotion. We did have to participate in a 2-hour presentation from the HGV team. Well worth the 2 hours to get this great deal!!!

Special callouts to: Jasmin, Dashanda, Abigail, John, Alex, and Harrison. They are excellent people. Very friendly. Very professional. Very patient. Very helpful. I would stay at this hotel again because of their awesomeness alone. They definitely made us feel like Diamond members.

title: Inexpensive for NYC, but there’s a reason for that
text: For the price, it was ok.  However, the room was small, drafty and cold (we visited in January) and the heat was really loud.  There were no cups in the room.  Desk staff was pleasant and efficient.  The Location is great.

title: Not the best hotel in the the area
text:
Wifi doesnt work, when i reported it, i was told
To keep on trying. It never worked after numerous attempts.
Lamp not working, he came tried to fix it and broke again. 
Carpet outside the door was filthy.
There was obstructed view and no free upgrade.
The credit was not sufficient.
Hilton Garden inn used to make breakfast
To order
Now its powdered eggs.

title: NYC Family Getaway
text: This HGI was average. Small rooms but great location and a good size gym. There is a restaurant adjoining the hotel, so you can order to your room. Staff was ok, rooms were clean but we had issues with room temperatures.

title: Great Location, Not a great value
text: The location was fantastic, close to everything midtown. The rooms are very small and not kept up well. Too bad, as they look like they were recently "modernized" but the stains in the carpet made me make sure I wore socks-all the time.

title: Fraco
text: Fraco, caro e não tem serviço de limpeza de quartos. Fiquei hospedado 4 dias. E não me limparam o quarto e nem me trocaram toalhas. Mesmo pedindo na recepção eles não o fizeram. Apenas disse que era de 5 em 5 dias. O que é péssimo para um hotel de 4 estrelas. Péssimo.  Pequeno almoço, ou café da manhã fraco com pouquíssimas variedades em produtos e caríssimo, com crianças pagar o mesmo preço de adulto. O que é ridículo. Meu filho de 4 anos pagou o mêsmo apenas por tomar um copo de leite e comer um pouco de ovos mexidos.

title: Centrale ma pessimo
text:
Location molto buona e la camera era abbastanza grande e confortevole, ma a parte questo pulizia della camera inesistente.
In una settimana di soggiorno la camera è stata pulita solo un giorno; il riscaldamento era ridicolo e faceva così tanto rumore che abbiamo dovuto spengerlo per dormire.
Il personale alla reception non era professionale, anche se ammetto che erano "ragazzi" gentili.
Nel complesso non lo consiglierei affatto

title: Great location and value
text: Give this hotel a look if you are planning for business or leisure travel in the Broadway area, or farther afield. I was teaching graduate school classes on the Upper West Side and this was very convenient via Uber, Taxi or Subway.

title: Average hotel visit
text: Reasonably good visit, but some fairly consistent pipes and hallway noise made for poor sleep. Poor elevator service as well, would strongly recommend a low floor number to use the stairs instead. Would have been a great value if not for the overall noise issues limiting sleep.

title: Cheating a guest after check out
text:
This hotel betrayed the trust with a guest and mischarge USD 535.99 after check out and never explain why. I emailed them but never getting back to me, and I am currently directly dispute with Hilton but it is very irritating to go through the process.

Ladies and gent, if you provide your credit card credentials, please make sure cancel your C/C upon checkout from this hotel

title: Please double check your final folio
text: You should strongly avoid to stay at this hotel. This hotel overcharged to my credit card upon check-out without any notification. I was totally freaked out when I got credit card statements after I got back to my country. I’ve sent email to this hotel several times yet there wasn’t any feedback for couple of months. Don’t you think it is kind of FRUAD?

title: Dont stay here
text:
Other than the location, I have nothing positive to say about this hotel. 

Firstly, the customer service was extremely poor, we were made to feel like an inconvenience. I understand there are COVID rules in place, however, the rooms are not serviced each day, unless asked for. However, when asking for some fresh coffee, bedsheets, and towels, they were simply left in a bag on the floor of your room and the coffee did not arrive. We stayed for 4 nights and ask for our bins to be emptied and the cupboard door, which fell off, to be repaired. None of this happened. 

The hotel and rooms were not maintained and appeared very well worn and run down.  Our bathroom door handle fell off, meaning the door would not shut. Again, after two requests for this to be repaired, this was not resolved. 
Unfortunately, my partner left some valuables in the room after departure and after many telephone calls and emails, not one member of staff has come back to us to confirm they have been located. 

Considering the price we paid for this hotel, I would strongly recommend you spend your money elsewhere.

title: Worst customer service ever!!!
text: Tried to cancel a reservation my 18 yr. old daughter and her 18 yr. old girlfriend had planned to visit NYC for five nights, but due to the recent surge in Covid-19 thought it not wise to go at this time. But the customer service reps I dealt with on multiple attempts(Expedia reps and Hilton reps)to cancel were time staking and excruciating to say the least and to no avail. They finally did what they are trained to do which is just to wear you down, where you just stop trying and let them keep the money. I do not know why people reserve through 3rd parties like Expedia it gives the Hilton the excuse to give you the runaround. Never again to Hilton or Expedia.

title: Thanks Hilton but this is going to be a One Night Stand
text:
The Hilton Garden Inn is a hotel that is certainly showing its years of service. From entering the lobby you are greeted with a respectable lobby but far from higher end Hilton properties. We were greeted by Victoria and quickly checked in and thanked for our loyalty as a Hilton member. We were provided our room keys and sent off to the elevators to ride to the 14th floor where we found our room. 

The elevators are old and could use a good cleaning. All three elevators rattle and feel a little unstable as you ride up or down. You have some doubts about the area you are in as you must scan your key card to make the elevator move and the evaluators are all video monitored (so keep it clean in there folks). 

Upon arriving to our floor we exited the elevator to a corridor that was well lit but just was in need of a good cleaning. The carpet had dirt around and the table outside the elevator appeared to have a small area where something spilled at some point. We entered the room through a heavy door and found a decent room that I considered large compared to some of the other New York hotels I have stayed in the past. This was a handicapped accessible room so that may have helped with this feeling larger. 

The room had a small bathroom with shower, toilet and sink. The rest of the room had a long “desk”, TV mounted to the wall, king sized bed, and a closet that housed the ironing board, Keurig brewer, mini-fridge and microwave. The TV has a dark band at the top of the screen that effected the viewing as well as the top drawer having an issue where someone pulled the face off and tried to stick it back on. In one of the drawers we found old shopping bags which really makes us feel that the room was not cleaned well. There is tape on the walls of the room as clues that there was a party at some point as well as fingerprints on the ceiling. The wall sockets are worn and plugs fall out if you are not careful. The bed is okay, but squeaks and is a little uncomfortable but not the worst. The sheets seem clean and were soft and comfortable. 

The bathroom needs a good cleaning and there is damage to the ceiling and mold in areas. The small shelf where you place the bath products while you shower was dirty and caked with soap of past guests. 

The building mechanical can be loud and at one point it seemed like a helicopter was overhead but it turned out to be something in the ceiling of the bathroom. At least this was during the day so it wasn’t too annoying.

The food pantry downstairs is a sad excuse for a “grab and go” store area. We opted to not use our loyalty credit there and will be asking for points instead as we check out.

Overall, the hotel serves its purpose as a budget hotel, but I would strongly suggest the Courtyard or Residence Inn next door as a alternative choice (yes they are Marriott and this is a Hilton property, sorry Hilton).

Thanks Hilton but we are only staying the one night.

title: PESIMA EXPERIENCIA, ME SIENTO ROBADA
text: La verdad es que el hotel esta en pésimas condiciones para el precio que tienen, empezando por su personal. Las mucamas no tenían mascarilla, y así se subían al elevador. Era un tramite de 30 a 40 min de espera para los elevadores, el cuarto ni digamos, no lo hacen todos los días por Covid pero en otros hoteles si lo hacen y de menor calidad que el Hilton Garden Inn. No tuvimos Wifi por 3 días, el snack bar horrible. El personal como que si era una obligación estar atendiendo. Para resumir el precio de las 8 noches contra todo lo que es el hotel NO LO VALE. Yo no recomendaría esto nunca, para ese precio mejor me voy a quedar al Plaza Hotel.

title: Hôtel très sale
text: Nous sommes rester 4 jours dans cette hôtel. Nous n’avons pas eu de ménage de fait pendant tous le séjour. Les poubelles et les serviettes sales sont laissés par terre dans les couloirs. Les chambres sont minuscules bruyantes ! Le personnel n’en a rien à faire Vraiment éviter cette hôtel ! Pour un 4 étoiles à ce tarif  nous nous sommes bien fait avoir.

title: Disappointing for a Hilton
text:
Booked via booking.com. Hotel did not pass on food allergy requirements to restaurant for breakfast. We had paid for this but had to eat elsewhere every morning. 

Despite Covid pandemic hotel didn't restrict numbers in lifts, we found ourselves getting out each day each time more than 4 people stipulated on signs inside the lift got in. We spent many a day waiting for lifts which was tiring.

On arrival we were not told that our room would not be cleaned and to leave dirty towels and rubbish outside our door the carpets in hallway were dirty for all the time we were there and toilet dirty on arrival.

None of the hotel staff were wearing uniform and one of the receptionists was chewing gum and blowing bubbles which was pretty off putting. 

The lack of professionalism and reinforcement of Covid restrictions was frankly appalling. Do not stay at this hotel. It is not the Hilton you would expect.

title: Awful Elevator Situation
text: Room was clean. There was a constant line of 10-20 guests in the lobby waiting for an elevator. Signs indicate that you should plan for "peak times" - there are only 2 working elevators in this hotel of 30 floors, each with a capacity of 4 people. Add 20-30 mins each time you plan to leave your room or return from anywhere. No housekeeping occurred during our stay (Probably because they couldn't access the elevators). Would not stay here again. Plenty of other options in NYC in this neighborhood without the inconvenience of a long wait and then being stuffed into an elevator during a pandemic.

title: Terrible...DO NOT STAY HERE
text:
The only benefit of this hotel is it's location.  Everything else is absolutely terrible. I am not even sure where to start:

1 - Housekeeping - Covid is used as an excuse to not replace towels, replenish coffee or amenities in the room unless "it is requested".
