We requested this and all that happened were a bag of towels were thrown on the floor in our room. The room was not cleaned for the duration of our stay despite a request and nothing was replenished (tea/coffee) etc. Covid is not an excuse to make guests stay in dirty rooms! They seem to be able to clean the rooms at other hotels we have stayed at in the last three years!

2 - Rooms are Tired - The bathroom door and a drawer were broken in our room. Despite reporting this to the front desk nobody fixed either of these problems during our stay! As well as this the door had been painted but someone hadn't even bothered to paint it all the way to the edges.

3 - Staff - The staff always make you feel like it is an effort to help you and are completely clueless. I've experienced better customer service in the former Soviet Union!

4 - Customer Service - Finally, the customer service from both the hotel and HiIton is none existent. I left a couple of items in a drawer by accident and have been trying to reach the hotel for over a week. All I need is confirmation they have not been found so I can claim on my insurance. I haven't been able to actually speak to anyone at the hotel who can help me and I am just fobbed off by anyone I do speak to. Given the reviews on this page and the lack of management responses I don't think they actually care about their customers.

In summary I would avoid this place at all costs, everything is sub-standard and certainly does not reflect the room rates charged!

title: Hotel is dirty
text:
During our 5 nights stay , no one cleans the room . The hallway and elevator is dirty and smelly . Covid should not be a reason to not clean the room for 5 nights or not ask us if we need a towel . Putting our  trash outside started during Covid coz no one pick up the trash or clean the room on your entire stay . They even cut down the housekeepers now to probably one a day or two . They don’t even clean the hallways or elevator anymore . 

In Europe , hotels rooms get cleaned everyday when you’re not around with their mask on  during Covid I don’t understand why hotel like this in NYC don’t do the same . I don’t understand why this is the reason to not clean the hotel room at all during Covid . The house keepers can wear mask and clean the room . That should be a problem

title: Sub- standard For HGI
text:
Disappointed in this sub- standard Hilton Garden Inn. Shabby lobby area, very crowded, inadequate help and services like luggage storage. Rooms were not well maintained with several outlets not working , refrigerator not working and microwave broken. Took repeated requests to get refrigerator replaced. 
Convenient location but not up to usual Hilton standards

title: Close to Carnegie Hall
text: Front desk and bellman very friendly and professional. Rooms are clean and good place to stay. Close to Carnegie Hall, night show with Steven Colbert, and close to the subway. Restaurants close by for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Buffet breakfast has very limited options but maybe due to COVID. Better to go elsewhere for breakfast until post COVID. Only downfall is the wait for the elevator. Allow time for the elevator. Only 3 elevators.

title: Felt like I stayed in a 3rd world country hotel
text:
omg I have a list of complaints about this hotel!
- no room cleaning at all
- $3 for water in room
- my shoes were sticking to the floor; that’s how dirty
- elevators running all night next to my ear
- electric shocks in water from the sink
- guest service never picks up, only once and even hung up on me 
- bad internet WiFi
- my emailed complaint to Hilton honors never got answered
- takes 15 minutes wait for the elevator (up and down)
- if you want clean towels, coffee tabs or shampoo, you need to go to reception to ask (as nobody picks up the phone)
It felt like we ended in a 3rd world hotel… is this really Hilton???”

title: Small and bare necessities
text: Room was crowded and small, hard to get any requests addressed from the front desk and the breakfast was NOT your typical HGI breakfast. Location is nice between the park and the theatre area plus Rockefeller Center.

title: Superb attention to by management
text: I travel a lot for work and leisure so I have plenty of experience when it comes to hotel stays. Without exaggerating, may I commend the level of professionalism Ms. Veronica, a manager at Hilton Garden Inn, displayed. Her eagerness to deliver superb customer service is unparalleled. She addressed my concerns with a level of detail that is rare and made me feel welcome. Veronica's attention to detail is amazing and very on-brand with Hilton.

title: A eviter
text:
Alors pour commencer, la chambre à été nettoyée une
seule fois pendant la semaine, c'est inadmissible, les
serviettes changées une seule fois également.
La propreté de l'hôtel laisse à désirée pour ce
standing, l'attente aux ascenseurs jusqu'à 20 minutes
parce qu'il n'y en a que 3 pour tout l'hôtel et ses 30
étages.
Nous avons retrouvé une punaise sur le rideau de la
chambre !!! Le café : 2 dosettes tous les 4 jours, les
bouteilles d'eau à 3$ . Bref nous ne reviendrons plus
jamais dans cet établissement, ni aucun de la chaîne
d'ailleurs.

title: Nice place
text:
Had a nice stay and all was pleasant and clean.
Staff at checking/out was pleasant and helpful.
Too bad there was no food service, would have been good to have a “grab and go” breakfast.
We’ve stayed here before and will again in the future.

title: Great visit to the Big Apple
text: From the moment we entered the lobby to the time of our departure we felt comfortable and wry, very safe and well looked after by the entire team of Hilton staff Members. I can not think of anything else that we wanted or needed

title: Disappointing
text: I stayed in this hotel For a weekend during Christmas season.  There was a flashing light I. The room that did not stop all night. Room w as no t cleaned nor was it communicated that it would not be cleaned unless it WBA’s requested.the elevator was so slow we took the stairs more than using elevator from 12th floor

title: Great location
text: Great location! It’s very close to just about everything! Room was decent! We were told upon check-in that there is no housekeeping services for any stay less than five days which I was OK with! I have no problem with that because there were plenty of towels and I’m not a drama queen. I am a Hilton diamond member and my only frustration with them is that they don’t answer the phone when you call guest services it just rings forever. I had to call in from the outside from their website in order to get someone at the front desk to ask about a late check out.  Room size decent and clean. The elevators some times take a while to get to your floor which is frustrating. However over all I would consider staying here again.

title: Quick overnight for Broadway Shpw and Shopping
text: All I learned about the hotel upon arriving was that our customer rep was getting off in 2 minutes. No information on amenities, the area, housekeeping services, in house restaurant...nothing. I had to ask her if she had all she needed as we were just left standing there waiting for her to say her line. Water in the room is $3.00 per bottle, Why do they have a coffee maker in the room with not enough supplies? The room itself was okay for the amount of hours spent in it but the bed was uncomfortable, the sheets were stained (clean but obvious stains), they had holes in them and needed replacing and the sheets were not secure to the mattress. There were no extra pillows or a blanket in the closet. We noticed the tv had dark spots in the picture and will need to be replaced.

title: Like sleeping in the street
text:
Couldn’t be worse.  Dirty and disgusting.
The carpets on the floor have never been cleaned. I’m almost sure the rooms aren’t cleaned.
The manager on duty 12/10/21 has a miserable attitude like he is doing you a favor by having you as a guest at this flee-bag.  There were no towels in the room and when I asked how that could happen his response was I guess we missed that without any shame. Thermostat didn’t work as well as refrigerator and the mattress was awful. Towels that we eventually got had holes.Do you self a favor stay anywhere else. Even cardboard box on the street would be better.
I have included pictures of the ripped towels in the dirty floor in the elevator with garbage.

title: Schlimmster Hotelaufenthalt
text: Dreckige mit Kot und Blut verschmierte Laken und Bettdecken. Überall Staub und alles war klebrig. Personal ist am Empfang mit FaceTime Telefonie und mit dem Senden privater Nachrichten auf Sozialen Medien beschäftigt. Reinigung der Zimmer wird nur alle 5 Tage gemacht und falls Hygieneartikel, wie Toilettenpapier fehlen, muss man regelrecht dafür kämpfen solche zu bekommen.

title: Hazte tú la cama y límpiate
text: El hotel nada más llegar nos dice que no hay servicio de habitaciones y que no nos hará la cama, lo que tampoco nos dijo es que no nos limpiaría ni habitación ni baño en lis seis días que estaríamos alojados. Además que si necesitamos toallas las pudiéramos en recepción, así como los productos de aseo, tenías que andar pidiendo toallas y geles todo ellos dias. Está sucio en sus zonas comunes. El aire hace mucho ruido y tampoco es que funcione muy bien

title: La peggiore esperienza di viaggio della mia vita
text:
È stata la peggiore esperienza di viaggio della mia vita, tanto da aver deciso di agire in giudizio per il risarcimento del danno da vacanza rovinata.
Troppe sorprese negative: stanza piena di polvere, pulizia della camera e cambio tovaglie una volta a settimana, colazione pagata e non garantita con le stesse modalità tutti i giorni; cassaforte non funzionante e riparata solo il quarto giorno; disservizi vari e difficoltà ad interloquire con il personale e con il servizio clienti di Expedia (che si vantava di aver ottenuto chissà quali risultati, ma niente di significativo)
Mai più metterò piede in un hotel di questa catena, neanche gratis. E sono molto deluso anche da Expedia.

title: Muy malo
text: No hubo housekeeping! El desayuno muy básico. La calefacción se encendía al lado de mi almohada desperté cada vez ! Esperamos excesivamente el ascensor hasta la habitación. Relación precio calidad pésima.

title: Horrible Stay - Freezing Cold & Dirty
text:
I booked one night at this Hilton Garden Inn due to an unexpected extension of my NYC trip.  The room was actually well portioned for a midtown NYC hotel, but everything else from the first second to the last second was just horrible:

1. No room was available at the 4pm check-in time and I had to wait for an hour.

2. I asked the front desk staff to add my Hilton Honors number to my booking; he seemed annoyed and told me that there is no benefit to add the HH# since I made the reservation on Expedia.  When I finally got to the room, I was prompted to join Hilton Honors before I could use the complementary wifi.

3. I stayed on the 19th floor and the entire floor was freezing cold - you could feel the chill the moment you step out of the elevator.  The heating system in the room was super loud but only blows lukewarm or cold air.  The outside temperature dropped to 32F the night I stayed and the room was just freezing; the bathroom was even worse - standing on the tiled floor felt like standing on ice.  

4. Bedding looked dirty.  There were even a few black hair on the sheet, which was disgusting.  

5. The bathroom sink was clogged.

6. The bathroom has a sliding door but does not close all the way - leaves a one-inch wide gap.  Didn't bother me too much but it would be a pain if you were sharing a room with a friend.

title: NO LO VOLVERÍA A ELEGIR
text:
El hotel tiene buena ubicación (pero hay muchos con mejor ubicación al mismo precio). El servicio, como en casi todo NY, es amable normal. La
habitación tenía microondas, refrigerador pequeño y cafetera. Las habitaciones son muuuuy muuuuy pequeñas. 
Tal vez cualquiera de los dos hoteles que están al lado sean mejores.

title: Worst Hotel ever
text: This was by far the worst hotel I've been in NYC. Wrote an email 15 days before check in asking about packages handling fees, since I had some Amazon orders delivered to the hotel during my stay.. never got an answer. They assured me Amazon never delivered but in fact they handed to another person who contacted me days after I left the hotel. Surprise??? They charged me 50 USD for handling!!!! We were here for 5 days and no one from housekeeping took care of the room during the entire stay.. unbelievable!!!

title: Lack of Basic Cleanliness!
text: HH member for many years & never had a bad experience, yet this is the second terrible experience with Hilton in a month.  I asked when our room would be cleaned and was told after our 5th night.  We requested the 3rd/4th night and we were told that it had to be  5th night.  Stayed 6 nights and our room was NEVER cleaned!!! This is just not acceptable!. If the restaurants in NYC can staff, prepare food, and serve to the public, it does not make sense that hotel rooms can’t be cleaned the way they used to be. When on vacation, we don’t want to worry about hair on the floor, trash, dirty bedding and dirty toilets. We don’t live this way at home and it totally ruins the vacation experience to have to deal with this while on vacation. In the morning and evenings, we tried to request towels, toiletries, coffee, trash takeout at the front desk. Sometimes we were not able to put in our request because the front desk was busy & we didn’t have time to wait. On those days, we tried calling the front desk but NO ONE ever answered. Twice we had to call HHonors and they connected us to the front desk. Both times we were calling to get FRESH towels and trash service. The 1st time we requested towels, we returned our dirty towels but we didn’t get a complete set of towels in return. One time we got 4 bath towels (no face, hand or bath mat). We had to use one of the bath towels as a face and hand towel and the other bath towel as a floor mat. The 2nd time it took 2 hours to get towels and even though we asked for a complete set of towels we only got 2 towels. But that is not the worst part, the towels we received were of poor quality, wrinkled, and crumpled in a plastic laundry bag! Due to the lack of basic services we spent a significant amount of time during our vacation communicating with the front desk about the lack of basic services. We have been loyal to Hilton for many years but we have been very disappointed recently. We will consider Hyatt/Marriott for our next vacation!

title: Recent visit to Manhattan
text: I have stayed at Hilton Hotels in most major cities in USA as well as in Asia and Europe over the past 30+ years. I have also stayed at  several Hilton hotels in Manhattan in the past. However, the Hilton Garden Inn experience is not what I would have expected from a Hilton branded hotel, which are generally top of the line.

title: Bad service overall
text:
No service and when asked for it, the employees in the hotel were angry to provide for it

I will. Not recommend this hotel.

I understand that the pandemic is creating challenges for all but respect and courtesy have to be a minimum

title: Terrible Experience - Don't Do It
text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel and would not recommend it to anyone. I am a Hilton Honors member and have stayed at many Hilton properties and can say this is the worst. The staff is not at all helpful and not friendly at all to talk to. The room is very small and if you pay extra for a city view then that means you will be on floor 24 and above but don't expect a view. They do not tell you in advance but room service is every five days.  If you call the front desk for service the phone rings and rings and no one picks up. That's when your pissed off and head for the elevator.  The wait for the elevator is an experience in its self. Pack a snack because you wait for ever. I will never stay at this place again and would recommend you do not either.

title: Anniversary stay
text:
This hotel was OK if you’re on a budget and want to stay close to Times Square which is what we liked a lot.  There are lots of restaurants around, I highly recommend Redeye Grill on 56th Street and 6th Ave where they have a great weekday pre-fixe 3 course lunch for $39.  The rooms were tight and the AC and heater were noisy and would wake you up. 

Usually when staying in any Hilton chain hotels the breakfast is usually included but not in this hotel which was disappointing.

title: Great location, but that's it.
text:
1. We stayed for four nights and there’s no house keeping.  When I checked in, there was no explanation.  When I called on the reception on the day 2, I was told that there would be no housekeeping due to the shortage of the housekeeper.  I had never experienced at any hotel that there was no house keeper for four nights stay.  Even though they don't provide the housekeeping service, the room was not ready at 3pm, and we had to wait for 30 more minutes.
2.  Even though there was wifi, there was very unstable and basically I couldn’t use wifi.
3. This is a small and tall hotel.  There are ice machines on 7, 12, 18, 24 and 30.  None of them were working!!!  When I told a front desk staff, he told me that the 7th floor one was working, but I don’t know when.
4.  There was a pair of sunglasses forgotten in the safe from the previous customer.  Obviously the housekeeper didn’t check it.

If you need a great location, it is great.  But, do not expect too much.

title: Don't stay at Central Park Hilton Garden Inn
text:
I've stayed at 2 Midtown Hilton Garden Inns and have had such good experiences that I thought I'd try this one near Central park. What a mistake.. I will never stay at a Hilton Garden Inn in NYC again.

I understand we are still suffering from COVID and staff is limited but this hotel plain doesn't care.  No cleaning for 5 days and they claim it's because of COVID. Really? If staff cleans rooms in between guests it's not COVID - it's staffing limitations !  On day 3 we called front desk and housekeeping about5 times and finally reached someone who promised us towels... nothing.  Out of tissue and toilet paper- called and called and finally reached someone who promised in 20 minutes.  Nothing. 

I sleep anywhere and have travelled all over the world.  These beds were so bad (bed in a box latex without box spring) that both my husband and I were rolling off the sides of bed ! and we are not big people. 

In the end we checked out 3 days early and went to a luxury hotel where they cleaned rooms daily.   

The staff was on their iPhones when you arrived to ask questions.  
They plain don't care about you.

When I returned a day later because I forgot something in the room.  I waited by the front desk for an hour. As I waited I heard one customer after another with the same complaints as me.  

Buyer beware this is a great location but don't ruin your vacation by staying here. They plain just don't care.

title: Excelente hotel
text:
El hotel excelente, la habitación muy amplia y cómoda, el desayuno maravilloso y la ubicación maravillosa.
El servicio de limpieza se realiza cada 5 días eso debería ser diario, pero en general muy limpio todo

title: Great neighborhood location
text: Near shopping, dining and transit. Not quite as busy an area as near Times Square, but every bit as convenient. Guests should expect an older building with slow elevators and poor internet access. In exchange, you have convenient access to coffee, restaurants and food shopping, as well as subway. Walking distance to Central Park.

title: Disappointed
text:
Room not serviced in 4 days. Ran out of cups and shampoo. Trash not picked up. Towels not replenished.
Thermostat in accurate.Phone to guest services not answered. Too several attempts to reach front desk

title: Rude staff, not clean, elevators take forever
text:
Elevators at the hotel takes forever - it would take at least 10 minutes for me to get from the lobby to my room because it was always packed.

Rooms were not even that clean. I came in upon check in and found hair on the pillow. And for future guests staying - keep in mind they only clean your room after the fifth day of your stay. 

Staffs at check in counter are rude, lazy and they don’t even bother to help you. They don’t respond to requests, pick up the guest services line or even reply to my text.

Save yourself the time, some inner peace and don’t stay at this hotel. You’re in NYC, there are plenty of other hotels. Don’t be stupid like me. Don’t stay here.

title: Poor Customer Service
text: AFTER checking in, we were told that "due to Covid" there would be no housekeeping and if we needed towels or anything, to let them know.  We stayed SIX NIGHTS and did request towels once.  My thought was they should have given us a discount "due to Covid."

title: Beware of Smokers Fee Even if You Don’t Smoke
text: Location, cleanliness & Staff were great. However after checkout I realized there was a $250 smokers fee on the bill. When questioned I was told housekeeping goes through the garbage & if they find anything smoking related they will charge regardless. So if you are cleaning out pockets or a bag and happen use their trash can to throw it away they charge you. Currently battling for refund.

title: Worst Hilton Ever
text: We booked four nights as a birthday celebration in NYC; checked out after two nights. How is this a Hilton? Filthy rugs in room and halls; sheets and pillows felt unwashed. The air vent in the bathroom was clogged with dirt, looks like it was never cleaned. Furniture was chipped and breaking, desk chair had obvious spills never cleaned up.  Elevators inefficient and can't handle the traffic. We went to great effort to book a room advertised with an outdoor "terrace" which the photos show as larger than the room, and surrounded by greenery, so we could have friends join us for a birthday gathering, We were given a different terrace, so dirty we couldn't use it, tiny and no greenery, totally different than photo.Our room was situated between two elevators, noisy and felt awful going and coming, surrounded by people waiting for elevator. Front desk didn't answer phone, we asked for refill for coffee machine in person but never got what we requested. We salvaged our trip by checking out early and going to the Marriott a few doors down, which was like going from hell to heaven. Beautiful clean room, great service. We've always used our Hilton Honors account for travel, complained and got back the charge for early checkout by going through Hilton's customer service.  How this hotel is a Hilton is a mystery, do not be fooled, it's a mess.

title: Great central location
text: The hotel was very central to everything you would want to do in New York! The room was clean but a little bit small but that was expected in NY. I would recommend this location and would stay there again.

title: Good location.  But very very limited housekeeping even on request.
text: Hotel is in a good location.  Accommodations were ok.  But good luck if you want any housekeeping even on request.  While I understand due to the pandemic housekeeping services are limited, to every 4th day, but to my understanding across all the Hilton brands other than their luxury brands, housekeeping service can be requested for more frequently.  Apparently not at this property.   Now I don’t need the linens changed but I like at least everyday the room freshen up (change out the towels, take out the trash, make the bed). Hey I’m paying for it anyway. Well this property doesn’t do it even on request.  And was pulling teeth to come in every other day.  Again I understand the limited service and that should be an option to each guest if they don’t want the daily service fine, but when a brand has a policy that it can be requested and you don’t do it, now that’s a different issue.

title: Servicios demasiado limitados
text: Tarifa muy elevada. Muy poca limpieza y servicios. Te piden el carnet de vacunacion COVID para acceder al desayuno cada mañana (pasé 10 dias en el hotel con desayuno incluido). Servicios muy reducidos aduciendo restricciones por COVID. Mala conexión de internet. Solo destacar que todo el personal fue amable y atento. Y funciona bien la app del Hhonors.

title: Good location-Poor Service
text: This hotel is in convenient location for business and leisure. The service is lacking. This was our second stay and it seems the service is declining. We were not informed of service options, the room was not cleaned well and we were not advised we could opt out of room service. Will look at alternative property in the future.

title: Such a bad experience!!
text: Terrible service, the room was dirty and old. We asked for the room to be cleaned 3 days in a row and they just didn't care, they did not clean the room in our whole stay (7 days). Staff was rude. I don't recommend staying here! Wifi does not work well, elevators are not sufficient for the amount of people. Room phone does not work if you want to call front desk! Look for Park central hotel...' much better.

title: Well located and reasonably priced: let's see if service improves after Covid ..
text: This Garden Inn provides an extremely well located and reasonably priced (for NY) location in the city, just off Broadway, on the edge of Hells Kitchen for great eats, and a quick jog from Central Park (to work off those calories).  Rooms are spacious and comfortable. And it hosts a convenient bar and restaurant with good patio seating right on the street.  The one regular  issue is the elevators .. only two (of 3) seemed to be working when we were there, and waits could be interminable. Having stayed before we know to take a low floor room so we could go by the stairs (8 floors, mind you)- be warned.  One reason we stay in Garden Inns is that they have the best breakfast in the Hilton chain (a big plus for Diamonds) … but this one was not providing it, supposedly because of Covid.  Seems a lame excuse when you have a patio area, and could presumably seat the vaccinated inside, no problem.  Looks like cost-saving to me.  Similarly with housekeeping: Covid is the excuse for no service, garbage piling up and no express checkout.  Really?

title: NY 2 nights stay
text: Poor internet connection. No trash bags so my trash piled up. I called guest service fir my entire trip and couldn’t get a hold of anyone. No one showed up to clean my room. Elevator were slow. Overall dissatisfied

title: טוב
text: מיקום מרכזי מאוד קרוב לכל, חדר גדול מכונת קפה מגהץ חבל שלא ניקו את החדרים כל יום רק אחרי 10 ימים ניקו וחייבו אותנו 6 $ על 2 בקבוקי שתיה שלא שתינו שירות קבלה טוב מלון בסבירות טובה ממוקם ליד הטיימס סקוור כיכר קולובוס והשדרה ה 5

title: Do not stay here!
text: I checked in early morning after a red eye flight. I checked out later that day after booking at the W Union Square. Hotel is dirty, open trash bags left in hallways next to elevator, dirty sheets and linens, leaking refrigerators flooding rooms, even on non-peak hours the elevators can take 10-15 min.  Colleague had a leaky refrigerator flooding room floors and while in the lobby I overheard 2 different people complaining about leaky refrigerators + 1 person complaining about dirty sheets. I can say, without hyperbole, this hotel is disgusting, not well maintained, and an embarrassment to the Hilton brand. I’ve decided to move my Diamond Hilton status over to Marriott/Bon Voy based on this experience.

title: Только расположение.
text: Отель не стоит своих денег. Из плюсов только отличное расположение. Грязные полотенца. Старое покрывало. Плохой wifi. Негде перекусить в самом отеле. Персонал не особо приветлив. Душ тесный и неудобно выходить (полным людям не рекомендую).

title: Horrible dirty hotel-expected better from Hilron
text: The hotel was very dirty. The carpet looked like it had not been cleaned for years. The rooms were super tiny. Motel 6 would have been better. No joke. The staff was ok. The maintenance people and cleaning staff were good.  My friend reserved this room and I paid half. They charged both our credit cards!  I will NEVER be staying here. The street is cleaner. Lol

title: Good location, meh everything else
text: Rather unimpressed. The room itself was okay and the location good, but a lot of negatives came with it. For one, our room was never cleaned over the three nights we were there. We left around 9:30am each day and were disappointed to return to dirty towels on the floor and our trash pile still standing tall. The sliding bathroom door didn't close all the way so this couple was forced to do our business with a two inch door crack out to the room. The room was inexplicably moist, such that every morning I'd have to wipe the condensation off my phone. And as others have said, the elevator situation was rough (very long waits sometimes - useless social distancing guidelines but no mask protocol). For over $300 a night I would expect much better.

title: Serviceable, But Well Below Average for Class
text:
The positive - the room was clean and modern.

The negative - only three elevators for ~35 floors, often meaning a 5 to 10 minute wait.  Any "4 aboard" Covid restrictions (and those signs were still posted in the elevators) were obviously a joke with those numbers, as any available elevator was always packed shoulder to shoulder.  Ice machine on our floor was broken, and the sign didn't look recent.  No hot breakfast available, just freezer burned frozen generic breakfast sandwiches.  Pre-selected room not ready by posted 3 pm check-in.  The replacement room (corner room ending in "01") had no closet, no place to hang clothes, and no hangars, which seems odd for a NYC business class hotel.   If that was the best alternate they had to offer, then clearly Diamond status didn't mean much either.  Wi--fi certificates were outdated, making wi-fi unusable without being a security risk.  

We've stayed in at least a dozen Hilton properties in NYC.  This was towards the bottom 1 or 2.  While serviceable and the room itself was mostly fine (other than the no closet or place to hang clothes part), we expect better.

title: Rude staff
text: Parking manager was very rude and said he did not work at the hotel when he had his black collard Hilton Garden Inn shirt on. Later encountered him at the front counter where he gave me a hard time about my gift shop/snack shop voucher.

title: Bad service
text: Service is very bad; location is very good but cleanliness is average. Hotel is not recomended. I stay 10 days and the quality is not a Hilton hotel. The staff of the hotel has bad attitude and the cleanliness is bad also.

title: Disappointed!
text:
Is there a lake to post a survey for this location?

Out of the 30 or so Hilton's I stayed at over the past 24 months, this one could use some help. 

Tried to explain some of the issues to the manager over the phone, he seemed annoyed and eventually hung up on me.  

It was a courtesy call to voice my complaints over the phone directly, rather than posting them on the Internet.

Dirty toilet, cigarette burn on bedspread.

title: Rude staff
text: There are many hotels in this area, even on the same block. Do not stay here. Staff is aggressive, condescending and rude.  Stay at the Marriott next door. This hotel is in serious need of customer service training or at least basic human decency.

title: Hilton
text: My room was the biggest problem with my stay here. I had hair and stains on my sheets, there was blood on the walls, bugs in the shower drains and on the shower curtains, and the place just did not feel clean in general. Cleanliness is not their number one priority and it is falsely advertised.

title: Lack of customer service in this hotel
text: During our stay we attempt to call the front desk with no luck whatsoever, I had to come down to the desk to express the needs of bathroom towels or paper. Elevators where a disaster, you had to literally wait 15-20 minutes to get on one. Rude personnel at front desk.

title: Elevator problems, no covid friendly
text: The elevator did not work well, waiting 20 minutes to get down, not covid friendly 12 people in the elevator.. the hotel has a good location but not good service. From 9 nights only 1 day came the hotel to clean the room. Disappointed

title: Moldy bathroom, dirty towels, rude & inattentive staff, lacking amenities, 20minute elevator waits
text:
Worst Hilton Garden Inn experience ever. 

Wasn’t expecting much from this hotel other than basic accommodations when my husband booked it for me when I was stranded in NYC for an extra day due to flights canceled because of a hurricane at home. He called and explained he’d booked the room on his HiltonHonors account with his credit card and added my name to the reservation and confirmed I could check in and get the room keys without his card. 

Upon arrival, the woman working at the front desk staff refused to allow me to check in despite their  earlier assurances. I was a stranded traveler and instead of treating me with a modicum of kindness, she was incredibly rude and dismissive. I was finally able to get a digital key on my phone using my husband’s HH account. After that, a different employee allowed me to have a room key-important later on. 

A little before 11PM, I went downstairs to pick up food from a delivery service and when I returned to my room, neither the digital key nor the key card worked. I went back downstairs and explained the lock was not working and the guy working told me he couldn’t control my phone malfunctioning 🙄 He reprogrammed the key card but it didn’t work when I went back up. Back downstairs and he finally sent maintenance to my room with assurances he’d let me know when it was fixed. An hour later I was still sitting in the lobby, freezing, being subjected to his expletive filled rap playlist. He’d forgotten I was there. The door lock had been fixed at some point. 

The next morning I called for a 1PM checkout. It took two calls (hung up on once) and 22 minutes on hold for someone to pick up the phone. 

The cleaning staff will commander ALL the elevators so expect 20 minute waits to go downstairs. They will also cram cleaning carts and linen carts into elevator cars when there is clearly NOT enough space for them. 

Someone else’s hair was embedded in the bath towel when I unrolled it. Gross. Mold in several places in the shower that could have easily been cleaned with minimal effort. 

There are several other reasonably priced Hilton properties in the area, even within a few blocks. Do yourself a favor and choose one of them and not this place.

title: Disaster
text:
Probably one of the worst hotel experiences ever. 3 elevators; 30 story hotel; one elevator completely out going on 4 days now; 2nd elevator also went out Friday and today. If you enjoy waiting 25-30 minutes to get to the lobby or get up to your room, we’ll then this is the hotel for you! In addition to the elevators being out and management having no empathy or plan to deal with it, there is no service elevator. So imagine 20 people waiting on the lobby for 25 minutes, or waiting on your floor for 25 minutes, with one elevator working and the cleaning crew trying to do their jobs but taking up 1/2 the space in the one elevator.

This was an absolute disaster of a stay; I’m a Diamond member and I will never stay at this hotel again.

Shame on Hilton for not having a plan to deal with this…..

title: Nice, safe decent hotel
text: This hotel is in a great location if you plan to spend time in the upper west side and like walking around.  The hotel is clean and the staff were all friendly and professional, and we felt safe at all times.  I give it three rather than four or five stars for two reasons.  First, the elevators are just too small and slow to comfortably handle the foot traffic.  We were on a lower floor and just took the stairs rather than wait.  Second, for whatever reason, the bathroom in our room had a sliding door rather than a door that shuts, and it was set about a half inch or so from the doorway, so that even when slid shut you could see out through the slight gap, just as others could see in.  The gap (and no fan) also meant no sound privacy.    In a room where we were three adults, I just found it to be an unnecessary inconvenience.

title: Don’t buy the breakfast package
text: No breakfast as restaurant closed. Terrible frozen biscuit given instead at the “shop”. Just awful. No staff around to complain and checkout takes so long that you don’t have the energy to complain anymore

title: Worst Hilton I ever stayed in the last 20 years
text: Worst Hilton I ever stayed in the last 20 years. Facilities were not cleaned and only clean your rooms if you stay more than 5 nights….Please choose other hotel and avoid the “pain” to stay here. Management does not care of Hilton company policies

title: Just avoid
text: While not the worst hotel stay ever, it was pretty bad. We reserved two queens but were given two doubles. The bathroom was dirty. No towels were provided, and it took a very long time and multiple efforts to get them. Employees were not especially friendly. The rooms are very small, even for the city. If you want to be between the Park and Times Square, the location is good, but I cannot recommend the hotel in any other way.

title: Great experience
text: Went on a friends trip and the location of this hotel was ideal. Not too noisy at night. Had a fitness center available. Everyone was friendly. Many restaurants were in walking distance of this hotel which was super nice.

title: Horrible Experience
text: Great location and that was the only great thing about this place. Extremely short staffed and the staff that are there are extremely angry and miserable. The elevators are slow, nobody answered the front desk phone the entire seven days we were there, and we arrived to a dirty room.  They dirty, I mean someone’s underwear left on the floor and some kind of body fluid smeared on the nightstand. Even when you request towels and coffee you don’t get them and I was really surprised this was a Hilton. I’ve had better experiences at motels along the highway.

title: Don't recommend this one
text:
Not clean filthy 
Bad manger
Small room
Busy elevators 
Noisy 
I don't recommend this hotel 
Location was good though 
................................................................ sometimes the manger might become crazy and shout at phone asking about reservation
......
.........
.........
.......
.......................

title: Great value in the heart of Midtown
text: Great location so close to theatre district, Times Square, Central Park and an incredible selection of restaurants. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We chose a Junior Suite and were very satisfied with the room….truly a great value compared to other hotels we checked

title: Don’t waste your money
text: Rooms too small, no housekeeping and no breakfast.  Information on website not correct.  People at front desk not very helpful.   I would NOT book this hotel.  The only good part about the hotel is the location but there are many hotels nearby.

title: Family
text: The front desk person who works in the morning are the worst ever.  I have stayed many hotels in the past and this front desk gentleman who works in the morning who wouldn't even give me his name was the worst experience ever.  Rooms are small but expected in NY.  Room was clean however, the elevators took forever during peak time.  I would not stay here just because of the customer service.  Just plainly rude.  Worst ever.

title: Do not stay there!
text:
The HILTON GARDEN INN CENTRAL PARK SOUTH was totally below our expectations. 
The lobby was dirty, they did not clean the rooms during the 5 nights we stayed there at all!
There was a homeless man who knocked at our door asking if we were checking out so he could come in…. Just picture that!
Never again!

title: Habitación cómoda limpia y buena atencion
text: Buena habitación, buena atención y la mejor ubicación, el personal siempre está dispuesto a ayudar, solamente algo complejo el servicio de desayuno. Pero por lo demás muy bueno, aún estoy pendiente a que resuelvan un problema con mi recibo pero espero se resuelva

title: Chair stained and no hot breakfast
text:
Chair in the room was stained with something that could be gum or something else… in either case disgusting, there is no hot breakfast (they gave me 20 usd voucher to buy from their convenience store, but just snacks)… first night they didn t put enough towels for my wife and I (only one towel), and in general staff treatment was just transactional… not unkind not rude but not warm either

Only positive is the location, great location

I guess I had super high expectations as I always choose Hilton, and compare to Hilton Mexico Santa Fe and Hilton Garden Inn Costa Rica…. A whole different level and I was expecting the same standards

title: Do NOT stay at this hotel
text:
I had a terrible experience at this hotel last month, when I stayed for 1 week. I would absolutely never recommend anyone to stay there. I've never regretted booking a hotel so much before.
It was awful in so many ways that I'm doing something I always avoid - bad reviews.

Some of the points that have deeply disappointed me:
- They don't clean the room during your stay: and if you have to ask for something, know that you'll have to ask more than 3 times to, perhaps, be answered.
- The elevators can't handle the number of hotel guests: you'll waste precious time that you could use to explore NYC while waiting for the elevator. At least 30 min each time.
- They will try hard to overcharge you: they tried to overcharge me and then double charge what I had already paid.
- The staff, including the manager (Robert Matarazzo), are unprepared/untrained: expect to waste a lot of time every time you have to deal with them. Also, expect to have to deal with their massive errors, like giving you keys to a room that still has people staying there.
- The lobby is always crowded and with luggage all over the place.
- The beds are too small to share, the carpets are dirty and you'll probably get a room with something broken like the bathroom doorknob.

The only good thing about this hotel is its location, but it's NOT WORTH IT.

title: Misinformed and rude staff, dirty rooms.  Worst Hilton experience in memory.
text:
My husband has Diamond status with Hilton, and we needed to be in midtown/Hell's Kitchen so booked a stay.  We needed two adjoining rooms for two nights and then one of those two rooms for a third night.  The hotel reservations clerk did not know how to do this without making two separate reservations and making us change rooms, but eventually transferred me to a front desk clerk who did.  While I was on the phone with him, I asked about the clearance of the garage, as we would be arriving with an SUV  with a roof mounted luggage carrier and needed about a 7'6" clearance.  He told me he was texting with the garage attendant who confirmed for him that the clearance was 11 feet.    On a subsequent call (to ask about another matter), a different employee gave me a phone number for the garage that was disconnected.   

We checked in via the Hilton app the day before our arrival and noted an expected arrival time of 4 PM.  Due to traffic, we did not arrive until 6 PM. The line to check in was about 25 minutes long.  We then found out that our rooms were not ready.  While we waited, my husband drove the car to the garage (down the street) and was frustrated to learn the clearance was too low for our vehicle.  We were lucky to find an appropriate space at another garage.  Sometime after 7 PM, after repeat visits to the front desk, they moved us to rooms that were ready but were not the configuration that we had reserved.  These rooms had dirt on the floors.

In my three day stay, encountering at least a dozen staff, I found only one staff member who wore their mask over both nose and mouth.  The housekeeping staff used the guest elevators during prime hours (there are signs posted near the elevators alerting guests to times of day that the elevators are busiest) when I am certain there are elevators for staff only.    We stayed on the 6th floor so we ended up using the stairs most of the time.  

I understand that some hotels are understaffed and that the stress level can be high.  But I found the staff to be unfriendly, rigid, disorganized, sometimes rude, and misinformed about their own hotel amenities.  We won't be staying there again.

title: Will never stay here again
text: Terrible experience! Rude staff at check in, they didn’t resolve any issues. Tiny rooms. Run from this place! I was very disappointed, this isn’t what you expect from a Hilton. Horrendous experience and will be glad to go somewhere else!

title: Cleaning
text: The staff was wonderful but the room was very dirty.  The bathroom had built up mold and very gross.  The bed frames had built up dirt.  The room had an odor to it secondarily to the mold in the bathroom.

title: Overall good hotel
text: Great location, dispensers of sanitizer in the lobby were empty. Room was clean, had a nice cozy terrace. All time there was a noise maybe of the fridge woke up a few times because of that. Alarm was set to 6am prior our arrival. Of course alarm did ring I was sleepy and turned off trying to get back to sleep. After 10 min it did ring again, I wanted to smash the alarm but I got up to figure it out how to turned off, of course couldn’t sleep after that because of the noise too. In the morning I and my husband we drink coffee but there was just one regular coffee, one decaf and just one tea. Overall all good hotel and probably wouldn’t book it again next time.

title: Great location, decent hotel
text:
I booked this after seeing the star rating from guest reviews but before reading the actual reviews. I got very nervous since all of the recent reviews are awful. I went in with very low expectations and they were exceeded.

The room itself was fine. Normal NYC size, but not awfully small. Using the Hilton app, I was able to pick a room as far away from the elevators as possible and we did not have any noises at all - not from neighbors, hallways, street (we were on 10th floor), or elevator. The bathroom was clean and a good size. Two of the four towels were wet and smelled bad so we had to ask for more towels, which were delivered (a lot of them) and left at our door when we were out. 

When we tried to call the front desk from our room, we never got an answer, but when we stopped by the front desk, they were helpful. We asked for a pack and play, which was delivered 45 minutes later but without bedding. We made do with towels and what we had, but it wasn't ideal. When I told the front desk the next day, they sent up a bag of queen-sized sheets. If you're coming here and need a pnp, bring your own bedding. 

I didn't really mind that there is only cleaning service every 5 days - the only issue is that the garbage cans aren't really big enough to hold 5 days' worth of trash. The fridge doesn't have a freezer section, FYI. The microwave didn't actually heat up the food. The wi-fi is extremely slow - probably so you'll pay for an upgrade. 

The location was great. We parked at the City parking lot just a block over using SpotHero to get a good price ($105 for 3 days).

title: Not worth the money
text: King room is too small. Hotel looks old and outdated. Doors to hallway stick and were very hard to open and close. Only 2 elevators and they’re too small. Third elevator was reserved for hotel employees and as a result wait time for elevator was unreal. Some guests just took the stairs regardless of what floor they were on. Bad customer service. No one seemed to care.

title: Buena ubicacion, pero poquito antiguo
text: Mi hija y yo nos quedamos por 6 noches en el hotel. La ubicacion es de lo mejor, muy cerca a Times Square (10 minutos caminando) y muchas lineas de metro que llegas en 15-20 minutos a cualquier parte de Manhattan. Tiene en frente un Subway y tiendas de todo tipo muy cerca (Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Walgreens etc.) La habitacion era pequeña (pero en NY entiendo que son asi), el cuarto limpio, la cama comoda, tiene microondas, cafetera Keurig, minifridge. El baño pequeño pero limpio. Las alfombras si estaban con algunas manchas tanto en la habitacion como en los pasillos. Como no hay servicio de limpieza, los huespedes dejan su restos en los pasillos, esto deberia mejorar. Por lo demas, la verdad yo si dormi/descanse super bien y la pasamos de lo mejor. Ah, el elevador es cierto que demora un monton, un dia bajamos a pie desde el piso 12 porque la cola era muy larga.

title: Worst experience ever
text: Staying here since yesterday evening and it has been a horrible experience so far. No one cares to pick up the phone on front desk or has the courtesy to call back. I called twice to ask for towels and help with fixing the room’s temperature and it’s now close to midnight and no one has turned up. How long am I supposed to keep waiting or will I be disturbed mid sleep. Room service was not available and no sign of house keeping. I really really regret booking this place. Zero hospitality and reflects so badly on the brand. Had I not been accompanied by my 5 year old I would have moved somewhere else in a heartbeat.

title: Just Don’t Do It
text:
First, the positives. Great convenient location, bathroom was clean. 

Now, the reasons I’m writing this: The elevators are horrible. There are only 3 of them for a 34-floor building, and apparently one of them is reserved for those who clean/service  the rooms. This lead to 5-15 minute waits for the elevator. And lines of folks in the lobby at busy times. 

The stains on the carpets are disgusting. Not only in the hallways, but in the room I’m staying in as well.  The place is totally run down and not like any other Hilton I’ve ever stayed at.  

What I did learn about this property, is that it is not run by Hilton, it is a franchised operation. I don’t understand why Hilton would allow their name to be used on a property that is just sub-par.

Save your money, there are many other options in the area.

title: Had a great time in NYC!
text: Everyone at the Hilton was nice and helpful. The concierge, I believe her name was Danielle, was so helpful getting me around town since I needed handicap accessible routes! Our room was on the small side but I guess that’s how it is in NYC. The rooms were clean and nice.

title: Stay in NYC
text: Great room and location.  Room and service at the hotel were excellent.  The location is on 54th which is close to Times Square and shopping.  I went to the bar Friday and Saturday night.  The staff was welcoming and very attentive.

title: No lo recomiendo, pesimo hotel
text: No funciona un elevado y te tardas 20 minutos en bajar del piso 15, la atención en el mostrador es pesima, no hay quien te entregue toallas, pesimo hotel no lo recomiendo, en el baño no hay ventilación y la puerta es corrediza el cuarto esta muy pequeño

title: Great People / Disgusting Property
text: I gave this property 3 stars rather than 1 exclusively because of the great staff working. Aside from the people, the hotel is rather gross. Hallways and rooms are dirty. Carpets and furniture all with stains. Rooms smell poorly.  I won’t be returning to this property despite the location.

title: Horrible noise from the elevator for the entire night
text:
I seriously don’t recommend this hotel. The elevator makes very loud metallic noise and you can’t sleep with it. But the reception guy only repeats there is nothing he can do. The hotel doesn’t have even an ear plug. The mechanical failure of the elevator may be an infrequent event. However, I guarantee that the internet connection from the room is terrible. I checked the speed and it’s around 800kbps, in 2021! This is the worst Hilton I have ever slept for the last 10 years. I am writing this because I cannot make sleep due to the horrible noise. It’s past midnight and the elevator is still squeaking.
I usually don’t leave a review on a hotel, as I think what I get is what I paid for. However, this hotel is very disorganized, and the hotel is not paying any attention to hotel guests. I want to warn potential guests for this hotel to stay away from it.

title: Not worth the price
text: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend for 1 night. While it was fine to sleep for 1 day, I probably won’t come back. Unfortunately my husband did not read the reviews before booking for that 1 night however upon reading the reviews, I understand what the people are talking about. For the pros: it is located in a prime location, you are a few blocks away from Central Park, time square and Rockefeller center. But for the price, this hotel could be better. The elevator is small, and you do have to wait. They do have a sign to be aware of peak times as the elevator can take a while. The “breakfast” that they advertise is a frozen jimmy dean sandwich that you microwave. There is a small little room with a microwave and coffee maker for you to heat up your sandwich. The room was very small but being that it’s NYC I expected it to be small and while it was OK for the one night I did find some random things on the floor. The carpet was filthy, with stains I did not take off my flip flops the entire time. The room had a random Bobby pin on the floor which tells me they didn’t do a good job vacuuming. And there was dust all over the desk. The mini fridge in the room did not work. The bed was ok, pillows were uncomfortable. The bathroom was decent, I did find a hair in the shower but that was all. All in all for the hefty price of $350 a night this could’ve been way better. As I said I did not stay here for more than 1 night, so I don’t know anything about the housekeeping that everyone is talking about. However there is a sign in the bathroom that says the housekeeping only comes every 5 days. For me they should be coming everyday. Also the parking for the hotel is $55 a day, the parking garage across the street is cheaper, I’d suggest to park there instead. Definitely not worth the price find another hotel if you are staying more than one day.

title: Terrible
text: Too expensive for 4 nights, zero room service, they took on too many guests they could not handle. They checked us into a room with a clogged toilet that could not be flushed. Very disappointing as it was too late to change the room. The next day after begging we were moved to another room. We needed bed linen changed as our kids spilled water, we called 5 times for room service until midnight no linens came. Next morning when we complained to the manager his response “ you didn’t pay for a water bed did you?” Not funny at all! Not recommended at all!

title: Don't expect anything but an expensive room, no services available here
text: Not a cheap 6 day stay. No service on room allowed until day 5, only if requested no less. No business center open, no breakfast, no room service. Sure I got a credit to buy packaged food in the gift shop, but really not what I'm used to from Hilton. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. I'm a Hilton Diamond for Life, so I've stayed at alot of Hilton properties over many years and I've never been so disappointed.  This property has taken Covid and turned it into a profit margin boost by not providing any services.

title: Don't ask Danielle, the manager, for help!
text: I realize that the pandemic has been very hard on the travel industry, but perhaps this is not the best place for Danielle, the manager.  Very tense and unwelcoming.  Unwilling to resolve the smallest problem.  I have advised Hilton Honors of the lack of customer service.  This was also a corporate stay, and have advised corporate sales as well.

title: Very Small Rooms
text: We had a 2 queen bed with terrace… We could barely fit 1 adult and 2 kids in there… also, the doors are so heavy I believe it causes constant banging noises… also, can’t get an elevator to take luggage up and down during peak times.

title: Bad experience
text: Unfortunately our stay was disappointing. The day we arrived the front desk personnel were more focused on their conversation about there weekend plans then checking in guests. We never received any housekeeping services. The second day we asked for fresh towels and never got them. On the third day we asked for them again and the front desk guy said what do you want me to do about it look around I don’t have them here. I have NEVER had that type of experience with any hotel. When we got into the elevator we ran into the house man and he apologized and said he was the only house man in the building. I blame management for being low staffed and for over booking a hotel that doesn’t have the man power to function.

title: Awful hotel!! Dirty
text: This is a sh…..hole, one of the towels has excrement on it, the bed was dirty and smell like a very dirty underarm,awful, the ice machine doesn’t work, the elevador are not enough for the amount of people. This is the most disgusting place that I’ve ever been. In my opinion please go to other hotel. But the location is good. Otherwise is a complete mess!! Also the room was so small, the breakfast included is terrible. Every guest that we have the chance to talk with says the same!! In my entire life i have never seen an hotel this awful.

title: Previously loved this hotel, but very disappointed with most recent trip.
text: This used to be the best place to stay in NYC bc it was always 100% clean and overflowing with cheerful, helpful staff. They reminded me of the Chick-fil-A staff with how chipper they were about bending over backwards to make sure your stay there was great. During my last trip, it was no longer clean; I don’t believe the first room I was given had been cleaned. Even the second room had stains and holes all in the sheets. They seemed very understaffed, and the staff was so irritable and unhelpful, like it was a pain to have to interact with the customers. It felt like a completely different place from the last time I was there; this place has taken a serious nosedive. Will be looking for a different hotel for my future trips to NYC; nobody wants to be dealing with dirty rooms and rude staff on a vacation.

title: Stay away! Look for a better option.
text:
Stay away. I cannot emphasize it more: find something else. I took this punch in the stomach of hotel so you don't have to. 
It's not a cheap option but it feels like one... so it's even more disappointing. 
Breakfast? A bag with elementary school snacks : no thank you - but they happily charged for it. 
Worst customer service ever. I know new Yorkers are not known for their friendly smile, but these guys just hit a new low bar. 
Dirty carpets all over the hallways. 
It really needs an upgrade/ update. 
Towels with stains and holes. 
AC system just barely works. 
No room service even if kindly requested. It's like begging for everything. 
Covid policies need to be updated. It's 7/21 and you can't pull that card anymore to cheap or in room service. The ONLY reason you go to a hotel instead of your aunt's guest room or an Airbnb is to have a fresh room when you come back at the end of your day. 
But they managed to screw that too. Bravo. 

Client services never answers the phone, and when they do, bad attitude when you ask for anything.

The only star they get is for the restaurant that is just next door, but not part of the hotel. Great food. 
Skip the hotel altogether.

title: Just. No.
text: I trusted this place because it's a Hilton (and I wanted the points, let's be honest). Big mistake. First the good stuff. The room WAS fairly clean (no real complaints there, although I did find a peice of plastic trash under the bed when I got there), the bathroom smelled like bleach, the linens all seemed very clean.  Maybe the other stuff was disinfected (remote control, light switches, etc.) not sure, they weren't wrapped, but there was a "santized" tag on the door. The location is great! And... that's about it for the good. The bad: the pillows were terrible and not comfortable AT ALL, the A/C leaked water into the carpet, and there is no free coffee. No breakfast either, other than a crappy grab and go sandwich. I ended up at DD around the corner each morning. . Elevators take FOREVER and you have to use your key to engage (I get it for security, but what a pain, especially when it's a digital key). Hotel staff very disinterested. I called to report the A/C issue and no one answered several times, so I gave up and was stuck in a room with a damp floor. When I told the lady at the desk on checkout, she was like, oh, yeah, the phones aren't working great. Okay, whatever. ATM wasn't working. Business center was closed.  With a gazillion other places to stay in NYC, do yourself a favor and keep looking. There's a Residence Inn literallly right next door.. It has to be better than this.

title: A terrible stay - no room cleaning- dangerous for infectious disease
text: I am staying at the above hotel and after the first day when I saw that the room was not cleaned I went to the front desk (after they did not answer my phone) and asked to clean the room. I was shocked to hear that the room will be cleaned after 5 days!!!  After 6 days when they still did not clean the room I went down and again asked the front desk to clean my room. It was about 14:00. Again I was shocked from the answer that I had to tell them by 9 AM... although that morning at 8 AM I told the front desk. The garbage was every where. The room was so dirty that I told the front desk I should report to the CDC about the dangerous of this room for infectious disease at the moment !!!!  Again, only after I shouted they cleaned the room. Needless to say that I pay a regular fee for the stay and I think that this is unfair. At least they should have told me the first day I arrived that the room will not ne cleaned every day. But cleaning after 6 days!!!!!!! This is something every one should know before coming to this place. I shall never come to this place again!!

title: Great location, but….
text:
The Good - The hotel is in a fantastic location. It was quiet by NYC standards, and the room was a good size. Tons of places around for breakfast. Easy walk to Central Park and museums. 

The Not-So-Good - Parking was a challenge - we parked down the street at Best Parking, downloaded an app and paid $50 less for our stay than we would have if we’d used the valet service. Room had a used, wet towel on the back of the bathroom door and another hand towel that was stained. Room was also damp/humid the entire stay. We couldn’t get the thermostat to move. Towels never dried. Sleeping was uncomfortable. We understood we would not get housekeeping and had the towels dried or thermostat been usable it wouldn’t have been a problem.

Staff were not wearing masks in common areas or they’d put them on when guests approached, or kept them under their noses. Guests definitely were not wearing masks in common areas or elevators.

All things being equal, I don’t think I’d stay there again.

title: Be aware
text: The elevators can take up to 20 min. The breakfast is simply a microwaveable sandwich. There is no room cleaning service for 5 days so u have to call for items and they may arrive. Room was clean but otherwise hotel is drab.

title: Stay at rikers
text: One coffee for two people two nights postage stamp soap two waters for two days no response on room service bad internet cell service and ac. Deblasio hotel for homeless would of been better or just jail at least there I would of got water and coffee. Ps I never have wrote so much. But have travelled the world and will tell all about my stay please advise

title: Manhattan South Central Park Stay
text: The location of this hotel is great. Walking distance to Central Park and walking distance to Times Square. As NYC hotel rooms go- tight small rooms. This was during the end of June and the hotel could have been more welcoming, one is not looking for a relationship, but friendliness would be nice.

title: Scene from Law and Order
text: The location was great but the room was the worst I have ever stayed in. Getting off the elevator and into the room the carpet was so dirty and stained I feel as though I was still on the streets of New York. I was given the trip for an owner update and staying in the room did not put me in the mood to spend any more money.

title: Worst Hilton I have ever been and one of the worst of all times
text: Worst Hilton I have ever been. I travel a lot and I have had good and bad experiences in hotels and I need to say that this Hilton is one of the worse: terrible service, smallers rooms that you could see in the photos, cleanning only every 5 days upon request and even collecting the garbage or changing towels you have to call to request and wait in line longer that you should in a hotel. It is like they were doing you a favor. The only great thing about this hotel is location; a few blocks from Central Park and just a few steps from Broadway, but there are many other options around.

title: Customer service needs addressing
text: Customer service needs improving. Interactions with guest when you have a simple complaint. The parking was ridiculous. We couldn't get access to our car when it was left in garage. The parking attendants were extremely rude to us we didn't know what condition the car would be in when we were leaving.

title: Buena ubicación, pero no el resto
text: Muy buena ubicacion. No nos dieron la habitacion reservada por la pagina del hotel, sino una que tenia olor a cigarrillo y el aire acondicionado no funcionaba. Los pasillos sucios. El desayuno malo. Despues nos cambiaron a la habitacion que habiamos reservado y era mejor. La habitacion no la limpiron ningun dia. Los ascensores siempre llenos y sin respetar distancia social y varias veces funcionaban 2 de los 3 que tenia el hotel.

title: Loved the Private Lanai
text: Since we were going to be there for six nights, we booked the King bed junior suite (with a pull-out couch) with private balcony. It was an awesome outdoor space! We are only a family of three, so a king bed and pull-out couch are enough for us. Everyone was incredibly friendly. Loved ordering DD on the app and quickly running around the corner for an easy breakfast/coffee pick up. Also enjoyed Iguana Mexican restaurant across the street. Great overall location!!

title: Convenient Location
text: The hotel's biggest strength is location. We easily walked to Central Park, MoMA and the  Museum of Natural History. Also, there are plenty of options for coffee, drinks, food and shopping nearby. The rest of the hotel is fairly average with one exception. The room size is generous for the price . The hotel staff is pleasant. The rooms are clean. My one compliant with the room is the closet is small and crammed with essentials. There is a small Hilton shop to purchase snacks and necessities. There is an adjoining restaurant that we did not eat at it, but it had a nice atmosphere and we had a couple drinks at the bar. Depending upon occupancy the elevators can be a bit of a wait. I recommend using them during off peak hours. If you plan to spend a lot of time out in the city, this is an appropriate hotel for you.

title: Horrible Hilton
text:
Dirty from the start. Check inn, room ready & waiting, no entry b4 3 without fee as diamond member. Never before refused access early. Return at 5 allowed in room 22 minute wait for elevator. Patrons started pushing packing in no distancing. This a college dorm partially. 28 trashed carpet walls doors stained dirty not vacuumed. Room thank god cleaner after crashing into the cart full of trash left in hall. Weird soap does not lather.  Watered down shampoo - two bottles to wash.  17 minutes waiting for hot water next morning. Break fast diamond member $10 credit about 3 items for 2 people. Then I looked frozen stuff to nuke, hard breads that’s it we forget to use the credit after going out to eat. 
Write to Ceo Chris nassetta no response from him, but Justin Elliott who states he speaks for Chris nassetta wrote sorry. Is this acceptable if you just put up 70,000 points or a few hundred dollars?Apparently this is what Chris nassetta thinks is quality well Hilton quality. Brand consistency never been to a garden inn like that. 
When I mentioned quality to front desk they burst into laughter 
Hilton has surprises for you and you might not like it watch out Chris nasseta lives in a fantasy land if he thinks he is making things right. 
Try a different option
We were so disgusted we just left in morning 
Skip really you will be happier 
Oh the pillows squish down to paper thin. My neck is so messed up.

title: Bien ubicado, mala atención y muy viejo/sucio
text:
Bastante flojo el hotel
La ubicación es excelente pero la atención es muy mala, el hotel es sucio y viejo. No te dan toallas cuando las pedis, no te dan bola. 
El precio es correcto, pero no es un buen hotel donde estás cómodo en tu estadía en Nueva York

title: Unhappy
text: We arrived early for check-in time for our stay but I was told we would have our room ready by 3 PM and that we were first on the list for a reservation for two queen beds.  The room was never ready until 5:30 PM which delayed us getting to our planned events. Several other people who arrived AFTER us were able to get into their room while we watched and waited in the lobby. Additionally, I had reserved two queen beds and we ended up with two double beds which was quite small for 4 adults. So what happened to the room that I reserved? Obviously, it was given to someone else but the hotel would not admit that.  They allowed us to stay later than next day and we were given a gift card to each purchase a drink at the restaurant there for some compensation. I still feel that we should’ve been compensated a night stay because of the inconvenience. We arrived earlier in the day, yet we ended up waiting 2 1/2 hours for a room in the afternoon and missed out on our dinner plans because we could not get ready in time as a result of the room delay.

title: Awesome hotel will recommend to the world 🌎
text:
Excellent hotel 
Excellent  room
Excellent environment 
Excellent  experience 
Excellent staff

Recomiendo este hotel a todo que venga a Nueva York. El hotel te da la experiencia que necesitas Central Park , time square , Bar , Restaurante, Mucha opciones de compras y lo mejor transportaciones de train de todo Manhattan y más.

title: Early checkin fee
text: $20 fee to checkin early when rooms were ready. Fellow travelers werent charged fee    No bath soap in room.  When requested received paper thin slice of soap. Wouldnt even call it a bar. No cleaning of room or fresh towels

title: Lacking customer service
text: We booked a queen room but was given full sized beds. We were only given 2 towels; asked for additional and never received them. The pillows were awful. The front desk staff was not helpful and didn’t seem willing to help. Positive was that the hotel was relatively quiet and was in a good location for us.

title: Worst experience ever!
text: Room wasn’t ready at 3pm to check in! Didn’t have a higher floor for me as was promised when i booked, i was placed on 2 nd floor. Basically  I paid $400 for no reason. Next morning when i asked for 11:30 check out instead of 11:00, they told me it wasn’t possible , but checking me in 30 min late and placing me on 2 nd floor was possible. Definitely the worst Experience i’ve ever had with HGI. And this is coming from a guy who has been part of HGI family for 5 years, we never treated our customers like this!

title: Not cleaning the rooms!
text:
Their policy is not cleaning the rooms
Until the 5th night. And than it is cleaned only once.you may ask for towels if you need it. But you still pay full price.  Location is great though.gym is nice.  Rooms are ok

title: They need to step it up.
text: There was hair left on the bathroom counter, no face cloths, the coffee maker had a used pod left in it & there was no fresh coffee or set ups; old bed linens; the premium tv channels were only in Spanish (I only speak English).  The lobby was in disarray. Definitely not up to Hilton standards. Do I need to go on?

title: Terrible Customer service
text:
I checked into this hotel about an hour ago.  I noticed there was no soap in the room and that the safe did not work.  When I checked in they gave me a card and said text if you need anything.  I did and never received any text or call back.  I tried calling guest services.  Twenty minutes later they finally answered the phone and said they would send someone right up.  Still no one has come to my room or told me they were on their way.  

I have been to NYC over a 100 times and usually stay at the Hilton Chain.  I have never seen customer service this bad and I definitely will never stay at this hotel again.  I am extremely disappointed with this hotel!!!!

title: Traveling alone
text:
This location is quite comfortable and relaxing. Great for the quick meetings and interviews that suddenly pops up.
Lobby restaurant and bar is always a favorite of mine where you can also dine or have a drink outdoor.

title: Hilton broken elevator
text: Dirty room. Dirty sheets. Dirtier hotel. Elevator took forever so we walked Down ten flights with bags. Then got lost in basement of hotel. Nightmare. Elevator broke the night we stayed. Fire department had to come. Very scary to see the fire department at your hotel when my wife and children are in the room and the elevator is not working. Skip this hotel.

title: Love NYC
text: We found the location to be easily accessible to subway transportation and in a safe neighborhood.  An easy walk to Central Park and Times Square. We had a few issues with the room but nothing critical to our stay.

title: Terrible treatment
text: Been staying with Hilton Properties for over 20 years on 5 continents.  This was the worst stay I've ever had.  Loud music (wall vibrating from the bass) in the room next to us prompted us to call the front desk around 10pm to ask that it be turned down.  Waited 30 minutes, no change.  Called again, front desk hung up on me.  Went downstairs, asked to be moved to a different room, was told hotel was sold out.  Went back to the room and looked it up on the app and I could book a room at that hotel, that evening, so it was not sold out - employee too lazy to move us.  Took a sleeping help hoping that would make me sleep, didn't work, went back to lobby at 1:30am and a manager was on duty and moved us to a new room.  We were so tired from about 4 hours of sleep the next day, we canceled night two of our weekend trip and left.  Awful way to treat a guest by lying to them, hanging up on them and not doing anything to remedy a loud guest disturbing others.  I will never stay at this hotel again.

title: Stay Away
text: Horrible experience from little black bugs in shower, stained carpeting and towels with holes. No place to sit in the room except on a work chair. Because of COVID they didn’t give us service and had to request towels and soap daily

title: Inexpensive but you get what you pay for
text: Inexpensive and one of the better deals and locations in NYC for a quick trip. Just a few minutes walk from central park and Times Square. However, it's extremely crowded and nerve-wracking to be crammed in a lobby with dozens of people waiting to speak with the front desk in the midst of COVID. We were also downgraded upon arrival, and rather than updating our room price to the cheaper price of the room we were given, we were charged MORE. This took three separate phone calls across a week to get resolved.

title: Very bad experience
text:
The carpet in the room was dirty
The door on the bathroom did not close
They offered self serving breakfast but did not have utensils
We stayed there 3 nights and they had Coffee machine in the room but only one coffee pod

title: No Service
text: The service that Hilton detailed in an email prior to my arrival was 100% false. For eight days, I received one housekeeping service. When I spoke with staff and showed them the Hilton email, they shrugged and said that they were not providing housekeeping other than one day.

title: Don’t get the parking
text: Don’t use the parking they charge 50 for city park through the hotel and then city park charges you an extra 20 ....ridiculous , I could have parked for 27 for the entire time I was there. Absolutely no reason to pay 70 to park in the city

title: Avoid Hilton GARBAGE Inn at all costs!
text: This hotel is a dump! Suspect stains practically everywhere… from the room chairs to the carpets. Women may wish to take birth control before sitting on the furniture. Everyone should definitely consider getting an STD test after their stay. In one elevator, there were four pealed social distancing stickers on the floor, each leaving sticky residue that collects gunk so that it looks like four large dirty connect the dots of the ground. Staff doesn’t wear masks or PPE indoors. In particular, we saw the same housekeeper not wearing her mask several days in a row. Staff are as unpleasant as the hotel itself. The only redeeming thing about Hilton Garbage Inn is it’s location, everything else is for the trash heap.

title: Good Location and Clean Rooms
text: Hotel located in great area near theaters and other venues.  Rooms are clean but VERY small.  We were on the 2nd floor so that we could take the stairs so no view but very quiet.  There are currently NO options for food at this location.  Also, the tiny 16oz bottles of water in your room are NOT free (labeling is misleading)

title: Great location
text: Clean, Comfortable, Quiet, Great Location.  Access to everything, everywhere you wat to go.  Excellent restaurants nearby.  Close to Central Park and all transportation. Friendly, helpful staff.  Defiantly recommend this property.

title: Amazing
text: The room was very clean beds were comfortable very easy to fall asleep I highly recommend this hotel me and my husband absolutely loved it great hotel overall although parking on the street is hard to find

title: Manhattan
text: Hilton honors members must still wait in line here to personally check in and out. They don’t make it convenient like every other Hilton. Room was clean. Elevators take forever to arrive. Staff was nice

title: Broken elevator.  No follow through on even basic service.
text: 1of 3 elevators was broken our entire 4 days, which led to long wait for elevators and any people crammed in tiny elevators during a pandemic.  Service was worst hotel experience I can remember.  We were given 3 towels for the 4 of us with a rack to dry only one.  When I asked for fresh towels and cleaning of room floor and more paper cups, I was promised all 3 within 4 hours.  I asked again 12 hours later for towels and cups and was promised both within an hour.  I asked again in the morning and both were delivered.  Floor was never cleaned.  No one ever collected the wet towels.  When I left them by a linen cart in the hall they stayed in the hall all day.  Bed was comfortable.  Room was clean on arrival.  Walls allowed me to hear neighbors talking loudly.

title: Comfortable and Convenient
text: Great room with city view and comfortable beds. The room was clean and wonderful selection of channels on tv. I was able to catch a couple of shows I figured I would have to miss. Very walkable to every where I needed to go.

title: Brenda Johnson
