text: It been great. My refrigerator did not get cold, but that was find, only there 2 night. Long wait for the elevators, but to be expected since COVID 19 - 4 to an elevator. Clean, comfortable, nearby everything; restaurant stores, mall & time square. Great place for a stay, highly recommend.

title: Expect a lot more from a Hilton property
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April 2021. It was our first trip back to NYC since the pandemic. Immediately upon walking in I noticed both staff members had masks under their mouths - not on really at all. I was surprised to see this as I would expect more from a Hilton property. I was also surprised at how busy the elevator always was. We were on the 18th floor, and were not comfortable cramming in with so many other groups of people (including many students who appear to be living there this year, and additionally, multiple people who were not masked). In addition, the hand sanitizing stations in the lobby were empty while we were there,

Our room had a Lysol clean sticker on it. Immediately upon walking in, we noticed the room was dirtier than all other hotels we've stayed in. There was visible dust on the night tables and dressers, and red wine stains that we had to remove. There was remnants of garbage under the bed. This room didn't appear clean, let alone above and beyond "Lysol" cleaned. We went out and bought our own cleaning wipes to wipe things down so we had a bit of peace of mind. 

The room wasn't a bad size for NYC - and it had a microwave and fridge which was nice, especially when traveling with kids. 

We never had housekeeping when we were there. We were out most of the day, but no one showed up. I don't know if they aren't doing that anymore, but it would have been nice to at least have been offered fresh towels or our garbage emptied during our 3 night visit. 

We were also surprised at the amount of garbage in the hallways. When we arrived, there was a bag of garbage in the hallway along with some additional empty takeout containers. They stayed there for at least a full day. 

The location of this property is good for families and travelers. It is very close to Columbus Circle, the subway line, and Times Square, but feels quiet. We parked in the garage across the street - $40 a day we paid (not through the hotel but just through the garage, I think it is more through the hotel). 

Overall, this hotel is not what we would expect from a HGI. We both came home and got Covid tests because of the amount of people we encountered multiple times a day in the lobby and the elevators, and because of the poor masking procedures of the staff and visitors.

title: Terrible
text: Poor service, manager was rude, staff not helpful, will not be staying at a Hilton ever again based on this experience. The rudest staff and they did not even try to help us.  Also liars and just want to take peoples money but not help people out

title: Property was clean however
text: Upon arrival I didn't expect much being a native New Yorker. My husband and I decided to spend a night in the city and opted to the hotel because it advertised being by Central Park..wrong it's not close like it claimed. Our biggest issue was one of the elevator was out and it's small so with only two functioning elevators guest had to cram on the elevators not good during this pandemic. Upon entering the room was small and cold so we adjusted the temperature. At 3 in the morning we heard squeaking and rattling by the curtains and I immediately called the front desk. The agent sent someone up who did nothing and said they would return..he never did. The entire night  we were up due to the noise. When I checked out I bought it to the attention of the front desk who brushed it off as if it is impossible for a mouse to be hanging out in a hotel in the city. This alone left a nasty taste in my mouth and for this I will no longer go to Hilton properties.

title: Disappointing hotel stay
text: The rooms did not feel clean at all, no extra items that you would expect like extra towels, trash pick up, due to no house keeping taking place. 3 elevators, one broken and the other being used by housekeeping with 34 floors really, always a wait for them

title: A very rude receptionist
text: The receptionist was acting in a very rude manner during the checkin and checkout. I was trying to ask him about the invoice. Instead of explaining, he just made jestures with his head. Also, during the checkin, he was so rude

title: Rude staff
text: The front desk person screams your business for everyone to hear and doesn’t honor your Hilton rewards membership I’ll never stay at this location again. My business is obviously not wanted here. Go to a Marriott

title: Lack of personnel causing bad customer service.
text: Sent my wife and daughter to stay for the winter, started off bad soon as I called to ask for special request and never got anyone to pick up had to call the 800-number from main hilton webpage just to ring the front desk. I mentioned I had packages going to hotel for family and they said no problem. They gave to my wife last day she checked out and said package arrived 3 days ago and they forgot to notify her?  She tried to ask for room clean up the guy working the front desk was alone and she got tired of waiting. I called the hotel let the phone ring on the hook no answer. I called the 800-number again to get the front desk, was told had to make a reservation 24 hours prior for a room clean up, WTH??? fine made the request and they never showed up, ARGH!!!! asked for clean sheets had to request, what happened, nothing again. Awful experience to a great hotel next to some great areas. Lack of people working the hotel for basic things. No amenities offered after first day for basic things, water,coffee, or tea. Never again, worse hilton my family has stayed, wish I was with her cause she was so shy and didn't want to cause any issues.

title: Nice stay
text: Hotel was good.  Rooms were clean, everything was modern and up to date.  Location is great to walk over to Central Park.  Parked at City Park which is right across the street.  Ordered from Three Monkey also across the street and had good food.  The gentleman at the front desk, Mark, I found extremely helpful.  He was very pleasant, took care of a couple of things, and he called me by name each time I was in the lobby.  His attitude made me feel like a valued guest and I really appreciated that.  With all of the choices of places to stay in NYC Mark's efforts will bring me back to this property again.

title: Great hotel great suite great view nice location
text:
I booked a junior terrace suite yesterday great room to stay in clean spacious and pretty quiet in room the 400sqft terrace balcony was amazing I was overwhelmed how nice it was even in the rain! The room has microwave fridge and most standard amenities plus 2 showers (which was 1 walk in and 1 tub shower combo) Just keep in mind the if you check in on New Year’s Day the rooms take a long time to be clean and you may wait over 1-2 hours for room to be cleaned after 3pm (my room was apparently trashed night before and had to be deep cleaned) but was clean when I walked in that’s only reason I don’t give it 5 stars

But hotel did give apologies regarding the issue

Will come back in summertime to use terrace better!

title: Not prepared for COVID
text:
Stayed here for a night out in NY after Christmas; our 1st ever stay in a hotel during COVID.
The main problem with this hotel is they are severely understaffed, which results in poor customer experience and making social distancing impossible.
Since they are unable to assign rooms quickly due to slow turnaround, there are a dozen people piled up inside the tiny lobby just waiting for their room; and it's too cold to wait outside. During normal times this would be a mere annoyance, but during COVID, this is a high risk scenario.
I understand times are tough for hotels, but if they can't guarantee basic COVID safety protocols, why bother opening at all?

title: Localização privilegiada
text: Ótima localização, bom atendimento e café da manhã completo. Ótimo para quem precisa usar o metrô ou caminhar pela ilha. O café da manhã é bem completo, coisa rara em hotéis dessa faixa de preço em nyc

title: Great front desk service!
text:
Stayed here on 2 different occasions on very short notice and needed to be within walking distance to the UES.   We were in 2 couple different Deluxe - outdoor terrace rooms and had equally different experiences.  Our first stay in room 201 was less than ideal since we kept getting woken up by the door opening and closing next door starting at 5:30am during our first stay.   Our follow up visit in room 205 was much quieter and for some reason felt a bit more spacious as well.

Breakfast during this COVID period consisted of choosing 3 items/pp (frozen breakfast sandwiches, muffins, OJ, coffee drinks, yogurt, etc) in their snack shop for Diamond members.

Where this hotel really shined for us were helpful front desk staff.   We accidently left something valuable in our room during our first stay and both Maggie (over the phone) and Mark were instrumental in helping us to retrieve it when we came back.  Additionally, I'd goofed on a reservation and made it for the wrong day and Mark was again able to save the day.   We were so appreciative and felt that they both needed a shout out.  

Thanks for making us feel welcome and our day less stressful!

title: Overcharged and Rude manager
text:
PLEASE BEWARE OF miscellaneousCHARGES and being OVERCHARGED during your stay. 
I am a Hilton Honors member since early 2000s and have stayed on many Hilton properties,and  I've never experienced such rude behavior from management; or had these mysterious charges appear. I  had a bad experience today on the phone with MARK regarding my recent  5 night stay.
 I understand due to covid the rooms aren't changed over daily, but are to be sanitized after a guest departs.  Upon my arrival my room was full of dust around the bed area. The desk next to the bed , which the phone rests on, the headboard and the bed board  were  ALL FILTHY. I changed rooms and to my surprise , the same issue.   I was asked if I wanted housekeeping to clean it thoroughly to avoid changing rooms again. I then had to exit the room while they cleaned. 
At that point , I just wanted to get settled in and rest.  
While reviewing my card statement, I noticed different charges from the hotel. Now I know incidentals nightly should be 50$ . Mine were somehow $100 per night.. In addition to that, there was another charge that was there and I went to front desk to inquire about.  I spoke to Rob M  , who was the manager on duty about the miscellaneous charge, overages and about why I was being double charged for incidentals. He couldn't explain to me why these charges had occurred but assured me it was a "SYSTEM" error beyond his control and it would settle or "fall off" the account after my stay. Fast forward a week later, the incidentals did " fall off"  but I was overcharged for 2 of the nights. 
I called  the hotel and spoke to Rob again . He credited my account and assured me that it was corrected.  A week later , I checked my statement and still there was a credit  of only 1 night now.  I call once again and get Dora at front desk on the phone . She looks into the charges and says no credit was made to that night.  At this point , I request a manger on duty . She places me on a long hold and says they're not answering , can I call back in an hour . I ask her who the manager on duty is she says she doesn't know but call back in an hour , and ask for billing dept and they will be able to assist. So I ask her the name of the GM because now I'm getting the run around. Reluctantly, she says ask for Kevin. I ask her is he the GM or the manger on duty? Dora then replies he's someone that can assist but doesn't know who the GM is. At this point, I'm thinking this is all a game . How do you not know your GM name?
 
I call back an hour later and speak to MARK. I explain to him that I was overcharged for 1 night . He now starts to explain that Robert had credited my account and showed me invoices justifying this and that I NEED TO MANAGE MY ACCOUNT ACCORDINGLY. As if I'm the one at fault . At this point , I tell him about my experience with the system overcharging me double  from CHECK IN and that it had nothing to do With ME mismanaging my account. He was curt, seemingly annoyed and rude. He replied that he didn't "Need to hear All THAT". Well if you don't care that you all are overcharging guests then that's an issue I have and will not be returning, if this is the nonsense I have to endure.
MARK needs new training in customer service. His Diva  attitude Sucks.  Watch your charges if you decide to stay.

title: Excelente hotel
text:
Escolhi o hotel pelo custo x benefício que estava na época e acabei me surpreendendo. A localização é ótima, tem metrô a 5 minutos do hotel e muitos restaurantes perto. O quarto não é muito grande, mas, para o padrão de NY, achei bom de tamanho, além de ser bem confortável. Tinha um microondas dentro do quarto, o que achei ótimo. 
Todo dia de manhã tinha café gratuito à disposição no hall. Também tem um caixa eletrônico dentro do lobby e é possível encomendar coisas e mandar entregar no hotel, mas tinha um custo adicional. 

Problemas: pouco elevador para o tamanho do hotel e sempre tinha um em manutenção. Então às vezes se demorava uns 15/20 minutos só para conseguir descer.
O segundo problema é que a gente foi cobrada por águas que não consumimos. Acabamos resolvendo o problema, mas deu uma pequena dor de cabeça.

title: Definitely will stay again
text: This is an awesome Hilton Garden Inn. Very clean (including an excellent job with the Covid-19 disinfection procedures), and helpful and friendly staff as well. Convenient and easy to get to. Nice view from our room  -- which was up-to-date and well appointed. I must make mention of one of the employees, Ishmael, who helped us out on two occasions. The management needs to be made aware of his dedication to his job and extremely excellent customer service. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Camere piccole, rumorose e sporche per 130 $ a notte.
text:
Penso che il titolo sia esemplificativo.
Le camere sono molto piccolse (meno di 20 mq). Le porte non sono dotate di un rallentatore e quindi quando i vicini la chiudono, sbatte violentemente e procura un rumore infernale a tutte le ore della notte. In tempi di Covid non c'e' il servizio di house keeping............... quindi se sporchi la camera, rimane sporca. Per questo servizio pessimo, 130 usd sono una follia.

title: Robert Rocks!!
text: My a/c wasn’t working. Without a/c I’m very irritable. Robert walked me through shutting it down and restarting it and it work. His greeting over the phone was happy. He offered to come up but I asked if it were something I could do per his instructions over the phone and it worked. He also offered to have an Engineer stop by but all was well so I declined. Thank You Robert!!! The room was very clean!! Thank you Housekeeping!!

title: Excelente ! Localização , quarto, staff
text: Excelente escolha ! Este hotel estava simplesmente perfeito a nivel da localização .Tudo com excelentes condições com uma centralidade magnifica. Quartos grandes e imaculadamente limpos . Preços normais para a insignia Hilton .

title: Great location
text:
This hotel was centrally located, less than a $50 Uber (with tip) from La Guardia. We walked to Times Square, Carnegie Hall, and it was easy to get transportation to the ferry for The Statue of Liberty. 

It was a short distance to the nearest post office, there were lots of food options around, and taking in a Broadway show on the fly was a real treat. 

I want to take a moment to especially recognize Winford, one of the people in guest service at this location. He, and an older gentleman that was a doorman, were the kindest employees at this hotel and were very helpful. 

It was a family trip, but my daughter was staying at a nearby hotel with her school and I stayed at Hilton with my parents. We had rooms on the same floor so we were close to each other, but as small as the rooms were: I know they love each other, four days in such close quarters would have driven me mad. The bathrooms were lovely and bright as well as clean.

There was desk space for me to use my laptop and get plenty of work done, but unless you want to eat in bed or a reading chair: plan on having dinner out. 

They have an attached restaurant that we didn’t get to try because we had plans elsewhere each evening, but there was a lovely 24hr restaurant around the corner where I had an early (4am) breakfast one day. 

I decided to walk up the flights of stairs in the hotel for exercise, which I could only seem to get to from the 2nd floor, but it was a nice way to get the blood flowing. All in all, I would stay there again If I were just in town for a few days like we were this time, but wouldn’t stay there on a longer trip unless we reserved a room block with a cheaper price or got better service.

The text check-in from the front desk to see how our stay was going was nice but didn’t actually do anything. Winford and the front doorman in the morning were the highlight of the hotel service for us.

title: Awesome
text: Perfect hotel and in a great location, can't wait to return once this pandemic is all over. Hotel staff were absolutley fantastic and always asked how our day was on way back in..ideal location for the big city..

title: Not a Comfortable stay
text: Not a  comfortable stay  especially for the price I paid I expected more especially from Hilton.   I was told to receive more from the customer service rep and that did not happened.  They did not even try to fix or make the stay any better.

title: A great location
text: This hotel is conveniently located near central park, carnegie hall, moma and many good restaurants and cafes within a walking distance. The hotel is very clean, staff are friendly, rooms are large enough and well equipped. Considering the price and facilities it was good value for money.

title: Great!!! location theaters and park
text:
Small room, very adequate bathroom.  This is a great place to stay for a theater week-end. A  half block to Broadway and 10 blocks to Times Square.   It's also an easy walk to Central Park.  The restaurant attached is just okay.
The staff is friendly and obliging.  The elevators are inadequate for the number of floors/rooms and there were some long wait times.  All-in-all it was very satisfactory for the purpose.

title: Family/mom medical consult
text: Let me start by saying I am accustomed to a 4 or 5 star hotel and this is definitely not that but it is decent for what you pay for it or at least what I paid. The hotel is clean and the staff is responsive and pleasant. We asked for shower caps and an extra blanket and they brought it up pretty fast. Coffee machine in the room, refrigerator end microwave. Safe too. Towels are thin and tissues are kind of rough but again this is not a five star hotel. The city view is nice in my upgraded room. I like that they include two bottles of water silver and up it is included complimentary. I wish I had known about the cooking classes/demos which sounded fun so ask about those ahead of time.

title: Disgraceful after stay service
text: Stayed in the Hilton garden hotel central park in February. Ok hotel.had to pay 50 dollar deposit per night.  Still hasnt been returned to my account. Hotel stopped responding to my emails and hung up on my phone calls.really really poor

title: Unexpected great location
text: Hilton hotels are usually nice but this one was so sparkling clean. And The room didn’t look like a 3star hotel one. Quite small as all other NYC hotels but so clean and cozy. It’s an awesome location - really close to everything but not too crowded.

title: great location and I'd stay here again
text:
Rooms: The room we stayed in was clean and offered great views. It was also updated and felt higher end. This hotel also offered remote check in from the Hilton App, so we were able to bypass the check in counter and went straight to our room after the app notified us that our room was ready. 

Location: You are 4 blocks from central park and within walking distance of damn near everything. This gets you close to Time Square ( i don't go there but I know lots of people do) but it also gets you far enough to not have so much noise and light coming into your room while you're trying to sleep. 

Staff:  Staff was very friendly and seemed willing to help. With the self check in though, our contact was minimal at best. 

You don't go to NYC for the hotel experience, you go for the sights. This hotel gives you beautiful rooms, beautiful views and a quick walk or cab ride anywhere you want to go. I would suggest this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in Manhattan.

title: Great Hotel
text: We booked this hotel as part of a package with Virgin Holidays for a friends 30th birthday. When we arrived we checked into the hotel and found the receptionist extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were spacious and clean and the beds were very comfortable. The maid cleaned the rooms on a daily basis which was great. The hotel itself is central and makes getting around NYC on foot easy, Times Square is a 5 minute walk and Central Park 10 minutes. The staff were all very friendly and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 was the wait time for the lifts. During busy times of the day you can be waiting 15/20 minutes for a lift which is the only way to get to the ground floor when your room is on the 19th floor. Other than that it was great!

title: Topverblijf gehad
text: We hebben 6 dagen zeer goed verblijf gehad. In andere beoordelingen staat wat over drukte met de liften. Ja dat is zo. Maar hiervoor wordt gewoon op geattendeerd in het hotel dus vind ik niet dat over geklaagd moet worden. Verder wel gehorig op de gang. Maar doordat er op 1 verdieping max 8 kamers zijn en je eigenlijk maar 1 buur hebt door de opzet, heb je hier minimaal last van.

title: A true gem
text: I have been to Hilton Hotels all over the world and this one is truly a diamond in the rough.From the moment you get there you are met with people that truly enjoy working there. They are pleasant and helpful from the doorman to the person that opens the door as you leave.It is an older hotel but kept immaculately clean with a very nice restaurant with an exceptional wine list. The morning after breakfast is very good and overall a very very pleasant experience. I recommend this place highly and you are reading this from someone with over 1 million Hilton honors points.

title: EXCELENTE EM TODOS ASPECTOS
text: Hotel bem localizado, equipe comprometida a dar o melhor, quarto grande e confortável. Custo e benefício excelente para NYC. Movimentação grande no hotel pela quantidade de quartos mas nada que seja tão complicado.

title: Hilton garden inn nyc cps- feb 2020
text: We stayed at the Hilton Hotel My sister and I as part of a family trip in New York for a week.  Great hotel, great location, courteous service and comfortable and good rooms.  Unfortunately, the price we closed through Booking did not match what we ended up paying at the hotel.  There are additional taxes in addition to the tax that was registered at the beginning of the booking process.  There are four types of tax that were not mentioned at first.  Despite the price, the hotel location is excellent and suitable for those who come to experience the city for the first time

title: Emplacement idéal
text: Café mis à disposition tous les matins à la réception , personnel aimable et très accueillant, très bonne literie. Je recommande cet hôtel situé près de Times Square et Central Park. Rapport qualité prix parfait.

title: Correct
text: Hôtel bien situé, mais chambre et salle de bain petites avec ventilations très bruyantes , accueil correct mais impersonnel, moquette dans les chambres attention aux allergies, éviter la navette aéroport que l hôtel sous traite rapport qualité/prix pas terrible

title: Organize-se para sair pois o elevador é demorado!
text: O hotel, em geral, é muito bom, ótimos quartos e banheiros limpos. Pela manhã havia café e chá a vontade na recepção e a tarde serviam deliciosos cookies de aveia e água saborizada. A localização é excelente, perto de várias atrações turísticas e de metrôs. O ponto negativo fica por conta do elevador extremamente demorado, na ocasião haviam apenas 2 elevadores funcionando, as vezes ficava 15 minutos esperando, portanto: organize-se para sair um pouco antes do hotel.

title: Junior Terrace Suite - Great Accommodation
text:
Th HGI New York Central Park South is a lovely hotel, that I would describe as a middle scale to upper scale hotel, but not luxury. It has everything one would expect from an HGI. The hotel is in a very accessible area. The 54th Street Orange line subway stop was about a 3-minute walk away to the southeast. Central park was maybe (at best) an 8-minute walk north. The shops of Columbus Square where also about an 8-minute walk away depending on how fast you walk. It is close to Times Square if that is your thing, but it is not directly in TS which we thoroughly enjoyed. Basically, you can get anywhere in the city from this location. There's plenty to eat in the immediate vicinity from cheap eats to 5-star dining. I personally loved the Lenwich around the corner, they have the best blueberry muffins!  Both my husband and I tried the ribeye meals from Empire and they were nothing to write home about especially considering the cost. 

We chose the Junior Terrace Suite which by NYC standards is huge at a little less than 400 sq ft. Shot out to Carl W from Madison, WI... here on TA as he highly recommended the room and he was dead on! There are only two Junior Terrace Suites and both are on the 20th floor each with a terrace that is bigger than the room. We were given room 2006 which I initially wasn’t happy about as I wanted to face the east. 2006 faces the west, but I found that while both rooms are private 2006 was even more private because it didn’t have the Marriott Residence Inn/Courtyard where people could easily look down onto the terrace. 

Our only qualm with room 2006 was that there is an office bldg. that faces the patio door. The patio door does not have any type of covering (I recommended some type of curtain or blinds to management, let’s see if they make any changes). The problem with this is that the patio door also faces the bathroom, so don’t walk around naked near the door if you are concerned with privacy. I learned the hard way when I walked out from taking a shower with only my towel on and the office worker starring right in the room. The room was kept immaculately clean and stocked with the basics. I enjoyed that the bathroom had a vanity with seating where I could do my hair and a lighted makeup mirror. 

We loved that this particular location offered paid laundry especially considering it's in the city. The laundry was expensive and cost $2.75 to wash and $2.75 to dry, but again it is available and if you want clean clothes like me, it’s a life saver – overall well worth the cost with minimal effort. Bring your own detergent because it is really expensive to get it from the hotel. 

All in all we recommend this hotel, based upon our stay in the Junior Terrace Suite. We can’t speak to any other room type as we haven’t stayed in those. However, the staff were friendly and would go above and beyond for you and the accommodations comfortable.

title: Nothing fancy but does its job.
text:
Stayed for 4 nights in February .

Hotel is in good location for tourist attractions, many are within walking distance .The subway stations are a 5 minute ( slow pace) walk. 

The concierge staff were pleasant and helpful on all occasions I dealt with them. On both phone and in person.

Lifts were very hit and miss but enough has been said about them in other reviews. Our longest wait was 5 minutes ( 4 night stay) 

Our room was on the 15th floor. 
We did not get the 2 beds I had requested. The bed we did get was big and comfy. Luckily my teenage daughter did not mind sharing with her mum. The room was very clean and had everything we needed. Safe was easy to use. The fridge, coffee machine and microwave all very clean. We did have noisy neighbours for 2 nights of our stay but nothing having the telly on didn't disguise . Wifi was crap ( even when we paid for the upgrade) and choice on tv channels was not so good.  Overall the room was fine, no problems .
 
Two members of staff that stood out.

Pro - The cleaning lady - did an amazing job everyday and was so well mannered and polite. Always said good morning and always smiling. 

Con - One of the doormen was quite frankly rude. He helped us into the hotel with our suitcases on our arrival . I did tip him but maybe he was not happy with the amount as he ignored us for the rest of our trip. One day he ignored my daughter and I when we were entering the hotel with lots of shopping bags and struggling with the revolving door. He definitely saw us and made a conscious decision not to help. We were then waiting in the lobby for the lift and had all our shopping bags placed on the floor.  The manager of the hotel then appeared in the lobby and was stood right near us talking to another member of staff.  He looked at our bags and then was looking around. Suddenly the very unhelpful doorman who had ignored us for 3 days and had just blatantly watched us struggled appeared. Big smile on his face and acting like we were old friends. Said to us loudly " I can't believe you didn't let me help you with all those bags "
I personally am not bothered by the fact he ignored us during our visit but his action on this occasion got under my skin as it was done to deceive his boss. Shame on you. 
I am disappointed with myself for forgetting his name, he was the taller and larger framed doorman. 

The other doorman who was smaller in height was very nice and friendly and gladly hailed us a taxi for our return trip to airport. He was very grateful for the tip I provided. 

Overall this hotel is acceptable for what you pay.

title: Elevators will drive you crazy!
text:
This is a very well-located hotel. The rooms were small, but not a problem. Interesting views from the 25th floor. The restaurant and bar were very nice. The staff was incredibly helpful...everyone of them, without exception. We registered to check in early, but the room was not ready when we arrived. Though they charged us for the early check-in, when I pointed out the error, they refunded it immediately. The lobby was small and crowded every single time we came in our went out. Always there were people in line.

Only three elevators for a large 35 story hotel. They posted signs warning of long waits. We had friends who waited 30 minutes for an elevator one morning. Absolutely unacceptable. First time and last time at this location. The HGI on 8th Avenue has six elevators for a much smaller hotel and it is closer to theaters and subway. Much better option all the way around.

title: Not For Diamond Members
text: They charged a Diamond Member $16.00 for WiFi and never provided an invoice after I requested that one at least be e-mailed to me at checkout. I had to look up the invoice on the website to discover the error and then lodge a complaint with the Diamond Desk to get a refund. I then had to deal with the fallout of an inaccurate travel report. Unpleasant little hotel that cost me two hours of my personal time for charging me for a well-known Diamond Benefit. I will never stay here again.

title: Wonderful hotel and I would definitely stay there again
text: The rooms were so clean, well decorated and comfortable. The staff was so kind and accommodating. It had a beautiful view. It had all the comforts of home and the location I’d prime. It’s so close to all the wonderful city sites.

title: Нью-Йорк прекрасен, отель-ни о чем
text: Лифт нужно ждать порой по 10 минут. При стоимости номера 367 долларов, с меня списали ещё 283. Это депозит? Ничего себе! А почему не 1000?! Прошло больше суток с момента выезда, деньги не вернули. В крошечный шкаф не умещается ничего! Все коридоры заставлены тележками горничных.

title: Hotel céntrico y tranquilo
text:
Nuestra experiencia fue muy buena, habitación espaciosa, cama cómoda, baño espacioso, buenas vistas...además, todas las mañanas desde bien temprano ponen servicio de té, café y chocolate en polvo en recepción (gratis), el WI-FI es gratis también pero no va del todo bien. Además, ponen aperitivos por la tarde como galletas de canela y pasas y nachos con guacamole. Nos encantó la atención. En NY el agua embotellada es muy cara y nos regalaron un par de botellas el primer día.

Estás a 10 minutos del Top of the Rock y de Times Square y a 15 de Central Park, Empire State Building.

title: Pior experiência possível!
text:
Habituada aos voos que chegam pela manhã em NY, me dirigi ao hotel para solicitar um possível check in early e deixar as malas. 
Para minha surpresa, a tragédia já começou aí. Concedida a antecipação de duas horas na entrada, durante o check in fui obrigada a fazer um depósito no valor de US$350,00 separado da reserva para caso eu “quebrasse” alguma coisa. 
Frise-se que tal depósito não está mencionado na política do hotel disponível. 
A recepção, ou a pessoa que me atendeu, primou por me tratar mal. 
Informei que gostaria de pagar em espécie, o que foi recebido com risinhos entre dentes, com zombaria. 
Quando entrei no quarto MARAVILHOSO a mim destinado no 14º andar, descobri que a vista dava para várias paredes de prédios vizinhos. 
O apartamento era adaptado à deficientes, e o cofre ficava no chão, o que inviabilizou sua utilização, como pode ser checado nas fotos que tirei. 
Tudo era para cadeirante, e eu e meu filho não portamos nenhuma deficiência. 
O banheiro tem barras e uma cortina de tecido faz as vezes de box, o que alaga o banheiro a cada banho. 
Impreterivelmente às 10 da manhã a arrumadeira bate na sua porta para arrumar o quarto. Você tem que se lembrar na noite anterior de pendurar o “não perturbe”. 
Se sair do quarto depois das 10:00, não haverá arrumação. Mas todos os dias a porta do meu quarto era o estacionamento de vassoura, aspirador, carrinho de limpeza. Dia e noite você se deparará com essa cena. Sem dizer que o quarto é sujo, mas aquela sujeira de anos. 
O tal café oferecido no hall e descrito em algumas avaliações como ótimo , é outro show de horrores. 
Ordas de pessoas se acotovelam para pegar algo que eu não consegui nem ver do que se tratava. 
A recepção, além de péssima, parece um depósito sem portas de encomendas. Teve dia que a pilha de caixas chegava perto do teto!!!
Enfim, não encontrei absolutamente NADA do que os hóspedes elogiaram. Fui tratada com absoluto desdém e pouco caso, tratamento esse destinado à todos que pude observar. Esse ridículo hotel em nada lembra algo da rede Hilton. 
Para completar a maravilhosa experiência, ainda que na noite anterior à minha partida meu filho tenha reforçado que o pagamento seria em cash, cobraram uma diária, no valor de US$137,75. 
Quando digo cobraram, não quero dizer pré autorizaram. Fiz o pagamento total em cash, no valor de R$1.054,00. Fizeram tanta confusão e até agora não recebi o estorno da tal diária. O gerente geral veio tentar explicar o inexplicável e não tomou providência alguma. Nos tratam como idiotas!!! Não se hospede nesse lugar... Existem outros muito melhores pelo mesmo valor.
Com certeza receberei deles a resposta que eles copiam e colam para quem faz alguma reclamação. Basta verificar nas postagens. 
Talvez eu tenha tido falta de sorte nos OITO dias que fiquei hospedada lá...

title: Cuidado com as contas
text:
A localização é boa e os quartos são limpos.
Cobram 10 dólares por encomenda recebida em seu nome, ainda que seja um envelope. Não há indicação disso no site.
Cobram 50 dólares por dia de depósito além do valor das diárias. Às vezes o cartão debita tudo e fica mais difícil receber a restituição.
400 apartamentos em 34 andares e apenas 3 elevadores. Há até avisos para você "programar" o horário de uso dos elevadores.
Ar condicionado muito barulhento.
Banheiro com portas de correr, sem privacidade

title: Great experience
text:
Stayed for two nights. Wonderful room and rate, but the staff made the visit exceptional. 
From the time of our arrival to check out staff extremely courteous and helpful. 
Hotel was very busy, yet on day two went out for about 15 minutes. When we returned the room already serviced.
Will definitely return.

title: Nothing fancy but perfect all the same
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights in January as a couple. Having read reviews prior to booking we were a little skeptical as reviews ranged from awful to great. Let me tell you - there is nothing awful about it.

We got a great deal on the hotel, and knew we didn’t want any fancy hotel with grand lobbies as we knew we wouldn’t be in it much. This hotel has a cute and warm lobby for winter, with complimentary tea/coffee and biscuits daily’s, with home made flavoured water and newspapers. Check in was simple - although there was an additional $150 charge as a deposit for any damage which will be refunded that we weren’t expecting. 

The room was adequate size, many reviews complain about the size but it was more than ample for the 2 of us, large king size bed, desk with a chair, wardrobe, safe, TV, full length mirrors and a good size new bathroom with walk in shower. AC worked well when we needed a little warmth. I’ve stayed in many hotels with much smaller rooms. This one was great.

Elevator wait was longest about 1 minute, it’s a hotel of 30 floors and if I’m honest most buildings in NYC will likely have a couple minute wait for elevators due to the sheer size of the buildings. We had zero complaints with this but again were from the UK so to us it seemed reasonable. 

Location was perfect and in walking distance of many NYC attractions, we walked to Empire State which took approx 39 minutes and was a great way to sight see. There are a couple metro stations within a 1 minute walk too which is handy for airport transfers or if you head to lower manhattan. Plenty of food options around ranging from cheap to expensive (we fully recommend the 99cent pizza shop around the corner - ahhhhmazing! And 24 hours, thank me later).

We’d definitely recommend and return here. Thank you Hilton Garden for being a perfect place for us to rest in between busy NYC days.

title: This is not a proper hotel.
text:
This is a guest house. The rooms are clean and the staff are nice. The location is also good. BUT the room service stops at 10.30pm. There is no mini bar or even bottle openers in the room. No robes, no gel, and for a period - no hot water.

If you are looking for a decent, clean, place to stay (and don’t mind waiting on the elevators) then this is fine.

It is however not a hotel in the normal sense - rather a place to sleep which has facilities you may use at its own convenience.

title: Poor customer service
text:
When paying for my stay at check in, I also had to pay a deposit. At checkout I was assured this deposit would be refunded right after.
However instead of refunding Hilton took another payment for my whole stay. So in the end I payed the whole amount twice. No one at Hilton seems to be bothered to get into this, let alone making things right again. I would call this pure theft. Not amused..

title: Nice stay; convenient location
text:
Hard to beat the location.  Restaurants, theaters, shops, subways and Central Park all within easy walking distance of the hotel. 

 In light of all the activity going on all around, the place is surprisingly quiet.  The room was comfy, if small, but well appointed and kept clean daily.  Comped Wifi worked great.  Elevators worked, but they can be slow at times with all the traffic.

Desk staff friendly and efficient.

title: Excellent rapport qualité prix, accueil irréprochable
text:
Nous avons réalisé un séjour d'une semaine dans cet hotel. Le check in s'est déroulé facilement et rapidement, le personnel est très accueillant et au service de leurs clients. Le hall n'est pas très grand mais agréable et du café à volonté est offert le matin. Les après-midis, de l'eau infusé est offert ainsi que des cookies. La chambre était plutôt cosy et agréable malgré sa petite taille. La salle d'eau est grande et pratique. Seul petit bémol: le ménage n'était pas irréprochable même si tout à fait correct.
Je recommande cet hôtel également pour l'emplacement: à côté de Times Square et Central Parc, parfait pour visiter tout Manhattan!

title: コスパが良く安全で便利！
text: ３泊しました。タイムズスクエアや５番街など徒歩圏内で、メトロの駅にも近く、とても安全で便利な立地でした。周りにカフェやレストランも多く、一人での３泊ニューヨーク旅行にはよかった。部屋はそんなに綺麗ではないが、値段と立地を考えるといいと思う。ただエレベータの数が少ないため、乗るのに十分程度待つことも（チェックインとチェックアウトの時間帯）。

title: Never again! Disappointed!
text: I paid for a basic hotel service, but still, basic should mean clean and comfy, with a good customer service.. not what I got! getting a left takes you around 30 minutes, breakfast is very poor, and above all .. not good experience dealing with the manager on duty!

title: Disappointed member
text: Very unhappabout the messed up elevators and the issues with check in and check out. I’m in the military and don’t have much money for trips like this so spending the money and my family not happy because of the hassle of the room being split up, extra charges for the room, and elevators being messed up just caused issues!

title: Excellent option for a short stay near Manhattan theatres
text: We stayed here for one night after a two-part Broadway show. The rooms are small but typical for Manhattan, very clean, and everything worked the way it should. The staff was very friendly, accommodating our check-in right at 3pm--this involved a move from the room we selected on the app to one that was ready earlier, but this ended up being quieter and closer to the ground floor. The elevators are very slow, so we typically used the stairs to get to our 4th-floor room. Overall, a great value for a quick overnight stay, very conveniently located to the 1 and C/E trains to get to Penn Station, without being smack in the middle of Times Square.

title: Deposit for Room
text: We are arriving on Monday 27th January, please can you advise if we have to pay a deposit as we were advised by Virgin Holidays that we dont. Please advise thank you. Can you advise about the water and coffee in the room will we have to pay for these? As there are 3 adults travelling, is a high floor best?

title: Excellent spot in Theater District.
text: The hotel is located close to most theaters. Walling distance to the Park. Staff was amazing. Location is great. Super clean, even the curtains smelled good and fresh. Decent sized room, very nice bathroom - the sliding bathroom door was a bit odd - but not too big of a deal. Close to 54 Below and other nightlife spots, and great restaurants next door and across the street.

title: Sleepless in NYC
text:
This hotel was nice and in a very convenient  location.  
However,  the bed was like sleeping on lumpy concrete.  Needless to say that we were very disappointed and felt that this was beneath Hilton's standards, in our experience.

title: Location location location!
text: The location is amazing. A couple of blocks to Central Park, a couple of blocks to Times Square, but not in the crazy thick of the city. There is a police detachment a block away so there is frequent sirens but that's New York. Also, the honking! We were on the front side of the hotel, so above the street, sixth floor ... if you open the window a crack, you can see that the windows are pretty good at keeping out the bulk of the noise. The room was absolutely fine. Some reviews had complained about the size but for NYC, we thought it was quite generous. Also very clean, fresh and nice beds. People have complained about the elevators and, yes, sometimes you have to wait, but rarely caused us a problem. Really happy with the place!

title: Great location - worn rooms & beware of rooms sandwiched between elevators!
text: Great location. Rooms look worn - there was glitter ground in the carpeting. Room location was problematic 1. Was to be “city view” but being one of the shorter buildings means it’s just the side of buildings and 2. Our room was between two elevator shafts. Dueling dings and elevator motors at all hours does not assist sleep...

title: Security Deposit not returned
text:
The hotel has a great location and is practically walking distance from everywhere. The facilities are great, the room is clean and the staff were amazing. 
However, the hotel charges security deposit and advice for it to be released within 7-10 business days of your checkout. It’s now been 3 weeks since my stay at the hotel and they still HAVENT RETURNED THE DEPOSIT. The hotel does not give clear or prompt responses even after many emails and calls.

title: Wonderful Location
text:
We stayed one night in this hotel before Christmas. The location was great - near the Broadway shows and Central Park.  The room was nice and clean. It was small but this is not unusual for rooms in New York City. There was good use of space in the room.

The crowded lobby and the hotel elevators were somewhat challenging, though. It involved some wait but not unreasonably so. The staff were nice, but there was no acknowledgment of Diamond Status or offer of an upgrade. I had to point out that I was a Diamond member before the free breakfast was offered. 

Overall, the stay was ok. I had good value because it was a Sunday night. I would consider staying here again.

title: What a location!
text: We just got back from spending a week staying in this hotel and while some of the reviews I read before booking have merit, some of the complaints need to be taken with a grain of salt...so to speak. The location of the hotel is fantastic, so centrally located, surrounded by everything you could want or need. Yes, it's a narrow, tall hotel, so the lobby can be crowded, but we never found it a real problem. There are only three elevators, true, so you have to be patient. We never had to wait an unreasonable amount of time. Our room was really nice, not at all the tiny, cramped hovel some people described. It was spotlessly clean, very modern, comfortable and surprisingly quiet, considering we were on the front of the building. Staff were friendly and professional.

title: Always a great stay here
text: Clean rooms, courteous staff, centrally located to everything, including shopping, food courts, restaurants, theater district and central park. The only issue is the complimentary wifi is very slow and spotty and the digital key only unlocked my room door and not the elevator and or other rooms , there's also a great restaurant on the site as well

title: Very good choice to visit Manhattan
text:
This hotel is very well located, minutes from Times Square, the 5th Avenue and Central Park. The staff were very friendly thoughout our stay and the rooms are very complete even featuring a microwave in case you take some takeaway in the NY style.

The only negative comments would be that the rooms tend to be small and the elevators can get crowded at peak hours.

Will definitely repeat on the next trip!

title: A éviter
text: Hôtel bruyant ( air conditionné extrêmement bruyant, porte des chambres qui claquent impossible de les fermées doucement). Moquette qui sent mauvais. Personnel ne parlant pas un mot de français. Nous sommes restés 10 jours, pas sûre que nos draps aient été changés durant notre séjour.

title: Capodanno a New York
text:
Hotel vicino a Central Park e Times Square.
Personale gentile e disponibile. 
Camere pulite e bellissima vista.
L'unica pecca è il bagno perché la porta non si chiudeva benissimo e nella TV non c'erano programmi italiani

title: Natale a NY
text: Posizione ottima, vicino a Central Park, Times Square e Rockefeller Center. Check-in veloce, gentilezza e cortesia. L'unica cosa da migliorare, se proprio vogliamo trovare un difetto, potrebbero essere gli ascensori: ce ne sono solo 3 per 34 piani.

title: Clean
text: Very clean hotel. Great location. We stayed there to see a Broadway show and it was so close. A Starbucks is close by too! We would definitely stay here again. The Empire Steakhouse (attached you lobby) was amazing.Inwas very nervous to valet park but it was  Super easy. $70 for overnight parking.

title: hôtel bien situé mais prestations très moyennes
text:
Nous avons séjourné en famille (3 personnes) pour 4 nuits durant la dernière semaine de décembre.
le personnel d'accueil est peu avenant et aucune envie de comprendre un touriste avec un accent français.
La chambre manquait de rafraîchissement et  petite pour accueillir 2 lits King size. Des installations très bruyantes : un frigo et un chauffage qui font du bruit . nous avons débranché le frigo mais pas le chauffage car nous étions l'hiver.
Nous avions pris le petit déjeuner dans la réservation. La prestation restauration est plus que moyenne; un buffet qui se résume à des oeufs brouillés, du bacon et des saucisses, le tout trop cuits, du pain de mie ou bagel, de la crème de fromage et de la gelée de confiture. Rudimentaire pour un 4 étoiles.
Nous avons versé une caution de 200 dollars au cas on nous ferions des dégâts. Elle ne nous a pas été restituée à la fin du séjour. A ce jour nous n'avons pas eu la restitution.

title: Incredible service
text:
We were happy with the hotel location as it is pretty close to both Central Park and Time Square, but I couldn’t imagine how good my family could be serviced in a hotel.
Here I highlight an staff person called Brian, who really saved us from stay stucked in Manhantan on Dec 31 st. As all the streets got closed for the New Years eve, this guy took all the efforts to get us in an Uber safely and on time! Once again, thanks to Brian!

title: Pésima atención. Los elevadores son un caos.
text:
El personal del frontón desk es poco amable.

Para hacer el check inn, EL GERENTE tenía un desastre con la fila ocasionando por él. El mismo GERENTE, que “exige” tarjetas de crédito cuando la reserva está completamente pagada, sin dar ningún tipo de explicación.

Ese mismo GERENTE me asignó una habitación con vista a la pared, cuando había pagado una con vista a la ciudad.

Los elevadores son 3 y viejos, y paran cada piso. Así que ya se imaginarán para subir a o bajar de un piso 31...

El personal del front desk está esperando propina para todo. Mi esposa compró una Coca Cola en recepción, y le pidieron por propina únicamente por cobrársela!

Mi recomendación sería invertir un poco más (considerando que es caro Nueva York) o hacer la búsqueda con más anticipación, para tener otro hotel.

title: Hotel like Home
text: The staff is very helpful, friendly, and kind. The location is perfect if you are intersted seeing historical sites and nature in midtown and upper east side. There are a lot of sites to see and restaurants nearby.

title: Hilton New Year experience
text: Fui a recibir el año nuevo , el servicio del hotel es muy bueno . En cuanto a amabilidad del personal. El desayuno es excelente. La cena de año nuevo fue maravillosa. En un ambiente de alegria y cordialidad. Es hermoso entrar con frio de la calle y poder servirse un cafe caliente y unas galletas o un agua con chocolates y caramelos, en el lobby como atencion del hotel.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn.  The staff was particularly helpful and friendly.  The restaurant staff was also very friendly.  We had a wonderful time.and would recommend the hotel and restaurant to others.

title: Good Location, Decent Staff, Clean
text: My husband picked the hotel and it was all about a convenient location to places like Time Square, Bryant Park, Shopping, Empire, etc. The lobby is very small and there is a decent restaurant next door. The elevator is slow but heck, patience is required in NYC during busy holiday time. Our room was very clean and nice, and the staff everywhere from front desk check in, service crew sometimes using elevator, even by the bathrooms in lobby level, were professional and friendly. We arrived where my husband was a bit tired and grumpy and I apologized to the front desk lady and she offered me a chocolate bar to cheer us up. It may seem simple but that did help. If you are looking for a hotel with a big lobby, lobby seating and extras, you won't find it here. If you are looking for a hotel that is clean and close to tourist attractions, it is decent. We liked the Empire Steakhouse next door for dinner too. I didn't think our room was overly small - it had a big bathroom and plenty of space around bed area, etc.(There are other Hiltons not far from this one - be sure your taxi driver drops you off at the right one - Our's did not and we had to walk backtracking, not fun!) There is a dunkin donuts around the corner and also a couple breakfast places that we liked too.

title: Attenzione alla carta di credito.
text: Hotel in posizione abbastanza centrale, vicino ai teatri e a Time Square. Le camere sono molto piccole, abbastanza rumorose e i tempi di attesa per salire o scendere con l’ascensore, interminabili. Inoltre, una volta tornati a casa, abbiamo scoperto addebiti sulla nostra carta di credito, riguardanti bottiglie d’acqua mai consumate. Sconsiglio decisamente.

title: Perfect Location for Holiday in New York
text: We just came back from NY and the hotel was perfectly located walking distance from Central Park, radio city hall, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller center, time square, etc. It was awesome to be able to walk everywhere without having to take a taxi or a subway. Highly recommend!

title: Good
text:
Well , it’s not 4 stars , it’s 3 

The room is clean , it’s included Microwave and coffee machine, but  it’s too too small , smallest room i have ever seen.

The breakfast doesn’t have alot of things to the vegetarians , there’s no variety food 

When I order an Water to my room , they told me come by your self , we don’t have a room service !!!!!!! 

But there’s a man his name is Conrad , he is the best and the best and the best and so helpful ❤️❤️Thanks Conrad for everything 

The location it’s great , a little steps to Time Square

title: À éviter
text: Un ascenseur sur 3 souvent en panne, ce qui oblige parfois à attendre plus de 15 minutes pour monter ou descendre dans ce building de 33 étages. Petite chambre, sans aucune vue. Piètre service, si ce n’est les cookies pour le goûter dans le hall d’entrée.

title: Best Location in NYC
text: The location is perfect if you want Times Square but far enough away from the noise.  Close to Central Park and surrounded by great Restaurants.  Staff is very helpful, rooms are comfortable and clean.  Breakfast was fantastic.

title: GOOD LOCATION, GREAT STAFF
text: Small rooms, noisy heater, hallway noise and slamming doors was bothersome during our stay. Staff was very nice and polite. Check in was very hectic in a small and claustrophobic lobby, Great location to hit tourist spots.

title: December visit
text:
The placement of this hotel was good proximity to the city however the lifts were so slow, we were on a lower floor so often just used the stairs cause the wait was so long. 

The rooms were good with a microwave, coffee machine and fridge supplied. The beds were comfy and a safe also provided. However when we called about a ceramic mug and bowl being sent up to the room, we were told they didn’t have any. Seemed a bit odd to me as there is a restaurant attached to the hotel. 

The only other issue was with items such as extra toilet paper or cups not turning up despite reception saying it was fine and they’d be up ASAP, but they never arrived.

title: Diamond member - Disappointed
text: Everyone was friendly, at least fake it till you make it. That can only go so far. I had checked in on line, to minimize wait at 9pm, chose my room 2113, which was on inventory. Well they decided to change it to 1013, bc of ‘plumbing issue’ but 2113 will be available tomorrow, 🤔 but not today. Meanwhile a clump of hair in 1013 on white bed spread, hard to miss. After speaking with management, they changed our room to 2013, after ‘not having a room to accommodate’ my original confirmed room selection by Marissa. Then 2013 heat wouldn’t work, kept going on/off even at 75, temp was showing at 69. The shower door wouldn’t close, so besides bath mat being soaked, had to put extra towels to avoid slipping in an already small space. Next morning, went down for coffee, empty container. Told the concierge desk - her comment to me ‘can you just tell the front desk yourself, because I’m tired of getting up and telling them’. 😳🤔. 10 minutes later, the coffee was replaced. There was no urgency, no attention to detail to make your stay without issue, they are just there to help him be there. This treatment is to their Diamond Hilton honors member and a card holder. Very disappointed in the lack of customer service & accommodations. Not big issues, but won’t be staying there again.

title: Great location, limited privacy
text:
Stayed for 5 days. 
Very convenient location and a pretty fair price.  
Average decor and ambience. Clean rooms and has complimentary WiFi.
Friendly and helpful staff.

A few things one should be aware of. 
The rooms are small. But then you’re probably not planning on spending a lot of time there. The water in NYC in quite chlorinated and the 500 ml bottles in the room are 3$ each! 
The bathroom door in the room is a sliding door that cannot be locked and you can hear everything going on in there - as well as in the rooms next to yours. 
The elevators are a story in themselves. 3 of them try to pull the weight of transporting guests from 400+ rooms. Needless to say, you’ll be waiting quite a while. 
There’s no complimentary breakfast, but an overpriced restaurant adjacent to the lobby with a below average breakfast. 
You can hail a cab right outside. We were wrongly informed by the staff in the lobby that all prices to get to the airport go up on rainy days, while she tried to sell us the hotel shuttle service for 85$ for four people. Yellow cabs have a fixed rate of 52$+toll, coming to around 60$ total.

title: Excelente opción, cerca de todo.
text: Magnífica ubicación. Muy cerca de Central Park, Broadway y Times Square. El personal sumamente atento y dispuesto a ayudar. Las habitaciones de buen tamaño, muy limpias, remodeladas y bien mantenidas.

title: Cold Night!
text: The night I checked in the heater in the room did not work and I was freezing throughout the night. In the morning I called to advise the front desk and they sent an engineer up. Pedro was great. He did everything he could. He thought he had it up and running and came back later to check on it. It seemed to be warming up but then it stopped again. He came in with a portable heater to help make it through the night since it was cold yet again. The front desk advised that they did not have a room available at the moment and due to my schedule I was unable to wait until later in the evening to switch rooms. I was in town attending my company holiday party which was that evening and I knew I would be back in my room late so I dealt with the portable heater that Pedro provided me. It did what it had to do but I feel like changing my room should have been a priority that morning when I called them about it. The rooms are small which is expected in NYC but they were clean. The bathroom sink did not drain properly but aside from those issues I would have been satisfied with my stay. I just don't feel it was handled properly from the moment I called.

title: Management and staff issues and overpriced
text: Stayed here for two nights on a quick visit to see the Christmas nights and attend a play. Location is great, accomadations are adequate. Rooms are small, which is expected in NYC.  When I discovered that our room was across form the elevators, I asked to switch.  I was advised that all rooms were across from three elevators, except for rooms that had adjoining doors, which we did not want for noise and security issues. Later that evening, recieved a text from manager asking to try and make things right.  These text messages went back and forth, assuring me that they wanted to make our stay a good stay.  I advised that I knew there were not other rooms to go to.  They them offered me a 25.00 gift card, (options for a variety of cards) whcih I inititally took, then returned as I thought that a major hotel chain, charging someone $987.92 for 2 nights, this was ridiuclous.  And yes, I know it is NYC at Christmas time, but please.  Also, did not find that their front counter staff were very helpful.

title: Disappointing Hotel. Management Issues.
text:
Was looking forward to trying out this Hilton.  Good location. 
Beware. Serious issues. 
The bed frames are very poorly designed - with a large steel foot below a wood frame.  
My wife ended up tripping on the steel foot and her knee crashed into the wood frame.  
She called down for ice to reduce the swelling. 
Nobody answered the front desk phone.  Front desk Hung up on her. 
Took an HOUR to get ice. 
A Manager - "Rob" came to her door later and insisted on coming in.  She refused.  He asked what he could do - he agreed to send a bellman at a specific time to get her bag (which she couldn't manage due to her hurt knee), and have a car to the airport waiting for her. 

The bellman was no show.  And nobody answered the phone when she called.  No response from Rob.  She ended up leaving late for the airport. 

The good news - Bellman Anthony finally arrived and took great care of my wife... including bringing her more ice for her knee for the car trip.  I am greatly appreciative of Anthony!

That evening I called and left a clear voicemail for the hotel General Manager - Kevin Cataransone (sp?) to make the hotel aware of my wife's injury to her knee and their many times over service failures. And asked him to call me back.  It's been over 27 hours and no call back from Hilton Garden Inn GM Kevin.  Given our experience at the hotel - I would say that's par for the course with this poorly managed hotel.  Doesn't seem to be any focus on customer service. 

After all that - I will also say that, as a status business traveler who spends over 100 nights per year at hotels in multiple countries - this Hilton Garden Inn has the absolute worst bathroom paper products.  The toilet paper was like sand paper and was so cheap it, it didn't even have places to tear off portions.   And the face tissue was super rough.  If you do choose to stay here - stop at a nearby Walgreens or CVS and get some Kleenex and Charmin before you check in. 

Beware of the bed frame.

title: Room issues, extended elevator wait times, staffing issues
text: Noise in room wall from air in pipes when someone showered (packed up and changed room); thermostat right under air outflow vent left room cold; had to wait again in long line just to pick up key; elevators aren't sequenced to serve lower floors. Great location.

title: Unauthorised credit card charge
text: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and upon check in, we were advised that we are going to be provided two free bottles of water everyday.  When we checked out, we even asked reception whether we owe them anything and they said none.  Two days later, when checking my bank account, we discovered a charge of Aus 39.76.  When we enquired, we were told that it was for the water bottles supplied to us for 7 nights.  When we argued the charge, they replied that since we're not hilton honors club members, we were not entitled to the free 2 bottles of water supplied to us for 7 nights.   I call this a blatant dishonesty on their part since that was not disclosed to us when we checked in and even when we checked out.  WE WILL NOT BE STAYING AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN.  THEY ARE A BUNCH OF LIARS.

title: Good location.
text: This hotel is located close to good shopping and Central Park, which is why I chose it. I was a little disappointed in the size of the room and the price of my stay. The room was clean and quiet which is a big plus.

title: excellent hotel , first impression of employees not the best
text: This hotel is very nice and it has a very good location I enjoyed my time here and would stay again in it. However the first impression the front desk gave me wasn't the best, still after my stay i notice I had left my jacket in the room and the employees where very helpful via phone to try to send me the jacket back so that help with me perspective. Overall the hotel had the amenities I needed.

title: Ugly area with an ugly attitude
text: Very small hotel on an ugly street. Minuscule itty-bitty room (the photos are wide-angled to make it look bigger.) Elevators were a nightmare (too few) — expect long waits. I had a small issue with the way they structured the bill (they split my rate incorrectly since one day was on my honors points.) The hotel and corporate then wasted an hour of my time while simultaneously treating me like an annoyance. I ended up just paying it and leaving; not worth the $50 aggravation. The manager offered me a few thousand Hilton points (worth about $1.50 I think) and acted like he was doing me a massive favor. After getting treated so poorly by this hotel staff and by corporate, I no longer wish to use Hilton for my school or for any personal trips. There are other chains that value my business more.

title: Only if you have to
text: Only if you have to stay here wold I suggest you give it a try. Staff is surly and not helpful. Rooms were okay and the lobby is tiny and over crowded. If this is the only hotel in town give it a try but keep your expectations low

title: Not appropriate for business travel
text: This hotel is not appropriate for business. The elevators can take 15-20 minutes to get to your floor. You request laundry and they do not do it so you are stuck with dirty clothes. No amenities. Not a viable option for business. And in a very unappealing part of town. Plenty of other NYC properties that are reasonably priced and don’t expect your bar for service to be zero.

title: Not the best... MANY OTHER OPTIONS IN NYC
text: The elevator is a nightmare. Had to walk up and down stairs with my toddler stroller and diaper bag. Arrived at check-in at 3pm as per reservation, my room was not ready till 4:45. I expected more from Hilton.

title: Where we stay
text: 4 out of 6 NYC trips this year we stayed here.  It is updated, clean, fridge in every room and close to a lot.  The staff is extremely friendly...not one bad experience, seriously even staff jumping on elevators were feiendly.  We will stay here next time we go to NYC again.

title: Disappointing Stay
text:
We only stayed here for a couple of nights and it was very busy! Elevator waits were long although they did warn us that they would be! We had no cold water in our room and the plumbing was very noisy! The door on our bathroom would not stay closed. There were cleaning supplies & equipment in the hallway virtually all the time! 
The room was comfortable and clean! The location was excellent! Breakfast was very good as well!

title: Good Location, Decent Price, Decent Hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel when we attended the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.  The hotel is only a few blocks south of Central Park and a few blocks north of Times Square and close to many of the theaters.  So, it is a good spot for a lot of what you may want to do in NY.  The entrance is a bit hidden and the lobby is very small.  The room was good -clean, comfortable but very small.  There was very little room between the beds and the counters/dressers.  But, we didn't spend much time there - so, it was fine.  The staff was friendly and even greeted us when we returned to the hotel.  I would definitely stay here again.  The only issue we had was our phones did not charge at night.  I think their outlets must not have much power.

title: Below standards
text:
This hotel and stay overall was disappointing.
Everything was below par or at the best mediocre.
Location obviously is good depending where you want to be on Manhattan.
Everything feels cramped. The lobby is not spacious. Many have complained about elevators and there’s always waiting. Just two worked out of three when we were there. The elevators are also small. It is a tall 34 floor building and I assume plenty of floors and rooms. Elevator capacity just is not adequate. 

The corridors are narrow and the room follows the suit. Small.
This wouldn’t matter actually to me that much if everything was otherwise fine.
Unfortunately that is not the case.

Soundproofing was very poor. We had a family with small children next door. They made a lot of and constant noise. Part of it is understandable, that’s what it is to travel with kids.
However the soundproofing is so poor that it felt like the neighbors were inside our room. Every sound and speak can be heard. 

Otherwise room is basic Hilton. Bed only average. I have slept on much better beds in Hiltons.

I booked city view room on top 34th floor. Well, the other buildings surrounding this hotel are even taller. Much taller. So, you can see walls as a city view. It is ok, but don’t expect anything else.

I got a complimentary breakfast based on my Hilton status. It was average quality and offering. The atmosphere was nervous and unfriendly. I had to yield few times waiters looking “busy” and almost walking over me. No smiles, no attentiveness, no friendliness.
I wouldn’t pay for this breakfast.

In the morning the shower didn’t work, no water at all. Eventually the tap stopped working too. Things happen, I understand. This was an unexpected incident. 
Anyway, we couldn’t take a shower nor wash ourselves. Not a good start for a day. 
When I mentioned about it when checking out, the receptionist was nonchalant. Basically he didn’t care. I politely suggested an idea of compensation as the receptionist didn’t himself seem to act. He said, looking bored, that they could give me Hilton points on my account. I accepted that, though felt really disappointed. 
Now, several days later, I checked my account. No points added.

title: Clean, modern hotel in ideal location.
text: The Hilton Garden Inn room size was noticeably larger than other hotels in New York, was clean, had modern amenities and friendly staff.  A great place to stay if you are wanting to be within walking distance to Time Square and Central Park.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: This hotel was in a fantastic location, close walk to both central park and times square but out of the way enough to escape the massive crowds of times square and the main tourist part of the city. Close to broadway and other sites. Room was small but to be expected in NYC. Clean and comfortable. staff were friendly and provided flavoured water each day in the lobby.

title: The room was clean, and that's where it ends
text: Hmmmm....Where to start.  My wife and I booked this place a few months ago, and I didn't really read the reviews (I'll never do that again).  So we board our plane in Dallas at 6am, and I receive an email telling me my debit card has been declined, and we were about to have our reservation cancelled if I didn't "back it up" with another card.  I have a $1000 per day spending limit on this card and they were trying at 6am, almost 3.5 hours before I arrived to charge the entire "authorization" on it.....I had fully intended to using a regular credit card.  I have been a Hilton Honors member for close to 25 years and have never heard of a hotel charging or authorizing a card BEFORE you set foot on the property!  So I call the hotel, and as the door to the plane was closing and the flight attendant was repeatedly asking me to get off the phone, I gave them my credit card.  We arrive at the hotel at 11:30am, and we are told that the rooms aren't ready yet.  Okay, I get that, it's fairly early and they need to be cleaned.  So we leave all of our luggage with the front desk bellman, and I am ask for my name and phone number by one of the clerks, and am told that I will be called to texted when a room is ready.....sounds great.....so my wife and I head out to the city to eat and explore.  5pm....no call, no text......so we head back to the hotel, and I look at the same clerk and inquire why no call or text, he just stares at me.  No answer at all.  We are given a room on the 13th floor (weird, but ok).....we board the elevator (it actually happened to be working) and go to the room.....the room was situated between 2 elevator shafts.  You could hear the elevators on each side going up and going down.  I call the front desk to ask for another room, and the young lady precedes to argue with me telling me this was one of their most "popular rooms".....I cannot make this up.  So I implore her to PLEASE give me another room NOW!  About 10 minutes later, we are met at the elevators by the young lady, who gives us a key to a room on the 14th floor.  The rooms was nice, CLEAN and fairly quiet...really all I ask in a room.  The elevators.  The elevators for this property SUCK.  There are 3 separate elevators, and for the entire 5 day stay at least one of them was broken.  You can expect at times ro wait close to 10-15 minutes for an elevator.  Then there was the concierge.  She asked me one morning in the lobby of I was a Hilton Honors member.  I said I was and she asked my if I wanted to earn 60,000 Hilton Honors points.  I said sure, and was directed to make an appointment to the "Hilton Club" on 57th street.  My wife and I went, and spent the next 2 hours (which if they would have cut the schmoozing and the BS down should have taken 45 minutes) being "sold" on a timeshare.  We finally refused, and were told we needed to speak to a sales manager.  I am, and have been a sales associate, sales manager, and a national sales manager for a number of fortune 500 companies in my life, and i have NEVER, EVER been spoken to in a manner that this woman spoke to my wife and I.  We were told we were "stupid" for not signing up and we needed to this immediately before this opportunity went away.  We flatly refused and left.  I have yet to receive my 60,000 points and I am not confident I will ever see them.  I have read many of the other "negative" reviews, and while I can see and understand what a thank-less business it must be running a hotel, the same problems that the manager of this property keeps apologizing for on this site, continue to happen.  I would think long and hard about ever staying at this hotel agin or recommending it to friends or family.

title: Elevator is a disaster. Water not working at times
text:
This has the potential to be a great hotel due to it’s central location for tourists and it is a nice building which is kept very clean. 
The main downfalls have been the elevator service and the fact the water in the bathrooms didn’t always work at peak times.
It seems there is not enough lifts for the size of this building and we waited 20-40 mins for a lift to the lobby at times. There was often one or two out of the 3 lifts out of service. On one occasion, the small lift cab was so packed and it took so long to get down to the lobby, that a gentleman collapsed and an ambulance had to be called when we got to the lobby-the lift stopped on every floor from 34 down to 1!!! A scary experience!!! Would recommend asking for a room closer to ground level so that you can use the stairs in the case of the lift not working/ lift too busy (which seems to be a few times daily).. 

Our room was a good size for NYC standards and it was clean. We were on the top floor (34th) and there was a nice view of other tall buildings in Manhattan. 

I was taking a shower at 08:00 on my first morning here and all of a sudden there was no water.. which was very annoying!! The next evening, my partner was taking a shower and the water started violently spitting as if there was an issue with the pressure! Another time, I ran the tap and some brown water came out before it ran clear. Obviously a serious issue with the plumbing in this building!!!

If they could sort the lift and the plumbing, it is definitely a hotel I would recommend.

title: King room with city room and balcony not worth it.
text: As a Hilton Honours member I opted for an upgrade offer to have King Room with terrace and city view ( 30 dollars a night extra ) . In the event it was a room in second floor above the bar which was noisy and the view was the bar opposite . Suggest you opt for standard room .

title: Hôtel bien situé
text: Hôtel proche de Central Park et de Time Square. Accessible facilement par le métro depuis JFK. Bon rapport qualité prix pour les prestations et pour NY. Chambre spacieuse, éviter celles proches des ascenseurs.

title: Good location and price.
text: Ideal location, generous size of the room which is clean and comfortable. The price is reasonable too. I would strongly recommend it to anyone. But the breakfast is really disappointing becasue the choices are limited and it is expensive. If you can, don't take it at the hotel.

title: Excelente!!
text:
Localização excelente. Quarto confortável, limpo e completo (até microondas - o que é um grande diferencial pra quem viaja com criança).
A única dificuldade realmente é o elevador em horários de pico - chegamos a ficar mais de 10min esperando o elevador no checkout. Mas isso não tira o mérito do excelente hotel.

title: A GREAT PLACE TO STAY
text: Two frenchies in NYC....We stayed in the South Midtown West Hilton Garden during five nights....Everybody was careful, patient, kind always available and smiling ! What a pleasure...The place is very well located...An excellent hotel !

title: Regular Guest
text: I've stayed at this Hilton Garden Inn several times.  It's just a few blocks south of Central Park.  I've done morning walks in the park since it's so close.  Clean rooms, quiet and great staff.  The only negative is that at times you have to wait a while for elevators.  Other than that, great place to stay.

title: Not what I expected
text: I stayed here for the New York Marathon, and anything that could go wrong basically did. I am a Hilton Awards member, and it did not help me with this stay. Members of my family whom are not and booked through a travel agent were treated much better than I was. I was given an occupied room at first, and when I went to the front desk about it, I was asked about the race of the person who was in the room. I'm not sure why that mattered. When I booked the room, I asked for a room that was away from the elevator because of the noise, and instead, got a room right next to the elevator. I also booked a room with "snacks" and I often had to remind the front desk about the snacks because they didn't restock them. Additionally, in the room, there was a constant blinking of the smoke detector light; it was almost like a strobe light, but less consistent. There are plenty of hotels in New York with a similar location; I recommend you stay at one of those for a better experience for the same price.

title: Great location
text: Very nice hotel with comfortable rooms.great location in the centre of Manhattan.great value for money.our room was clean and the staf very kind and helpful.our room was on the 15th floor and the elevator was very late to come.we defenetly recommend it.

title: Decepcionada
text:
