espera más x ser Hilton... algunos empleados con muy mala onda!! 
Habitación diminuta (para abrír la puerta ppal tenía q abrir la corrediza del baño)
No volvería nunca más! 
Hay miles opciones x mismo precio!

title: Well located hotel
text: Good location. Walkable to Times Square, Central Park, great restaurants, etc. Room a little small but good for 1-2. Very clean. Comfortable bed. Friendly and accommodating staff. Had room service once and food was good. Quiet.

title: Surpreende!
text: Localização ótima, atendimento gentil e rápido. Quarto excelente no tamanho, mobiliário e decoração nova e de ótimo gosto, em especial a cama extra grande, muito confortável para quem passa o dia caminhando. O banheiro igualmente excelente, em especial o chuveiro e a iluminação no espelho (este detalhe para as mulheres faz toda a diferença). Outro ponto positivo é o frigobar comum ( ou seja, para o seu uso) e o microondas que no nosso caso foi útil à noite para esquentar uma bebida chegando de uma noite gelada! Além das duas garrafas d´agua diárias cortesia do hotel, repostas toda manhã. E a cafeteira padrão que é sempre bem vinda para quem gosta do café americano (chafé!) ou um chá. Na recepção diariamente pela manhã fica disponível café e chá e água aromatizada ao longo do dia. Por fim, a disponibilidade de guarda-chuvas na recepção do hotel em dias de chuva também faz a diferença. Uma excelente opção sem dúvidas..

title: Great location, but some small issues
text: Although we arrived a couple hours early, the lobby of the hotel was packed and there seemed to be no attention to new arriving guests as we had to wait for a few other guests, but then just walk up to the desk.  We were finally able to check in about 2:30 p.m.  We really did not like the barn door set-up on the bathroom in our king room.  The door provided NO privacy and it seems Hilton is moving to these in more of their properties and even sharing the room with a spouse, we still desire SOME amount of privacy in the bathroom.  Our first full day, we decided not to have maid service, so in the evening my wife called down to get some additional towels and we waited an hour and still no towels, by this time, I needed to get to sleep for the marathon this next morning so she called back down to cancel and there was no apology for not getting us a few additional towels more quickly.  Finally, the TV had a crack in the screen and was very dark at the top of the screen.  I really felt like for the rate we paid was for the location and convenience of being close to the marathon finish, which was great.  If/when we come back to NYC, we will most likely stay at a different property.

title: Buena ubicación y genial personal
text:
Nos alojamos en este hotel durante cinco noches y he de decir que fue todo un acierto. Para empezar, su privilegiada localización entre Broadway y la 54, a escasos 5 minutos tanto de Central Park como de Times Square. Por otro lado, el personal del hotel en todo momento fueron muy atentos y agradables, hacían todo lo posible por hacerte sentir como en casa. En lo que se refiere a las habitaciones, no eran excesivamente grandes pero lo justo una pareja, y sobretodo y lo más importante: limpias y confortables para descansar en términos de los ruidos y la comodidad de la cama.
Sin duda volvería a repetir.

title: Ótima Localização, Conforto, Hospitalidade e limpeza impecável
text:
Escolhi este hotel pela localização, mas com certeza ficaria novamente. 
Era meu aniversário de casamento, enviei um e-mail pedindo apenas para imprimirem uma foto para fazer uma surpresa ao meu marido, e nos surpreenderam aos dois: Foto impressa, Chocolates, vinho e um cartão escrito A MÃO pelos funcionários do hotel. Não é para morrer de amor? ♥
Os funcionários sempre cordiais e simpáticos...
Quarto relativamente pequeno, porém Super confortável e limpinho. Então para nós, atendeu 100% da expectativa

title: A great option for trip to Midtown
text: Great hotel in a great location. With a great staff who went above and beyond to ensure our stay was everything it could be. Super clean room we received a free upgrade and rooms were clean and comfy our room was exceptionally large for a hotel in New York. Would not hesitate to recommend this place for one second. Thank you Hilton garden!

title: Attenti agli addebiti sulla carta
text: Albergo centralissimo e tutto sommato molto pulito e carino. Sicuramente non economico ma a parte l’importo della camera bisogna stare attenti agli addebiti. Prendono la carta e a parte l’importo prenotato bloccano anche centinaia di euro in più di cauzione senza chiedere alcun permesso e fanno anche addebiti a caso. A noi hanno addebitato post soggiorno delle bottiglie d’acqua MAI CONSUMATE. Non c’è alcun controllo degli addebiti prendono soldi senza chiedere e senza alcuna verifica da parte del cliente. Per questo lo sconsiglio nella maniera più assoluta.

title: Great Location/Mediocre Facilities
text:
The location of this hotel is fantastic as so much is within walking distance - theatres, shops, sites, restaurants and central park. And that makes this hotel.
Otherwise it just does what you expect. 
Acceptable rooms. Sufficient space but not roomy. 
Rooms are quite dark - there is never enough lighting in these hotels and even less so when lights are broken.
Adequate shower pressure.
Decor rather dated.
My husband & I had a room at the back of the hotel and the sound from the A/C for the hotel was quite noisy but also fumes were getting pulled into the room. Our kids were facing the front and had no problem so ask for a room at the front!
Breakfasted here one of the mornings and it was dreadful and seriously overpriced. Far better to find a good breakfast out and about.
There are many floors and not enough lifts. You can have a very long wait.

title: Recent stay Oct 2019
text: This is a perfect midtown location.  The entire property is very clean and feels brand new. The fitness center is more than adequate. The staff is very professional, helpfu and cheerful.  They will go out of their way to help.l

title: Great Location. Friendly Staff. Coffee in lobby. Quiet at night.
text: I walked to Carnegie Hall , Lincoln Center,Broadway shows and even the Frick Gallery on nice autumn days.  Our room was comfortable with a nice shower. It was  clean and quiet at night even though we were across from elevator.  Loved the water and coffee in the lobby.  There can be a wait for the elevator. Be careful if you park across the street in the lot.  They forgot to turn my new 2019 hybrid Avalon off and had to call AAA.

title: TIMES SQUARE Y CENTRAL PARK A UN PASO
text: El hotel se encuentra perfectamente ubicado si querés vivir de manera cercana Times Square y disfrutar del Central Park. Las habitaciones son muy confortables, con todo lo necesario para pasarla de manera excelente. Se lo ve como un hotel moderno y con una atención adecuada. Es altamente recomendable y la zona es perfecta ya que está muy cerca y accesible a varios lugares turísticos de la ciudad.

title: Terrific Location and Excellent Service
text: I enjoyed the location -- close to great restaurants and transportation.  It isn't far from the subway, and a small hop to central park.  The location was great.  I enjoyed the morning coffee service and they even found a room for me where I wasn't overwhelmed by street noise.  The shower was decent.  The room amenities are simply not big enough, but that goes for all of the HGI properties.  I am definitely staying there again.  The falafel cart on the corner was an added bonus for a quick bite and cheap water.

title: Great place to stay and enjoy Manhattan!
text:
This hotel is located in a walking distance fron Central Park in the North and Times square in the South. The rooms are not big, but have all what you need in a good base at such a fascinating City.

There are plenty of restaurants near by and 3 minutes walk to a Subway station. 
 It's nice to see their free coffee at the loby.

title: Bon emplacement
text:
Nous avions choisi cet hôtel entre Time Square et Central Park dans un quartier agréable.
La mauvaise surprise a été l’accueil d’une personne plus préoccupée à enregistrer ces paquets Amazone qu’a Recevoir ses clients.
Aucune sympathie ,aucune envie de comprendre et je parle anglais.
Le personnel pas très sympathique sauf deux jeunes femmes qui s’occupaient des excursions et des  réservation pour les sorties.
Chambre très agréables.
Belle salle de bain.
On vous demande de garder les serviettes c’est normal mais il n’y a rien pour les faire sécher .Résultat elles sont changées tous les jours ,Wy not!!!!!
Dommage pas de salon et un hall bien restreint pour un 4 étoiles.

title: Excelente opção de hospedagem em Nova Iorque.
text: Equipe atenciosa. Quarto limpo e silencioso. Não utilizamos o serviço do café da manhã. Cama extremamente confortável, o que, para quem está em viagem a turismo, considero essencial para um sono reparador! Ficamos um pouco sentidos, pois a despeito de termos informado que estávamos em lua de mel o hotel não proporcionou nenhuma amenidade a mais para nós deixar ainda mais satisfeitos.

title: Outstanding Staff
text: Absolutely amazing hotel staff! Upon our arrival, several of the front desk staff brought a handwritten welcome note along with goodies to our kids to welcome them to New York (their first trip to the Big Apple.) Everyone from the bellman to the housekeeper was friendly and always smiling. The hotel is well located and central to many activities without the noise and traffic. Would definitely stay at this location again.

title: Subpar horrible!
text:
Our room was 213 a view that was a joke a wall with a covering over it the room was small,expected with 2 queen beds where the cabinet was you couldn’t even get to the micro coffeemaker very very tight squeeze And we needed to use our phone light to use the safe No light most of the outlets didn’t work The shower had a leak maintenance did come After many calls And the housekeeper had been making the handle very very tight to stop the leak,Question is hadn’t she ever reported it? We found a glob of something outside our room on the filthy rug,Again,called many many times until someone came 
 On arrival,we left our luggage,upon returning,we waited over Two Hours for it to come up! Constantly had to call for towels.
When I made the reservation,One year ahead,I was told every time the price went down I should call and I did,as the time got closer when I called I was given such a hard time and then the last time the reservation was all of a sudden made non cancel?
We went to the restsurant to have breakfast and we found out ours wasn’t included.proceeded to the reception desk and we were told,every time I got a price reduction,something was taken away,News to me.We literally had to fight to get that back.
  The lobby which many people have commented about is too small ridiculous in fact!
The only positive were the bellmen,they were very helpful.
  Would never recommend!

title: De vacaciones en New York
text: Muy buena atención , fue la tercera vez que me hospedo con ellos. Está muy bien situado, a pocas cuadras de central park , con estaciones cercanasde las principales líneas del metro y a una distancia razonable de Times Square. Habitaciones cómodas , tiene en el sótano un buen gimnasio y un business center si necesitas imprimir alguna reserva o boleto

title: Great hotel
text:
Stayed at the Hilton garden Inn for 5 nights along with my husband and his brother and wife.. Arrived before the 3pm check in so reception allowed us to leave the luggage whilst we went for a look around the area they said they’d give us a call if our rooms were ready before 3pm ( they weren’t ) our room was on the 18th floor and our relatives were on the 11th to have rooms on same floor would mean one couple waiting until room was ready we chose not to wait any longer.
Our room was perfect for our 5 night stay it was immaculately clean and had everything we needed ie iron, hairdryer, coffee machine small fridge microwave etc Towels changed everyday and bed made. My only gripe was the bed frame ( as mentioned in other reviews) I knocked my leg several times so I stuffed a folded towel in the corner of the bed to avoid this. 
Staff always helpful and welcoming 
Great location for getting from A-B 
This may sound a little petty but a need to know if your on a budget there will be 2 bottles of water in your room on arrival which has a tag attached saying FREE to diamond club members everyone else $3 we didn’t drink them as you can pick up water for a $1 on every street corner if I hadn’t read the ticket that would have been a $ 30 charge on checkout 
We felt that NY was very expensive probably because the exchange rate with pounds sterling is so low 
We went to see “ Mean Girls “ at the theatre beware of extortionate prices at the bar. 
A hectic but thoroughly enjoyable stay in the big Apple would definitely use the Hilton again

title: Recomendo
text: Recomendo o hotel, muito bem localizado, próximo de 3 estações do metrô, a poucos metros do  Central Park e principais avenidas de NY, ótimos restaurantes nas proximidades e a poucos metros da Times Square. Localização muito boa!

title: Debated between two or three stars - wont stay again.
text:
The only reason this is getting three stars is because every single employee (besides one) that spoke to us was very kind and they said hello every time we walked in the door.. but I will never stay here again.

When we checked in they had sold out the night before and couldn't give us a room at check in. Fair enough but we're gold members making us prioritized. 3:30 pm comes around and we still haven't received a notification from the app telling us our room was ready and come get our keys so we decided to go to the room. 

The gentleman that checked us in was short and was honestly just bsing us the whole time. He said "let me upgrade you to two queen beds because you're gold!". We thought "okay fine maybe it's a bigger two queen" BECAUSE WE ORIGINALLY BOOKED A TWO QUEEN RESERVATION. It wasn't a larger two queen room it was exactly what we booked but it was supposedly a "free upgrade"... yeah okay...

Pros: 
1) close enough to Times Square but still far enough back where you don't feel like you're in the middle of the madness
2) close to 5th Ave and the shopping there.
3) comfortable beds.

Cons: 
1) no subway access nearby that we could find even thought they advertise that there is
2) fake "free upgrade"
3) extremely slow elevators not even during their "peak time" that they advertise near the elevators
4) not enough room to lay out two suitcases that's how small the room is

Will never stay here again and honestly after three bad experiences back to back with Hilton branded hotels I'm thinking of canceling my credit card and letting my status go away and build status with Marriot.

title: FANTASTIC Staff, food, rooms & location!!!!!:)
text:
Professional & personable!!!!  Marissa & Brennon made it very nice to check in and continued the friendless and helpfulness during our entire stay.  Room was clean, comfortable & quiet.  Christina & Ahsan ensured all questions were answered quickly, addressed my need for a later checkout and provided great tips for eating and sightseeing.  We had reservations midweek in a different hotel by choice because of location and Brian went the extra mile to help us with our luggage.  Highly recommend this hotel.  One of the few with two Queen beds.  Would stay there again:)
Michele

title: Would absolutely stay again!
text: I was very pleased with our one night stay at the Hilton garden inn. The location is very close to Central Park and lots of great restaurants. The room was clean and the king room was larger than we expected for a nyc hotel. Bed was super comfortable too. Definitely will stay there again.

title: Posizione perfetta
text:
Posizione ottima che permette di visitare a piedi Time Square, central park e la 5th evenue, e a pochi metri da 3 fermate della subway, per raggiungere gli altri luoghi della città. 
Albergo dalle "piccole" dimensioni che favorisce un soggiorno tranquillo. 
Camere molto pulite, personale gentile e disponibile. 
Ci torneremo.

title: Good location and rooms however doesn’t seem to care about special celebrations
text: We stayed at this hotel end of October 2018 whilst getting married (eloping) in New York. Location is wonderful. Rooms are good. However, several of the front reception staff knew we were getting married, saw us on the day, it was mentioned in the booking, dry cleaning etc. yet nothing special was done at all which was quite disappointing. It would have been nice to see a note and small token from the hotel at the very least, having spent 11 days in total at the hotel.

title: Not worth it
text: Poor loading and check in experience. Room dimly lit and needed maintenance. Cheap buffet breakfast for $30 per person. Crowded lobby, slower than normal elevators. Concierge not available. Bed too close to one side wall. Hardly any loading space. Long wait for car from valet.

title: Good location great staff
text: First time in NYC.  This was in a great location and the staff were great.  The elevators are a real issue.  One was broken during our stay and ITV seemed staff were using the other rent two almost constantly. I had to walk up and down 18 flights!

title: A good very clean Hotel
text: In general all was good,  no real complaints,  Reviews said it was sparkling clean,  I can say that is true.  The service at the bar/restaurant was not the greatest, but food was good.  Only issue was with billing at front desk,  they charged daily on a card that was not suppose to be charged.  was as guarantee only.

title: Excellent
text: Excellent Staff, excellent housekeeping, great location, very good restaurant for breakfast, very clean, good internet, nice bed and pillows, thank to Luis, Tess, Sarah, Maguie and the housekeeping staff. will recommend and will be back soon...

title: Great location good size comfy room in friendly environment
text: This was a perfect base for exploring NY. We upgraded to a slightly bigger room which was great. Very clean and all staff very friendly. There a nice bar and restaurant on site. Considering we were in the middle of NY our room was very quiet and we had much needed sleep at the end of our day. Would pick this place again

title: Nice Hotel and Good Location
text: The hotel was very nice and clean. The staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful.  The rooms were clean and neat.  The location was good and easy access to subways, Broadway, and Hells Kitchen and other attractions.

title: Will Stay Again
text: Second time here and will be back. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Location CANNOT be beat and staff is EXPERTLY trained in customer service. Front desk always staffed, always greeted by name and with a smile.

title: Good but with issues
text:
This hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, subway station, food etc. Staff friendly. Breakfast is provided in the Empire steakhouse next door (nice bar there)  The amenities are listed on the website so won’t repeat. 
We had a 2 bed room with Terrace and loved being able to walk up stairs to rom as elevators are very slow.  Terrace view limited due to high fence but really that was fine for safety. 
Room was clean, but very tiny and space between the 2 beds or bed and wall not even enough  to leave a carry on open. Bathroom slider leaves an inch gap and handle kept popping off. 
Mixed feelings as the room issues wont change but location and staff nice.

title: Consigliabile con riserva.
text:
Valuto il rapporto qualità/prezzo dell'hotel, la cui stanza è costata 2400 dollari per 8 notti. È vicinissimo a Times Square, Rockefeller Center e Central park e diverse fermate della metro si trovano a breve distanza, il che è estremamente positivo. Le stanze sono abbastanza pulite (mancano di fondamentali attenzioni, come le condizioni del copriletto e il ricambio delle saponette nel bagno) ma molto più piccole di quanto sembri al momento della prenotazione. In coppia si fatica a sistemare i bagagli in modo conveniente e c'è un unico, stretto armadio per sistemare i vestiti. Non basta per una persona sola, figuriamoci per due. Il ricambio della biancheria è giornaliero, il bagno piccolo e poco pratico, specialmente per una donna. Al mattino l'hotel dispone di bevande calde per gli ospiti, al pomeriggio di biscotti e infuso freddo. Il personale è cordiale ma poco premuroso negli inconvenienti in cui si incorre quotidianamente, come le lunghissime e snervanti attese per l'ascensore: un giorno fummo costretti a salire 27 piani a piedi, dopo mezz'ora di attesa davanti agli ascensori. Credo che l'hotel sia più adatto a soggiorni lavorativi per una persona sola che a viaggi di piacere in coppia, in cui si rischia di stare stretti. La parte peggiore è stata la navetta per l'aeroporto, costata più di un taxi, che si è rivelata un furgoncino sgangherato e sporco che ha attraversato Manhattan per fare altre fermate e andare a prendere ospiti da altri hotel. Oltre 2 ore di viaggio su un mezzo scomodo disposto dall'hotel. Inaccettabile. 
La spesa totale per il pacchetto offerto è stata eccessiva.

title: Still a great place to stay
text:
This is my fourth or fifth time at the HGI Central Park South.  The staff still make all the difference between an "ok" stay and a very comfortable visit.  This trip was no exception.  Despite some minor "glitches" staff was very responsive.  Marissa, the front desk manager, was very concerned that three things went wrong - and, to help make up for it, gave me a generous late checkout time and extra points.

My favorite room is the Junior Suite - I love the room size and spending time on the expansive terrace.  It is a shame that some "incident" has forced the removal of the furniture cushions.  I'm hopeful some compromise might be found to restore the comfort of the terrace.  Still, it was lovely enjoying breakfast, one supper, and and evening cocktail while watching the city skyline.

I look forward to returning next year.

title: Great place to stay.
text: We were very pleased with our stay, over all friendly staff was there to help us with all our needs and questions. Food was great  Room was clean, was the most important thing. Great location. Helped us with our cab rides and got our SUV back in great shape from valet parking.!!!!!!

title: Soggiorno  a new york
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo albergo per 6 notti a settembre.
Camera non grandissima ma confortevole. Bagno con una doccia grande.  Camera con cassaforte , tv e wi FI.
Ottimo il servizio e personale molto gentile e disponibile.
Specialmente il check in con luis . Veloce e cortese.
A 5 minuti a piedi da times square ma collegato benissimo anche con metro. 
Sicuramente lo riutilizzerei.

title: Good hotel for a weekend
text:
The hotel is in a great location, close to time square, Central Park, Rockefeller center, etc. There are many subway stations nearby. The bed was comfortable and, although the room seemed clean, the shower had some mold buildup.
I was disappointed that they charge for bottles of water. They charge $3 for small bottles. I recommend visitors to get water from Duane Reade or food trucks. It will be cheaper.

title: great place to stay
text: Good place to stay in New York.  Easy walk to subway, close to everything, room comfy, staff friendly.  Close to some good restaurants.  Free coffee and paper in lobby.  We had one small issue with our room that was taken care.of right away.  If I come back I will stay here again.

title: New York City
text:
Hotel in zona molto centrale vicono ai luoghi di maggiore interesse turistico: Time Square, Rockfeller Center, Central Park e altri.
Hotel con stanze molto piccole più adatto per chi viaggia per la voro e sosta in albergo per non più di una o due notti.
Pulizia nella media, servizi dell'albergo nella media, niente di particolare da segnalare nè in senso negativo nè positivo.
Non adatto a chi si ferma per più notti diciamo da cinque in poi e ha un bagaglio consistente, non esistono all'interno delle stanze standard degli armadi di adeguata capienza.
In coclusione ottimo come ubicazione e adatto solo per un breve pernottamento.

title: Great location and great value
text:
I enjoyed the value (low mid range from what I could observe for the area I was looking for). Outstanding location. Easy walking to Broadway, Central park and the subway.
I had read comments about not enough hot water.  We had plenty.  I also read about the elevators being substandard.  There are three banks for 34 floors so some wait times could be anticipated but we had no issues.  We did notice some non working banks twice, but the maintenance staff remedied the situation quickly.  I would absolutely stay there again.

title: Ottimo con riserva
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo albergo per 12 notti e credo di averne conosciuto a fondo sia gli aspetti positivi che quelli negativi. Partiamo dai primi: posizione fantastica e assolutamente strategica (si arriva in pochi minuti a piedi a Times Square, a Central Park, al MoMA o sulla 5th Avenue), camera molto spaziosa e pulita, personale estremamente accogliente e disponibile, caffè complimentary la mattina e infuso freddo durante il pomeriggio.
Le note dolenti: scarsa attenzione nella pulizia del bagno (saponette usate e flaconcini vuoti lasciati nella doccia), scarsissima manutenzione dei servizi (macchina del ghiaccio al mio piano rimasta rotta per tutti e 12 i giorni, ascensori perennemente bloccati nelle ore di punta con tempi di attesa di oltre 15 minuti), costi extra ipertrofici (3 $ al giorno per una bottiglietta da mezzo litro d'acqua).
In definitiva, un hotel vivamente consigliabile sia per brevi soste che per vacanze più lunghe, ma facendo attenzione a prevenire in anticipo eventuali problemi che, leggendo anche le recensioni di altri utenti, mi sembrano un po' troppo frequenti per essere solo occasionali.

title: Highly recommended
text:
Excellent location.  Very kind and accessible staff.  Slow lifts sometimes hit them for a long time.
We didn't try the breakfast.  There are dozens of places for breakfast.   lunch and dinner, we would be happy if there was a bigger discount for hotel guests.

title: Great location, but not quite what I expected from a Hilton.
text: The hotel is in a great location for everything we wanted to see in Manhattan. It was easy to walk to most locations from there. It is also conveniently located for the subway. The hotel is very big, and the reception area is not big enough for the number of people passing through there. It always seemed to be crowded and chaotic, and it was difficult to see a staff member if you wanted to ask a quick question based on the number of people that always appeared to be queuing. The rooms, although slightly on the small side for a Hilton hotel based on past experience, are comfortable and surprisingly quiet, given how big the hotel is. The one downside was that our room wasn't ready when we arrived at about 4pm after a long flight from the UK.

title: Friends trip.
text:
We were in the city for fun and shopping. We saw two Broadway plays and went to the US Open. So EXCITING!!! 
This hotel was conveniently located...within walking distance of Broadway and subway station.

title: Hotel de rede: Comum, com bom serviço e ótima localização.
text:
O Hilton Garden Inn New York/Central Park South-Midtown West é um hotel bom/comum, de rede, com altos e baixos.

Os quartos são pequenos mas com um espaço bem aproveitado. Achei o banheiro do quarto que fiquei (3410) estranho; tinha uma porta de correr que não fechava e nem parecia fazer parte do mesmo. Quarto limpo, com frigobar e microondas e serviço diário de limpeza.

Localização muito boa, da pra ir a pé pra vários pontos turísticos da cidade e tem duas estações de metrô bem próximas. Mas não se engane com a proximidade ao Central Park, ele é próximo ao lado menos interessante do Central Park e longe a pé dos pontos mais famosos do Park.

O hotel é no quarteirão de cima da Times Square, então está no centro da bagunça novaiorquina. Se você quer tranquilidade, o lugar não é aqui. Mas dentro do hotel, a qualidade do sono e o isolamento acústico é excelente.

Muitos restaurantes e lojas na região.

Gostei muito do serviço do Hotel, do pessoal que ajuda com as malas à recepção, todos pacientes e te dão toda atenção. O lobby é pequeno e movimentado mas bem agradável; música ao vivo e algumas comidas e bebidas.

Pra mim o ponto alto do hotel é o serviço. O ponto negativo é aquele que é comum em NY: quarto pequeno.

Peguei uma promoção, então se estiver em promoção eu recomendo sim. Iria dar 3 estrelas, mas dou 4 pelo serviço e porque em NY em geral, os hotéis nessa faixa de preço são bem ruins.

title: Très bien pour visiter New York
text:
Tout ce que l'on demande à un hôtel au cœur de Manhattan pour visiter :
Propre, literie confortable, très bien placé, café gratuitement tous les matins, équipements pratiques (cafetière, frigo, micro ondes) et une mention spéciale au personnel très sympathique et attentionné ! 

Mini bémol, nous nous sommes aperçus que 2 bouteilles d'eau nous avaient été facturées alors que nous n'en n'avons jamais consommé. Et il est vrai que la douche n'est pas des plus fonctionnelles. Mais ce sont des détails, l'essentiel est là. 

Bref que demander de plus?

title: Family trip
text: This hotels location is great, staff is generally friendly and accommodating, However we had to wait an extra hour for check in which didn’t really bother us, the rooms were clean and beds were comfortable, however upon checkout it took them 4 hours to get our car out! We have a 7 hr drive back home it is now 3 pm,, it ruined our whole day,,,, and put a damper on our whole trip, we weren’t offered anything for this inconvenience,,, not good

title: Fraude con un pediatra a la habitacion. Habitacion Oscura, pesima conexion de internet.
text:
Tuvimos una muy mala experiencia cuando preguntamos en recepcion si el Hotel tenia servicio de emergencias medicas para nuestra pequena de 18 meses que estaba con mucha fiebre y nos enviaron a la habitacion un Doctor de muy dudosa actitud que pidio nuestros datos (pasaportes, direccion, etc) y queria cobrarnos $3'800 por el servicio sin siquiera haber visto a la nina. Una locura! Resolvimos el asunto en una clinica privada cerca con profesionales de verdad.
Al margen de esta experiencia nefasta nuestra habitacion era super oscura, todo el dia con las luces encendidas, la conexion a Internet muy mala se cae todo el tiempo y hay solo 3 elevadores para unas 14 habitaciones x piso. Hemos esperado mas de 20 min por el ascensor.
El hotel esta bien ubicado en una zona muy activa.

title: Anniversary
text:
My husband and I stayed at this wonderful property for our 21st wedding anniversary. Our second floor room had a very cozy terrace. 

It's a couple of blocks from Times Square and just down the street from Columbus Circle. Perfect proximity to the subway. 

 Tess and Maria were awesome! I will definitely return to this property.

title: Best hotel in my shopping area
text: When traveling to NYC for the ultimate shopping tour, I go to the Hilton. Warm welcome, great rooms with nice views of the city. Rooms are clean and bathrooms are sufficient, clean and well equiped. Walking distance from my fav shops and burrows. Staff is nice and always prepared to help! Concierge is very fast with his taxi's!!

title: Most Friendly and Helpful Staff
text: The staff at the HGI NY/Central Park South- Midtown West were the friendliest and most helpful ever!  They made our stay very enjoyable. The hotel was clean, appeared pretty new, and well kept up. It was convenient to the Theater District, but not in Times Square (which was a big plus).

title: GOOD LOCATION, FRIENDLY FRONT DESK, PRETTY BIG ROOMS
text: We stayed here in May, the tempeture was a bit cold still but nice.  This hotel has free coffee or tea in the mornings, I think it also had free WIFI,  it always has two or three persons at the front desk to help you and it has a person outside to get you a cab.  We walked all around the area iT was pretty good, with good pizza places and restaurants.  There is a cafe on the corner (good for breakfast).  We also walked all the way to Time Square and NBC studios ( is a good walk but worth it).  The hotel has next door Empire Steak, they have a good happy hour, be aware at night the prices are pretty $$$$$.  We did have dinner here one night everything was excellent.  Overall this holel was pertty good.

title: Ubicación y trato
text:
Ubicación y trato
Hotel con una ubicación inmejorable. El personal muy amable, sobre todo limpieza de habitación. El detalle del regalo del café por las mañanas me encantó, pero ...
Fecha de la estancia: agosto de 2019

title: Charged for a stay I did not book, hotel refuses to make it right
text: First of all, I love the location of this hotel, the staff was very nice during my stay. We stayed 3 nights in July, 2019. However, when I got home, I noticed I was charged an additional $258.00 on a date I was not even there for. I have been trying for a month to get an answer, get it refunded. Finally, today, I spoke to someone at the hotel who kept yelling over me "YOU BOOKED A STAY AND YOU WERE A NO SHOW" no matter how many times I told her I was not there, I did not stay until the following week, and I did NOT book another stay other than the one I paid for, she kept repeating it louder. YOU WERE A NO SHOW. I kept telling her, no, I did not  book that and she yelled, YES, YOU DID...I was so frustrated I hung up on her. I could not even get a word in. I have contacted guest services, I have contacted the hotel directly, NO ONE will do anything. I am supposed to just give them $258.00 for nothing. I have been a Hilton Honors member since for years, I think I am ready to switch after this.

title: サービスが良い
text: 部屋は十分な広さで、かつ無料のコーヒーやクッキーがロビーで提供されていたのでとても快適でした。スタッフの方も気さくで良かったです。

title: Ubicación y trato
text: Hotel con una ubicación inmejorable. El personal muy amable, sobre todo limpieza de habitación. El detalle del regalo del café por las mañanas me encantó, pero me parece un poco sobrada que cobren el agua de la habitación, porque precisamente no es un hotel barato. Por la noche hay un poco de ruido pero es normal, la ciudad es muy ruidosa.

title: Walking through New York - Stay here!
text: Excellent location for a walking trip. The staff were friendly, helpful and gave great suggestions. Central Park is a few short blocks away, as are the bright lights of Broadway. We were able to visit all five boroughs of New York by the easy access to the subway from this hotel.

title: Hay mejores opciones en la zona.
text:
Tiene muy buena ubicación; sin embargo, hay mejores opciones en la zona.

Debes esperar bastante por los ascensores, pues hay tres pero con poca capacidad. 

En la habitación goteaba el aire, y en la tercera noche, después de estar todo el día fuera, encontramos un abanico secando la alfombra y el aire no estaba funcionando; con la temperatura súper caliente, ya saben que la habitación estaba como un horno, nada agradable luego que estas fuera desde las 6:00 am y solo quieres descansar.

title: Habitación muy comfortable
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado,  cerca de Times Square en la 54 con Broadway 

Las habitaciones tenían camas muy cómodas y un baño con ducha practica

Un poco caos la espera en el ascensor pero solo hay 3 ascensores para 34 plantas

Buen organizado aunque no me gusto tener que pagar un cargo de 50$ por día y habitación que luego te devuelven. Francamente en Europa no lo he visto nunca y que te lo devuelvan unos días después tampoco me parece correcto

Practico el Business center para imprimir las tarjetas de embarque

title: Location is good
text: I hate staying in big chain hotels but they are a bit more budget friendly than the other boutique hotels (for NYC budget which is still not super cheap). No breakfast included but coffee and water and cookies at certain limited times in the day.  Located around the corner from Stephen Colbert show and very close to Central Park access and to Hell’s Kitchen walking distance. Quite a few places to eat very close by as well.  The rooms are small but more than fine.  no street noise. My hubby thought the pillows were awful but I was ok. The elevators can take a while so give yourselves extra 5 minutes before you had to leave, just to get to the lobby. No joke.  Small fridge in the room and I think a tiny microwave?

title: Mainly good but pay attention to kindness...
text: For the hospitality industry, it does NOT matter that the satisfaction of all customer wishes. Honesty matters too, because you can't get extreme prices for a poor bottle of water. here in the world is not so, I have traveled a lot! This is not done, or ... if you think that this will enrich your hotel or company, or that it will make you be on everyone's lips, that is to say triple bottled water bottles, you are cheating. You didn't even mention, but very confused, that the water in the room is paid. I'm sorry you have a beautiful design and the employees seem kind, but if you rush for some bottles of water, you will end up struggling to have a bottle of water to live ...

title: Perfect Location
text: The location of the hotel was perfect near everything we wanted including subway stations within a couple of easy blocks.  The room was just right.  The staff were very friendly and professional.  When we are back in New York we will stay here again.

title: Retour sur Hilton Garden Inn
text:
Hôtel très bien placé
Service très professionnel
Très confortable et très propre
Personnels à l'écoute et très disponible
Petit-déjeuners et repas proposés au restaurant à côté de l'hôtel correctes mais très chers

title: Excelente relación calidad-precio y mejor situación
text: Estamos alojados en este hotel 5 noches. Situación innejorable, buenos servicios, habitacionrs amplias y cómodas,  perfil Hilton. Nads que objetar, excelente relación calidad-precio para un hotel en el centro de Manhattan.

title: Hilton Garden was Great
text: The Hilton Garden Inn on west 54th Street had the most delightful and dedicated staff, the place reminded us of a small European boutique hotel. The tiny lobby was often busting- served coffee in the morning and cookies and flavored iced water in the afternoon. complimentary umbrellas are available for thunder showers. Location near theaters , the Park and subways was wonderful. We were on the 24th floor with very fast elevators.

title: Perfetto 👌🏻
text:
Hotel situato in ottima posizione, a 10 minuti a piedi da Time Square e a 5 dalla fermata metro Columbus Circle.
Ambiente raffinato, pulito e staff cortese.
La camera è insonorizzata e non si sente alcun rumore dalla city(traffico o sirene), la vista dalla stessa è suggestiva.
Ottima soluzione, non solo per chi vuole far vacanza, ma anche come business hotel.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Excelente ubicación del hotel y el personal muy atento y servicial. Además hablan varios idiomas, lo que facilita el contacto y la ayuda con los pasajeros. Excelente experiencia con el viaje. 100% recomendada

title: Un bon hôtel, bien situé.
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, à l'angle de la 54ème et de Broadway, entre Central Park South et Time Square, proche de plusieurs stations de métro.

Les chambres sont correctes mais un peu en deçà du standard attendu pour Hilton. Satisfaisant néanmoins. 

Un bon séjour dans un bon hôtel.

title: Hotel serio.
text: Hotel situado en un lugar centrico en todos los sentidos. Desde este hotel se puede visitar caminando infinidad de lugares importantes de Manhattan. El Hotel está muy bien regentado y dotado con muy buenos profesionales desde la recepción hasta el servicio de limpieza. Destacar la amabilidad y celo por su trabajo de Joshua,  un chico siempre disponible para cualquier información que se le demande. Actitud y aptitud con la gran ventaja de que habla castellano , lo cual es una facilidad para los que no dominamos el inglés.

title: Great Location for a NYC Vacation
text:
The hotel sits right in the heart of the entertainment district. You are steps away from a subway station, the heart of time square, theaters,  
restaurants and central park. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Only complaint is the elevator service can be slow.

title: Ottima location scarsa disponibilità del personale e del consierge
text: Ottima location scarsa disponibilità del personale e del consierge. Al momento del check in non trovavano la nostra prenotazione mentre al check out scarsa gestione del servizio bagagli e del trasferimento con lo shuttle in aereoporto(viaggio non diretto con almeno 3 soste in altri alberghi con durata totale del viaggio di 2 ore con rischio di perdere il volo) e costo eccessivo per il servizio fornito (costa di più di un taxi privato)

title: Recommend!
text: We arrived at midnight and weren’t too sure at first, as the lobby is pretty minimal.  Our room was small but well laid out and had a microwave and refrigerator, which would be nice for young kids.  Our king sized bed was very comfortable and the A/C worked great. We were on the 10th floor facing the street and really had no outsize noise; it was extremely quiet.  The bathroom was immaculate, fairly good sized and a beautiful shower stall with amazing water flow.  We are Hilton Gold so could either have a free breakfast buffet (normally $24 pp) or extra points.  We had the breakfast the first morning and it was very nice with excellent service.  A huge plus for the hotel is the location.  It’s four blocks from Central Park, where we walked each morning.  It’s also very close to Times Square and all the theaters but is far enough that you’re not in the crowded chaos.  The hotel staff here seemed exceptionally friendly - we were impressed!  Others have mentioned slow elevators but we had no problems.

title: Fantastic accommodation
text:
Stayed here for 9 days and have nothing but good things to say about the place. I read the reviews before I came and was a little reluctant but please ignore them. Some people complained about the lifts being slow and the staff being rude. I found nothing of the sort. The lifts are lifts. I'm not sure what some people expect it's not a bloomin' rocket! Every member of staff I have come across have been polite and friendly. 

My room was a good size, modern in decor and more importantly clean. My teenage son's appreciated the excellent wifi connection. There were an iron, ironing board, hairdryer, fridge, coffee maker and microwave in the room. A good sized television. 

The location is perfect. Just off Broadway, a short walk to Time Square, subways, Central Park etc. You can't hear the hustle bustle from the street. An excellent bagel/ coffeeshop around the corner, Pick a Bagel.
I would definitely stay again if I return to New York.

title: 100% nice
text:
We stayed at this location July 30 through August 4.  I can’t remember the last time I stayed at a hotel where absolutely everyone who worked there seemed genuinely interested in being kind and helpful.  It was such a treat!

 Immediately surrounding the hotel is mostly restaurants,  but shopping begins in a few blacks as well as the subways.  

Midtown is such a great hub for staying in NYC.  This hotel also has an indoor outdoor restaurant attached that although a little pricey for the smart vacation or was convenient for a glass of wine or a quick salad.  

 We were put in a room for disabled persons. I wanted to switch but my family didn’t care. The door was automatic but didn’t close automatically.  There was a barn door on the bathroom and the water from the walk-in shower I thought was an unnecessary risk.   But more experienced travelers probably know this already. 

  Our room was also a bit on the small side but that we expected.  All in all due to location and staff it was a five star stay at a four-star hotel.

title: Séjour de 8 jours à new york
text:
Tres moyen , pour un Hilton personnel ne parlant pas français et aucun effort n est fait.
Hôtel très propre,manquant un peu de modernisme.
Prix trop élevé et ne reflète pas la qualité.
Bien vérifier le montant qui est à prélever.

title: Stayed on Business Travel
text: What you'd expect from a HGI... 4 stars overall.  Staff was friendly and engaging.  Was close to my place of business and to times square.  Was walking distance to most every place I needed to get to.  Would suggest dining out for breakfast - better pricing.

title: El peor trato recibido nunca
text:
Estoy alojada por 5 noches en este hotel y dos han sido horribles , la primera check in erróneo, molestias durante toda la noche para arreglarlo ..
La segunda despues de un dia agotador llegas al hotel y te han bloqueado la habitacion  por impago de depósito, depósito que cargaron a otra habitacion, para comprobarlo me hacen Subir a la habitacion donde tenia la Visa y ahora lo mejor : escoltada con dos personas de recepcion a mi habitacion donde estaban Todas MIS cosas.
Una Vez Hecho esto se dan cuenta que es un error suyo y adelante ni disculpas nin Nada me hacen un nuevo Checkin y me dan otras llaves ..... a todo esto ni una disculpa 
Vergonzoso aún es el momento que alguien nos diga o nos de una explicación y nos pida disculpas.

title: Good stay in Midtown Manhattan
text:
My sister and I spent 4 nights at this Hilton Garden Inn. The room was clean, albeit small (typical for NYC). The beds were comfortable. The bathroom fully stocked with Neutrogena products and lots of clean, fluffy towels. As a Hilton Honors member I had free wi-fi and bottled water - great perks. The staff were professional, friendly, and helpful.
The location of the hotel is perfect for Broadway shows - only a 5-10 block walk depending on which theater. Plus, we were only 5 blocks from Central Park.
I recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

title: Avoid completely
text: THis hotel overcharged me more that $1000 and took more than tw weeks to repay me. They also tried to convince me that I owed them this money because it was for city and state taxes. I booked via booking.com which clearly stated my bill included all taxes. The hotel then admitted that they were overcharging me. They also pressured me into attending a sales meeting for their 'Hilton Club'. They kept me in a room for an hour an tried to convince me to hand over $10k then and there using serious sales and pressure techniques. OF course I have nothing like the money they wanted so they could not extract it from me. But it leads me to wonder what kind of organisation is the Hilton? Anyone else had this experience with them? Finally, they have no lobby space to relax in and only 3 elevators to service over 30 floors which means you spend too much time standing around waiting for elevators.

title: Una gran decepción
text:
Me parece muy cutre que te cobren 10 dólares por la botella de agua de plastico que te dejan sobre la mesa y que parece te ofrecen como bienvenida.
La lavandería es un show! Ni detergente, un lío pedir las monedas...
La atención del servicio muy pobre y 0 resolutiva

title: Loved the hotel
text: Best experience ever. Loved the hotel, restaurant, wifi access, and fitness center. We also loved the location to everything as well. Everything was within walking distance. We will definitely go there again.

title: 6 hours sleep
text: Seemed like a really good hotel...sadly we only slept for 6 hours since we had no other choice until our hotel checks us in. But the rooms seemed really clean... beds were comfortable and quite...its in a great location as well

title: Just right- size, location & service
text: This was just the right place for our family stay. Location is great, facilities are good with gym bar and restaurant. Staff were good and rooms clean. Can’t complain - just what we needed. Close to Theatres and Time Square

title: Truly enjoyed my stay here
text: Great location!  Close to everything I wanted for this trip. Close to my conference center, Broadway, 5th Avenue shopping, etc  Small and intimate, but I preferred over the hustle and bustle of the larger Hilton a few blocks near it. Happy to stay again.  Recommend a lower floor room so able to take the stairs when needed.  The elevators are slow.

title: Great location and staff
text: Highly recommend this hotel.  Great location near Times Square and Broadway, near several subway lines, close by restaurants.  Rooms very clean, bathroom large and bath products nice.  Very quiet for sleeping!  Free wifi and water and coffee in the lobby.  The staff was always eager to answer questions and give help.  The doorman made some great restaurant reservations and got us a cab to the airport.  This was a trip with my daughter in law and two teen grandkids.  We had a great time and always felt safe in this area.

title: Worst Hilton so far
text: I travel for business and I always staying at Hilton properties. This one has been the worst so far. Room stank. Toilet bowl less than clean (yuk). Stinky pillows. Poor, poor breakfast options. Broken lights in the bathroom. Broken air dryer (I asked for a new one, I had to call after 20 minutes because they forgot). Wow, I suggest you book somewhere else, this hotel it is not conducive to business!!!

title: Hilton
text: I love this hotel.  It is small but very clean with comfortable beds.  The Empire Steakhouse next door is great and has a great bar.   The location of the hotel is right in the hub of all the NYC action.  I have stayed there both for business and pleasure.

title: Horrible Service/AC was out
text: I have been a Hilton Honors member for a few years & I was extremely disappointed in the service in this hotel. AC was out in our room, patio door broken, & horrible mattress. When we called to have the AC fixed they refused to change our room. Sent 3 engineers up & kept promising all would be made right each time we called. Finally at 9:30 at night when the AC still was not working we demanded a new room. I still have not heard back from the hotel for compensation for the horrible service.

title: Bad experience! having a confirmed room to no room at all. Not our fault. They don’t care
text:
On July 9, 2019 I reserved a three night stay at this location.  I received a confirmation number.

On Tuesday, July 16, 2019 evening at approximately 5:00 pm eastern standard time, I logged onto my Hilton Honors account online to confirm everything was ok with my stay. Once I logged on, I saw that my three night stay was cancelled. I most certainly never cancelled my reservation.

I immediately called the Hilton Garden inn and spoke with a male representative. He told me my stay was cancelled, however he kept me on hold for approximately 30 minutes. He never came back to the line and I was disconnected. I called back and spoke with a female representative, she also kept me on hold for approximately 20 minutes. She however told me that my stay was cancelled due to a discrepancy in the card that I provided. I was then  disconnected again!  I called back a third time, and spoke with the night manager Maria which confirmed that my reservation was cancelled.

Maria stated Hilton sent me an email to let me know of the situation. I explained to her that I frequently check my emails constantly throughout the day, however, I did not receive an email from Hilton advising me of such matter. She continued to bypass what I was telling her and said they sent an email. She told me that she did not have my reservation anymore and no more spaces were left. She was very rude. I explained to her that I didn’t receive a phone call, a voice mail, or a text message. I told her I would have resolved this issue if I had received a call, text, email, or voicemail. I asked Maria if they had my phone number on file and she said they did. I asked her why they didn’t call or text me, however she didn’t have an answer to that. She simply didn’t care.

She unsuccessfully attempted to find a room for me and my family. We were left without a room in New York until I found something else later.

I was also charged $158.93 dollars for taxes and was never refunded the money. I am very disappointed with Hilton. They acted very unprofessional. Hopefully someone will see this and understand how they didn’t go above and beyond to try to contact me so that I could resolve this matter.

title: New York
text: This hotel is conveniently located to the theatre district and many other attractions including, but not limited to, Central Park, high line, the vessel, Rockefeller Center, etc, and to subway entrances.  The rooms were fantastic and the staff was superb.  The only complaint would be the slow elevators but small inconvenience for all the perks.

title: El peor Hilton Garden Inn en NYC
text: No vale la pena lo que cuesta este hotel vs lo q obtienes. El servicio y la atencion de la gente del hotel deja muy lejos el nombre de Hilton. Es una pena que no traten.bien a sus clientes mas leales.

title: Ótima viagem!
text:
Fui sozinha para NY e fiquei hospedada no Hilton e super recomendo! Excelente!
Os funcionários foram super simpáticos e receptivos, me ajudaram, mesmo quando tinha alguma dificuldade em entender alguma palavra em inglês; educados e solícitos. O quarto é ótimo! Tem um frigobar que você pode usar, assim dá para comprar algumas coisas e comer/beber quando estiver lá. Além disso tem micro-ondas e cafeteira. Internet sem custo adicional, adorei!
A localização é ótima! Fiz várias passeios a pé; estações de metrô super próximas.
Dica:usando o google maps você consegue andar de metrô por toda cidade, ele mostra em qual estação você precisa embarcar, se precisa fazer baldeação e em qual deve descer, maravilhoso!!!

title: 2nd Stay Just As Good As First
text: Our family stayed here last July and again July 2019. My favorite thing about this hotel is location. A short walk to Broadway and Columbus Circle at Central Park. So much within a short walking distance. Our family of 5 had two rooms. We weren’t able to get adjoining rooms, but we were on the same floor. No noise. I love having a refrigerator in the room. Housekeeping kept the rooms very clean. The staff at the front desk are very nice. As mentioned in other reviews, there are only 3 elevators, but the wait is really no different than what I have encountered elsewhere.

title: No complaints -- great location and service
text:
Our family of four stayed four nights.  The rooms are small but typical for NYC.  Everything was really clean and the staff were all very professional and helpful.  

We had a corner room on the 13th floor and it was very quiet.  I didn't hear any other guests and the only street noise we heard were sirens.  

Very close to Central Park, Times Square, and the theaters.  Great deal!

title: Wonderful!
text: We love our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn. It was the perfect location - we walked everywhere and/or took the subway, which was just steps away.  The staff was amazing and super helpful!  We loved every minute of our time in New York!

title: Horrible experience!! Do not stay there, very shady and rude management!
text: When I arrived they had given my RESERVED room away! It was a king bed with city view... Then they said they only have an accessible room, it was much smaller, queen bed, small bath... (no bath tub, but a strange dirty shower)... I was too tired to walk away and just search for another hotel. So I took the room! I told them well in advance I was going to the city for a surgery, and my surgery got canceled so I had to check out three days earlier. I called to give them a two day notice, and they said they would jack up my rate from 260 to over $470 per night!! I even spoke with their manager Darrin Rosenberg, who was even more rude and unhelpful than their front desk, who said that's our computer and there is nothing we can do about it! Yet they didn't lower my rate for giving me a small dark queen size accessible room instead of the KING CITY VIEW I reserved and paid for!! It was just unbelievable! Very opportunist managment who don't understand that if you want someone to come back or spread good words about you you should treat them FAIR and JUST and not take advantage of an opportunity to overcharge them just because they HAD to leave early! Not even that I told them the day or day before, I told them TWO DAYS before I had to leave. This is the same ones who give me a SMALL QUEEN SIZE ACCESSIBLE ROOM for the same price I had RESERVED a KING SIZE CITY VIEW LARGER ROOM!! Just unbelievable. I will be filing a complaint for refund and adjustment of this shady business with BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU. The room was disgusting, how can they do this?!! First charge me for a smaller room the same as the king city view room, then even double the price per night! very opportunist SHADY and rude MANAGEMENT. If you're gonna pay that much go stay at a nice CLEAN hotel who will treat you nice and friendly as the PAYING CUSTOMER that you are.

title: Lovely ‘reasonably’ priced hotel; great location
text:
It’s difficult to go wrong with the Hilton brand, although the ‘Garden Inn’s’ are decidedly a step down from the regular Hiltons. I was looking for a relatively affordable place to stay in central New York for a three day visit in the peak of summer. Still coming in at $900 US but much cheaper than many other hotels in the area. The room as expected was on the small side but very comfortable and clean. IT was also surprisingly quiet with virtually no noise drifting in from the street below, although we were only on the 5th floor. Room includes the usual amenities—safe, coffee maker, basic toiletries. Seemed updated; bathroom was very clean with lovely glass shower doors. Attentive staff. 

I have made this point many times in other reviews I’ve posted for “Inn’s”—please provide actual glassware and wine glasses in the room! In bulk for hotels, no doubt this could be had very economically for basic glassware. Not only is it more tasteful for the guests, but I can’t imagine the amount of garbage generated by the disposable plastic/styrofoam cups.

Price differentiation looking throughout the year for different seasons is excessive. In general it irks me how hotels gouge tourists during high season. 

General New York tip: If you can manage it otherwise, DON’T come in the middle of the summer. During our three day stay the temperatures were an unbearable +100 degrees.

title: Decepcionante
text:
Cobraram um valor de USD50 por dia no meu cartão de crédito que, teoricamente, seria devolvida, entretanto, até o momento não recebi o reembolso do valor conforme me prometeram. 
Já enviei diversos e-mails e os profissionais me informam que não encontram a minha reserva. Inclusive já encaminhei o e-mail com o número e nomes das reservas e não obtive nenhuma resposta do hotel. 
Além disso, a porta do meu banheiro não fechava o que causou um grande desconforto com a pessoa com que eu estava viajando.
Fica aí a minha avaliação!!

title: A great place near Times Square and Broadway Shows
text: Next time your traveling to New York to see a Broadway show, go to Times Square, see the Stephen Colbert show, right around the corner or just come to NY, this is a great place to stay. I also felt safe as you need a key to access the floors.

title: Excelente localização e serviço
text: O hotel está no coração de Manhattan a 2 passos da entrada sul do Central Park. Muito confortável e o staff sempre simpático e pronto a ajudar em tudo. Não utilizei o serviço de restaurante mas pelo que vi pareceu-me de qualidade.

title: Our first time in New York
text:
We stay at many Hilton’s worldwide and selected this hotel for its close central location.

The staff are all exceptionally helpful and welcoming. When we had a query on our room rate the girls behind the counter were super patient.

The breakfast is a little limited and gets very same ole same after two days. So we decided to venture further afield for our meals. Was surprised that there were no pancakes available at breakfast.

All in all a great central hotel.

title: New York 2019
text:
I have just returned form New York my fiancée birthday present we stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Central Park
This is really a great location for Times Square and Central Park
The hotel is clean the staff are very very helpful great place to stay when in New York oh added bonus Starbucks in a 2 minute walk away

title: Slow lifts but overall great stay
text: The lifts are slow at times, but that’s the only negative. Quiet and spacious rooms, with coffee in the lobby in the morning. They have a washer and dryer (additional charge) and gym which was important to me. Business centre was good too, and friendly staff. Location is convenient.

title: Qualité, Confort et Emplacement idéal
text:
L’hôtel est conforme a ce que nous attendions. La chambre est assez grande, et rien à redire sur la propreté la literie est exceptionnelle. La salle de bains est très fonctionnelle et de qualité. L'insonorisation est parfaite, seul bémol la climatisation un peu bruyante. La situation est idéale située entre Times Square et Central Park, métro et bus a proximité.
Coté points négatifs, le personnel est agréable mais à la réception il est étonnant pour un hôtel de ce type que très peu de personnes soient au moins bilingues. Le hall d’accueil est relativement petit pour un hôtel de 400 chambres et les 3 ascenseurs sont souvent saturés aux heures de pointes. Le petit déjeuner est à mon avis trop cher.
Ceci dit, globalement très bon séjour dans cet hôtel que je recommande pour son rapport qualité / prix et son emplacement.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text:
I stayed here for a week, redeeming my Hilton Honors points. I expected the service to be of low quality, noting is this Midtown Manhattan. I was pleasantly surprised! On multiple ocasiones, I was greeted by multiple staff members at the same time!

My initial room was right in front of the elevator. Once I asked for a quiet room, I was placed in a corner room on the 24th floor. (I had a Gold status with Hilton Honors, so your mileage may vary.) I really liked the serenity of the room.

Another feature which was a nice surprise for me was the guest laundry facility, wherein one could do their own laundry for prices in line with what NYC residents pay (Ioved in Manhattan for 6years.)

Housekeeping was somewhat inconsistent: the 2 complimentary bottles of water promised to Gold members were forgotten on 2 or 3 occasions, no new bath soap for a couple of days, and worst of all, the bath sink had standing water in it when I returned one day.

Overall, I was happy with the experience!

title: City Break NYC au Hilton Garden Inn au travers de Voyage privé
text: Le voyage avait extrêmement mal commencé car à notre arrivée (vers 1h de matin), ils nous ont annoncé ne pas avoir de réservation à notre nom malgré le voucher de voyage privé.... et pas de place dispo dans l'hotel. La fille de l'accueil a été exceptionnelle (Christina), elle a passé de nombreux coup de fils pour nous trouver un hébergement et nous trouver une solution pour le reste du séjour. Quant à Voyage Privé, même pour les cas d'urgence, ils ne sont pas accessibles 24h/24h et quand vous arrivez à les joindre, ils ne peuvent pas proposer mieux que d'attendre que leur partenaire US ouvre ses bureaux... Donc encore un grand merci à Christina qui a sauvé nos vacances. Pour ce qui concerne l'hotel, les chambres sont spacieuses, confortables et bien insonorisées. L'hotel est bien placé, au sud de Central Park et proche des transports en commun. Le petit dej est copieux et bon.

title: Excellent location
text: Had a great time at this hotel, staff were friendly and helpful, nice room,definitely stay here again if returning to nyc,free coffee in lobby, hotel offers airport shuttle at reasonable price, great restaurant adjoining hotel

title: Mother Daughter Weekend near Central Park, Times Square and Broadway
text: Location is perfect at Hilton Garden Inn Central Park South - within walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue shopping and the Rockefeller Center.  The hotel has an open air bar with great happy hour specials as well as an upscale restaurant.  We utilized the Metro Card for subway travel to the World Trade Center 9/11 Memorial, Battery Park (Statue of Liberty), Madison Square Gardens, Greenwich Village, Little Italy and Soho.  For casual eating, we recommend Angelo's Pizza around the corner on Broadway.  In Times Square, the sandwiches/fries and Cheesecake at Roxy's in Times Square are delicious.  For viewing the Empire State Building, do the Top of the Rock (Rockefeller Center) where there are multiple floors for viewing and you can walk around all sides to get a 360 degree view of the city including Times Square, Central Park and a very distant view of the Statue of Liberty.

title: Great hotel near Central Park
text: I stayed here last month for work and loved most of the things about the hotel. Great location only minutes walking time to Times Square and Central Park. Friendly staff and rooms are clean, albeit a bit small. The only negative is that the elevators can take a long time during peak hours, which the hotel is aware of and let's guests know about. Other than that, I loved my stay here and would definitely stay again.

title: Sin sorpresas
text:
Miré un montón de hoteles antes de decidirme y acerté. Hemos estado en habitación 3005 con cama grande y vistas a la ciudad. La cama es comodísima, las vistas desde ella mientras te tomas un café con la cafetera en habitación es un lujo. También dispone la habitacion de mini nevera y microondas. El lavabo con un plato de ducha con mampara de cristal y mucha encimera resulta muy cómodo. También dispone de secador de pelo y te dejan muchas amenities de baño. 
En el vestíbulo del hotel cada mañana puedes tomarte un cafe o los que quieras gratuitos, y cuando vuelves al hotel despues de haber andado tienen agua fresquita para que te tomes un par de vasos antes de subir a la habitación. 
Hotel muy céntrico al lado de la Av. Broadway, cerca de muchos restaurantes y andando a Central Park en un momento.
El hotel dispone de un convenio con una serie de restaurantes y tienes el 15% de descuento. Si te gusta la comida cubana cerca hay Guantanamera con menú al mediodía muy económico y música en vivo por las noches; y de comida tailandesa Chai Thai que lo recomiendo.
Para terminar decir que no nos defraudó el hotel. Es la segunda vez que viajo a NY, si hay una tercera volveré a este hotel.

title: Family of 4 at end of June
text: This is a nice Hilton Garden Inn in a great location. The very clean rooms feel new and are of typical size for NYC, albeit smaller that typical HGI. The lobby is a bit crowded at times as it is little smaller than HGI norm, but not uncomfortably so. Sometimes the elevators were not instantaneous, but longest wait was two minutes. Staff always helpful. Breakfast is typical for HGI, although staff was very attentive. I travel a lot for business and travel soccer (Gold on Marriott and Hilton) at all levels of properties. The 4 of us stayed a week. If traveling on my own dime would pick this property every time over, for instance, the Ritz Carlton in Battery Park. In short, excellent place to stay in NYC.

title: Clean rooms  and outstanding front desk staff!
text: I will definitely return to this Hilton Garden Inn. They went above and beyond to be outgoing and meet guests needs. It is very conveniently situated near the theaters and a ton of restaurants and The Empire Steakhouse is in the building and is very good and friendly, too.

title: 12 hours to open a door
text:
I left my room for couple of minutes at 9.45pm.When I came back the door was locked and I couldn't open it. They brought an engineer. He couldn't open it. Then they said I should wait for another one to come. He couldn't open the door as well. I had to wait at the lobby until 12.45am before they let me into another room promising the chief engineer will be there at 7.30am. I had to sleep in my clothes since I didn't have an access to my stuff. No phone, no wallet, no laptop. In the morning no one knew what's going on. I had a meeting at 8.30am which I couldn't get to since I didn't have my laptop/proper clothes. They managed to open the door only at 9.00am. They only canceled my payment and after a while offered a voucher for one free night. They didn't care about my meeting, the general manager was rude and they refused to give me anything in writing that will prove my stuff was locked for almost 12 hours.
It's a nice place to stay if everything is OK. When there is a problem they care nothing about their guests. Be aware

title: Not so happy ....
text: The lobby is rather crowded and noisy, sometimes stuffed with loud music. The staff is friendly, but only moderately efficient. The garbage bags on the floors are disgusting. This place was not worth the price that I paid. There is a lot of space for improvement. Not to forget: this is a Hilton, a big name!

title: Tolle Lage - tolles Hotel!
text: Dieses Hotel hat eine fantastische Lage. Unweit von den Sehenswürdigkeiten entfernt. Man ist schnell im Central Park. Die Zimmer sind sehr schön und man fühlt sich wohl in diesem Zimmer. Eine Kaffeemaschine, ein Bügeleisen ist vorhanden. Am Morgen kann man sich unten in der Lobby kostenlos Kaffee holen. Dass einzige Manko, dass es nur wenige Lifte gibt und dies ist zum Teil zu Hauptzeiten etwas mühsam und mit warten verbunden. Sehr empfehlenswert!

title: L’HORREUR !!! FUYEZ !!!! Ils débitent n’importe quoi sur votre compte !!
text:
1440$ débité en trop sur mon compte !!!
Notre facture pour une semaine était de 2040$ (7 nuits à 2000$ et un repas). Nous avons demandé à partager la note : 1440$ sur le compte de mon compagnon et 600$ sur le mien. J’ai demandé les reçues des cartes bleues mais la réceptionniste, désagréable, m’a dit qu’ils n’en donnaient pas, que la facture suffisait. J’ai trouvé cela bizarre, mon compagnon a pensé qu’on pouvait leur faire confiance. ERREUR !!! A notre retour nous vérifions nos comptes : 1440$ de débité sur le compte de mon ami comme prévu MAIS 2040$ de débité sur le mien (au lieu de 600$).
J’appelle immédiatement l’hôtel. Nous sommes samedi. La réceptionniste me fait attendre 10 minutes au téléphone pour finalement me répondre qu’il faudra voir avec le service comptable qui ne sera là que lundi. Je dit que je veux une réponse de toute urgence. Elle me dit qu’elle ne peux rien faire, ni rien me dire. Je n’entends aucunes excuses, pas de mots réconfortants comme « ne vous inquiétez pas, c’est une erreur » RIEN !! Juste : « le service comptable vous contactera dès qu’ils pourront ».
Pour le moment, j’ai un découvert sur mon compte, je ne sais pas si ils vont me rembourser et je doit attendre 2 jours !!! 2 jours d’angoisse !
Sinon vous sentez bien que vous n’êtes qu’un numéro dans cet hôtel, au moment de payer, personne ne nous a demandé si le séjour s’était bien passé, si nous étions content, c’est pourtant un minimum il me semble, surtout dans un 4*, et en partant personne ne nous a dit au revoir !!
Nous ne sommes pas prêt de retourner dans un Hilton et je vous déconseille de réserver chez eux si vous ne voulez pas prendre le risque qu’on vous débite n’importe quoi sur votre compte !!!

title: Excellent location, great staff, decent hotel - and yes, elevators
text:
I stayed here for 6 nights on a business trip - normally I stay closer to my office near the UN, but had some meetings uptown and preferred this location nearer to the 1 subway.  First time at this HGI, and although I am semi-picky about hotels (and stay in one 100+ nights/year), my greatest concern was about the elevators, based on other reviews.  So here it is:  for me, as someone coming and going 2-3x per day from an upper (30th) floor and at predictable hours, the elevators were slow, but not a deal breaker for me.  YMMV, and I think that is a fair assessment.

For the rest, I really enjoyed my stay here - the location is perfect, near Times sq, Broadway, Hell's Kitchen and Central Park, and the subway.  Tons of restaurants. Decent gym. The staff was super friendly and helpful (though the lobby is chaotic), and cabs/uber easy to get.  The waiters at the restaurant (for breakfast) were very nice, though the buffet could use a few more 'fresh' options - the kiddies love the waffle maker, but some granola, a banana or berries would go a long way for me.  Overall, the room was on the small side, but clean, quiet and comfortable and everything worked.  King room perfect for a solo traveler, but would be tight for 2.  A 3 star hotel, but with the staff and location I gave it the extra.

title: No value
text:
Shower was scalding, unable to adjust 
Bed too hard 
Closet designed with iron in middle of hanger space 
Internet worthless.
Didn't want to waste valuable vacation time trying to address/fix 
No one has complimentary breakfasts

title: So disappointed....
text:
I am a long time Hilton Honors member and have stayed in Hiltons all around the world. This was my first 1 star experience and the only time I've had any complaint worth mentioning.
Do not book a room near an elevator! The wifi connection was nil. We were moved to a different room the next day and told there would be an adjustment to the charges. I never heard back, called 2 days later and was told the manager had not responded. Finally, I was told there would be a $100 adjustment made to the charges. This never happened. I was given 2 gift cards for use ONLY in Hilton Hotels. but that is quite different from what I was told.
Also, I would recommend staying on a lower floor. There are only 3 elevators for this 30+ plus story hotel and often 1 was not working. Either wait for a long time or plan to use the stairs.

title: great hotel in a great location
text: We had the most enjoyable stay at this hotel. Rooms are clean and spacious . Close to everything  Big thank you to Alex from the concierge desk ,He went above and beyond the call of duty to assist us with printing off our tickets to see "Come From Away" His shift was finished and he was on his way home . He stayed and helped us and made sure we were looked after . Loved the flavored water in the lobby after a hot day sightseeing

title: Wonderful stay, clean, close to attractions
text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. You can't beat the location. Walking distance to Broadway theaters, Central Park at Columbus Circle, Times Square, and subway. While other reviewers think the rooms are too small it was perfect for us. We had a king sized bed and both had room to lay our suitcases out and move around room comfortably. We never had to wait more then 2-3 minutes for elevator but we were usually leaving by 6:30-7am and not returning until late at night. Small fridge, microwave, iron, hair dryer available in room. Staff always greeted us nicely. Room was cleaned daily which we appreciated. Small grocery store about 2 blocks away to stock up on drinks and snacks. If we come back to NYC we will stay here.

title: New York-LGBT+ couple
text:
Lovely friendly staff, felt safe the whole time. Overall a fantastic hotel.
Bed was massive and really comfy. Shower was hot amd powerful. Room was small but big by New York standards.
Great location, but took ages from airport. Easier to get the airtrain that a cab.

title: Wonderful experience
text: Went with a few friends for NY long weekend. One of our friends arrived earlier and staff was super helpful to add her to the reservation. Staff very helpful and friendly and accommodating. Our reservation was supposed to be for queen beds but we had full beds. Staff promptly changed rooms for us.

title: Great choice!
text: Good value for the room and great location! Close to Times Square.  Staff was very helpful and service was great. Rooms were small but expected in NYC. Glad we chose this hotel.  Easy to get to everything!

title: Hilton Garden Inn
text:
This was our first time staying here. We come to New York frequently to see our children and try a variety of hotels.  This was in a good location for us, very close to the subway and to a variety of locations. The rooms were roomy for New York and quite clean and comfortable. The only flaw was, as other reviewer‘s have said, slow elevators at certain times of the day. Complimentary  water and coffee in the lobby were nice to have. 
We booked directly with the hotel and got a good rate and will definitely stay here again. It was also nice not to have any additional resort fees added to our bill.

title: Pleasant stay
text: Pleasant stay, very good location, helpful staff. Restaurants, subway and a lot of cool places nearby. Theaters, broadway shows, shoping and a lot of interest places close. Only need to improve elevators.

title: Good location and comfy beds.
text: Good location as a lot of the attractions are walkable from here, such as Central Park, Times Square and Fifth Avenue.  We booked as a family for two rooms and requested joining rooms or near to each other.  However we were told this was not possible when we checked in, although we’d received an email from the hotel saying this was possible. Ended up with four floors between rooms so that was disappointing.  Rooms were a little tired and carpets need replacing.  Very little hanging space in closet but there were drawers. Beds were super comfy and linens were high quality.  Air con good but noisy. The steakhouse restaurant we ate in once.  It was off putting to find plates were inadequately washed and some slight food debris remained.  I had to ask for these plates to be removed.  We were left wondering if there would be food debris on other plates under food served.  I would have preferred to leave the restaurant at this point, but didn’t want the embarrassment. The starters and steaks were okay but the cost was very high and not good value compared to others in the city.  The breakfasts in the hotel were adequate but not wonderful.  Appreciated the free good quality coffee and newspapers in foyer in the mornings and iced water and cookies in the afternoon.  The barman was professional and friendly.  We previously stayed in the Hilton Times Square which was a superior property.

title: A fine hotel in a great location
text: The location - just north of Times Square, just south of Central Park, is ideal. Our room, though small, was clean, comfortable, quiet, and functional, with a fridge and microwave. Staff was helpful throughout the stay. The only negative I can think of is that there aren't quite enough elevators for the number of rooms, and there can be significant delays during "rush hours" (8-10AM, 3-5PM).

title: Muy buena ubicación y habitación
text: Muy buena ubicación, cama muy cómoda, habitación muy linda. Desayuno no incluido y muy caro si se lo solicitaba de manera adicional. Según la hora, el ascensor tardaba bastante en llegar. Recomendable, volvería.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel. Very quiet. Comfortable beds. Need more elevators!! Long waits.  Room a little small. Did not get room requested but same location. Good hotel. Great location. Well priced for nyc hotel. Would stay again

title: MUITO BEM LOCALIZADO MAS DECEPCIONANTE!!! TENHA CUIDADO!
text: A localização é simplesmente fantástica para os que querem ficar próximos do circuito turístico de NY City.
