Meia quadra do Times Square, da Estação do metrô, de lojas, etc (inclusive um supermercado Whole Foods!). Os quartos são pequenos, como aliás todos os hotéis de NY que não sejam para os muito ricos. O café da manhã é cobrado separadamente, mas isto também é a regra da cidade. O sinal de wi-fi é bom e não tivemos problemas. Até aí, tudo bem! O problema do hotel ficou no atendimento. Quando chegamos, pediram um cartão de crédito por segurança (procedimento normal) só que exigiram que eu digitasse a senha do cartão e nos disseram (textualmente!) que era isto ou não nos hospedaríamos (apesar de já ter pago 5 noites). Nem queriam nos dar um recibo do pagamento da taxa! Depois de muita discussão e de ter sido muito mal tratada pela recepcionista, conseguimos que nos dessem um papel dizendo que era somente uma taxa de segurança. Fiquei preocupada (afinal nos cobraram US$250.00), mas o que fazer?!.. No check-out, tornei a perguntar (para um atendente muito mais simpático) como ficaria a questão e ele me disse que o valor seria estornado. Na volta ao BR recebo a fatura do cartão e COBRARAM TUDO!! Agora estou vendo o que posso fazer para receber de volta a grana... Além disto, no nosso quarto tinham 2 lâmpadas queimadas (que não foram trocadas, apesar do pedido) e no último dia deixaram o quarto com lixo e sem amenidades. Não volto mais lá!

title: Excellent hotel choice
text: My son’s graduation from medical school was near the hotel location. The staff was incredibly helpful and we enjoyed our stay. Very clean and comfortable rooms, great location in NY, very polite personnel. Highly recommended.

title: Splendido
text:
Hotel centralissimo, a pochi passi da time Square. Il personale in reception è davvero cordiale e sempre sorridente. Le camere sono pulite, spaziose, molto luminose e ariose. Il personale che pulisce le camere è gentilissimo specialmente Peter al 15esimo piano. Super consigliato! 
Unica pecca gli ascensori, sono solo due e quindi in alcuni orari c’è un po’ da aspettare, per il resto nulla da eccepire.

title: Perfect Location for Time Square, Broadway, Central Park..but Not Perfect
text: The PLUS is the location.  This is a great spot with only 4-5 blocks to Central Park and the same to Broadway and Times Square area.  You can really get around quickly here.  We watched King Lear in the Cort Theater and it was just a 10 minute walk at most.  Lots of restaurants, shopping and easy subway access.   Elevators were horrible.  Expect a wait and at times a long wait as there are not many, there are 30+ floors (we were on 33) an they are very small.  We waited anywhere from a few minutes to 15 minutes for an elevator.  Breakfast was free for Hilton Diamond, but it was not good.  Didn't try the hot buffet (typical of what you'd get at a Hampton Inn, but it has fruit cups, some Yogurt and that's about the end of the healthy options. NO the typical cook to order breakfast at all other HGI's.  Room was fine, but small - typical for NYC. Staff was good.  Parking is challenging at times but the Valet staff is very good.  If you have to drive, it is a good option, but valet is $70 a day.  Overall, nice place but some issues.

title: Very impressed.
text:
We were in town to help a family member move and chose this Hilton Property which we had not tried. I am a Hilton Honors member and like to stay at Hilton’s. 

I can’t say enough good things about this property and staff. Our trip was complicated by a cancelled flight and frantic rebooking. We arrived exhausted and the front desk staff set the tone with the most gracious, competent and friendly welcome. A bellman took my bag up 3 flights of stairs (!!!) because the elevator line was long. Note the elevators were fine during our stay in terms of wait time. 

We had not slept in 2 nights and opted for room service from the restaurant on the 1st floor of the hotel. It was fantastic: steak a perfect medium rare, pasta, drinks-it was to us in maybe 20 minutes and served by another wonderful staff member. 

Our room was very attractive with thoughtful amenities like an empty fridge for guest use, Keurig coffee machine and a microwave. Plus lots of places to plug in electronics! 

The staff was an A+ on every level:front desk, bell, wait staff, housekeeping-whatever you are doing at this location, it’s working! We look forward to returning. 

The location, if you’re not a frequent NYC visitor is wonderful for anything you might want to head out and see/do.

Thanks for an excellent stay.

title: Muy buena opción
text: La habitación Excelente, su ubicación ideal ,puedes salir caminando del hotel a central park y time square. El personal muy amable y preparado. Después de recorrer mucho se agradece llegar a descansar a un lugar tan confortable como el hotel Hilton Garden inn central park.

title: Another great stay
text:
This was my fourth stay at this property – and there’s a reason.  The staff are fantastic and always ready and willing to help and answer questions.  Housekeeping kept my room nice and tidy – despite a rather hectic schedule.  My room, a Junior Suite, was very comfortable for my 6-night stay.  I especially enjoyed the large terrace for an evening cocktail or a late nightcap.

On only one morning did I have an issue with the elevator – waiting just over 15 minutes to get down to breakfast.  All other times the elevator arrived within 5 minutes – not bad considering there are only three.

It was nice to have the included breakfast from the adjacent Empire Steakhouse – however, the food was of only average quality and the menu rarely changed.  It was nice to have the waffle maker, which did make breakfast a bit more enjoyable.

As usual, on my next trip to NYC I will stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Central Park South.

title: Good location, inadequate elevators
text:
I stayed for 5 nights in this well located hotel. Situated about 6 blocks south of Central Park, 10 minute walk to 10 Times Square and amongst broadway it is a convenience and central location to explore New York. This is the strength of this hotel. There are several train stations within approx 5 min walk. The room although somewhat small (most ny hotels are similar) was comfortable. The room was clean, bed comfortable with air con, coffee making facilities, free wifi, decent bathroom.

The frustration/weakness of this hotel is the elevators which most reviews mention. In short there are an inadequate number of lifts for the number of rooms/guests. Waiting 10+ mins to get into a lift was common to the point I often gave up and used the stairwells. For a Hilton branded hotel and the prices charged to stay here it’s not acceptable. The service staff also use the same lifts which exacerbates the problem. If you do stay here my advice would be to request a room on a lower floor so that you can use the stairs if necessary, 

Overall whilst the room and location were good I would look elsewhere in the same area next time if hotels are similarly priced or cheaper.

title: Great hotel
text: Had a wonderful experience at this hotel. We have stayed there once a year  for the past 4 years.  Clean, convenient, and a wonderful staff. This is the place to stay. Very close to all that is happening in NYC.

title: Loud Noise from back wall at room 1610
text: This was a nightmare. I lived in NY for more than 4 years so I know this location is pretty good, even though I understand all rooms in NY is very small, I was still shocked how tiny the king bed room is. I checked in on 11:50 pm and the front desk was very rude. Started from 1:00 am, there was bad noise from the back wall, sounds like water drop noise from tubes or something. I hope it can be temporary so didn't bother anyone, however I was WRONG. From 1:00 am to 11:00 am on the other day, it never stops. Sometimes even louder and more frequently. I took several videos and showed front desk at 5:00 am, as I can't sleep at all at such noisy place, the lady told me she has nothing to do because the room are sold out. I understand at holiday seasons hotel can be very busy, but how come you didn't fix these problems before? Why you have such terrible room for your guest? I spent LOTS OF money for this night, but I literally up all night. This room wasted my money and time, also ruined my whole trip. As the second day I can't do anything since I was so tired for not sleeping whole night. The front desk said managers went for trip so nobody can follow up with me on this issue, didn't hear back from the hotel for almost one week. Very very disappoint, please AVOID this room 1610.

title: Great Location seriously SLOW elevators
text: We loved this location about 6 blocks north to central park, 6 blocks south to Times Square and right in the heart of many theatres and great restaurants. We were not in our room much at all, we got there at 1, dropped off our bags, came back to change around 5 and were off until we got home from dinner and a show. The beds were comfy and the room was small but made very good use of the small space. We were on the 23rd floor and did not hear the all night sounds of the city. The only frustration is that it was often a ten minute wait just to get an elevator and of course people are tired of waiting so they cram in so tight. There were only like 14-15 rooms on each floor, so it is not a huge hotel but one that I would definitely stay at again if in NYC.

title: Brilliant
text:
Lovely stay, very comfortable, great location, central to everything. The staff were so friendly. The fresh water throughout the day was a lovely touch. 

The room was very small, it was a bit of a tight squeeze. There was also no area that you could sit back and relax. The reception area was too busy and the seats aren't designed for sitting for long periods. Also, the pictures on booking showed a rooftop area but on enquiry there didn't seem to be one but one did exist in there midtown Hilton.

title: Great Staff
text: The staff was great from check in- room servicing-check out.  The concierge was especially helpful.  The rooms were nice.  16th floor was high enough to be quiet.  A very nice market on the corner of 8th & 54th was very good for groceries.  The Empire Steakhouse, 15% discount from Hotel was very good.  The lunch portion of the steak was actually big enough for 2 of us but we had already ordered 2 plates.

title: Stay at Hilton’s all the time BUT Never this property again!
text: I have stayed at Hilton properties for years including a great Hilton property in Midtown. This property was a disappointment from the minute we stepped through the door. We traveled on a special occasion and though we advised the hotel and I am a Hilton Honors member, there was not one recognition of the special time at all. The rooms are small, the temperature was either too hot or to cold, the elevators worked less than 50% of the time. The amenities at this property are minimal at best and the communication follow up was poor at best. We always asked prior to arrival for firmer pillows and though they responded that they would take care of it it wasn’t. After 3 requests more they were delivered day 2 twice and not at the requested time. The bathroom was in disrepair - paint coming off ceiling, towel bar falling off not to mention shins banged on poorly designed beds with sharp edges in a small room. I requested an upgrade room and was assured it was just right but the view looked at a side alley and garbage. The only shining light was the bellman on our day of check out who helped us get a great ride to the airport. I will not be back to this Hilton property ever. Very underwhelming and disappointing as well as Luke warm friendly staff. The location was good but that said there are a handful of properties with Hilton in midtown. Sorry Hilton this property doesn’t live up to what you promise or we have experienced at other properties.

title: Not up to Hilton standards
text: I’ve stayed at Hilton hotels for 30 years. The rooms at this Hilton are pretty small but the most irritating thing is that the wait for an elevator could be up to 20 minutes! Only 2 out of the 3 elevators were working while we were there. Will not be staying there again.

title: Hilton Grand Vacations didn't deliver
text: I purchased a stay at this hotel through Hilton Grand Vacations. The story about what was included in my package changed multiple times. No staff was willing to help me sort out the issue, everyone kept passing the blame to another staff member or another department. The room itself was OK, but one of the elevators was broken the entire stay and a second one went down my last day. Doesn't give me much confidence in Hilton's desire to run their businesses with integrity.

title: Hot - Cold Room Temp Issues
text: Our entire stay the AC unit was not repaired.  Constantly Hot and Cold   Did not sleep well for 5 days.  Engineering never fixed.  This was very frustrating.  The room was clean but on the small side considering the cost.

title: An incredible anniversary!
text:
My wife and I visited this property to celebrate our first wedding anniversary in NYC. Upon arrival our room was not quite ready as it was roughly 1pm, which is to be expected, however it was here that our experience with the staff began on an incredible note.

The agent we had the pleasure of being served by, Luis R., is an incredible asset to the property. His upbeat demeanor and can-do attitude deserve the highest accolades when it comes to the service of guests. Without our asking, he offered to have  our luggage stored as our particular room was still in the process of being cleaned, which he then contacted housekeeping to expedite, again of his own accord. However, he didn't stop there. Luis inquired if we'd had time to eat during our travels, and continued to provide us with a handful of great nearby restaurants to choose from (Chai Thai was exceptional, per this recommendation) while our room became available. We returned from lunch closer to 2pm, and were again informed that the room wasn't 100% ready, which was also expected due to check-in being 3pm. Yet, Luis went out of his way to provide us with a coupon to the Empire Steakhouse next door for us to grab a few drinks while we waited and told us he would send us a text when the keys were available at the desk. Not 30 minutes later, Luis didn't text us that the keys were ready, but instead personally walked them to us at the bar of the restaurant, to allow us to continue enjoying our time at the bar without interruption. Never have we been treated so kindly, and sincerely appreciate the efforts and courtesies extended to us by Luis. But wait, there's more!

Upon arriving to our room, we found that we'd been upgraded to a beautiful Terrace King, in honor of our special occasion! Being that we'd only booked a standard king room, this was an unexpected yet deeply appreciated surprise. We thought that would be the icing on the proverbial cake, until a knock came at our door shortly after we'd arrived. Provided by the team was another unexpected amenity; two bottles of wine, chocolates, and a hand-written card from Raymi (our check-out agent who was equally superb!), and signed by the other front desk staff! We were blown away by everything the staff had done for us, just within hours of being in the city.

To the management:
I can't thank you and your staff enough for the courtesies and level of hospitality that was provided to us throughout our stay with you. It sincerely made our celebration that much more special, and is an experience I will not forget. Being in the hospitality industry myself, I know what proper service looks like, and the entirety of your staff exceeds that expectation at every point. From everyone at the front desk, to the bellmen, lobby ambassadors, and housekeepers, there was not one instance in which we were not greeted, asked how our stay was or if we needed anything, and welcomed with a smile. It is apparent that the standard of service unremittingly exhibited by your staff goes well above and beyond the norm at all levels of the organization; of which you should be incredibly proud.

If ever you or your staff venture to my property here in Daytona Beach, I kindly insist that you or they reach out to me, so I may have the opportunity to repay the kindness I was shown as a guest at your establishment.

My sincerest thanks to you and your staff for making our stay better than we could have imagined, and I wish all of you the best!

title: Small rooms
text: First time here.  Typical HGI.  Check in was good.  Elevators SLOW.  The room was very small.  I guess fine for a solo traveler,but not sure i would be happy with my wife with me as there is literally no room.

title: Hilton Garden Inn NYC
text: This is our second visit to this hotel this year. The elevator problems still persist. It is not acceptable to have a hotel in the theater district in NYC where 2 out of 3 elevators work. If you stay here, plan on a minimum of 30 minutes per elevator use. That amounts to an average of 2 hours per day for a round trip in the morning and a round trip in the evening. We will look for another hotel, because I would hate to experience a fire in this hotel.

title: A éviter
text:
Une nuit avant croisière. Avons choisi l'emplacement pour la proximité du port de Manhattan.
Première impression mauvaise ! L'entrée semble mener vers le soubassement. Parties publiques peu ou mal entretenues. La 1ère chambre allouée était plus petite qu'une cabine de bateau ! impossible d'y ouvrir la valise. On nous donne une autre chambre, à peine plus grande. Cependant les chambres sont neuves et propres.
Le personnel peu affable et ne peut même pas nous demander un taxi. On nous dit de se mettre au coin de la rue et de héler un taxi au passage. Avec nos valises ?
La salle de petit-déjeuner compris est un vrai hall de gare à l'heure de pointe. 
Nous nous sommes encourus et n'y reviendrons jamais !

title: ALL AROUND IT’S THUMBS UP
text: First time staying at this hotel.  Great location.  Rooms are abit tight but not a problem for two people.  Clean, modern and great amenities.  Well lit bathroom.  Shower stall not tub/shower combo.  Provided double on Nutrogena brand shampoo, conditioner and soaps.  Plush and very absorbent towels and not just two sets either.  Mini fridge, microwave, Keurig machine and laptop size safe.  Lots of plugs for electronics.  Good working area with ergonomic chair.  Beds are super comfy, selection of pillows, crisp linens and the mattresses are actually in a wooden frame which is way better than using bedskirts.  Just watch the corners so you don’t hurt your legs.  No annoying humming air/heat unit like in some hotels but just forced air/heat so just like at home.  Windows open for a few inches so getting fresh air is nice.  Quiet and never heard the neighbors even though there was a connecting door.  Staff was very helpful.  Restaurant on-site but tons of places to eat all around.  Nice they provide umbrellas on a rainy day, too.  Big plus for luggage storage if you have a late departure and want to tour the city some more.  Definitely would stay here again.

title: Good business hotel if meetings in Midtown West
text: Despite the slow elevators and the narrow rooms, the hotel ended up being the best price-value place for the meetings we had on 55th street. I do travel a lot, privately and for business. While I do often decide to go to more upscale places, I have to say that the staff in this hotel, in particular the front desk staff is simply 5*star material. Big bravo to Marissa!

title: Central midtown location with friendly helpful staff
text: We spent a Thursday and Friday night at the Hilton Garden Inn,  I arrived to find that I had made two duplicate reservations which the receptionist fixed and I wasn't charged for the cancellation.  Our room was nice, clean and quiet.  The connecting steak house had a nice bar area with a variety of fun cocktails.  The staff was very friendly and constantly asked if they could help or be of service.  Very close to Central Park, Time Square, theaters and restaurants.

title: Very well located in Manhattan
text: Located in Manhattan, at walking distances of many interesting places: Central Park, Rockefeller center, broadway, Times Square. The room is large, quite, clean and comfortable. Attendants are friendly and always helpful. Certainly, I would can back.

title: Clean and modern
text: Clean and modern rooms, Good location, close to Central Park, Times Square etc. friendly and helpful hotel staff. Bit noisey outside rooms but typical of NYC. Noisey in hallways outside room. Bed was super comfy.

title: New, Nice but ROOMS ARE TINY
text: After we checked out out of the Doubletree a few blocks away we went to this HGI and got a room.  The property is in a great location and the staff were friendly and helpful.  However, the room we were given was literally TINY.  No space for luggage, no space to move around, etc.  We each had a small back as we were there for one night, but little to know room.  I know it's NYC and hotels are cramming to make the $ and get more for their property but this, well, just wasn't working.  We stuck it out for the one night but won't be back.  For the record, this was a last minute reservation and they may not have had any other rooms, but had we known we may have tried another property.

title: Visite à notre petite fille, étudiante à New-York
text: Hôtel très bien situé (Près de Central Park et de Broadway, Times Square, etc.), très propre, mais avec un hall d’entrée peu avenant, ni confortable. Décoration nulle et identique pour toutes les chambres. Personnel sympa, mais 1 seul passage par jour : pas de préparation pour la nuit. Plutôt un hôtel pour groupes, avec des prix convenables pour l’emplacement et les prestations.

title: Great location
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights and it’s a great location for exploring NYC. It’s a couple of minutes walk to Broadway and near to
the subway station and good restaurants.
Room was spacious and clean. Lifts were a nightmare, with constant breakdowns which meant queues of people waiting to use the lift, ordinarily we would take the stairs but being on the 18th floor meant we wanted to take the lift! 
We used room service once which was nice. 
We had an issue on checking out with our charges in that the hotel preauthorises an amount to be taken from the payment card (to ensure it’s a real card which is standard in most places), however this was taken and the actual amount for the room wasn’t taken for a few days after - we had to call the hotel to check and the preauthorised amount was returned but just watch out for this.

title: Great for Tourists
text: We stayed here five nights on our first trip to NYC...excellent midtown location near theatres, dining, nightlife, tourist spots...our room was quite small but we were not there much so it worked just fine...bed was comfy, quiet even though we were right next to the elevator...we read some complaints about elevator noise but we experienced none of that...room was clean...the walk in shower was much appreciated since we are moving into our mature years...plenty of light and counter space...lobby is small but not a factor for us...front desk staff and concierge were friendly and helpful...would definitely stay here again!

title: Could easily be better
text: Stayed there for few nights, for my business trip. The location is perfect front desk helpful and door man is friendly . The lobby area is crowded mainly with people waiting for the elevator, which can be very busy during rush hours. Cleaning is ok, but the service staff uses the guest elevator. For a few days, I found the cleaning cart in front of my door and few times even collection of garbage. easily could be better, small things big difference

title: A bit squashed
text: Great location and clean, but room layout poor.  Wardrobe already full of ironing board, iron and safe, so very little space to hang clothes.  Also, little room around base of bed to make use of the desk.

title: Vista mozzafiato
text: Una camera panoramicissima, per il prezzo che abbiamo pagato per trascorrere una notte, ne è valsa la pena. Vi consiglio questo hotel, sopratutto se amate l’altezza.affacciarsi ed avere un panorama del genere ne vale veramente la pena. Colazione ricca e sopratutto per tutte le etnie. Personale garbato e cordiale.sicuramente verrò  a trovarvi.

title: נוחיות ושירות ומיקום מעולים
text: המלון ממוקם ממש באזור המרכזי של מנהטן עם גישה נוחה מאד לכל אזורי הבידור והקניות. המלון נוח מאד, נקי ומסודר והשירות של הצוות הוא מעולה. החדר בו התארחנו היה נוח ומרווח וגדול ביחס לחדרי מלון בניו יורק. לחדר מרפסת קטנה וזה פלוס גדול. מעבר לזה חדר נקי ומסודר והאחזקה ברמה מעולה. הלובי קטן צפוף ולא פונקציונלי, לא כזה משמעותי למלון שמטרתו לינה וגישה נוחה לעיר המדהימה.

title: Bel établissement bon emplacement
text: Établissement confirme à la présentation les chambres sont propres et modernes. Le service est au rendez-vous. Le rapport qualité prix est exceptionnel pour l’emplacement. Nous avons séjourné une semaine dans cet établissement nous avons apprécié le café, thé en libre service à l’accueil ainsi que la disponibilité du personnel. Nous avons mangé dans le restaurant partenaire qui est excellent (même s’il est assez cher)

title: poteva andare meglio
text: L'hotel si trova in una buona posizione, tra Central Park e Time Square.  Le camere rispondono alle descrizioni, ma quello che non funziona affatto è la gentilezza di alcune persone alla reception. Si passava da alcune assolutamente educate e cortesi, ad altre molto maleducate e indisponenti. Una tra tutte Maggie, ma non solo. Altro lato negativo, le attese agli ascensori e il non rispetto della prenotazioni. Avevamo chiesto piano alto e ci siamo ritrovati al 4 piano in una stanza più piccola di quella prenotata, in quanto ci è stato detto che non c'erano più camere disponibili.In poche parole, se prenoti con booking,  il trattamento è di seconda scelta.

title: Hilton Garden Inn, NYC
text: The Front Desk Staff was very helpful and nice, especially Marissa! She was very friendly and efficient and even remembered me every time I came back in and greeted me by name. The hotel was close to Broadway, Times Square and MoMA. The breakfast was just ok. The room was comfortable and clean. I would stay here again!

title: NYC Trip
text: Was there for business. I always stay at this hotel when I go for work. Is convenient, clean and while the room is in the small side it works well for me. The staff is always nice an attentive. It is also priced right as far as NYC goes.

title: Bed bugs and no response
text: I stayed at this property last week. I emailed management after the stay regarding bugs in shower and cleanliness.  I got a live chat and ticket number etc.  No response. It’s been a week and noticed bed bug bites within days of check out. I knew while there room was disgusting. It was a handicap accessible room with visible bugs in cracks of bathroom. I plan to report to NYC health folks as well. Pls avoid at all costs

title: New York Weekend
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn for a birthday weekend celebration.  We were within walking distance of Central Park, the theater district, 5th Avenue attractions and Times Square.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Visiting NYC
text:
We have stayed at this Hilton Garden several times. We continue to return to this Hilton property because of the professionalism snd friendliness of the staff and cleanliness of the property. 
The entire staff from the Bell person the chambermaids work very hard to make every stay very enjoyable.

title: Just ok
text: A very average hotel with very average Amenities and ambiance at exorbitant prices— so relatively poor value for money.  Rooms are clean and comfortable though very small.  Service is friendly and location is excellent

title: Great location, tiny rooms
text: Stayed here for 1 night with my wife and kids. I stayed here once before with just my wife. The room is too small for 4 people. When you sit in the 1 chair in the room there is no space for anyone to get by you to go to the bathroom. This is one of the smallest NYC hotel rooms that I have seen. Staff were all excellent. Breakfast just ok.

title: so close to 5 stars
text: I reallllly wanted to give this place 5 stars, and had I written this review before sleeping the night, I would have.  Karina at check-in was awesome and got us into our room before our app notification. We had a wonderful view of the Empire State Building, which could be seen by higher up rooms ending in 00. The room was clean and the bathroom was beautiful. The sliding shower door made showering a breeze with not a splash of water escaping onto the floor. Yes the towels could be "more plush" but they were fine. The bed was fine, not too firm and not too soft... but then came the sleep quality.  While we were so excited to not have neighbors on either ends (00 rooms are facing inside and not street side) with great views. However, you're nearest the elevators which go UP and DOWN alllllllll night. Even with a white noise machine, the clicking from the shaft could be heard. I'm pretty sure I woke up every hour on the hour because of the noise from the three elevators outside our room. It was really disappointing because we're usually woken up by inconsiderate neighbors slamming doors or street noise from down below, but this was equally annoying.  If you're a heavy sleeper, you'll have a great night.

title: Nice Midtown Hotel
text: I am a diamond member and stay in a lot of Hilton hotels for business.  This location is nice.  Right in Midtown West side.  Easy access to Central Park, nice restaurants, and other midtown sites.  The rooms are clean and nice.  The staff is nice.

title: Para estar bien en South Central Park
text: Excelente ubicación en Brodway en un hotel no excesivamente  costoso y que por lo confortable de las habitaciones y la amabilidad del personal y la impecable limpieza hacen que la relación costo/beneficio sea muy buena

title: Buen servicio, ubicacion y habitaciones
text: Viaje de turismo con dos niños. El metro está a un paso y está rodeado de sitios para cenar/desayunar. Las habitaciones están muy bien y la habilidad del personal impecable.   No probamos el desayuno ni el gimnasio. Único punto a mejorar es la espera en los ascensores en hora punta (5 min. Tampoco exagerado)

title: Location is best attribute
text: Spent two nights here last weekend as in town to see a show.  Location was great, close to Central Park, Broadway (we walked to/from show), shopping and dining.  Nice to have a Duane Reade (Walgreens) right down the street for forgotten items.  Check in was smooth as was check out.  No lobby at all, just a waiting room for the three slow elevators.  Room was tiny, but that is probably not too uncommon in NYC.  As someone who stays at a lot of Hilton properties (Diamond Member), I will stay at a different venue next trip.

title: Location is good check elevator
text: Stayed for 6 nights 1/3 elevators worked. Would take 10-15 minutes to get to/from room. Staff especially bellmen are not particularly friendly. Would only stay here again due to the location easy access to train, restaurants and shopping.

title: Wonderful location and top notch accommodations!
text: Stayed during an overnight business trip.  From arrival, through my stay, till departure the hotel personnel was on top of things, the room was pristine, beautiful and spacious.  Location was perfect to move around town, as needed, for our meetings. I will definitely recommend and stay again!

title: Problemi di relazione con una receptionist
text: Arrivati dopo un viaggio intercontinentale con jet leg e stanchezza ci attende una receptionist sgarbata e per niente collaborativa. Superato questo primo ostacolo, che non ha dato sicuramente una buona prima impressione, ci avvisano che due dei tre ascensori sono fuori servizio. Tempi di attesa intorno ai dieci minuti. Per fortuna è stato riparato nelle 24 ore successive. La stanza   è comoda e pulita. Il frigo non funziona, le finestre non sono doppie quindi si sente il rumore della strada. Il condizionatore è molto rumoroso. La doccia è fissa e non ci sono né cuffie né ciabatte di cortesia. La posizione è ottima. Le altre receptionist sono state sempre molto cortesi. Vale il prezzo pagato. Ci sono state addebitate due bottiglie d'acqua in camera che invece dovevano essere gratuite (le prime due). Se potete permettervi di spendere di più cercate altro.

title: Discreto
text: Camere pulite ma piccole. Bagno dotato dell’essenziale ma niente di speciale. Hall super piccola quindi nei momenti di più affluenza ci si ritrova un po’ tutti schiacciati. Appena arrivati scopriamo che gli ascensori sono rotti ed è stato così tutta la settimana.. quindi un po’ lente le salite e le discese. Tuttavia il personale è sempre stato molto gentile e disponibile. Posizione centralissima per vedere tutte le attrazioni più famose.

title: Grwat stay
text:
The staff were very helpful the doorman Desmond was the best the front desk staff were very polite and helpful the room service was perfect the restaurant steak was great 
The management was very experienced and helpful

title: Muy buen servicio
text: Muy buena ubicación tiene este hotel , sus habitaciones son pequeñas pero muy bien distribuidas hasta cafetera eléctrica y free coffe, los artículos de aseo son de marca neutrogena muy buenos y abundantes como las toallas . Remarcó la muy buena atención de sus empleados del primero al último . Esta vez optamos con la opción de desayuno incluido , es un excelente buffet , se ofrece en el restaurante que está en la misma propiedad. No tengo ninguna queja pasamos una buena estadía.

title: First time in New York!!
text: I would have given this property five stars; however, at one point, there were no working elevators and we ended up walking down 14 flights of stairs so that we could get out early enough on Monday morning to catch the taping of the Today show. A major shout out to Serenity on the front desk. She was very professional, very accommodating, and very energetic. Serenity acknowledged us when we walked in the door, she acknowledged us when we were heading out, and it was just refreshing!! I would also like to give a compliment to your front desk supervisor Nelson, who was also very accommodating. Nelson made adjustments for the inconvenience of not having any working elevators and for probably a 24-hour period there was just one that was up and running.  This was our first trip to New York, and in spite of a few minor set backs, we had a wonderful time. New Yorkers were very nice to us, very pleasant people, the food was great, there is lots to do, and we really enjoyed everything. We were comfortable with where we were staying, and Serenity and Nelson are definitely assets to the Hilton family and properties—thank you once again!!

title: Outstanding staff. The location is great, too.
text: I left an electronic device in my room, realizing the loss after returning home. The hotel staff was fantastic in helping to FedEx the device back to me. Also, the room was one of the cleanest I have ever stayed in. And I travel nationally and internationally a lot.

title: This is horrible
text: Booked a room at this hotel. When I arrived they advised only one elevator was working but they were getting the second fixed today. Came back to the hotel and found that the second elevator would not be fixed till the next day. I asked could they please transfer me to another Hilton and was told no they can’t. I wait over a half hour just to get to my room that was on the 30th floor. This is not a way to treat a Hilton customer. I always thought Hilton meant quality.

title: NON FATEVI INGANNARE DAL NOME!!!
text:
Siamo stati con la mia famiglia in questo hotel 4 notti nel mese di marzo 2019.l’hotel dispone di camere piccolissime .l’hotel è vecchio e datato.abbiamo prenotato una doppia ma al momento della partenza un’altra persona si è aggiunta.all’arrivo all’hotel abbiamo cercato di modificare la prenotazione poiché non siamo riusciti a farlo tramite Booking.la tripla che ci è stata assegnata in realtà era una doppia ,perciò ci siamo dovute accontentare di dormire in 2 in un letto alla francese e in una stanza microscopica.
Il prodotti messi a disposizione dall’hotel sono a risparmio ,no pantofole di cortesia ,no acqua di cortesia.prenotazione per 2 persone ,colazione per una persona.non si sa come mai ,L Hotel lamenta la mancata chiarezza da parte di Booking ma di fatto :prenotazione per 2 persone ,colazione per 1.
La Colazione è mediocre ,prodotti di bassa qualità .
Non dispone di un servizio di cambio denaro alla reception.
Prima di andar via abbiamo comunque creduto nell’errore da loro reclamato da parte di Booking e dal momento che saremmo dovuti passare nuovamente per New York ,ci siamo fatti prenotare da loro una tripla.al nostro rientro in realtà L Hotel stesso ha venduto ugualmente la nostra stanza ,nonostante abbiano prenotato loro stessi ,con conferma della carta di credito,ci hanno annunciato che nell’hotel erano arrivati degli studenti e che hanno dovuto dar loro la nostra tripla!!ci propongono un ‘altra stanza da loro spacciata come tripla ma in realtà si trattava di una camera con letto matrimoniale...quindi secondo L Hotel tre persone adulte dovevano dormire in tre in un letto matrimoniale.come se fossimo in campeggio!!
abbiamo annullato la prenotazione, con tutti i disagi che può comportare andare  alle 9 di sera dopo aver fatto 3000km ,quindi stanche morte ,alla ricerca di un altro hotel ,per la loro incompetenza.
Nel ristorante dell’albergo si mangia molto bene ,ma i prezzi sono stellari.
La posizione è molto buona ma L Hotel equivale ad un 3 stelle non ad un 4 stelle.
Questo è un hotel che anziché semplificarti la vacanza crea solo disagi.
Non lo consiglio per niente.

title: Super Aufenthalt
text: Dies war unser ersters Besuch in New York und dafür ist das Hotel nur zu empfehlen. Vor Allem die Lage des Hotels ist top. Man kann viele Sehenswürdigkeiten direkt zu Fuß erleben. Auch die Sauberleit und der Service war super. Klare Empfehlung.

title: Chintzy with a good location
text:
We are disappointed in this hotel. 
The elevators are VERY slow! To make matters worse, one of the three was out of order for several hours during our stay. 
We stayed on the 7th floor, one of the few floors with an ice machine, there was NO ICE in this ice machine. 
The rooms are VERY small.  We could barely wheel our luggage between the bed and the desk. 
They inconveniently parked a house-keeping cart and vacuum cleaner in front of our room. (We were at the end of a hall way)
On a positive note, the location is excellent and they did provide us with umbrellas while it was raining.

title: 5day New York weekend
text: Great location, value for money and very helpful staff. In some reviews i have read people have complained about the elevators , so what if you have to wait a little while:) some people just like to complain. Go figure 🤷🏼‍♂️

title: Beyond friendly staff
text:
Have just returned from a 5 day stay at this hotel and I cannot emphasise enough how friendly and welcoming the staff are, they're a credit to the hotel. Nothing was too much of an ask with them. The amount of times we rang reception for minor things (we were missing a tv remote at one point, we wanted more info on room service another night), they were quick to respond and gave us the info we needed quickly.

We were on the 23rd floor and had no issue with noise, whether this was because we were on a higher floor? I'm not sure. Also no issues with the lifts taking ages, a few minutes at most, but this is to be expected staying at a hotel with 34 floors!

Location is perfect for sightseeing NYC. This was my second visit to New York and I found this location much more preferable to the previous hotel we stayed in on 45th st. The bar Three Little Monkeys across the road from the hotel was pretty damn good too! We popped in to catch a football game early on Sunday and were pleasantly surprised, good food and AGAIN, friendly staff!

I will deffo consider this hotel for my next visit to New York :-)

title: Needs more soundproofing
text:
We were very pleased with the friendly check in and the lovely clean and fresh room at this Hilton Garden set in a convenient location between Broadway shows and walks in Central Park. 
Unfortunately the first night was totally ruined by very noisy people who partied until 1:30 AM and others who started a loud conversation at 4:40 AM! The sound was not even muffled. The absence of soundproofing is also obvious in regard to the bathroom door which is a slider that doesn’t fit tight enough for real privacy. 
The desk staff was very helpful when I complained in the morning and even gave me earplugs but nevertheless soundproofing is needed so that earplugs are not!

title: BEWARE: UNSAFE, UNCLEAN, horrible staff.
text: BEWARE! Checked in. My business partner stepped on broken glass as we entered room. Found half eaten chicken breast in refrigerator. Was yelled at (comical) by front desk staff when we requested a different room and was forced to stay in the same room. Will NEVER book here. Contacted manager - never responded to our email. Yikes!

title: Great stay!
text: My wife and I were staying in the city for the NYC experience. We were in the middle of everything! The subway system was close and most everything we really wanted to see was either within walking distance, or the connecting subway was in walking distance. We felt safe the entire time and enjoyed our stay! We were on the 26th floor looking at another building...but that is NY isn't it? Highly recommended. The staff was great, the room was great and location was awesome!

title: Ótimo
text: Ótima localização, próximo a tudo, tudo novo e bem aconchegante... amenidades de banho Neutrogena . Voltaria com certeza, ficamos apenas uma noite. Não tomamos o café da manhã. Academia maravilhosa, recepção cordial.

title: Perfecto!!
text:
Solo puedo tener palabras fantásticas para éste hotel. La habitación preciosa y completa (nevera, microondas, cafetera de cápsulas, plancha y tabla) la ubicación es Excelnte y el trato desde la gebte de recepción, pasando por el resto de personal, simplemente genial.
Será mi hotel siempre que vuelva a NY

title: Nice hotel in great location
text:
We just spent 4 nights in this hotel. From a late night check in through check out, the staff were all excellent. The rooms are smaller than other cities but typical for NYC and very resonably priced for the location. 

It is a quick 5 minute walk to the south to Times Square (far enough away to avoid the chaos) or any Broadway play. A quick 5 minute walk to the north is Central Park. Importantly, it is between 2-5 minutes from 3 different subway lines so depending on which part of NYC you are headed to - it’s a great location. 

The breakfast in the restaurant is also quite good. We went other places for lunch and dinner so can’t comment on those. 

Highly recommend and will return.

title: Convenient - Daughters 1st visit to NYC
text: Beautiful sizable room - paid for the upgraded King Room with view of Times Square. Expected a direct view but it will do. Otherwise the property was clean, hotel lobby not on street level which was great. Secure because you had to use your key to get up to the rooms. Also had security in the lobby. Just 20 steps to stones Square, but not many convenient restaurant options within a block. Front desk staff was great!! Would definitely stay here again but try the corner King Room with views.

title: Super 👌
text:
3 nuits pour une escapade dans les rues de New York à deux....
Super hôtel, bien situé au milieu de tout ce qu il y a faire en quatre jours à New York 
Super accueil, couchages de rêve, propreté rien à dire, n'hésitez pas une soirée au resto de cette hôtel service au petit soin et de qualité dans l assiette très très généreuse et de qualité (pièce de boeuf pour ma part 700 g au moins) 
Une tuerie...... 
Merci

title: NYC
text:
Hôtel très bien situé dans New-York
Le personnel est très agréable et présent
Là chambre pour 4 (2 lits doubles) un peu petite mais grande salle de bain mais ma que de rangement
Le petit déjeuner est moyen et pas toujours bien organisé

title: NY Half Marathon Weekend
text:
After searching for the nearest hotel to the NYC Half Marathon Central Park finish line and close to the Q train...without breaking the bank... I am very happy that I found the Hilton Garden Inn New York/Central Park South-Midtown West hotel.

What a fantastic stay. From the moment I stepped into the hotel the staff was welcoming and attentive. When I made it back from the race the staff must have been aware of the event because they were very upbeat and congratulating the finishers returning to the hotel. 
As for my hotel room, I was not expecting to see the room serviced but it was. That was nice to see.
Overall it was an excellent hotel stay and I highly recommend it for other travellers coming to New York City.

title: Personale molto gentile
text: Hall di medie dimensioni, operazioni di check in/out molto veloci. Personale molto efficiente e gentile: dalla reception  al personale di supporto per informazioni, fino agli usceri. Molto gradito l'aperitivo offerto nella hall. Stanza di medie dimensioni, pulita, WiFi che funziona perfettamente, bagno discreto, frigobar vuoto. Ottima la posizione, una soluzione consigliata.

title: Not worth the price.
text: The staff at the property were unable to check us in during normal arrival hours. They were then too busy to call and let us know when our room was ready. Then they were too busy to check us in once it was ready. The 3 elevators are rather slow and you may wait awhile. A marketing rep got a little pushy about going to visit a new property for free points. Broken ice machine. Thin walls to the hallway.

title: top
text: Superb hotel, propre spacieux et animé avec son restaurant et son bar. Le personnel est merveilleux toujours aux petits soins ! l’emplacement est parfait pour visiter le cœur de manhattan sans avoir à prendre les transports en commun. Proximité de broadway times squat central park la 5th avenue central park et j’en passe. Je recommande pleinement cet hôtel

title: Spring Break with Kids
text: We stayed with our 6 year old and 8 year old for 4 nights. There was an issue with our room being ready when we arrived but the manager was very apologetic and made it right. The doorman was great! He gave us subway advice, helped us with our bags and got us a car to the airport. The room was a normal size for NY and the beds/pillows were comfortable. The room was very clean which is a huge factor for me. We had breakfast included with our rate and it was good. The location of the hotel is central to everything and the rates are very competitive.

title: Comfortable room
text: The room was comfortable, but not that big. The hotel location is pretty convenient, really close to Central Park. The biggest issue was the elevator, the waiting time was really bad, a lot of times he had to take the stairs.

title: Not living up to the Hilton Brand
text:
Beware tiny rooms. Staff needs additional training.

First Impression - small cramped lobby. Six people standing in line waiting to check in. Two gentlemen assisting with check-in but Megan stands behind the counter not helping anyone for more than 10 minutes. Finally I get her attention and she beckons me to the counter. She finalizes the check-in process with no interaction, providing no details about meals, rooms nor upgrade status. Since I'm a Hilton Diamond member I inquire if it's possible to upgrade my room. Her answer is "We're fully booked tonight, but I'll upgrade you tomorrow."

Second Impression - My room is situated "Between" the elevators - allowing me to hear them dinging every time the doors open on this level. My entryway is similar to a long bowling alley opening onto the smallest hotel room I've ever seen. Literally the amount of space between the foot of the bed and the "desk" ( really a 15 inch wide shelf) is an astonishingly small 21 inches. I'm not a claustrophobic person - but this room was small!

The desk lamp blinked on and off. I called for service and a man replaced the bulb - but did not fix the issue.

Third Impression - The following day I waited to hear from the front desk on the upgrade until 3:00pm. I called to inquire. The front desk knew nothing of Megan's offer to upgrade my room for the second night of the stay. I requested an upgrade again, but was informed "We're completely booked, we can't upgrade you." 

Room Service - the hotel relies on the Empire Steak House adjoining to provide room service. They got my order wrong, but corrected it when I called them after delivery. BEWARE - they add on a "Zone Charge" on top of the instant Gratuity. Ask for the total before you finalize your order. To make things worse, when I compared my room service receipt with my checkout receipt the hotel charged me an additional $4.00!

Fourth Impression - upon checkout the young woman Esri asked how my stay was. I went over my issues above. She looked in the computer and saw that there were Junior and Senior Suites available the night before and could not provide an answer why I was not upgraded to them. She offered to give me a paltry 5000 Hilton Honors points for my poor experience. They was no manager available to discuss this with.

I travel to NYC a lot on business and I am a dedicated Hilton customer. I have stayed in Hiltons throughout the USA, Europe, Asia and Africa but have never been so disappointed in a Hilton property.

title: Acceptable
text: The Hilton Garden Inn brand typically means a bright and airy lobby with super clean rooms and a relaxing experience, but this is NYC and this HGI is anything but that.  A dark dingy lobby with a nice reception leads one to a room that has stains in all the lobby carpets that carry into stained and old carpets in the room.   It’s a don’t look too closely room.  Bathroom was clean and bed was comfortable.

title: Great Location, Underwhelmed
text: Arrived after long travel day, room not ready and only ready 2 hours after check in time. No one had any answers, Hilton Club salesperson persistant to point of pestering. Fridge motor excessive in noise, but desk staff tried to be helpful. Location is incredible. Room clean and comfortable. So close to being well above average but not quite there our trip.

title: New York Weekend
text: This is a very good mid-range hotel. The staff were friendly. This is a no frills but very reasonable hotel for the price. Good location for walking in NYC. There are several good locations to visit n the neighborhood and is close to Central Park.

title: Ótima localização. Ótimo atendimento
text:
Estivemos em NYC durante o carnaval, e escolhi o Hilton Garden Inn Central Park South pela localização. Gostamos muito do hotel! 
Todos da recepção muito educados, solicítos em ajudar. Nomeio Joel, tentando falar portugues, e o Johnatan, que cuida das malas. 
No lobby tem sempre água o dia todo, e até as 10 hs tem um cafezinho de cortesia.
Às vezes precisava esperar pelos elevadores, mas não tanto tempo.
Os apartamentos são pouco pequenos, éramos quatro pessoas e duas camas casal, mas conseguimos nos arrumar. Confortáveis, roupas de cama de bom padrão, e as toalhas bem felpudas. Banheiro grande, com produtos Neutrogena e secador de cabelo. Senti falta de ducha ao lado do vaso. 
O quarto dispõe de frigobar, cefeteira, e microondas. Tem várias delicatessens nas esquinas proximas, onde comprávamos itens para o café da manhã. Saliento a ¨Westerly Natural Market¨, com sanduiches naturais, e bom preço., O restaurante do hotel é de ótimo padrão, mas muito caro! Os hóspedes tem direito a 15% de desconto, mas os pratos são em média U$ 50,00 por pessoa! mas conseguimos pedir dois pratos para 4 para compartilhar, e foi bem servido...
Quanto à localização, que é um fator importante na viagem, o hotel fica entre a Broadway e a 8a av, a poucos quarteirões da Times Square ao sul e do Central Park ao norte. Tem estações de metrô proximas. Quase todas noites íamos passear, jantar, comprar... na Times. Fica próximo tb do Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Terminal, MOMA, 5a av... Fomos a pé no Museu de Hist Natural e no MET, cerca de 30 min caminhada passeando pelo Central Park, apesar do frio de 0 grau!
No último dia pedi late checkout, e me deram 1h (até 13h), não podia ser mais. Eu paguei então U$ 100,00 de taxa (cerca de meia diária) e pude sair às 17h. Achei caro, mas valeu a pena...
Recomendaria este Hotel!

title: Cramped room, uncomfortable bed.
text: We did not care for the accommodations. The room was smaller than we are accustomed to. We did not find the platform king bed comfortable. The linens were not the best quality and the pillows were flat. Not a fan.

title: great stay
text:
The front desk and all the staff were very welcoming and accomodating.  I needed to extend my stay until 2:00 - no problem.  Room was very comfortable - was on the small side as most NYC hotel rooms are, but clean and well equipped..
My only negative would be the breakfast.   I'm not sure if they were understaffed but they difficult to get coffee, refills, etc.  Considering there were 34 floors, the elevators were quick to arrive and quick to get to y our floor.     That seems to be a problem at many NYC hotels

title: Great stay
text: My daughter and I stayed here for a second time in 6 months.  The rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff is super friendly. Always said hello when we walked in from our day.  A good sign for me showed the same staff was there over a 6 month period  I think they speaks volumes for the work environment.  They seemed genuinely happy to be there and helping us!   Great location.  10 minute walk to the shows and it’s not too busy like Times Square area.  There is a great local diner on the corner for a quick meal called Cascades.  No brainer for where we will stay in NY.  If you don’t have to have a super fancy lobby, then this is a great place.

title: Great location
text: Hotel is located near many attractions...Central Park, The Late Show, theatres, Rockefeller Centre and Times Square.   Staff is friendly and helpful. The only con to consider is that the rooms with 2 queen beds are small...there isn’t much space to move about.  Having said that, I would still consider staying at the hotel in the future.

title: Excellent value, very good location
text:
True HGI high quality, much better location than the one dubbed "Times Square - which is actually Port Authority".
Staff was courteous and helpful. My room was actually fairly spacious for NYC - perfectly clean, bed was comfy.
I did not have significant issues with the wait for elevators. I usually ask for a high floor for the view but I think a better strategy would have been a lower floor so the stairs would be an option.

title: great location, great hotel
text: We have stayed at several hotels in NYC and this by far was one of our favorites. The location of this hotel is perfect and the staff goes above and beyond to make your stay is a great one. The hotel as a whole and the rooms are clean and updated.

title: Beware of elevators
text: Had issue with one elevator and wait times to get an elevator were at times up to 20 minutes. The rooms were very clean, staff was very helpful. Breakfast and wait staff in the resaurant were excellent.

title: Ótimo hotel
text: O hotel é bem localizado, podendo fazer muitos passeios a pé. Meu quarto era 2 camas queens, e tinha um otimo tamanho. I banheiro era grande e bom. Única coisa ruim é a espera pelo elevador em horários de movimento, fiquei esperando 15 minutos.

title: Plan for Extra Long Waits for an Elevator!
text: The elevators in this property are wholly inadequate for the number of guests they have, even if the hotel is only half full.  They post signs at the elevators to expect extra long waits at certain times of the day.  Take those signs seriously, 24 hours a day, and plan for a 30 minute wait.  During the day in particular, the fact that there is no service elevator and every elevator that comes seems to be filled with housekeeping staff, only exacerbates the problem.

title: Hospedagem tranquila.
text:
Fiquei nesse hotel de 01 a 13 de março e a localização é ótima, quarto muito bom.
Alguns probleminhas, internet no quarto péssima, demora no atendimento de manutenção e espera de mais para pegar o elevador.
Porém achei ótimo custo/benefício.

title: Horrible Experience
text: This hotel is bad news. Checked in and then had to wait 10 minutes for an elevator. They have only 2 elevators in operation for 40+ floors! They even post signs in the hallways telling you to expect delays during "elevator rush hours". After getting to our room (which was adequate), I couldn't connect to the complimentary internet. Why? They had someone else's name listed for the room. Had to go to the front desk to get things straightened out. Shortly after returning to my room, a hotel employee knocked on my door to tell me that the room was double booked and someone else was trying to get into the room. Had to advise them that I wasn't moving. Upon departure, my wife and I waited over 20 minutes to get an elevator which never arrived. We had to walk down with baggage to the lobby in order to check out. Pathetic hotel...never again!

title: òtima localização
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, com rápido acesso a estações de metrô, a Brodway, Tiimes Square e Central Park! única coisa que me encomodou foi o tamanho do quarto, apesar de ser um quarto tamanho padrão de Nova York, acabei me machucando esbarrando na cama quando transitava pelo quarto.

title: Awful & Moved To Another Hotel
text: This has to be the worst hotel experience of my travel life and I have been all over the world. We arrived to a lobby of wall to wall people, some sitting on the floor.  Music was blasting and luggage was everywhere. It reminded us of a bus station. People were eating pizza, repacking suitcases and kids were crying.  Our room was so small that if my husband sat at the desk I had to crawl over the bed. When we arrived at our room there were two huge bags of trash at our door . I asked the front desk if they could remove them. The next morning, more trash greeted us as we left the room. There are four very small elevators for 31 floors with no service elevator so housekeeping carts and food service trays join you as you move from floor to floor. Signs are posted on each floor, warning of the elevator delays at peak hours. If you love noise, chaos, kids screaming and tiny rooms this is your hotel. For this we paid $299 per night.

title: GREAT LOCATION...FRIENDLY STAFF...DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS,,,
text: Visited for business/pleasure in March.  Superb location...easy walk to Central Park, restaurants and the theater district.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  So why wouldn't you stay here?  The 34 floor hotel has three elevators for the guests and the staff (no service elevator).  During our five day stay, all three elevators were in operation only on the last evening.  On more than one occasion, only one was in operation.  Throw in the staff usage and contractors renovating two of the floors and the wait for the elevator is worse than rush hour on the FDR.  If they ever get the elevators fixed simultaneously, the rating would be five.

title: Great location, Slow elevators
text: Well it is NYC located 8 blocks from the middle of Times Square and across from a giant iguana restaurant.  30+ story hotel with three elevators means you will wait awhile.  Big hint is to get a low floor and use the stairs.  Rooms are small and walls are thin.  If you open the closet door, it will block entrance to your bed where they squeeze in two double beds.  But the room is very clean with microwave, refrigerator, safe, coffee maker.  Separate bathroom with only glass enclosed shower, sink, toilet.  Free wifi.  Has fitness center.

title: Great getaway
text: Friendly, helpful staff beginning with Desmond, the awesome doorman, to helpful porters, everyone is working to make your stay pleasant. The location is fantastic for shows and great dining. Within walking distance of Times Square, theaters, great restaurants and the subway, yet the rooms are quiet. The rooms are not large but they are adequate and very clean with comfortable beds, and soft linens. Wonderful concierge service and delicious cookies served in the afternoon. Also handy is the guest laundry downstairs for those unforeseen issues. Definitely a homey atmosphere and I recommend it highly. Oh, parking is available and there was a wonderful package available when I went.

title: Disappointed and upset
text: This was a reunion trip w my mom and sister. I was told I'd get early check in Hilton honors points and a great city view if I went through the honors spiel. Upon arrival in a noisy crowded lobby I was told no early arrival. We had wine and snacks to celebrate in our room and had to sit in the business center by the elevator since we were not given a room.  Got into room at 330 and waited 20 minutes for our checked luggage. Room on second floor had adjoining room was opposite a linen closet and the view was of the alley and roof below complete with water tower and construction debris netting.... no city to be seen.  The desk light and outlets did not work nor did the tv.  The breakfast was pretty good and service there very nice. However we hadn't been given vouchers and had to go out to the front desk diring breakfast to retrieve them. All in all not a fun experience.  In fairness they did offer more points but not sure I will use them.  On a positive note it is an excellent location.

title: Just okay
text: Good location.  Friendly staff.  But a 1+ hour check-in delay is extremely dissatisfying.  Hotel operations seem to be very disorganized--between front desk staff and housekeeping. Disappointed in this Hilton property.

title: Super Lage
text: Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral in Manhattan. Sämtliche Sehenswürdigkeiten (Empire State Building, Time Square..) sind gut zu Fuß erreichbar. Die Parallelstraße ist schon der Broadway. Wir hatten das Zimmer im obersten Stockwerk (34.) hatte einen schönen Stadtblick. Im Zimmer gab es zudem eine Kaffeemaschine zur kostenlosen Nutzung. Die Kaffee Kapseln wurden täglich aufgefüllt. Wir würden jederzeit wieder kommen.

title: oltre mie aspettative
text: ottima struttura, prenotata tramite web e non direttamente dal sito hilton, ottimo personale ,sopratutto la mattina, ci si sveglia con il sorriso, entrando nella piccola sala da pranzo (speciale grazie all'unico ragazzo "moro" con i capelli lunghi raccolti  del gruppo di camerieri), camere più che accettabili, pulizia e ordine nel stile della catena, se si passa una buona vacanza, è anche grazie a tutto il personale.

title: great hotel great location
text: the location was fantastic.  the rooms are a good size for new york.  the coffee in the lobby in the morning was great.  they have cocktails in the early evening with appetizers.  rooms are clean.  overall very pleased with hotel.  and we did not experience a long wait for the elevators!!!!

title: Lovely Hotel in a perfect location
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights. Great location minutes from Time Square, Central Park, Broadway for all the shows, we went to see Wicked just around the corner. 7th Avenue subway nearby, shops and a good selection of bars and restaurants within walking distance. From JFK get the air train to Jamaica Station change to E subway to 7th Avenue. 
Check in was quick and efficient, all staff very helpful and friendly.Reception area was small and offered free tea and coffee first thing in the morning, Lifts could be a bit slow but wasn't a problem for us. We were upgraded to a lovely room on the 31st floor with very good facilities. Microwave, coffee maker, and a fridge. The telephone didn't work but this was rectified quickly. Even though you are in the heart of the city it was very quiet on a night. Breakfast was excellent served in the Empire Steakhouse. Small gym, equipment looked ok. Guest laundry which took cash/card. Small shop near the reception. We really enjoyed our stay here and will certainly return to this hotel on our next visit to New York.

title: Comfortable but noisy
text:
Me and my wife stayed here for 3 nights , the staff are really polite and friendly, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable, the tv channels are a good selection.
The room service has lots to offer and the food was with us within 30 mins which was ok, the only bad point was that there is a 20% charge plus $6.50 on top of what you order which is a bit steep I thought and because of these extra charges I didn’t think it was acceptable to give the person a tip when he brought it up to the room, which I did feel bad about but I thought that the extra prices were paying for that .
Now to the bedroom, as I said the bed is comfortable but at around 2am we were woken up by the room next to us having a bit too much fun if you know what I mean? The walls are thin , and after about ten mins I had to bang the wall to let them know we could here them lol.
In departure day we checked out and they kindly looked after our luggage until we needed them.
The staff are great, 
Thanks

title: Will stay again
text:
Stayed in Feb 2019 with two other people.  The room was tight but we expect this in NYC, so no complaints there, though it was tricky to navigate with all of us inside.  But we didn't go to NY to spend all day in the hotel room, so it was manageable.

Easy 15 -20 min walk to and from the Port Authority bus terminal, with plenty to see along the way.  Staff was friendly and helpful. 

And the elevator wait times are no joke.  There's even a sign reminding you that during peak times there's a long wait for the elevators.   Add 15 minutes if you are trying to get somewhere at a certain time if you need to take the elevator. 

Skip the restaurant attached to the hotel.  It's expensive and there's about 10,000 other restaurants to try in the city.

title: Excellent séjour
text:
Excellente découverte avec cet hôtel extrêmement bien place à NY aussi bien pour le métro que pour aller à l'aéroport.
La chambre était top et super propre spécialement la salle de bain qui semblait neuve

title: Management doesn’t back up staff commitments
text:
I have stayed at this property twice in the past 3 years, most recently in February 2019.  The hotel is conveniently located just off Broadway, near Columbus Circle and many attractions.

The rooms are small, but efficient (it is New York).  Complaints about elevator wait times are not exaggerated, but it is a midtown Manhattan hotel, 30+ floors, with three elevators shared by guests and service staff.  It is what it is.  Plan your stay accordingly, plan arrival and departure times, plan your room floor and take all that into account.

Rooms are clean and quiet.  If street noise bothers you, ask for a room on the back side of the hotel.  These rooms are very quiet.  

My complaint about this stay revolves around management not honoring commitments made by front desk staff.

I checked in on February 6, into room 707.  The room was not ready at check-in time at 3:00 p.m.  It was not ready at 4:00 p.m., either.  The front desk clerk was very apologetic.  She gave me a discount coupon for the restaurant and said that I could also have the two bottles of water in the room and she would make a note on my reservation that I would not be charged for them.  

I drank one during my week-long stay.  I stopped at the front desk and told the same clerk, and asked her if the note was still on my reservation.  She checked and said it was.  I asked a different clerk the next day, she checked, and she said the note was there.

When I checked out on February 13, I told the front desk clerk about it.  She checked and said there was a note there and she would not charge me for the water.  It was not on my receipt.

A day later, a charge up $3.29 ($3 for the water and .29 tax) showed up on my credit card statement.  I promptly emailed Hilton guest services about it.  They undertook to investigate.  I provided them with the receipt number and other information they requested.

Yesterday, February 26, I received a communication from Hilton guest services that they understood the hotel had been in communication with me and the matter was resolved.  The hotel had not been in communication with me and when I checked, the charge was still on my credit card.  I replied that their understanding was incorrect - the hotel had not been in communication with me, the matter was not resolved, and the charge was still on my account.

This morning, February 27, I received a communication from Hilton guest services that the manager refused to remove the charge.  The water was consumed and the charge would stand.  

This isn’t about $3.29.  This is about hotel management not backing up staff commitments.

There are a lot of hotels in NYC.  There are a lot of other Hiltons in NYC.  I cannot recommend this one.  If they will cheat on $3.29, what else will they cheat on?

title: Bon rapport qualité/prix
text: L'hôtel est bien situé pour visiter Midtown, les équipements de l'hôtel et des chambres sont grandes et d'un bon niveau. La literie de qualité. Le personnel y est globalement agréable et efficace. Pour un premier séjour en famille, l'avis est positif. 2 bémols : éviter les chambres en angle et privilégier les étages supérieurs pour la vue.

title: Fantastique
text:
Nous sommes restées une petite semaine chambre 503 5e étage . Les plus grande chambre, lit king size, coffre, grande salle de bain. Emplacement exceptionnel. 7 min à pieds de Times Square. Idem de Central Park et du Moma. Stations de métro 5 minutes qui permettent de rayonner dans tous Manhattan sans faire de correspondance. Donc gain de temps indéniable. Personnel adorable et très serviable. Micro onde, frigo de bonne taille type table top, Machine à café dans la chambre. Dosettes fournies (thé, café léger, café médium et deca et chariot à l'etage si vous avez besoins de plus de Dosettes. Contrairement à ce qui est noté, pas de longue attente aux ascenseurs pour nous. Est ce qu'ils ont été renovés ? 
Café et deca et chocolat chaud à volonté gratuit dans le hall le matin. 

La conciergerie peut tout faire ! 

Camion de street food indien en sortant de l'hôtel presqu'en face. Pour 6 à 7 dollars (les prix sont affichés) vous aurez une énorme barquette de riz, viande salade. Il ajoute le piment à la fin seulement mais vous demande avant si vous en voulez ce qui est bien pour les enfants. Boisson 1 dollar. Tout y est délicieux et frais et les vendeurs qui se relaient sont très gentils.

Pizza à 1 dollar à 1min à pieds. Vous pairez 0,50 ct par ingrédient supplémentaire soit 2 dollars la grosse part pepperronis champignons. Vous avez sur la droite du restaurant des flacons de piment, parmesan, origan pour agrémenté selon vos goûts . Il fait les hot dogs à 2 dollars. 

Les moins la douche est difficile à régler et la puissance du jet est très moyenne. La soufflerie est forte mais en février se déclenche très rarement donc pas de gêne pour nous.

title: Excellent location, friendly staff
text: Perfect location, 2mim wall from times square and 10mins from central park, subway 5min walk away, lovely restaurant but pricy!! Pay for what you get in New York. Rooms were spotless but small and nothing fancy for the price. Took at least 5mins at times for the lift to become available. But staff were lovely and location couldn't have been more perfect.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: We had tickets to a venue very close to this hotel and the restaurant was highly recommended by a family member, so we decided to make it a weekend and do a little  must see NYC locations. We had no problems getting a good breakfast and getting on our way. And dinner at the Empire Steak House was excellent!

title: Nothing special, but location is nice
text:
Rooms and in-room amenities are fine, no worries there. Our room had a safe. Staff is hit or miss. Some (housecleaning, doorman, Ashley at front desk) are very friendly and eager to help. Others go out of their way to avoid talking to you. We saw one staffmember (a manager I presume) arguing with three guests in the lobby at one point.

We arrived before check-in time, left our bags and explored the city. Once we received the text that our room was ready, we returned, got our room keys, and then proceeded to wait 25 minutes for the staff to bring our bags to us from another floor. A minor inconvenience for us, but it was a big deal to another group of travelers who were also waiting for bags. They had a car waiting outside the whole time. Bottom line: make sure you have time to spare if you ask them to hold bags for you. Also, the lobby is small and the elevators are slow, though not as slow as others have said (we waited 5 mins. once, I think). Be prepared for a throng of people to be in your way at peak times.

Location is great if you want to explore Midtown. Right around the corner from Colbert and the Late Show. Blocks away from MoMA, Rockefeller Center, Times Square. Only a block or two to the 50 St subway station.  Calibrate your expectations appropriately and this is a good place to stay. But, don't expect to be "wowed." We got a good deal because it was the offseason, so that gives it a value bump.

If you are a Hilton Honors member, make sure to talk to the concierge for tips and discounts to local restaurants.

title: Service horrible, staff has attitude , rooms are decent
text: The staff has the worst service I have experienced .even the lobby manager has such horrible service . Booked 2 weeks in advance and called and asked them if I arrive at 7am can I be checked in early .over the phone it was all yes .When I got there they didn't care one bit .arrived at 7am and they made me wait till 3pm. after being up for 24 hours i did not have energy roam NY so had to sit in lobby for hours

title: Stay was great, post-stay, not so much
text:
I am extremely disappointed with this hotel. I had a great stay and the front desk was very kind. While I was actually at the hotel, everything was great. I stayed from January 26th to January 27th. 

A few hours after I checked out on January 27th, I realized that I left a dress of mine in the closet. I immediately called the hotel and was directed to the lost and found. I got a voicemail, which was fine, so I did as instructed and left my name, number, etc. and was told that I would receive a call back. Two days went by and I didn’t receive a call so I called back myself. This time I was connected to someone in housekeeping and she said that she was just listening to the voicemails today and that she would call me back later that day to let me know whether or not she found my dress. I never received a call back so I called again a few days later and left another voicemail. This process repeated two more times. I spoke to someone on the phone again and they said the same thing that they were going through the lost and found items and would give me a call at the end of the day. Once again, I never received a call. Being frustrated at this point, I left another voicemail a few days later and was still not contacted. This was almost a month ago and I have heard absolutely nothing. 

I am absolutely disgusted by the way the hotel handled this. Even if they couldn’t find the dress, the fact that I left three voicemails and never received a response and was told on the phone more than once that they were looking into it and would call back that day is inexcusable. Being a Hilton Honors member and supporting the chain for a long time, I’m extremely disappointed with this location. I’ve never received such terrible customer service at a Hilton before in my life. The entire thing was very shady and proves that honesty and integrity are not qualities that are important to the staff members of the hotel.

title: A few decorative issues
text:
Having stayed at this hotel in 2014, 2015 and 2016 we returned again in February 2019 and had a brilliant stay. 

As per our previous stays, the staff are so helpful and polite too plus happy to deal with any sort of question be it touristy advice or regarding the hotel itself.

Our only issue is that the rooms most notably the bathrooms seem very tired compared to our original stays. Chipped tiles, toilet roll holder hanging off the wall, shower area stained and generally a little shabby. 

It would be great to stay again in the future but do hope a lick of paint and a few minor maintenance repairs are complete by then.

title: Старенький отель
text: Номера маленькие ,кондиционер гудит,обогреватель трещи , спорт зал в подвале без окон  ,в ванной комнате пол ледяной!!!!  Место расположение отличное !!! Все рядом !!! Завтраки в отеле не стали брать сходили в французское кафе Оооочень понравилось  Maison Kayser !!!!

title: Bad Experience...period.
text: After checking in early (11:00am) and having the hotel hold our bags, we were told we would get a call when the room was ready. By 3:30 when I hadn’t received a call, I went back to the hotel. I was told then, yes your room has been ready. No call, nothing. Then I get the room keys. 2 rooms printed on the sets of keys, 814 & 815. 6 of us go up to the 8th floor and none of the keys work. I head back down, and while “reprogramming the keys, I see her add a 1 before each number, now 1814 and 1815. She tells me they should work now. Really? Maybe if I had the right floor in the beginning there would be no problem. Get to the right rooms now and bags are there. As we get in the room, now all we hear is construction through the wall next door. I call and they say “sorry” it needs to be done”. Next morning at 8:45, same noise. We leave the room at 11:30am to go out for a bit and get back at 2pm to find one of my wife’s diamond earrings missing. I go to the front desk and they eventually get me a manager who was very nice but obviously wouldn’t be able to make the ring appear. I explained that we realize the earrings were left in the counter, but should we have to be worried about one of them going missing!? All in all, I was only offered 3000 hotel points for any of this. I don’t even care about the money. Oh yeah, and the outlets in the room on the desk in 1815 don’t work. They also, in 4 days, never replenished the bottled water in the room.  I travel quite a bit and have been in less expensive hotels with WAY better experiences. I will never go to a Hilton Garden Inn again.

title: Great location & friendly staff
text: Great location, Pre-paid room rate quite reasonable.  Front desk and bell staff very friendly & helpful.  We found the location conventient to subway and areas we wanted to see.  We would definitely consider this hotel for future visits

title: Presidents dsy weekend
text: Lobby, check out very busy and small.  Unable to walk through and be greeted.  Is like been on NY streets.  Dust in room walls and fire extinguisher.  Very amall room.  Sliding bathroom door wiyh no air flow.  Tried to use hh app and did not work.  Checkout was horrible.  Waited in line for 1 of the 2 attendants and got someone take my spot and when i complained i was dismissed and the other persin got an apology from front desk.  Very rude.
