Concierge servicea were poor as well.  Great location.  No pool.  Would go back but knowing that customer service is poor and barely existant.  Room and lobby uncomfortable due to space.  Bed good.  The lady that checked us in did a wonderful job and treated us as if we were special.  That was the best part.  Again, checkout and working your way in and out of tge hotel was a nightmare; elevators included.

title: Me aguardem, que vou voltar!
text:
Acabo de voltar de uma semana em New York, onde estive para celebrar meu aniversário. Escolhi hospedar-me no Hilton Garden Inn CPS e fiquei muito feliz com tudo que vivenciei ali.
A começar pela recepção no checkin, ainda que os aptos. não estejam disponíveis, para quem chega pela manhã, é possível deixar as malas guardadas sem custo e usufruir do café/chá e chocolate quente  colocado no lobby, ofertado aos hóspedes. 
Atendimento da recepção é super atencioso, tem a Maggie no balcão que fala inglês e espanhol, o Nelson disposto a resolver qualquer problema e o Johnatan, sempre sorridente que cuida das malas. Além deles, com quem tive mais contato, toda a equipe da linha de frente é super eficiente e pronta a esclarecer dúvidas, ou responder suas perguntas.
A atmosfera no lobby é muito acolhedora: trilha sonora agradável, um aroma suave e as luzes do teto que mudam de cor sutilmente. Único problema é que por ser um espaço pequeno, alguns hóspedes brasileiros  habituados a falar alto, repetem seu péssimo hábito por ali e chamam a atenção de todos, que entendem ou não o que eles falam...

 3 elevadores dão conta do movimento e mesmo que você precise esperar alguns minutos, não é nada desesperador, em no máximo 3 ou 4 minutos o elevador te alcança, foi esse o maior tempo  que esperei. 
Apartamentos novos, limpos, pequenos mas muito confortáveis; janelões para a cidade oferecem um cenário perfeito para a estada. Camas grandes com roupas limpas e de bom padrão. Ar condicionado e calefação silenciosos. Banheiros claros, com produtos Neutrogena e secador de cabelo potente. Água quente a qualquer tempo, mas ducha poderia ser mais forte. O quarto dispõe de frigobar, máquina de café e microondas. 
Recomendo fortemente a estada no Hilton Garden, em especial pelo atendimento de toda brigada e pela excelente localização, no coração do Hell´s Kitchen e a poucos passos da Times Square e do Central Park.
Voltarei, com certeza. Me aguardem!

title: A great value, good quality, courteous staff
text: We stayed for a three day weekend to attend an award ceremony.  Checkin was a breeze, and the room was very nice.  Small, but quite good by NYC standards.  Clean, well stocked with both a microwave and fridge.  The location is close to Carnegie Hall, and within walking distance of Museum of Natural History.  Eight blocks to times square and theatre district.  Metro station is a block away.  If we attend the event in future, this is where we will stay.  If you want to be closer to Times Square, Hilton has others, BUT Times Square is noisy, this area is not.

title: Perfect!
text:
Great location. Clean rooms. Staff always friendly and accommodating. Any time I travel to NYC, I stay at this Hilton. I've been coming for years and will continue to in the future. Hotel prices in NYC are high so
I plan my trips on lower priced months/days of week.

title: Ótima localização...
text: Ótima localização... Fica quase esquina com a Av.Broadway, entre o Central Park e Times Square... ótimo pra quem que explorar a região a pé... quartos confortáveis, lobby pequeno mas confortável e com café cortesia pela manhã... Vale a pena!!!

title: Great value for your money
text: Stayed here for 3 nights on a trip with a friend.  She'd stayed at the hotel before and said it was a great value and it truly was!  The room is tight quarters and the elevators are slow but it seemed fairly new, very clean and all staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.  This is my new go-to hotel in NYC!

title: My worst New York hotel experience in 45 years
text: I was in a real hurry while checking in, so I didn't notice that the room they put me in was in between two elevators (Room 505).  You read that right  IN BETWEEN TWO ELEVATORS!  I noticed that it was much smaller than the room I had occupied previously at that hotel (hey, those elevators take up space).... but I was late for a meeting, so I dropped my bags and ran out to the meeting.  I wish I had stopped to listen.  Listen?  Yes, listen..... because ALL NIGHT LONG we listened to the banging of elevators (or elevator cables or something) against the walls.  It was impossible to sleep because of the noise.  When I complained to the hotel, they offered me 2,000 bonus points (worth $7) for my discomfort and loss of sleep.  That is no way to treat a Hilton Honors Gold member (or anyone else).  Be aware also:  The elevators are so slow and so backlogged, they have signs in the hallways telling you to leave extra time between the hours of 8 to 10 am and 3 to 5 pm.  You can wait 5 minutes for an elevator to arrive, and the chances are it will be stuffed far over legal capacity.  THIS WAS MY WORST NEW YORK HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER.  I will never go back to this hotel.... or any other Hilton property.

title: Très satisfait
text:
Nous avons passés une semaine dans cet hôtel très idéalement placé pour visiter New York !
Équipements de la chambre satisfaisants avec micro ondes, frigo et cafetière avec disettes fournies.
Très bonne literie. Nous étions au calme dans notre chambre en bout de couloir au 32eme étage. J’en garde un très bon souvenir et recommande cet hôtel sans soucis!
Cf photos de la vue depuis la chambre.

title: Nothing exciting here folks
text:
Front desk service was mediocre, hotel didn’t reply to request / messages via the Hilton app (then why offer this feature?), lobby is tiny and busy all the time...

Rooms are very compact, but clean and with super comfortable beds. WiFi works well. Hotel gym is a cramped, uninspiring hole underground. We did love the central location of the hotel.

The most shocking thing happened on our first night. Fire alarm went off full speed at around 9:30 pm, just when we had gone to bed. It kept going on, and as we could not get through to reception and there were no announcements we took the alarm for real and evacuated from our room on the 28th floor. Lobby was full of people and it was shocking that none of the staff members took any control of the situation. There were no announcements, no information. Eventually fire department arrived, turned the alarm off and left. Still no announcements or assurances that it was safe to return to rooms. I hate to think what could have happened if this had been a real emergency. Not cool at all. We won’t be back with these haunted memories.

title: Great location and nice room for the money
text: Hotel is near Central Park, Broadway Theaters and Carnegie Hall.  Rooms are dark and quiet.  Only real issue is the long wait for elevators; three are not enough,  Several waits were over 10 minutes, and one was 20.  Hard to walk up or down 30+ flights of stairs!  Steakhouse restaurant connected to lobby is pricey.  Drinks are decent, but also pricey.  Good homemade potato chips, though!

title: Treated Like Royalty
text: This is a typical Hilton in that the beds are comfy, rooms are super clean, breakfast is good and location is well-situated for walking everywhere.  What stood out for us was how friendly everyone was - from the late night service crew arriving for their all-night shifts to the waiters at breakfast to the front desk, to the maids in the hall, every single person we encountered seemed genuinely happy that we were there.  We loved this visit and wish we could go back tomorrow!

title: Pongan atención al momento de pagar el hospedaje
text: Lamentablemente nos hicieron cargo doble del hospedaje, situación que a la fecha sigue sin solucionarse, según el gerente del hotel, la situación ya estaba del lado del banco para arreglarse, pero llamando con el banco, nos hicieron saber que el hotel no había liberado aún el reembolso, el cual aparentemente se vera devuelto hasta un mes posterior al tiempo que estuvimos ahí

title: Excelente ubicación, limpio, personal amable
text:
Nos hospedamos en la semana de navidad de 2018. El hotel está muy bien ubicado, se  puede acceder caminando a gran cantidad de puntos turísticos y también a pocas cuadras hay una estación de subte.
Ofrecían por la mañana café y otras bebidas calientes de cortesía en vasos térmicos para llevar. 
La habitación no era gigante pero tenía todo lo necesario para una buena estadía. Contaba con microondas y pava eléctrica y Wifi gratuito que funcionaba correctamente.
El hotel no cuenta con muchos ascensores si se considera la cantidad de pisos y habitaciones, por lo que tuvimos que esperar varios minutos casi todos los días para subir y bajar.

title: Girls Trip!
text: The hotel was in an excellent location!!  We could walk to Central Park in about 5 minutes.  Great shopping all around. Great food and wonderful  restaurants ALL around.  We went to see Mean Girls while we were there.  We were able to walk to theaterand eat at a wonderful restaurant.  I  highly suggest going to Patsy's!!  The best italian food!!!   I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff was friendly and very helpful!  We truly enjoyed our stay here!

title: Ok but needs renovation
text:
Location is good, rooms are worn but ok and they have free coffee in the mornings. 

However plumbing needs a serious upgrade. Showers take ages to get warm and there is very little pressure. A clogged drain that made the room smell too bad to stay in took them hours to get around to not fixing so we had to move room. They then moved us to a room between two elevators (claiming you could not hear them) with the window facing straight into a wall. When we pointed out we had paid for city view and the bed was shaking from the elevators we were met with indifference. Not until we asked to speak to the manager did we get moved to the room we had paid for but by then we had vasted 4 hours of our vacation. We have been happy with Hilton hotels before but this one is just not up to standard.

title: Location, location, location
text: This HGI does not charge the ridiculous "resort fee" the boutique hotels in NYC charge, and the nightly rate was very fair. The location of this HGI was fantastic, as we were in town to see our nephew's orchestra perform at Carnegie Hall which is just blocks away. We stayed in room 3413, and while the room is typical NYC small, the decor is modern and the shower pressure and hot water were excellent.Staff were helpful as well. I would definitely book here again.

title: Localização nota 1000
text:
Perto de tudo! Colado na Broadway, este hotel está próximo da entrada sul do Central Park, da 5a avenida, de estação do metrô, do MoMa. Impossível melhor localização. Atendimento cordial, quartos limpos e equipados. 
Ar condicionado fazia um pouquinho de barulho. E o único inconveniente foi um dos elevadores quebrados, o que provocava um certo congestionamento nos horários de pico!
Apesar disso, super recomendo o hotel, inclusive pelo valor da diária!

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Arrived home today from a fabulous 4 night stay at this lovely hotel.
Having never been to NYC before, didn't know what to expect but I would highly recommend this hotel & would definitely stay again.

It is located on a lovely street, only a few mins walk from 5th Av, Times Square & Broadway. Central Park is only 10min walk Everything you need is nearby.

Our room on the 27th floor was lovely, very clean & the bed/pillows were so comfortable (I wanted to bring them home)! Housekeeping came in everyday, couldn't fault it. 
Room has a hairdryer so no need to bring one, also has x2 USB ports on a bedside clock so if you forget your plug adaptor, No panic, you can still charge your phone! 

We were a party of 7 for my partner's daughters 21st birthday & we all had rooms next to each other. The staff were all brilliant, friendly, very helpful & a pleasure to talk to! Thank you for making it a great stay for us! 

The hotel provides free tea/coffee in the lobby in the mornings & fruit infused water through the day. The room also had a great coffee/tea pod maker :) ...Being English, we like our tea! 

The only downside in my opinion is that there is no separate service lift for the maids/staff so on occasions there was a wait for the lift. Although there are 3 lifts! It wasn't an issue for us, but maybe for impatient people!! 

The Empire steakhouse & bar joined to the hotel is excellent & the staff are fantastic, don't forget to try the happy hour! Roberto made our stay absolutely fantastic. Thank you! 

All in all a huge thumbs up & apart from the lifts, I can't think of anything else negative :) :)

title: Gorge prijs/kwaliteit
text: Locatie is echt een top (2min van Times Square en 5min van Central Park) . Kamers zijn proper soms wat klein. Personeel is ok. Leuk ontbijt met zelfgemaakte waffels. Fitnessruimte aanwezig. Wifi is traag.

title: Great location
text: Conveniently located near the Broadway theatre and Lincoln Center. Large clean rooms with a microwave and refrigerator . Close to Times Square and walking distance to the Ports Authority as well as Rockerfeller Center, buses and the subway.

title: There may be better options
text: One good thing - the location. Otherwise I would look at other options. Even though NYC, the rooms are quite small. The staff "bothered" me twice about switching out of two bed set-up into a king even though I was traveling with my daughter, a high school senior in the city for college interviews. Even when explaining this, the staff seemed not to understand that reality. The elevators - one word: disaster. People were totally upset and the staff failed to care. Parking - $75/day for a small SUV. Found a lot across the street for $40 per day. Literally across the street. There are two competitor places to stay right next door and have stayed in one of them which was MUCH better and at a lower price point. As stated, look at other options.

title: Nice hotel, bad elevator situation.
text:
The property is nice. Rooms are clean, beds comfortable. The elevator situation makes this place a no-go for my future travels. 3 elevators, 1 of them out of commission - end result was up to 10 minute waits in the lobby to get on.

Breakfast buffet was not great for a HGI in my experience. I have seen Hampton Inns with a better spread.

I use Hilton properties all the time. I likely won't use this one again, especially with so many options in the area.

title: Magnifico hotel, un poco impersonal, pero limpio y comodo.
text: Es un hotel estupendo, muy bien situado, como muchos servicios, personal agradable. Muy comodo todo, estupendos desayunos a la amerciana. Traslados al aeropuerto desde el propio hotel, problema con los ascensores.

title: Good value and location
text: We stayed a week and found this hotel just fine: friendly staff, quiet room (14th floor); good location and value for money. The room had a fridge, micro-wave and coffee machine, so we saved on eating breakfast out at least. Our only gripe were the lifts, which often seemed to have 1 or 2 (out of 3) not working, resulting in long waits.

title: laute Heizung im Winter
text:
wie mehrfach beschrieben: super Lage in Midtown, gut ausgestattet mit Kaffeemaschiene, Bügeleisen, sauberes Bad, freundliches Personal ... wie mehrfach beschrieben. Nur: bei kalten Temperaturen unter 0 wird es unangenehm. Die Fenster /-rahmen beschlagen innen mit Eis, die Heizung im Zimmer springt regelmässig an,  sie läuft SEHR LAUT, geht dann wieder aus und wieder an: also entweder schlafen oder frieren. 
Ansonsten erschien uns das Zimmer nach Außen (zur Strasse) sogar recht gut gedämmt und ruhig. Blöd lediglich die (verschlossene) Tür zum Nachbarzimmer, durch die jedes Geräusch zu hören ist.

title: Excellent hotel, great value
text: We chose this hotel due to its close proximinty to Feinstein’s 54 Below and because we are Hilton Honors members. The price was less than $200 for a two queen room on a weeknight. Front desk was consistently friendly. The room was modern, attractive with a fridge and microwave. It is a NYC sized room (not huge) but the use of space is efficient. Everything was spotless. Bathroom is a good size with a walk in shower. I would recommend new larger shower heads but overall very nice. Weekdays from 5-7 there is complimentary wine, snacks, and live music in the lobby. There are many theaters, bars, and restaurants in this neighborhood. It’s a short walk to Times Square and fairly close to Central Park. We were on the 32nd floor and it was pretty quiet for sleeping. Nice city view up there! We were very happy with our stay and would recommend this type of room for a short stay.

title: Natale a New York
text:
Abbiamo scelto questo hotel per la nostra vacanza nella grande mela tra Natale e capodanno.
Posizione ottima, a due passi dalla fermata della metro da e per l’aeroporto, e vicinissima alle fermate di altre linee.
Praticamente su Broadway, a 5 minuti da Time Square e da Central Park, vicinissima a Starbuck e Dunkin’Donuts per delle ottime colazioni all’inizio della giornata.
Ci siamo mossi quasi sempre a piedi, macinando 18-20km al giorno, e consigliamo a tutti coloro che vogliono visitare NYC di farlo il più possibile a piedi, scoprendo ogni angolo della città.
L’hotel era molto pulito ed ordinato, molto bella l’idea dei dispenser di bevande nella reception la mattina presto o nel pomeriggio.
Effettivamente gli ascensori sono un po’ caotici, ma tutto sommato non è un problema, ogni volta abbiamo aspettato massimo 2 minuti prima che arrivasse al nostro piano.

title: Great Location
text: This hotel is located between 8th Avenue and Broadway! It’s very accessible to great restaurants and shopping. It’s only a few blocks from Times Square and all the Broadway theaters. The hotel staff was very helpful while there and very knowledgeable. The room was clean and spacious. I would definitely stay in this hotel again when I visit NY!!!

title: greart stay until leaving
text:
we loved the central location.   near to theaters, central park, etc.   good local parking garages.. 

BUT as others have noted:  THE ELEVATORS.

when leaving yesterday morning about 10:30, on MLK day, a Monday, we waited over 1 hour for an elevator to come to the 27th floor.

I am diabetic, and with no food, etc. this could really have presented a problem.   I survived BUT....

there was no management or staff support for managing the elevators---at least one was broken.   when we got one, it became an express to floor 1...  something very wrong with this....

the front desk said, "we apologize", but what if there was an emergency???

while I would like to stay there again, as a gold member, I WILL NOT...  It will be the 2 Marriott properties next door.

What moron designed this building with over 30 floors and only 3 elevators???

Promised bonus points have not materialized, but honestly I should receive back some of the 150,000+ pts I used to stay here for 3 days???

title: gran hotel
text: Perfectamente ubicado, a 5 minutos de times square, todos los serevicios, desayuno americano fantastico, habitaciones amplias y comodisimas, lo unico un poco debil, la wiffi, en el hol y la cafeteria bien ,pero en las habitaciones justito

title: Wonderful Stay
text: The hotel was wonderful from every point of view: it is centrally located, with restaurants, shops and Broadway theatres close by, as is public transportation. The hotel itself has all amenities a guest could wish for: a wonderful restaurant and bar with friendly hospitable staff, free wifi throughout the hotel, ice machines, business center with printer, even a guest laundromat! All this is topped off by a warm welcoming staff for whom nothing is too much, and who are determined to resolve any problem that may occur during your stay! I especially want to mention Raymi at the frontdesk, and the guest services manager on duty when i arrived (evening Jan 18th); whose card i unfortunately misplaced, so i do not have his name, but who went above & beyond to help me! But all staff were wonderful, and made me feel i had found a new “home”! I shall be back!

title: Terrible customer service
text: Booked a room for the day just to take a nap from a long trip, hotel room was clean and spacious. However the fire alarm was on the entire time I was in the room so I was not able to sleep at all. Called and tried to reach manager, they just picked the phone and hung up, never talked to me. Called again and spoke with the manager who didnt have any empathy at all, arranged to get partial refund. Asked for confirmation email of the refund, but never got it.

title: Great value in Midtown area.
text: 2nd time I've stayed here.  Cozy little property with a solid staff, helpful bellmen and nice rooms.   Only one issue, NY Hotel rooms are notoriously small and the room I had was just too small for a King bed.  I'd have been happy with a queen bed and a little more room to maneuver.   Love that there's a fridge and microwave in the room.  Great shower and the morning coffee and afternoon flavored water are nice little amenities.   Maybe some late night coffee for us night owls.

title: Comfortable room and helpful staff
text: This is the 2nd time I've stayed here. Both times my stay was very good. Front desk staff I thought did a great job even during hours of peak activity. Decent selection of bars and restaurants close by and on site. Will definitely stay here again

title: Días de paseo por NYC
text:
Muy buen hotel . 
Habitaciones confortables y bien equipadas
Buena vista en pisos altos.
Personal. Muy servicial y dedicado 
A un paso de Time square y Columbia circle y del metro
Buena promoción por booking

title: Nice stay
text: Excellent staff at check in. Very accommodating and helpful. Rooms are on the small side for this chain, but it’s NY. For the small size, the space was used well, and the room was very clean.  We did have a negative experience dining in the  restaurant, but this is managed separately from the hotel - writing as a caution to others.

title: Ottima posizione!!!
text: Nota dolente la receptionist di notte.Siamo arrivati a tarda notte per inconvenienze di volo molto stanchi per il tragitto da JFK aiport all'hotel molto carino e pulito, ma l'accoglienza è stata la peggiore della nostra vita di viaggiatori in quasi tutto il mondo!!!! Receptionist sgarbata,maleducata,arrogante ed ignorante. Ci ha dato la chiave della stanza che non funzionava ,ritornati alla reception senza scusarsi minimamente dell'incoveniente ha resettato la chiave e ci ha rispedito con bagagli, stanchi morti, di nuovo alla stessa stanza e nuovamente non funzionava....motivo? Era già occupata,una signora svegliata nel bel mezzo della notte ci urlava hi fosse che cercava di entrare nella stanza!!!! Riscendiamo per l'ennesima volta ,e lei senza scomporsi minimamente o scusarsi ci ha dato un'altra tessera per la stanza. Finalmente ,ripresi i nostri bagagli siamo riusciti ad avere una stanza .Peccato perchè per il resto non posso dire niente di negativo. Il personale della mattina gentilissimo e professionale mi hanno riportato il buon umore. Posizione dell'albergo abbastanza vicino alle maggiori attrazioni,la metro a pochi metri ti porta ovunque tu voglia andare, al ferry boat per fare un bel giro nella baya di Hudson e gustarti da vicino la statua della libertà e il ponte di brooklin.

title: Weekend getaway
text:
Room was clean and bathroom kept nice. Stayed on eighth floor Elevators are a bit slow and do heat up your water before u are ready to shower.  Coffee goes fast downstairs so never got a cup.  Location is nice though. 

Why bothered me the most is my pants that got taken. I left leather pants hanging in the bathroom and checked out.  When I  called back to get them of course they are “missing”. Obviously house keeping kept  them and never turned them in. Would excpect more from their employees to not steal    Not happy about that.

title: Problemas con los cobros de la estadía
text: Se nos hizo varios cobros repetidos en la tarjeta de crédito cosa que tratamos de aclarar. Se nos aseguró que todo estaba arreglado, pero siguieron apareciendo cobros indebidos y finalmente nos cobraron el valor de la estadía de tres piezas en vez de dos. A cinco días de haber terminado la estadía aún no se soluciona el problema.

title: Nice stay
text: We stayed here over the weekend and was very pleased. It was clean.  The rooms small but nice.  The staff friendly. The location was great.  The only two issues is that the beds are horribly firm.  I think I might have done better to move my pillow to the floor.  And we were traveling with children and requested either connecting rooms or rooms near each other.  After booking we were told that morning on the drive there that not only do they not having connecting rooms but that one room was going to be on the 12th floor and one on the 34th floor!  This required us to now split up our family.  It made our stay very difficult and hard to meet up as we now had to fight the elevators and waits for them just to get things or see each other.  We made this reservation through the call reservation center.  If they don't know what a hotel offers they shouldn't tell us we will be able to get it and if they can't or wont honor a request so simple as put us near each other.......then they shouldn't say they can do that either. By the time we arrived there were no other rooms available and we were stuck.  Their compromise was to move us the following day which was really impossible.  1.  who wants to pack up and move again?  2. we weren't going to be in the hotel from 8am until bedtime so how were we going to move?  Cancel our plans to move luggage?  It was very disappointing.  If I had been told all this prior I honestly more than likely would have looked elsewhere.  They also charged for water that was not used.  We went to the store and bought our own vs paying for a $3/4 bottle.  It was not on our receipt but it showed on the credit card bill.  We had to call about that too.  They did remove it but make sure you check your bills and credit card statements. Over all, if not booking multiple rooms or caring which floor you are on or room you are in isn't an issue, I would stay again.  The hotel over all was very nice.  Just have a heads up in regard to the issues we had if they may apply to you.

title: Room very uncomfortable , service not proactive in solving the noise problem.
text: Our stay was affected by being assigned a room that was really uncomfortable. The heater was very noisy when in use (so at night time we didn't sleep at all) , we reported the issue to the Reception after the first night asleep but they only changed room after 3 nights because they wanted to try to manage the issue as room repair first (not possible for sure, as they realized later). We expected Hilton care about guests to be different. Moreover , at the end we spent 3 nights out of 6 without sleeping but no discout or upgrade of room was proposed as mitigation for the disturb.

title: Gutes Hotel, schlechtes Frühstück
text:
Wir waren über Sylvester 2018-2019 in diesem Hotel, d.h. vom 31.12.- 3.1. Das Hotel war sehr gut, sehr freundlicher Empfang, sehr hilfsbereites Personal. Ich hatte nach einem ruhigen Zimmer gefragt, das möglichst hoch liegt... Ich bekam das Zimmer 3405, d.h. im höchsten Stockwerk. Als wir dort ankamen, war ich geschockt, da das Zimmer genau zwischen den Liften lag... Ein langer Gang führte ins Zimmer, das grösser war, als ich angenommen habe. Das Zimmer war schön, sauber und es fehlte an nichts... doch, der Kühlschrank war leer. Das Zimmer war ideal!! Wo ich dachte, dass wir andauernd durch die Aufzüge gestört werden würden, hat sich als Fehler herausgestellt! Das Zimmer war herrlich ruhig, schöne Aussicht auf die Nachbarhochhäuser. Es war ein tolles Zimmer. Würde ich immer wieder nehmen!!
Dann morgens, das Frühstück! Es gab Bacon, Würstchen und Scrambled Eggs. Ein wenig Teilchen, ein paar salzige Bagels, zwei Sorten Marmelade und einen Toaster, wo die eine Hälfte nicht funktionierte. Der Kaffee war Spülwasser... (ist normal für die USA). Das Personal war sehr unfreundlich... Am Abreisetag meinte ich zu dem Kellner, dass das Frühstück bei uns im Preis mit inbegriffen war. Er fragte dann nach dem Voucher?.?.?.? Leider hatte man vergessen, uns beim Einchecken darauf hinzuweisen, dass das Frühstück an das anliegende Restaurant outgesourced wurde und man jeden Tag ein Voucher vorlegen muss. Hier gab es zwischen mir und dem Verantwortlichen des Frühstücksbereichs eine unfreundliche Auseinandersetzung, als dieser meinte, dass dies nun schon abgeschlossen war, und dass ich das Frühstück zusätzlich zu bezahlen hätte. Ich meinte zu ihm, dass ich das nicht machen würde, da es inklusive sei. Es war sehr unangenehm... Er meinte noch, dass es eine andere Gesellschaft sei, jedoch meinte ich zu ihm, dass ich mein Zimmer mit Frühstück bei Hilton gebucht habe. Mich interessiere nicht, ob es eine andere Gesellschaft sei... Er meinte dann noch frech, dass es ja mein Geld sei, das abgebucht werden würde... Ich habe dies dann an die Rezeption weitergegeben und diese haben das gesamte Problem ohne weiteres gelöst. Ich möchte mich hier über diesen Weg nochmals herzlich für deren effizientes Verhalten bedanken. Es wurde mir kein Aufschlag berechnet! Also: Aufpassen, dass man sein Voucher vorlegt beim Frühstück, oder noch besser: woanders frühstücken!

title: GREAT HOTEL AND STAFF
text: Great location, very friendly and helpful staff, very close to Time Square and Central Park, a lot of restaurants a things to do and see around. Clean rooms, comfortable bed, good fitness club. Over all great experience :).

title: Nice Hotel, Super Small Guestrooms
text: The Hilton Garden Inn is a very nice hotel but the guestrooms are extremely small.  The hotel is located in close proximity to Times Square and Central Park.  The staff is very friendly and professional.

title: Great location
text: Me and my sister stayed here for a night because we went to New York to surprise our dad for his birthday, hotel is nice great location to some good places. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom was nice, the only thing I did not like about this hotel was the long waits just to get into an elevator, one of them was broken but even after it got fixed there was still a line to get in one. Overall it was a good night stay.

title: Zweiter Aufenthalt im Hotel, nach wie vor sehr gut!
text:
Wir waren schon vor über zwei Jahren einmal in diesem Hotel und nachdem es uns damals sehr gut gefallen und alles gepasst hat, haben wir uns dazu entschlossen, auch diesmal wieder dort zu übernachten.
Dank der Möglichkeit in der HIlton App, sich das Zimmer selbst auszusuchen, haben wir genau das gleiche Zimmer erwischt, wie schon vor 2 Jahren: Ein Zimmer im obersten (34.) Stockwerk am Ende des Ganges. Es handelt sich dabei um ein Zimmer mit zwei Queen Size Betten.
Im Unterschied zu vor 2 Jahren, waren wir diesmal schon zu viert unterwegs, meine Frau und ich mit unseren beiden Mädels. Das Zimmer hatte eine ordentliche Größe und nachdem wir eigentlich ohnehin fast nur zum Schlafen dort waren, hat das perfekt so gepasst. Auch das Badezimmer war für unsere Verhältnisse groß genug, außerdem sehr schön ausgeleuchtet.
Zimmer war sehr sauber und gut und zweckmäßig eingerichtet. Das einzige, das uns gefehlt hat, war eine Möglichkeit in der Nähe der Tür unsere Jacken aufzuhängen. Hier gab es leider keinen Haken oder Ähnliches...
Sehr nett war die Möglichkeit, kostenfrei Tee oder Kaffee im Zimmer zuzubereiten.
In der Lobby gab es in der Früh immer gratis Tee und Kaffee zum Mitnehmen, das war sehr angenehm!
Frühstück haben wir im angrenzenden Empire Streak House eingenommen, dank unserer Hilton Gold Mitgliedschaft kostenfrei. Das Frühstück war gut und die Auswahl ausreichend und ab dem zweiten Tag hatten sie auch die Temperatur im Lokal im Griff (am ersten Tag haben wir gefroren).

Zu den Liften, weil anscheinend jeder darüber schreibt: Wir hatten keine Probleme, die Wartezeit betrug einmal maximal 2 Minuten...

Fazit: Sehr gutes Hotel zu einem vernünftigen Preis in wirklich ausgezeichneter Lage. Wir kommen wieder!

title: Great Location, In Walking Distance of Most NYC Attractions
text: This Hotel is in a PRIME location. We came for my sister's bacherlettes party. Hilton Garden Inn was walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, Rockerfeller Center, etc. It was also Directly across the street is a popular club called Iguanas it was so convenient to party until 3 am and be just across the street from your hotel. This hotel made you feel apart of the action of NYC but secluded to also have some peace in quiet (They have blackout curtains #winning #bestsleep). It was a perfect combination and I will definitely be using them again! The only con was the carpets needed cleaning in our room. But there were vacuumed.

title: Family Vacation to NYC
text: We enjoyed the Hilton Garden Inn very much with exception of the beds and pillows. The bed was too firm for us and the pillows were flat. We did not sleep well, even though we were exhausted from miles of walking. The hotel is in an excellent location with easy access to Times Square. We enjoyed our trip very much!

title: In the heart of Broadway.
text: This Hilton Garden inn is in a prime location for seeing a Broadway show. Also very close to Central Park. If you need to go further than that be sure to set up a cab or Uber in advance. The room we had was very tight on space. I guess that is to be expected in this prime location.

title: Service and house keeping very non responsive
text: Not happy with the service we received here.  Housekeeping never came to our room during our 3 day/ 2 nite stay.  Asked for additional towels by maid outside door and she said she would bring them in broken English...never did ...had to call front desk/ housekeeping to get fresh towels.  Breakfast was mediocre and expensive...would have been ok if free but had better breakfast around the corner 2nd morning

title: Good value hotel option for NYC
text:
Visited as a family and thought it was good value for money. Great location, clean and great service. Expect it to be busy and room on the smaller side as it is New York. Bathroom however is a good size, especially for New York. Found it to be comparable to the Hilton property just down the road. 

Did not eat at restaurant on site as lots of other options in the neighborhood.

title: NYC Holiday
text: Great staff! The location was very convenient. Hotel is walking distance to Central Park and Times Square.The rooms are very clean and cozy. The bathroom was nice and clean.However, the price is quite high for the size of the room.

title: Very Good Stay
text: Great location - spent 6 nights staying in a recently refurbished room on a high floor - remarkably quiet at night for centre of city.  Service was very good and friendly including helpful concierge.  Breakfast was fine as buffets go.  Evening drink at bar enjoyable.  Would stay here again when in New York.

title: limite limite.....
text: Heureusement que l’hôtel est idéalement placé, propre et dispose d'une literie très confortable car tout le reste est très limite pour un hôtel de cette catégorie. Vieillot, défraîchi, encombré, il faut attendre des heures la disponibilité des 3 malheureux ascenseurs qui desservent 34 étages... lobby minuscule, chambres clairement démodées et usées, climatisation ultra bruyante, douche d'un autre siècle, eau chaude au bout d'un quart d'heure d'ouverture du robinet... mais tout est propre et le personnel est correct, alors l'un dans l'autre, on reste satisfait.

title: 良かった
text:
クィーンサイズのツインで5泊しました。
立地条件が良く、部屋は清潔で、冷蔵庫も電子レンジもありとても便利だったが、
チェックインの際にセキュリティーフィーみたいなのが余分にかかると言われたので、ヒルトンの予約アプリを見せ、予約金額を見せたところ、それは日本の予約価格だと言われ、予約時よりも300ドルほど高い金額を請求されたけれど、結局、カードの引き落とし額にはその額は含まれていなかったし、チェックアウト時に明細をプリントアウトしてもらったけど元々予約した金額のままだった。
そもそも、全世界共通のアプリなので日本の予約価格など無いと思う。私の英語力が足りなかっただけなのか…

title: Family trip to New York City
text: Excellent location. Just a few blocks from Times Square. We prefer this as less noisy and congested but an easy walk.  Close to Central Park which we loved.  Clean, friendly, subway nearby. Plenty of food options

title: Great stay in great location
text: This hotel is in a nice location near many great restaurants in walking distance to Central Park.  The room is spacious.  The place could use a little updating.  This is a great value considering where it’s located.  Service is very good.  Manager Darrin was very accommodating and helped to make our stay enjoyable.

title: Garden Inn always delivers
text: I have stayed at numerous Hilton Garden Inns over the years and I have to say that they are one of the most comfortable places to stay. The beds are very comfortable as are the pillows usually(pillows were a little too soft for my taste). The staff is always very helpful. We asked for items and they were delivered promptly, with a smile. I just find this hotel very comfortable for the price. We stayed 3 nights and were close to the subway and were able to get to where ever we needed to go. Just a great experience.

title: Muy buena experiencia
text: Muy buena experiencia, fui con mi hija. La zona muy segura, se podía caminar de noche sin problemas, cerca al metro, cerca también a: Central Park, Time Square, MOMA, los teatros, muchos restaurantes en los alrededores, el hotel tenía buen servicio y habitaciones cómodas y limpias.

title: Great stay
text: I’d read about the rooms being small but was pleasantly surprised, decent sized room, big bed, room was clean and presented to high standard. Coffee/tea machine was nice. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful throughout our stay. It was my first trip to New York so location was perfect, Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller all a short walk away. Plenty of places to eat and drink close by. Would happily stay again.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great medium sized hotel in the heart midtown.  We love the location only blocks from Time Sq and Central Park.  Friendly staff and quite comfortable rooms.  This was our third return visit to the property.

title: Great Stay at HGI NYC/CP South
text: Don’t understand some of the bad reviews. Room was very clean and staff was very friendly and helpful. Checked bags following an early morning arrival. Was notified by text that the room was ready at 12:05 PM - a pleasant surprise. Was greeted by the staff in the lobby each time we entered or exited over a four day stay. Elevators were always available within a couple of minutes. Reasonable for a 30+ story building. Overall, it was a great stay!

title: Location Location Location !!!
text: We booked 2 rooms and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn New York/Central Park South-Midtown West on our annual New York Christmas trip. This was our 11th trip. We've stayed in different hotels all over the City. This hotel is in best location of any we've stayed at. It's in the Theater district close to all the tourist attractions. Just blocks from Columbus circle , central park, times square, Rockefeller center, 5th ave. etc.etc.  The Hotel rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. I liked the walk in shower. The staff were friendly and  helpful. I'm not meaning to make this a negative review as I'll probably be booking this hotel for next year. The location out weighs a few flaws.  The rooms are typical  small New York Hotel rooms. I read reviews that people didn't like the sliding bathroom door. I didn't think much of it but I can see the negative now. The shower doors are clear and the sliding bathroom door doesn't lock so if Your traveling with a child they could easily just come in the bathroom and see more than you'd like them to. The  hot water takes a long time to get to the shower. We called the front desk thinking there was a problem. They told us to run the hot water in the sink 1st. They said that would help speed things up. It did but Who wants to do that every morning ? The lobby of the hotel is small. Not a big deal but could be if your waiting for a car service or something else. Not much room for sitting. The biggest issue are the elevators. 3 elevators just aren't enough for a 34 floor hotel. Their is a sign on the elevators giving peak times and telling you to make plans for delays. We were leaving at 6:15 PM one night for Radio City Music hall to see the Rocketttes.  This was outside the posted peak times. It took 25 minutes for the elevator to come.  We called the desk to make sure their wasn't a problem.We had to skip dinner because of the elevators issue.  I know it's for security but you have to swipe your room key in the elevator for it to work. It's a hassle when your carrying bags or luggage to get your room key out. Over all this hotel is probably better than I'm making it sound like. I wanted to let you know all the negatives. One tip is book early. I booked almost a full year out. In just a few weeks the price had gone up 2 1/2 times.  I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay at a great location in Manhattan.

title: Nice hotel and area
text: Used this property for a evening near a show. Somewhat secluded from the hustle and bustle. Our rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff and service was great. I would definitely recommend to others in need of a great location for a show.

title: I LOVE Hilton Central Park Midtown South/West New York
text: This was actually my mother and I's first trip to New York which both fulfilled one of my bucket list items and also completed the celebration of my mother's 78th birthday. What can I say but, "Location, location location." Nearly every where I wanted to go was within a 5-10 minute walk. My stay at this Hilton Central Park Midtown South/West was the ideal location. It was so refreshing and restful. I don't think I could have found a better location with a better staff. Cleanliness is next to godliness. It was centrally located to my four main places of interests (the Alvin Ailey Dance Theatre, the New York City Center, Broadway & Time Square). The staff were all so cordial and professional, from Doorman & Bell Cap to front desk and room service. They really seemed to enjoy doing what they do. I must give special kudos to front desk personnel "Serenity".

title: Nice hotel! - Great location!
text: I find Hilton's to be a little on the pricey side but if you can get a good deal, this hotel is definitely worth it.  Room was very nice, mini fridge, tv, nice bathroom with all the amenities.  Great location! Will definitely stay there again.

title: Another really nice Hilton property
text: If you plan to stay in New York’s theater district, you would be hard pressed to find a better location.  The hotel rooms are a bit on the smaller side, but spotless. We checked-in on a Saturday afternoon,12/1, so the process was a bit slow, not unreasonable.Keep in mind by staying here, you are literally a short walk from hundreds of entertainment locations and restaurants

title: Not Hilton's best effort
text: My family and I stayed 11/30-12/2, Check in was easy.  I reported a problem with the TV 3 times to no avail.  If you stay here pick a low level floor, elevators took too long.  Room was clean and staff was friendly.  As usual the City was a great time.

title: Perfectly fine for a few days in the city
text: Location was great for tourism and it was easy to get where we needed to go. Within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, Broadway and plenty of restaurants, so it's great for first time visitors. I usually prefer to stay downtown when visiting the city, but it was fun to stay in this area too. Hotel staff was nice and rooms were clean enough.

title: Do not stay
text: I stay in 70 Hilton properties a year and this is absolutely the worst property. Staff is rude. Floors filthy and sticky and water pressure randomly flips to cold after a half hour of warming up. Do not waster your time or money here. Many other properties to choose from.

title: Good location
text: While the Uber driver had some challenges getting to the hotel from the airport because of street closings, walking to the various sites is the preferred method of transportation. Even with the chilly weather, walking distance were not too great to the theaters, restaurants and Rockefeller Center.

title: Fantástico
text: Localização, acomodação, gentileza dos funcionários....excelente!!! Recomendo e voltarei a me hospedar nesse hotel quando possível! O hotel fica muito próximo do metrô que nos permite conhecer toda Manhattan! Recomendo!

title: Very nice property, but small rooms.
text: Very courteous, helpful, and professional staff!Was a good value for well located hotel.Well located near Central Park and Rockefeller CenterBreakfast was disappointing. Dining staff was excellent.

title: Worst Customer Service
text: Do Not Recommend for a family stay nor individual. The hotel restaurant was ok however they were not well stocked on certain food and beverage items.  This is surprising since my stay was during the holiday season!

title: Disappointing - DO NOT book a suite
text:
I’m going to keep this pretty brief, but on the whole I wouldn’t recommend this hotel.

The reception staff are surly, and when things go wrong, they get worse. 

The “suite” that I booked had initially been oversold.So we were offered the most basic room, with the potential to “upgrade” (which would still have been a downgrade, price-wise) the next day.after a chat with the manager we managed to get what we’d booked, albeit the room we were given probably should’ve been out of service.

The room was tiny and was unrecognisable as a suite at any other hotel I’ve ever stayed at. It does have the basic amenities of a coffee machine and microwave and coffee machine, but the terrace which comes as part of the suite was also disappointing. The “suites” are only located on the second floor, between high rise buildings, so you can imagine that the view isn’t exactly spectacular.

The actual room was very basic, with a TV that didn’t work and took 3 days and 5 phone calls to fix, and heating that packed up on the last day. There was maintenance in the room next door to us which started at 06:10 in the morning, although the hotel assured us the noise was coming from outside (the “maintenance” tag on the door of the room gave it away though). 

The reception is small and chaotic and all the staff we interacted with seem to consider guests to be an inconvenience. They’re not interested in sorting out any issues, or how your stay is going.

The maintenance of the room was poor, with threadbare carpets. Space in the room (remember it was a “suite”) was also minimal, with about 18” between the end of the bed and the fancy Herman Miller chair, that the hotel seem to make a feature of.

These issues were obviously raised with the hotel staff during the stay. their excuse for not being able to deal with them was that the room was booked via a third party, though in reality I suspect they just weren’t interested.

On the whole, don’t stay here. Unless you want to feel resentful, ripped off, claustrophobic, and like you’re a downright inconvenience.

title: Estancia perfecta
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado y perfecto en relación calidad precio para Nueva York, muy buen tamaño de las habitaciones, cafe, te y agua gratis en el lobby. Muy limpia y comoda la habitación. Servicio de guarda equipajes durante el ultimo dia muy controlado. En resumen, un hotel de 10.

title: Ok
text: Tinha um barulho constante no quarto, vindo do aquecedor. O pessoal do quarto ao lado batia as portas e gritava às 5 da manhã (acho que eles tinham parentes em outros quartos). A localização é muito boa, a Internet e o atendimento também.

title: What more could you ask for!!
text: Great location, helpful staff, well equipped room:  coffee machine, microwave and frig.  The room was clean and updated.  Housekeeping paid attention to detail.  The rate was a good value.  We will definitely be back.

title: Uptown Location - Close Proximity to All Areas
text: Came into New York for the Thanksgiving Holiday and stayed here.  Service was very professional.  The staff was cordial and friendly.  Our room for three adults was tight.  The room was better suited for a single king bed than the two doubles.  Kept bumping my knee on the wooden exposed frame.  Clean and the bathroom was updated.  The biggest issue with this hotel are the elevators.  Three (3) total for 34 floors.  People were complaining that they couldn't get to their floor.  Wait times were a minimum of 15 minutes with the holiday crowd.  They should really consider making the elevators express elevators to go directly to and bypass floors.  Thankfully we were only on the sixth floor and walked up and down the stairs - even with our heavy luggage.  If you have a lot of time to waste on waiting - another hotel would be better.  If you can't take the stairs I would consider another hotel.  The room was as pictured but not spacious. Close proximity to all that you want to see.  Not much in the way of amenities to offer - coffee in room.  Mini food/snack alcove in lobby for purchase.  Guest services available to print airline tickets.  If you just need a room, book it.  If you are looking for more -- stay somewhere else.  If stairs are a challenge yuou may want to go elsewhere.

title: Harika lokasyon
text: Otel çok merkezi bir konumda, oda büyüklüğü ve yatak konforu iyi, Oda temizlik bölümü hizmet ve servisi gayet yeterli. Banyo da su basıncı düşük ve kailetili bir duş alma şansı yok. Misafir asansörlerin,i çalışanlar kullanıyor, bu hoş bir davranış değil. Önbüro çalışanları oldukça düzgün ve candan.

title: Great location and easy in and out of city
text: Great staff, very friendly even with holiday rush. Room was big for NYC standards and had a great view. The elevators were small, but fast which helped. Location is close to Times Square, Central Park and Columbus Circle. Valet was $70 but they were quick and only took around 20 mins to get our car. Close to the west side highway so quick in and out of the city when taking the bridge.

title: Great location, friendly staff, decent value
text: This hotel has great location, friendly staff, and decent value.  We enjoyed our visit and would definitely stay there again.  This hotel is a decent value and very close to Central Park, Times sq and great food options.

title: Business trip to NYC
text: Nice hotel around the corner of Times Square. Rooms are small but well equipped. Room is very clean. Nice bathroom (shower only). Bed is good. Breakfast-buffet is very good. The staff is very friendly.

title: Happy Sleeper
text: I’m always pleased with the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness of the rooms. This location was perfect for a Broadway play. It’s also in walking distance to many other city places of interest including museums and stores.

title: Winter Break in the City
text: Every year my wife and I travel to New York for about a week where she shops, I attend the World business Forum and we dine at Italian restaurants and see Broadway shows. We stay in the midtown area. This year we stayed at the Hilton Garden. The room was perfect for us. Clean, nicely appointed and really quiet. The location on 54th street was ideal to get to walk everywhere.  The staff was excellent. Recommend the HGI without qualification.

title: Posizione ottima
text: L'hotel ha una posizione ottima, cammini in centro e ti muovi in modo facile, è un po' caro ma in generale vale la pena. Valuterei di migliorare l'attesa agli ascensori che spesso è lunga e di aggiungere spazio per i vestiti in camera.

title: Great stay and staff
text:
Met with front desk agent Cristina she was fantastic also got graded vice from Luis and Ann Darren. Hotel is located in a fantastic part of the city staff was courteous superfast and helpful with everything that we needed I would definitely stay here again.

Desmond was incredibly helpful with my wife and kids as well.

title: A wonderful hotel.
text:
This Hilton sits comfortably within walking distance of times square, central park south and many excellent restaurants.  The lobby of the hotel is typically busy yet comfortably modern and exceptionally clean.  

The staff are always at your disposal and happy to accommodate with the highest customer service at all times.  Anticipate you will have a slight wait upon arrival for your room to be ready.  

We have always had ideally located rooms which are very comfortable and exceptionally clean.  The bar and restaurant is available and a preferred choice for breakfast each morning.  Unlike other Hilton hotels you will want to make sure leave a tip.  There is a business center and small workout room in the basement with a few treadmills, ellipticals and dumb bells. 

We truly enjoy this hotel and the location in which it sits. It easily allows for brief walk down to times square, the theatre district, central park south or maybe just down to Juniors for the best cheesecake around.  If nothing else take a short walk down to 5th ave and go shopping.  

Enjoy the best of the city without fighting the crowds of times square when your ready to turn in and relax.  Cheers!

title: Great location
text:
From the beginning everyone was very nice, courteous & knowledgable.  But our toilet wasn't working very well.  It took  maintenance 3 times to get it fixed but they did.
They could also keep the flavored water out in the lobby all the time.  Location was very good.

title: Convenient to Central Park and Broadway; clean safe area; 2 doubles available
text: We needed a hotel room with 2 beds which was harder than I thought to find in the city but this hotel worked and was conveniently located in the city. Hotel is very clean and located next to a restaurant that was a nice fast option when we were tight on time and they give you a discount coupon at check in for it.  Hotel has a lot of floors so make sure you plan time to wait for elevator during peak times.  Would stay here again.

title: Tourist Hotel:  Not for the Business Traveler
text:
Its not uncommon near Time Square to enter a hotel lobby and see people camped out with their luggage in the common areas and surfing on their phones as they grab a charge. . . this is what you get with this particular property.  Heavy on tourists and lines, light on bells and whistles.

If you're a business traveler, skip it.  Rooms are tight, ironing facilities are poor (for those that need to prep for a morning business meeting) and the wait for the elevator could very well impact your arrival at a meeting.

title: Friendly Staff!
text: We had a great experience at this property - everyone was very helpful.  The room was very clean and a nice size for the City. Very convenient to the Ed Sullivan Theater.  I will certainly use this property again!

title: Viajei de férias em setembro. Não gostei
text: Hotel muito bem localizado. Não tão novo. Hotel com muitos quartos e os elevadores já não dão conta. Atendimento na recepção depende de quem te atende. Alguns eram educados e atenciosos. Outros nem se esforçavam. Concierge ruim. Mas a pior experiência foi no restaurante integrado ao hotel. Nos enviaram por SMS um ticket com desconto no jantar pelo aniversário da minha esposa. Quando chegamos lá não nos deram o desconto e ainda fomos muito mal tratados pelo gerente do restaurante. Não volto mais no Hotel. Ah, o WI FI grátis é péssimo.

title: Quiet comfortable stay & a Great location in the city
text: Our check in and check out was smooth and problem free. The price was exactly as advertised. The hotel lobby has a therapeutic aroma. Not sure what they use but it smells amazing. Clean, Extremely nice and helpful people. Pleasant and polite. I want to emphasize how nice and helpful everyone is at the hotel. We asked if it was possible to have a lower level room that is as quiet as can be. The room the nice lady provided us was at the back of the building (still a view of a street) on the 6th floor and at first we thought it would be noisy due to the fact it is sandwiched in between two elevators. NOPE. we never heard a peep. No traffic noise, no people noise, no elevator noise. Silence. The bed and pillows were also therapeutic. We tried to find out how to buy the same pillows for home. The room is small for Las Vegas standards but normal for NYC. We had a TV, and Yes a REFRIGERATOR, coffee, storage, clean tub and shower. We had everything we needed. There are great delis and restaurants all around you. Subway station is a block away at 53 and 7. Central park is a short walk. Rent a bike and ride the park. For New York City the hotel pricing was better than competitive and the stay was very nice, clean and comfortable. My advice is to take advantage of the pricing here as it is worth it and just know While the lobby smells so very nice it is on the small side, yet cozy with coffee and newspapers available in the mornings and excellent people. The elevators can take some time at peak times but is not unbearable. If you are on a floor that has no ice machine simply take the stairs to the next level. It is very quick and the stairs are located at the end of a very short hall, you can't miss them. Plan ahead for peak elevator and lobby times and you will be just fine. We never felt crowded in the lobby and the elevator wait wasn't bad. There is also a restaurant connected to the lobby if you don't want to walk across the street to the cool spots there. New York City is truly the city that never sleeps. I've never seen anything like it. Hilton Garden Inn New York/Central park South-Midtown West located on 54th St. between Broadway & 8th was an amazing part of the visit. Thank you to all at Hilton. Till next time Cheers from Dallas Texas, Go Cowboys, Go Longhorns

title: Tolle Lage und große Zimmer
text:
Die Lage des Hotels, in einer Seitenstraße des Broadways und gegenüber dem einst legendären Studio 54, ist perfekt um Manhatten zu erkunden. Die Zimmer sind für NY verhältnismäßig groß, wobei wir auch ein Zimmer mit King Size Bed und Aussicht wählten, was sich wirklich gelohnt hat! 
Das Hotel ist nicht all zu groß, weshalb man sich nicht verloren fühlt. In der Nähe sind zahlreiche Bars und Restaurants und Möglichkeiten zum Frühstücken. Trotz zentraler Lage ist es relativ ruhig! Die Mitarbeiter sind sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend! Wir würden das Hotel jederzeit wieder besuchen!

title: Family trip
text: The hotel was in a brilliant location close walking distance to most things but quiet enough to enjoy a good night's sleep with limited noise. Rooms could have been bigger and although very clean, for the money other hotels offered more luxurious  accomodation.

title: Great experience
text: The staff was friendly and helpful.  Their warmth was such a pleasure.  Generous and kind in every interaction.  The room was newly renovated with tasteful details.  The location is excellent for accessing mid town events.  Very impressed with their service and presentation.

title: Disappointing.
text: I stayed at this hotel for one night. The staff was amazing, the front desk was quick and efficient, shout out to Tejahna! she was honestly the best part of my stay. Unfortunately, my room wasn’t entirely clean. There were black marks on my comforter, and hair in my sheets (pictures attached) I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels, and I always check the beds before climbing in, for this reason. I checked in at 11pm and I didn’t want to deal with changing rooms and walking back to to the desk with my things, so I slept without a comforter and shook out my sheets. The desk did accommodate me with a late check out, which was really helpful because the train I needed was in the afternoon. I gave the opportunity to the hotel to make it right by using the in-app feedback option and shared the above information directly with hotel management, and I got a half hearted email from the AGM, a few points wouldn’t have killed you, considering I do spend 30+ nights a year with Hilton.

title: WARNING- be careful how you pay
text:
I feel sad to have to write a negative review as I actually had a good stay in the hotel until I was left in a position of no money.
When we arrived I gave the receptionist my bank card and was advised I would be charged for the room and $300 dollars would be taken as a deposit for 4nights in case of accidentals ,$1500 in total. I was advised that the $300 dollars would be back in my account a couple of days after we checked out.
In fact what happened was a further $1224 was taken from my account on the last day and I was unable to access the €1500 as it was on hold and could take up to 20 working days to return to my account as it was a debit card from overseas. 
I made attempts to call the hotel but was advised that I was wrong on the amount and was hung up on. 
We were in Woodstock and had to leave early to return to the hotel in NYC to try and sort it out. This was useless, resulting in such a negative way to end what was a great holiday.

I am back home now and still over £1200 short in my bank, I was expecting to have to wait for the deposit but not this amount.

I have tried to get details of who to escalate the complaint to but not getting a reply.

Up until this happened I would’ve been writing a very different review.

title: Super comfortable bed, perfect location, great staff
text: Minutes away from Central Park and Broadway this is an ideal place to have a quiet, comfortable sleep. The steakhouse attached is rather expensive compared to London prices but .. there are so many breakfast places and restaurants in the area. We're going back here in April and would recommend this hotel. Booked through Virgin Holidays.

title: Second time to stay here..great place! Friendly people!
text:
Perfect place to stay if you want to be in the center of everything! 
You can walk to almost anywhere you want to go..
The rooms are small, but clean. I was in NYC a few months before this and stayed at a much pricer hotel, supposedly nicer hotel and the service and room was terrible. This place is not, that's why I chose to come back. They did not charge me to keep my bags before or after check in. But please rememeber to tip these folks. They bust their butts and hustle at no charge...they deserve a little cash in their pockets to store your valued bags! And it would be kind to tip housekeeping too. They were amazing! 
We stayed for nearly a week...without a single comlaint!

title: Not a memorable hotel
text:
This hotel is located in a good location and while there is nothing per say the matter with the hotel, it's not memorable in any way.

 Everything was just 'ok'.  

I was not a fan of the sliding bathroom door which didn't quite close all the way - there was a gap of about 2 inches. You could actually see out into the bedroom while in there and vice versa which is fine if you are travelling on your own, not so much if you are on a romantic weekend away. Then again, this wouldn't be the type of hotel where one would go for romance. 

One thing I don't understand is why they have bars of soap instead of shower gel. It's 2018, not 1988.

The room was clean in that when we arrived, we could still smell the bleach which had been used in the bathroom. I was therefore surprised to then see a couple of small hairs in the shower.

Bed linens, just ok and were certainly not anything to write home about. 

Everything in the room seemed to be done as cost effectively as possible.

title: Overall a really good stay
text: This hotel has a wonderful location and a fantastic team.  Always friendly team members in the lobby ready to answer questions or help with luggage etc.  The rooms to us were pretty small.  Four people in a room with two beds was a bit challenging.  Great housekeeping service daily.  Overall a really nice hotel in a location that cant be beat.

title: Good hotel in a convenient location
text: Hotel is in a convenient location just off Broadway - ideal if you are taking in a show.  Located midway between Central Park and Times Square.  The staff were fine, not very enthusiastic but polite enough.  We had room 302 directly above reception - typical New York City hotel room - bathroom has a sliding door separating it from the main bedroom.  Bed was comfortable and the room was very clean.  On the Saturday night the hotel plays music outside the reception area all night.  As we were directly above this area the noise was quite intrusive - worth bearing in mind - make sure you ask for a high floor to get away from the noise.

title: Great service
text: Awesome property. Staff is incredible. Every time we entered we were greeted. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Restaurant next door is ok. AppleJack's around the corner of a much better choice for breakfast

title: Central Park / Times Square within budget
text:
Conveniently located between Times Square and Central Park.
Fairly good 5 star hotel with friendly and supportive staff 
Price is reasonable.
Spacious and very comfortable rooms.
25 usd for breakfast with not plenty of choice.
Atrium could be bigger, the 3 lifts are sometimes a problem (specially at rush hours) and obtaining hot water requires a long wait.
Relatively easy access from and to Newark and JFK airports and Central Station as well. 
Thus the rate would be a strong 4 if the price was comparable to similar hotels. As it was actually cheaper the rate 5 seems more accurate.

title: emplacement parfait
text: Le plus de cet hôtel est vraiment son emplacement. Le café thé le matin et les cookies a disposition l'après midi on également été bien apprécié. Pour un hôtel de ce prix, la soufflerie (ventilation) serait a revoir de mon point de vue.

title: מחיר הזוי ללילה ממש לא שווה את התמורה, הופעלה אזעקה כמה פעמים בערב וארוחת בוקר דלה מאוד
text:
לא נחזור, אבל כן נרצה לציין לטובה את כל מי שעבד בתאריך שלנו באיסוף מזוודות ובביטחון - כולם היו סופר נחמדים ועזרו לנו מאוד, אני לא זוכרת שמות היינו שם לילה אחד. תודה רבה!
המיקום מעולה בין סנטרל פארק לטיימס סקוור אבל יש מיליון מלונות באיזור. 
בלית ברירה כי נגמרו כל החדרים בהם נאלצנו ללון במלון הזה.
זה מלון טוב אבל אין תמורה למחיר.
כמו כן, הצוות בארוחת בוקר מאוד השתדל לעזור, ביקשנו ירקות ונתנו לנו עגבניה פרוסה זה היה המקסימום שהיה להם :)

title: Voyage à New York
text: Nous avons été un peu déçu de l'hôtel qui dispose d'un très bon  emplacement proche de beaucoup d'attraction. Malheureusement il comporte des inconvénients comme par exemple une attente insupportable pour les ascenseurs (qui sont empruntés aussi par le personnel de l’hôtel avec  des chariots, des produits de nettoyage etc..). Le rapport qualité prix est décevant (surtout pour le petit déjeuner)

title: Tout était parfait !
text: Accueil parfait, avec une équipe très sympathique, souriante et disponible. Emplacement exceptionnel à deux pas de Times Square, idéal surtout pour un premier séjour à New York ! Chambre fonctionnelle et confortable.

title: Nice Locataion Excellent Value
text: Stayed at this hotel for business, centrally located to trains and Madison Avenue. The hotel was clean and comfortable. There is a restaurant next door which makes it convenient if you don't want to leave the property. I will return to this property when traveling for business or even pleasure, very nice stay.

title: Good Place to Stay
text:
Pros:
Very well located and within walking distance to Central Park and Times Square. Near the Broadway with Restaurants and Mini markets nearby. Having a microwave in the room was a plus for us that were traveling with a baby. The room is reasonably sized and the elevators can manage the amount of guests quite well. We chose the King Room with a View but our impression was that the view was not worth the extra money we paid.

Cons:
We had some issues with the toilet that kept on clogging daily. The hotel engineering was fast in fixing it but they could not solve the problem during our stay.

title: Aanrader
text: Hilton Garden in Central Park is het ideale hotel voor een citytrip naar New York met een perfecte locatie . Het ligt op 10 min van Central Park en 10 min van Times Square. Metro op hoek van straat alsook een diner en supermarkt. Mooie propere kamer met zalige bedden. Kamer beschikt over koelkast, koffiezet en microwave. Badkamernetjes en elke dag wordt er schoongemaakt en heb je propere handdoeken. Het personeel is heel vriendelijk, zowel aan de balie, als de kruier en de kuisploeg. Dikke pluim voor dit hotel. Voor herhaling vatbaar!

title: Well located hotel
text: This hotel is located just off Broadway and within a ten-minute walk of both Central Park and Times Square. Staff were friendly and helpful, and our room was clean and quiet. Only downside to this hotel, in my opinion, was the breakfast - it’s served in the Empire Steak House and wasn’t included in our room rate, so the buffet option was $22.95. The restaurant space itself is nice but the breakfast was pretty poor; quite a small range for a buffet and very beige/carb heavy. Porridge was only available in instant form, and not much in the way of fruit. So my advice would be to nip out for breakfast instead (lots of cafes within easy reach). But overall, a good stay and I think we’d come back.

title: Nuestro preferido en NYC
text: Estuvimos en abril, por tercera vez. No nos defraudó. Cómodo, con una ubicación privilegiada, personal amable. Habitaciones amplias. Los ascensores tardan un poco, pero igual no me pareció para tanto.

title: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights leaving on October 3, 2018
text:
The hotel was fine, but the valet parking STOLE $160.00 from the center console of my car. It was closed, they opened it and took out to MA state lottery tickets. One for $100.00 the other for $60.00.

The hotel took no responsibility, as it is an outside agency.  Not going back there again.
AND I am a Diamond member and work in NYC almost weekly.

title: Great Location!!!
text: Three night weekend stay to take in shows and iconic sites. Great location and good value!!!! Helpful front desk. Clean, quiet, smallish rooms with comfortable beds. Slow elevators (stay on a lower floor). There is no bar/restaurant in the hotel but it does have an entrance into the pricey Empire Steakhouse that has a bar.  None of our room keys worked on check in (need for room and elevator) but used digital key available through Hilton Honors until we sorted it out. One bath towel was encrusted with paint. very nice hotel but mid grade for Hilton.

title: Great location for New York
text:
We stayed 10-14 October 2018.  The hotel is situated on 54th between Broadway and 8th, perfect location for Mid Town and Central Park

General

We arrived around 5pm and we were checked in very quickly.  The hotel is very clean and cookies, coffee and fruit infused water are available in the day. 

The hotel is tall and 'thin', with only 16 or so rooms per floor.  It's modern looking and well kept.

Room

We were allocated room 1613 and went straight out into New York.  When we arrived back around 10.30pm we realised the air conditioning did not work - it was about 25/80 degrees outside and so the room had warmed up somewhat.  The maintenance person attended and advised a part was needed.  We were then told they didn't have it and they also didn't have a fan to bring up.  But they agreed to move us the next day which they did.  I'm an Honors member and on checking out they gave me points as an apology and for the inconvenience. 

We were then moved to room 1813.  The room was exactly the same in terms of layout.  Two queen beds (5ft), drawers, wardrobe, tea and coffee and fridge.  The air conditioning worked in this room!

Beds came with a light duvet in a satin cover, and a cotton sheet underneath.  There were three pillows per bed. 

Bathroom

Spacious and with a shower, no bath.  Sink area was big.  Neurogena shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion was provided.  Three towels and flannels (wash cloths) were provided.  Towels were small.  A separate floor towel was provided.  The shower was hot and good pressure. 

Comfort

As we said above we had the air conditioning issue.  It was a bit warm that first night!  But the air conditioning is easyt to control - you can have on auto and set at a particular temperature and unlike other places there is not a lower limit on the temperature.

Staff

There are loads of staff in the hotel, desk staff were very polite and helpful.  There is  concierge service including those who help with luggage.  Maintenance is on site until 11.30pm.  

Facilities

There is an on site gym (considering our 10-15 miles a day we didn't use it!), two computers and water fountains.

Most surprisingly, self managed laundry facilities at an absolute bargain price - $2.75 per wash and 25c per minute for the dryer - cheaper than local laundrettes.  They're open 24 hours and there are four dual machines. 

Hilton Grand Vacations

We were staying due to the offer to attend the presentation.  This is held at 57th street and after the presentation, you're given elevated reward vouchers in multiples of $25 which can be used at a number of restaurants and retail outlets, mostly round Manhattan.  The presentation is a hard sell and they try to match you with a deal they think will suit.  It's a one on two (couple) presentation, not one delivered to a group which I had experienced before.  It's worth going to if you travel a lot as the outcome is to own a share in the Hilton and points each year to spend at hotel resorts.

title: Brilliant for everything!
text:
This hotel was ideally located. close enough walk to the hustle and bustle yet far enough away for noise not to be an issue.  The rooms were clean and we were happy with the housekeeping which happened everyday of our stay.
The staff were fantastic, they couldnt help out enough and Harrison, the doorman, always had a smile and a story for us in the morning with his friendly greeting and knowledge of NY.  
We needed to get to the other end of Manhattan for a Helicopter ride quickly into our stay and we were jet lagged and not familiar with transportation or areas, yet the front desk staff helped and arranged it for us.  Nothing was too much trouble.

title: Great area, bad service.
text: I stayed here for about a week.  10/6 to 10/13.  I initially called to set up transportation from the airport.  The lady I talked with bad an accent so thick I could not understand her. I asked for someone else to talk to and it became an issue. I moved on.  We arrived at the hotel and noticed a large line of customers waiting by the elevator to go to their rooms.  With 34 floors the hotel only had three elevators. One of which was not working. I understand that not everything goes right and mishaps are to be expected when you are a world traveler.  The elevator worked only part of the time and was consistently out of service. A couple days into our trip we became exhausted and decided to eat dinner in our room.  DO NOT eat at the steak house down stairs.  I was treated to floppy fries, burnt baked potatoes left in a steam tray, and a dry hamburger that was medium rare.  How a dry medium rare hamburger was achieved is perplexing. We had to ask to have room service several times. After we had been out all day we would return to an unclean room.  Once again I understand that things don't always go the way you wish but this was unpleasant.   Finally, the last night of our visit had come.  It was Saturday night and the lobby was full of customers. The conscierge desk was quite busy.  I resigned myself to wait until the crowd had dispersed before I attempted to make arrangement for my travel to the airport. At 8:45 p.m. I went to the conscierge desk and asked for help procuring transportation to the airport.  I was asked at what time was my flight. I responded that I would like to leave by 730 a.m. and without a moment's hesitation I was rudely told that they were closed and I should just take a taxi in the morning. Ummmm...  why did you even ask what time my flight was then?  That is also why I know it was exactly 845 pm because the two stayed and chatted at the "closed" desk while I waited for the busted elevators for fifteen minutes.  Please improve the service.  There were a lot of good people on the staff.  Especially the porters and doormen. As always the bad service of a few overshadowed the rest.

title: It’s QUIET!!!
text: The hotel is on 54th St., halfway between 7th and 8th Ave., so you avoid the traffic noise of the avenues. Mr. Zachariah was great at the front desk. He had lots of thoughtful advice and made sure our five day stay would go smoothly.  The rooms are very well maintained and the staff is always attentive.

title: NYC visit for the Emmys
text: Hotel was within walking distance of Columbus Circle and Broadway shows, so it was very convenient. Price is competitive with quality given that NYC prices are in a league of their own!Hotel was clean and room had microwave and small refrigerator and safe. All one needs for a few days in NYC!

title: hôtel a rénové
text:
Hotel vétuste, drap effilé voir déchiré,rideaux de la salle du petit déjeuné déchiré, bien loin des hôtels Hilton que je connais.
Ascenseur qui fonctionne avec la carte de la chambre pas très pratique.
Petit déjeuné a revoir .
Personnel super sympathique.

title: Moldy Room 902
text:
Had a bad experience.  See below for note to GM, awaiting response:

Hi Kevin,

I understand you are the GM for the Hilton Garden Inn Central Park.  I'm writing to you regarding an experience we had at your hotel on 09.14.  See attached for documentation.  Unfortunately we were unable to resolve this issue with your front desk manager so we are escalating it with you.  

As a quick summary of events, we booked through Hotels Tonight.  We got room 902, dropped of our bags there around 5pm, and promptly left to attend a wedding rehearsal and dinner that we were running late for.  When we entered our room, we noticed a strange smell but figured it would clear out if we opened the windows and put the A/C on, which is what we did.  Unfortunately, when we returned, the small was worse than ever.  This was around 11:30pm.  The smell was one of mold and dampness and was just absolutely horrendous.  Additionally, we believed it would be toxic to our health if we stayed in the room.  We called down to the front desk and asked to be moved, but were informed there were no more rooms available at the hotel was 100% sold out.  One member of your staff, Mister Salem, was sent up to inspect the room, and agreed that it smelled horrible and would let the front desk know.  With no other options, we were forced to evacuate our room and move to another hotel.

This is the sequence of events.  We were forced to pay for another hotel at a high price due to the lack of the Hilton Garden Inn's ability to provide us with a room where we could sleep, which is what we paid for.  Your staff agreed to refund the 2nd night of our book, and so we are seeking a refund for the additional $158.  As you can see I've been a Hilton Honors Member for some time.  We cannot believe that we would not get a full refund for this service given the sequence of events and that we could not even spend a night at the Hilton.

Please give me and my husband a response by email in the next 3 business days.  

Best regards,
Jennifer

title: Localização ótima
text: Já havia me hospedado na rede Hilton em NY no ano de 2015 e a experiência havia sido boa. Este ano repetimos, porém outro hotel. Chegando às 06 da manhã, nosso checkin era as 15h e assim que chegamos fizemos e tivemos o quarto liberado. No momento da reserva informei o horário da chegada, talvez isso tenha ajudado. Mas chegar e já ter o quarto disponível tem o seu valor. Funcionários solícitos. Localização maravilhosa. Cama ótima!

title: Convenient location but tide corners
text: Great location and great desk service but the inside feels very small. Narrow hallways and small rooms. Closets were not big enough to hang a regular size suite. Only few minutes to Time Square. Great Irish pub right next door.

title: Lobby smaller than living room with 80 people crammed in awaiting rooms, check in lines 5 people deep for 3 emp
text: Elevator rides (2) for 20+ floors took 18 minutes each way, crowded.  Dreadful wait times, security keys of guests for their floors failing on elevator.  A circus.  Postage stamp sized lobby.  5 people deep forecheck in with 3 employees working.

title: Excellent Location Good Rate
text:
This is the 3rd time we have stayed at this property for business trip.  It is right at Central Park and close to many of the financial institutions.  We could not find any other hotels which have this good rate.  I tried hard for Marriott hotels, but the only Sheraton costs much more.

It is just about 6 minute walk to destination.  The front desk staff was nice.

title: Mejor de lo previsto
text:
Muy buena situación a dos pasos de Columbus Circle. Habitaciones modernas, limpias y confortables. Personal correcto y precio muy razonable.
Se comunica con un buen bar y restaurante pero con precios ya bastante más elevados.
Detalles en contra son el excesivo tiempo de espera de los ascensores y la falta de un salón más espacioso, ya que solo dispone del que está junto a recepción ocupado habitualmente por más personas de las que caben a la espera de su transporte.

title: Caro pelo que oferece
text: Hotel com localização boa mas quarto pequeno,    Serviço de recepção regular porem concierge ruim, grosseira no trato com os clientes. Banheiro com problema na porta e descarga, reclamamos no primeiro dia e nada foi feito até a saída 5 dias após.
